Teaser: Cancer clinical trials are misunderstood and poorly enrolled. How about a game show to improve community understanding of them?

Teaser: How commonly are adverse drug events responsible for ED visits, and which drugs are most often involved?

Teaser: Will drugs targeting atrial K+ channels have decreased risk of proarrhythmia?

Headlines: LASIK Refractive Eye Surgery in the 21st Century

Teaser: The authors review the problems related to drug-resistant TB, describe recent advances in the development of new drugs, and discuss implications for control programs.

Headlines: EVITA: A Tool for the Early Evaluation of Pharmaceutical Innovations With Regard to Therapeutic Advantage
Teaser: This screening tool serves to evaluate the additional therapeutic value of new drugs compared to similar drugs.

Headlines: Lupus Clinical Trials: What Have We Learned So Far?
Teaser: What treatments are on the horizon for lupus? This review looks at some potential options.

Headlines: The Evolution of Consent Forms for Research: A Quarter Century of Changes

Headlines: Comparative Effectiveness Research: Implications for Hospital Medicine
Teaser: Learn how comparative effectiveness research  is different from standard research that hospitalists use to inform their clinical decision-making.

Headlines: Keeping the Rhythm: hERG and Beyond in Cardiovascular Safety Pharmacology
Teaser: What is the relationship between the hERG ion channel and torsades de pointes?

Headlines: Anesthesiologist Sentenced to 6 Months for Faked Research
Teaser: The resource, developed jointly by the FDA and ASCO, aims to help physicians and patients understand how to access investigational unapproved drugs.

Teaser: Traumeel S for Pain Relief Following Hallux Valgus Surgery: A Randomized Controlled Trial

Teaser: Dr. Maurie Markman and Dr. Richard Schilksy discuss the factors needed to develop and maximize the use of molecularly targeted treatments.

Headlines: ASCO® 2010 Wrap-up: Converting Cancer to a Chronic Disease
Teaser: A roundtable discussion between Dr. Maurie Markman, Dr. Kathy Miller, Dr. John Marshall, Dr. Mark Kris, and Dr. Richard Schilsky highlighting issues arising from the ASCO 2010 presentations.

Headlines: Top Scientific Papers vs  Furry Green Slippers: Which Should You Trust?

Headlines: How to Start Doing Office-Based Clinical Trials
Teaser: Physicians looking for new revenue sources and patient services should consider conducting clinical trials, which bring in revenue and are valuable services.

Teaser: Scott Reuben published articles touting the use of celecoxib and rofecoxib to help manage postoperative pain.

Headlines: NCI's Clinical Trials Program in Need of Improvement
Teaser: The ATHENA story is a good example of what critics say is wrong with medical research, according to a report in the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel. By allowing the drug company to control the raw data, there is concern that data can be manipulated or suppressed, making bad drugs look good or good drugs look great.

Teaser: In patients with nonsmall-cell lung cancer (NSCLS) with a rearrangement of the ALK gene, the investigational ALK inhibitor showed a 90% response rate.

Headlines: What's Hot at ASCO® 2010

Headlines: Plasma Interleukin-8 is not an Effective Risk Stratification Tool for Adults

Teaser: Dr. John Marshall asks whether US oncologists are going to once again become leaders in clinical research or be content to take a back seat to European investigators.

Teaser: Is a drug metabolized by CYP? New research is answering this question quickly and accurately.

Headlines: Absolute Benefits of Medical Therapies for Breast and CRC
Teaser: RCTs may be arriving at a point-of-diminishing-return for breast and colorectal cancer treatment initiatives.

Headlines: "Serious Ethical Dilemma" in Ovarian Cancer Chemotherapy Trials

Teaser: A comparison of the benefit/risk ratio of dronedarone and amiodarone is made for patients with atrial fibrillation.

Teaser: TMC207, a new compound with a novel mechanism of action, may be a breakthrough in the fight against drug-sensitive and drug-resistant TB.

Teaser: Do you know how to interpret negative results from a superiority trial

Headlines: NIH Launches Phase 1 Dengue Vaccine Trial
Teaser: ASCO will honor Nancy E. Davidson, MD, with the 2010 Gianni Bonadonna Breast Cancer Award later this year, in recognition of her original contributions to breast cancer research.

Headlines: Quantitative In Vitro and In Vivo Pharmacological Profile of CE-178253
Teaser: Will this cannabinoid receptor antagonist be a possible treatment for obesity?

Teaser: Clinical trials continue to test lithium in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, but these latest findings raise serious doubts about the drug's safety.

Teaser: What influence does grant money have on academic opinion leaders?

Teaser: Qualitative data includes diaries, photographs, and questionnaires.

Teaser: The development of methods to counteract drug shortages is crucial before patient care is adversely affected

Teaser: Improving the process of assisting oncology patients in making informed decisions about clinical trials pays dividends for all.

Teaser: Certain mineral mixtures and their aqueous leachates have demonstrated in vitro antibacterial activity. What is their mechanism of action?

Teaser: Bevacizumab added to chemotherapy delayed disease progression and extended survival, compared with historic controls, but the study has been criticized.

Teaser: If you have been to the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium (SABCS), then you know his voice. Now meet the man.

Teaser: Dr. Kathy Miller wants to recruit to her staff a fourth-grade student who won top honors in a science fair for her discovery in regard to patients who receive chemotherapy.

Headlines: Antimalarial Drugs: Modes of Action snd Mechanisms of Resistance
Teaser: An examination into the drug resistance mechanisms at work in P. falciparum, the malaria parasite species which accounts for 90% of deaths worldwide.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: When Are "Positive" Oncology Trials Truly Positive?
Teaser: The importance of clinical significance is discussed in comparison to statistical significance in clinical trials for cancer treatment.

Headlines: Clinical Efficacy of Telcagepant in Migraine
Teaser: The calcitonin gene-related peptide antagonist telcagepant may be a breakthrough in migraine therapy because of its novel approach--but is it as effective as more traditional drugs?

Headlines: PARP Inhibition in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer
Teaser: Dr. Maurie Markman reviews a recent paper from The New England Journal of Medicine looking at the potential benefits of iniparib in the treatment of triple-negative breast cancer.

Headlines: Clinical Trials: Opportunity or Burden?
Teaser: If you're thinking about conducting clinical trials within your medical practice, here's how to decide whether the financial and patient-care rewards outweigh the potential challenges.

Headlines: Negative Research Results? There's a Cure
Teaser: With apologies to The Onion, Dr. Andrew Vickers describes a study that confirms the value of hiding studies with negative results in your dresser drawer.

Headlines: Five Ways to Control Oncology Drug Costs
Teaser: Oncology practices face many challenges, but getting a grip on drug costs can help boost the bottom line.

Headlines: Legacy Effect of Hypertensive Trials: When the Unblinded See
Teaser: Henry Black, MD, comments on the legacy effect and what happens to all of the patients when hypertension trials end.

Headlines: Lorcaserin -- Rejected by FDA for Being Too Safe?
Teaser: Andrew Vickers educates us on statistics by examining the reasons why the FDA rejected lorcaserin.

Headlines: AACR Honoree Warns of Crisis in Cancer Research
Teaser: Susan Horwitz, PhD, the AACR Lifetime Achievement Award winner, warns that new investigators face a funding crisis.

Headlines: Self-Nanoemulsifying Drug Delivery Systems
Teaser: Learn about self-nanoemulsifying drug delivery systems--one of the many ways by which nanotechnology can improve delivery and therapeutic efficacy of drugs.

Headlines: Research Fraud: An Editor's Responsibility?
Teaser: In the wake of the autism controversy, pediatric psychiatrist and journal editor Dr. Fred Volkmar discusses the roles and responsibilities of editors in vetting the information they publish.

Headlines: Tiotropium: A Safe Solution for Long-Acting Asthma Control?
Teaser: Dr. Charles P. Vega discusses the results of a recent study of tiotropium as a step-up therapy for adults with uncontrolled asthma.

Headlines: A New Treatment Algorithm in Multiple Sclerosis
Teaser: How do the newly approved and emerging oral therapies for multiple sclerosis fit into existing treatment strategies? And how might a new treatment algorithm evolve in the near future?

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: QoL Measurement in RCTs in Breast Cancer
Teaser: When do measures of self-reported symptoms have the most utility in breast cancer research?

Headlines: Citizen Science Genomics for Preventive Medicine Research
Teaser: This paper proposes a research model for conducting citizen science genomics, integrating personal genomic data with physical biomarker data to be applied in large-scale preventive medicine studies.

Headlines: Nanocarriers for Pulmonary Administration of Peptides and Proteins
Teaser: Peptides and proteins are an important class of therapeutic agents, but their efficient and safe administration has proven challenging. Could inhaled delivery via nanocarriers be the answer?

Headlines: Efficient Gene Delivery by EGF-Lipoplexes In Vitro and In Vivo
Teaser: Could EGF-receptor targeted lipoplexes serve as alternatives to viral nanovectors for gene therapy?

Headlines: Improving Hospice Outcomes Through Systematic Assessment
Teaser: The efficacy of systematic feedback from standardized assessment tools for hospice patient-caregiver dyads is evaluated.

Headlines: Placebo Response In Clinical Trials With Schizophrenia Patients
Teaser: Excessive placebo response is an important factor in the failure rate of clinical trials for schizophrenia drugs. What are the potential causes and what steps can be taken to minimize this effect?

Headlines: Graphene in Biomedicine: Opportunities and Challenges
Teaser: Graphene, an allotrope of carbon, has exciting potential for various biomedical applications, including drug delivery, cancer therapies and biosensing.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Postpartum Diagnostic Depression Interview is Problematic
Teaser: Using a formal DSM-IV-based interview to identify depression in postpartum mothers may have serious flaws that could lead to underdiagnosis

Headlines: Cell-Culture-Derived Influenza Vaccine: Safe and Efficacious
Teaser: New approaches to influenza vaccine production are needed in order to meet high demand. Is a cell-culture-derived vaccine as safe and effective as egg-based?

Headlines: Regulation of Appetite to Treat Obesity
Teaser: How do medications alter the desire to eat?

Headlines: HIV/AIDS Patients and Clinical Trials in the HAART Era
Teaser: Who is most likely to sign up to participate in an HIV/AIDS clinical trial? This study looks at the data.

Headlines: Corticosteroids in Brain Cancer Patients
Teaser: How does dexamethasone reduce peritumoral edema?

Headlines: Methodological Challenges for Personalized Cancer Therapies
Teaser: Many clinical trials of targeted therapies have produced disappointing results, but biomarker identification and other strategies outlined in this article should help to improve outcomes.

Headlines: Review of Event Rates in Diabetes Clinical Trials
Teaser: Just how influential are these two variables on cardiovascular event rates in diabetes trials?

Headlines: NanoKnife, Liposomal Doxorubicin Show Efficacy Against Liver Cancer
Teaser: Irreversible electroporation and thermally sensitive liposomal doxorubicin might enhance the clinical benefits of tumor ablation -- in combination with radiofrequency ablation or alone.

Headlines: Periodontal Treatment and Preterm Birth
Teaser: Marjorie Jeffcoat, DMD, ponders the value of a meta-analysis on a subject that combines "apples and oranges."

Headlines: Quinidine Fades; Pharma Asked to Put Patients Before Profits
Teaser: The situation has gotten so bad that one physician recently couriered a few boxes of quinidine to a colleague halfway around the world who couldn't access it in his own country.

Headlines: Stenting Cost-Effective in High-Risk Surgical Patients
Teaser: The initial procedural costs were significantly higher for carotid stenting, at more than $4000 per patient, but with a shorter length of hospital stay, this reduced the initial hospital costs to just $559 more per patient undergoing stenting compared with those who underwent surgery.

Headlines: Four Cancer Genomics Papers Retracted From Top Journals
Teaser: Dr. Anil Potti and colleagues have retracted papers from the New England Journal of Medicine, Lancet Oncology, Nature Medicine, and Journal of Clinical Oncology.

Headlines: Fast Track for Cancer Drugs: Shut It Down or Speed It Up?
Teaser: FDA officials discuss the how the current system for accelerated approval is not working well; new changes being proposed include the idea of approval straight after phase 1.

Headlines: Targeting 2 Pathways May Enhance Antitumor Activity
Teaser: Combining therapies that target MEK and PI3K pathways has the potential to be more effective than either agent used alone.

Headlines: MAP0004, Orally Inhaled DHE for Acute Treatment of Migraine
Teaser: This RCT looks at the efficacy of MAP0004, an orally inhaled formulation of dihydroergotamine for the treatment of acute migraine. How did it fare against placebo?

Headlines: 'Model Translational Researcher' Wins Karnofsky Award
Teaser: World-renowned multiple myeloma expert is the recipient of ASCO's 2011 award and lecture.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Specialty Physician Involvement in Cancer Clinical Trials
Teaser: Find out what factors are associated with greater physician involvement in cancer-related clinical trials.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Antidepressant Studies in People With Depression and Dementia
Teaser: Is a sugar pill sweeter than the real-deal when it comes to benefits from antidepressant trials in patients with dementia?

Headlines: Potential Targets for Pancreatic Cancer Immunotherapeutics
Teaser: Immune-based treatments for cancer represent a rapidly evolving treatment option with great potential.

Source: Cancer Control: Journal of the Moffitt Cancer Center
Headlines: Direction of Future Clinical Trials for Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: Over the last several decades, clinical trials have defined the therapeutic approach for ovarian cancer. Future trials promise new directions.

Headlines: Is Vitamin E Beneficial in Children With NASH?
Teaser: The recently completed TONIC trial offers data to answer this question.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Prophylactic Antibiotics for Dog Bites with Refined Cost Model
Teaser: Does it make economic sense to treat all dog bite patients with antibiotics, even if the risk of infection is unknown?

Headlines: (Mis)Understanding Exploitation
Teaser: This article explores the issue of exploitation in the area of biomedical research.

Headlines: Targeted Therapy for SCC of the Head and Neck
Teaser: New treatments, especially targeted agents and novel combined regimens, are being evaluated in ongoing clinical trials for SCCHN.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Predictors of New-Onset Diabetes in Patients Treated With Atorvastatin
Teaser: High dose statins may be associated with the onset of diabetes, at least for some. Who is most at risk and why?

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Proposed New Clinical Trial System at NCI Gets Mixed Reviews
Teaser: Oncology community leaders got a look at the National Cancer Institute's proposal for renovating its clinical trial system and found fundamental changes that will undoubtedly impact clinical research and practice.

Headlines: The N-of-1 Clinical Trial
Teaser: Single subject studies may help advance personalized medicine.

Headlines: Clinical Trials and Tribulations: The Future of Cancer Research
Teaser: Dr. Robert Comis, Group Chair of ECOG, discusses the role of cooperative groups in cancer research and the toll that inadequate funding could have on the future of cancer research.

Headlines: Cellular Immunotherapy for High-Grade Glioma
Teaser: The outcome for patients with glioblastoma multiforme remains poor, but new cellular strategies may brighten the outlook.

Headlines: Benefits of Early Tracheotomy After Cardiac Surgery
Teaser: The timing of tracheotomy in patients requiring prolonged mechanical ventilation is the subject of a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: Choosing the Right Clinical Trial: Dealing With Malpractice Risks
Teaser: Choosing the wrong clinical trial can create difficulties, including a malpractice risk.

Headlines: Society Introduces Template for Peer Reviewers Uneasy With Stats
Teaser: Dr. Andrew Vickers provides a template for journal editors who wish to assist totally unqualified peer reviewers. Once again, with apologies to The Onion.

Headlines: Scientific Literature on Brain Volume Abnormalities Overblown, Expert Says
Teaser: Too many studies of brain volume abnormalities linked to mental health disorders report statistically significant results, a pattern that strongly suggests scientific bias, a researcher concludes.

Headlines: Novel Agent Prevents Lesions in Basal Cell Nevus Syndrome
Teaser: A new hedgehog pathway inhibitor inhibited new lesion development and reduced tumor size in patients with basal cell nevus syndrome.

Headlines: Staff and Partner Hostility During Clinical Trials
Teaser: Your colleagues and staff may be annoyed about conducting clinical trials. Here's how to deal with hidden or overt negative response.

Headlines: Placebos: Can Their Contents Affect Clinical Trials?
Teaser: Dr. Maurie Markman reports on a study which found that a high percentage of clinical trials do not list the contents of placebos, raising questions about the results of placebo-controlled trials.

Headlines: Ethical, Legal and Social Issues in Alcohol and Drug Research
Teaser: Research projects involving alcohol and drugs present many ethical, legal and social aspects that need to be taken into consideration, especially in relation to the informed consent process.

Headlines: US Doctors Face Sanctions for Spine Study Payments
Teaser: New Jersey's physician regulatory board has disciplined three orthopedic surgeons for failing to disclose financial interests in an artificial spinal disc made by Swiss medical device maker Synthes Inc.

Headlines: Elderly Can Be Included in Colorectal Cancer Chemo Trials
Teaser: A British Medical Research Council trial has adjusted its design so that benefits for chemotherapy in colorectal cancer can be better evaluated in frail and elderly patients.

Headlines: Drug Therapy Gets Personal With Genetic Profiling
Teaser: Understanding the effects of genetic variations on drug metabolism is the key to personalized drug therapy. This article will bring you up-to-speed in a hurry.

Headlines: Targeting NMDA Receptors for Treatment of Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: New research may facilitate drug development for neuropathic pain.

Headlines: Parents' Understanding and Recall of Informed Consent
Teaser: How well do people really understand the concept of informed consent in the context of clinical research? This study takes a look.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Invasive Ipsilateral Breast Tumor Recurrence After Lumpectomy
Teaser: Breast conserving surgery for DCIS may be more effective when combined with adjuvant therapies.

Headlines: Antiplatelet Agents in Surgical Perioperative Management
Teaser: For patients on long-term aspirin therapy, do the risks of possible thromboembolic events after withdrawal outweigh the bleeding risks associated with its continuation during the perioperative period?

Headlines: Ultrasound-Guided Breast-Sparing Surgery
Teaser: Can ultrasound-guided breast-conserving surgery provide better cosmetic outcome--and greater accuracy--in breast cancer patients with palpable tumors?

Headlines: Psychiatric Diagnosis: Where's the Science?
Teaser: Dr. Nassir Ghaemi discusses the shortcomings of the DSM classification system and how the NIMH Research Domain Criteria could improve psychiatric diagnosis.

Headlines: Periodontitis in Pregnancy
Teaser: Dr. Jeffcoat describes how clinical trials assess treatment effects and how this relates to the question of periodontal treatment and its effect on preterm births.

Headlines: Imputation -- Filling the Gaps in the Data
Teaser: Black and Andrew Vickers discuss imputation and how it works when a trial lacks all the data.

Headlines: Art Caplan on Ethics and Clinical Trials, The Stem Cell Debate, and More
Teaser: Internationally renowned bioethicist Arthur L. Caplan, PhD, talks with Eli Y. Adashi, MD, about the ethics of clinical trials overseas and other hot button issues of debate in medicine.

Headlines: Heading for the Beach and the Intention to Treat
Teaser: Henry Black and Andrew Vickers discuss "Intention to treat" using an analogy of driving to the beach. Does it count if you turn back?

Headlines: Warning! Media Distorts Results With Alarming Headlines!
Teaser: Henry Black and Andrew Vickers discuss how the media typically simplifies complex research findings which, given the increasing sophistication of clinical trials, can be very troublesome.

Headlines: Player on First! Can a Markov Model Get Him to Second?
Teaser: Henry Black and Andrew Vickers discuss the Markov statistical model and whether results that come out of these computations can be used for practice.

Headlines: Trial of Gabapentin May Have Been a Marketing Ploy
Teaser: The stated aim of the phase 4 STEPS trial was to study efficacy and safety of gabapentin; Instead, it may have been a "seeding trial" to promote the drug's use, researchers suggest.

Headlines: Clinical Trials: What Needs to Change?
Teaser: Four researchers in the field of medical oncology discuss the complex problems facing the conduct of clinical trials in the current regulatory and economic environment.

Headlines: Huge Databases and Meta-Analyses: Can We Trust Them to Treat?
Teaser: Henry Black and Andrew Vickers discuss studies based on large databases and meta-analyses and whether they have a place on clinical decision-making.

Headlines: Your Patient Is at 21% Risk for Something -- Now What?
Teaser: Henry Black and Andrew Vickers discuss risk stratification and how to decide whether and how to treat patients at relatively low risk.

Headlines: And Then There Were 5
Teaser: Dr. Robert Comis, Group Chair of ECOG, discusses ongoing changes in the cooperative groups and in other stakeholders involved in clinical cancer research.

Headlines: New Tool Aims to Boost Diversity in Clinical Trials
Teaser: A new Web-based "Clinical Trials Atlas" could help close the gap for minority enrollment in clinical trials.

Headlines: What's Happening at ASCO This Year
Teaser: Some of the cancer news highlights that will be hitting the headlines are described.

Headlines: Personalized Therapy Trials Up Response and Survival
Teaser: Phase 1 trials in cancer patients normally see a response in only 5% of patients, but an attempt to personalize with targeted therapy raised this to 27%.

Headlines: Therapeutic Options for Enterobacteriaceae Infections
Teaser: Carbapenem resistance in Enterobacteriaceae is rapidly becoming a serious problem. What other therapeutic options are available--and under investigation--to combat these infections?

Headlines: Blinatumomab Produced Complete Remission in ALL
Teaser: A novel antibody resulted in complete remission and negative status for minimal residual disease in 75% of patients with aggressive (acute lymphoblastic leukemia) ALL in small study.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Radiologists Urge FDA To Accept PET-Based Criteria
Teaser: The FDA has accepted only CT scans and Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors/RECIST to date. What clinical impact might such a change have?

Headlines: Stem Cells in Drug and Toxicological Screening
Teaser: Can stem cells be used to determine drug safety?

Headlines: Evaluating Sex and Gender in Migraine and Headache Research
Teaser: Several hypotheses have been proposed to explain the sex differences observed in migraine and other headache disorders, and numerous studies conducted, but how valid are their findings?

Headlines: Trends in Rhythm Control Therapies After AFFIRM and RACE Trials
Teaser: Significant utilization changes were observed in the years following the publication of the AFFIRM and RACE trials. What has the net effect been?

Headlines: 'Data Gone Wrong': Unreproducible Cancer Genomics Studies
Teaser: The saga of Dr. Potti has brought attention to the increasing complexity of "omics" research and the need for validation and reproducibility.

Headlines: Future of Nanomedicine: Obstacles and Remedies
Teaser: Although nanomedicine has the potential to revolutionize treatment for many diseases, it faces challenging economic, social and safety-related obstacles.

Headlines: Faster Response Rates in CML with Bosutinib
Teaser: In patients newly diagnosed with chronic myeloid leukemia (CML), bosutinib treatment resulted in better rates of major molecular response than imatinib.

Headlines: Dr. Lee J. Helman Honored by ASCO
Teaser: Lee J. Helman, MD, will receive the 2011 Pediatric Oncology Award and Lecture from the American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) at its annual meeting.

Headlines: Better Late Than Never: Antivirals for Dengue
Teaser: Despite estimates by the WHO that one third of the earth’s population is at risk of dengue infection, there is currently no approved vaccine or antiviral available.

Headlines: Antimicrobials for Bacterial Bioterrorism Agents
Teaser: The efficacy of current antimicrobials against highly virulent pathogens that may be used in bioterrorism is limited. What current options and new strategies in drug development show promise?

Headlines: Case Report on Trial: Do You Swear to Tell the Truth?
Teaser: This editorial ponders the value of case reports. Can the medical community learn from one case? The answer--a resounding "yes."

Headlines: Welcome to Developments to Watch
Teaser: This series of video programs highlights research at Sanford-Burnham Medical Research Institute and how it will affect clinical practice in the coming years.

Headlines: Objective Response Rates: No Such Thing
Teaser: A study in the variability of tumor measurements on repeat CT scans suggests to Dr. Kathy Miller that objective response rates in clinical trials may be anything but.

Headlines: Summer Reading:  One Doc's Required List
Teaser: Dr. Bruce Cheson designates 2 award-winning, nonfiction books as compulsory reading for his oncology fellows and recommends the titles to Medscape viewers as rewarding summer reading.

Headlines: The Pharmacist's Role in Preventing Antibiotic Resistance
Teaser: What is antibiotic stewardship?

Headlines: NIH, NMA Renew Push for Minorities in Clinical Trials
Teaser: Lung cancer experts praise the "enormous achievement" of a randomized trial showing a reduction in mortality from early detection with computed tomography screening.

Headlines: Public Citizen Wants 'Unethical' Canakinumab Trials Halted
Teaser: About a quarter of the phase 3 trials presented at ASCO annual meetings are either unpublished or publication has been greatly delayed.

Headlines: Patients Wait for Cures While Journals Fuss About Font Sizes
Teaser: Using 3 short cases, Dr. Andrew Vickers describes the frustration that some authors face when submitting articles for journal publication.

Headlines: Diagnosis and Management of Sjögren's Syndrome
Teaser: Sjorgren's syndrome is a common but difficult-to-treat autoimmune disease. The need to explore new therapies is becoming an important issue to overcome.

Headlines: Use of IV Ketorolac for Postoperative Analgesia in Infants
Teaser: Is IV ketorolac safe for postoperative analgesia in infants?

Headlines: Cancer Immunotherapy: Sipuleucel-T and Beyond
Teaser: Will this anticancer vaccine change the future of cancer treatment?

Headlines: Too Many Tumors, Too Little Unity
Teaser: Dr. John Marshall recommends that advocacy groups in pancreatic cancer, colorectal cancer, gastric cancer, etc unite under the banner of GI cancer to lobby more effectively for public support.

Headlines: Pancreatic Cancer Treatment and Research
Teaser: Learn about the most important strides that have been made in improving outcomes with pancreatic cancer therapy.

Headlines: Top Cancer Professor Leaves Academia for US Pharma
Teaser: Minority participation in clinical trials remains lower than in the general population, accounting for only 10% of participants in multicenter clinical trials.

Headlines: Projected Pharmacy Education and Research, 2010 to 2015
Teaser: Will the economy and healthcare reform alter the numbers of future PharmD graduates and pharmacy residents?

Headlines: Yale to Provide Review of Medtronic’s Infuse DataYale to Provide Review of Medtronic's Infuse Data
Teaser: Dr. Jim Cassidy, who was until recently professor of oncology at the University of Glasgow, is the now head of translational research at Roche US.

Headlines: Use of Chemo Assays Outside Clinical Trials Still a No No
Teaser: The watchdog group says the predictable risks of using the immunosuppressant, which emerged in trials for gouty arthritis, appear to outweigh the potential benefits.

Headlines: Cell Phone Study Was Flawed, Say Some Experts
Teaser: A group of neuro-oncologists insist that the time has come to include patients with brain tumors in phase 1 trials in oncology.

Headlines: Promising Developments in Osteoporosis Treatment
Teaser: Promising new treatments for osteoporosis are under study.

Headlines: Yet Another Retraction for Potti Cancer Gene Research
Teaser: The company hopes to answer criticism that side effects of their Infuse Bone Graft in spinal fusion surgery went unreported in published studies. Yale proposes a "new model" for collaboration between industry and academia.

Headlines: Include Patients With Brain Tumors in Phase 1 Trials
Teaser: The American Society of Clinical Oncology continues to recommend against the use of chemotherapy sensitivity and resistance assays, except in the setting of a clinical trial.

Headlines: An Effective Warfarin Alternative?
Teaser: In his first Medscape video commentary, Dr. Hans-Christoph Diener discusses the investigational drug apixaban as a possible alternative to warfarin for stroke prevention in patients with atrial fibrillation.

Headlines: New Drugs Beyond Biologics in Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: Blocking intracellular signaling cascades is a promising therapeutic target in rheumatoid arthritis.

Headlines: Insider Knowledge of Trial Results May Influence Stock Price
Teaser: Traditional large-scale trials, which recruit large numbers of patients and take years to complete, might not be the best approach for newer targeted cancer therapies.

Headlines: New Trial Approach Needed for Targeted Cancer Therapies
Teaser: Slow uptake of the investigational opioid NKTR-181 in the central nervous system reduces the euphoria and sedation that attracts opioid abusers.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Influence of Global Region on HF Beta-Blocker Trials
Teaser: Globalization of clinical trials represents an advance for researchers and patients, but new challenges come with a geographically diverse patient population.

Headlines: Novel Opioid May Deter Abuse Through Slow-Acting Analgesia
Teaser: Practicing-changing data, personalized medicine, and the integration of translational science into clinical practice.

Headlines: Opportunities and Pitfalls of Cancer Imaging in Clinical Trials
Teaser: Bruno Morgan discusses advantages and limitations of currently available imaging modalities and highlights the challenges associated with the incorporation of imaging biomarkers into clinical cancer trials.

Headlines: What Does Physics Have to Do With Cancer?
Teaser: Can the new US National Cancer Institute Physical Sciences-Oncology Centers initiative help us to better understand the complexity of this disease?

Headlines: What's Hot at ECCO/ESMO 2011
Teaser: In yet another chapter of the Anil Potti saga, several patients have filed a lawsuit against the beleaguered researcher and Duke University.

Headlines: Gene Sequencers Face Govt Budget Squeeze
Teaser: MG01C1, an extended-release formula of nonstimulant metadoxine, demonstrates safety and efficacy in a phase 2 randomized trial in adults with ADHD.

Headlines: Dr. Potti and Duke University Sued Over Faulty Research
Teaser: A recent study, which found that children using cell phones do not have a higher risk for brain cancer, is flawed and the findings are biased, say some scientists.

Headlines: Extended-Release Metadoxine Safe and Effective for ADHD
Teaser: A fifth paper authored by former Duke University physician and cancer researcher Anil Potti has been retracted. Is he setting a record?

Headlines: Revisiting 'Older' Antimicrobials
Teaser: Some older antibiotics have experienced a 'rebirth' for treatment of multidrug-resistant pathogens.

Headlines: Broader Implications of Vemurafenib Approval
Teaser: Dr. Maurie Markman looks at the recent FDA approval of vemurafenib for melanoma and considers its potential impact on future genomic clinical trials, drug costs, and more.

Headlines: How Does Linagliptin Compare With Other DPP-4 Inhibitors?
Teaser: Linagliptin is the latest addition to the array of medications available to treat type 2 diabetes. Dr. Anne Peters describes its role in the overall armamentarium.

Headlines: Congress Urged To Renew Commitment to Cancer Research
Teaser: Companies that make the gene-sequencing devices used in scientific research face a tough few years as potential cuts to the U.S. federal budget squeeze funding to its main academic and research customers.

Headlines: Tumorigenesis: The Origins of Glioma
Teaser: Liu and colleagues identify oligodendrocyte precursor cells as the cell of origin for glioma that is caused by inactivating mutations in neurofibromatosis.

Headlines: Many Trials Indicate Benefit of HIV Preexposure Prophylaxis
Teaser: Several trials of oral or topical antiretroviral compounds designed to prevent the transmission of HIV by sexual intercourse have produced proof of concept for preexposure prophylaxis.

Headlines: U.S. Authorities Perplexed by Drug Shortage Spike
Teaser: Two years into an escalating shortage of life-saving cancer drugs, regulators and lawmakers are still unable to identify why it is happening, let alone how to solve the problem.

Headlines: Managing Metastatic Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Will new, emerging therapies complement existing treatment options for metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer?

Headlines: Intense Obesity Interventions Don't Increase Attrition
Teaser: Diet and behavioral treatments had the largest effect on obesity-trial dropout rates; high-intensity interventions did not have an effect.

Headlines: Cell Phones and Brain Tumors: No Link, But Is Study Flawed?
Teaser: The largest study to date has found no overall association between cell phone use and brain tumors, but experts say the study is flawed.

Headlines: Liposomes As Drug Delivery Systems for the Treatment of TB
Teaser: Liposome nanocarriers are promising new delivery systems for anti-TB drugs by both intravenous and inhaled routes.

Headlines: New Drug Review 2011
Teaser: These drugs are "new molecular entities" -- they contain chemical substances marketed for the first time in the US.

Headlines: Will New Antimicrobials Overcome Resistance?
Teaser: The spread of resistance among Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria represents a growing challenge for the development of new antimicrobials.

Headlines: ACG Meeting Spotlights Hot Gastroenterology Topics for 2011
Teaser: One featured lecture will look at how food components can trigger or induce certain functional gut disorders.

Headlines: Tackling Diabetes and Obesity From a Different Angle
Teaser: Metabolism regulation is key in heading off the development of obesity and type 2 diabetes and may prove to be a new avenue for therapeutic intervention in both of these disorders.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Change in the Clinical Encounter Following Research Participation
Teaser: What are the short- and long-term effects on clinician and/or patient behavior after participation in a practice-based research network study?

Headlines: ARV-based Microbicides and Pre-exposure Prophylaxis for HIV
Teaser: The promising results of both ARV-based microbicides and oral PrEP have given the HIV prevention field a much-needed boost.

Headlines: Novel Drug Shows Promise for Mixed-Lineage Leukemia
Teaser: The small molecule inhibitor offers a new therapeutic mechanism for targeting mixed-lineage leukemia.

Headlines: Trial Drug Slows Slow Progression of Pulmonary Fibrosis
Teaser: An investigational agent shows a trend toward stabilizing lung function by significantly reducing the decline in forced vital capacity in patients with pulmonary fibrosis.

Headlines: Sulodexide -- Another Hope for Diabetic Nephropathy Blasted
Teaser: Jeffrey Bern comments on recent studies that have put to rest any notion of benefits from sulodexide for diabetic kidney disease.

Headlines: Certolizumab Pegol in Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: How safe and effective is Certolizumab Pegol for the treatment of Rheumatoid Arthritis?

Headlines: Global Spread of Carbapenemase-producing Enterobacteriaceae
Teaser: We believe we are now at the edge of 2 concomitant epidemics of carbapenemase producers worldwide. Is prevention possible?

Headlines: Cellular Adjuvants for Therapeutic Vaccines Against Cancer
Teaser: Various adjuvant products are currently under evaluation as potential candidates for use in cancer vaccines.

Headlines: Predicting Progression in MS, Plus Other Breakthroughs
Teaser: Dr. Fred Lublin discusses exciting advances in the understanding of multiple sclerosis disease course and pathophysiology based on findings from this year’s ECTRIMS/ACTRIMS 5th Joint Triennial Congress.

Headlines: Thyroid Cancer Stem Cells
Teaser: Understanding of the cellular origin of thyroid cancer may help identify therapeutic targets.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Randomized Phase II Trials: A Long-term Investment
Teaser: The high rate of failure in phase III trials suggest that current phase II trials are not adequately informative. Can the predictive value of phase II trials be improved by utilizing randomization?

Headlines: Improved Survival in CRC; Regorafenib Study Halted
Teaser: A pivotal phase 3 trial was stopped when an interim analysis revealed that patients on the investigational drug had significantly longer overall survival.

Headlines: FDA Approval for Medications Used in the PICU
Teaser: Many medications prescribed and administered in pediatric intensive care units may not have FDA approval. What steps should be taken to rectify this problem?

Headlines: Drugmakers See Pressure Points in Emerging Markets
Teaser: GlaxoSmithKline Chief Executive Andrew Witty says he is an "extreme bull" on emerging markets, echoing the view of Big Pharma peers that the world's fast-growing economies will drive drug sales as Western markets flag.

Headlines: Highlights of the Upcoming ACR 2011 Annual Meeting
Teaser: Attendees can expect information on pain, osteoarthritis, targets for rheumatoid arthritis, and new technology for imaging gout.

Headlines: Promising Results for Daclizumab High-Yield in MS
Teaser: Results of the phase 2b SELECT trial suggest this daclizumab formulation may be a useful option in MS.

Headlines: Yale Docs Propose Model to Aid True, Evidence-Based Medicine
Teaser: Making all clinical-trial data on products freely available for public dissemination once they are on the market is vital if doctors and patients are to make properly informed decisions about treatment, say two Yale clinicians. They have proposed a new model for transparency and have their first volunteer: Medtronic.

Source: Current Opinion in Allergy and Clinical Immunology
Headlines: Ocular Surface Damage by Ophthalmic Compounds
Teaser: A review of the ways to identify and minimize ocular surface damage in patients using chronic eye drop therapies.

Headlines: New Antibiotics in the Pipeline But Situation Still Dire
Teaser: Despite some progress in the clinical development of new antimicrobial agents against resistant Gram-negative bacteria (GNB), none has been identified that is active against panresistant GNB.

Headlines: Clinical Trials in Idiopathic Inflammatory Myopathies
Teaser: Proper evaluation of treatment in IIM is difficult due to the rare and heterogeneous nature of the disease.

Headlines: Raynaud's Phenomenon and Digital Ischaemic Complications
Teaser: The networking of clinicians has facilitated key advances in the management of Raynaud's phenomenon.

Headlines: When Is It Ethical to Withhold a Research Incentive?
Teaser: Is it fair for institutional review boards (IRBs) to offer incentives to survey participants? This commentary looks at the issue.

Headlines: The Effect of Simvastatin in Penile Erection
Teaser: Is simvastatin beneficial in the treatment of erectile dysfunction? The STED trial investigates.

Headlines: Erasmus MC Fires Poldermans; ESC Reviews His Work
Teaser: Erasmus Medical Center has fired Dr Don Poldermans, a well-known researcher in cardiovascular medicine, for academic misconduct.

Headlines: Two New Drugs Poised to Replace Interferon in HCV Treatment

Headlines: Novel Nasal Spray Bests Current First-Line Therapies for SAR
Teaser: A combination nasal spray is effective, well-tolerated, and provides a significant reduction in total nasal symptom score, compared with 2 first-line therapies for seasonal allergic rhinitis (SAR).

Teaser: PSI-7977, a pill taken once daily in combination with ribavirin and pegylated interferon, achieved 100% cure rate in hard-to-treat interleukin 28B T/T genotype HCV patients.

Headlines: New HCV Drug Achieves 100% Cure Rate Without Interferon
Teaser: A new oral polymerase inhibitor targeting the hepatitis C virus (HCV) achieved a 100% cure rate when used in combination with ribavirin, with or without the addition of interferon.

Headlines: ASCO Unveils New Vision for Transforming Cancer Research
Teaser: The American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) has issued a detailed prescription to transform clinical cancer research in the United States and speed the development of new therapies.

Headlines: Dutch Psychologist Admits He Made up Research Data
Teaser: A Dutch psychologist has admitted making up data and faking research over many years in studies which were then published in peer-reviewed scientific journals.

Headlines: Prostate Cancer Trial Stopped as MDV3100 Improves Survival
Teaser: It is likely that an experimental agent will eventually join the ranks of treatment for men with advanced disease.

Headlines: Improving Delivery of Nanomedicines to Solid Tumors

Headlines: MDV3100: New Variable in Already Complex Equation?
Teaser: Although new therapies for prostate cancer are always welcome, they further complicate the challenges that clinicians face in advising and managing patients, notes Dr. Gerald Chodak.

Headlines: What's Spooky About These Data?
Teaser: Dr. Bruce Cheson finds it spooky that a well-established investigator publishes a letter in NEJM questioning data from a previously published study in which he was the senior author.

Headlines: Effectiveness of Tocilizumab for Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: How safe and effective is tocilizumab for rheumatoid arthritis patients?

Headlines: Biologics: The Next-Generation Therapeutics for Analgesia?
Teaser: Current therapies for the treatment of chronic pain conditions are inadequate, and there's an urgent need for more effective analgesics. Are biologic agents, such as monoclonal antibodies, the answer?

Headlines: Management of Atrial Fibrillation Around the World
Teaser: Atrial fibrillation is the same worldwide, but treatments and interpretation of guidelines may vary - depending on where you are.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Development of Experimental Drug Combinations for Cancer
Teaser: Despite evidence of improved benefit of combined anticancer agents, the majority drugs are developed as single agents, resulting in substantial failure rates.

Headlines: Is the Cold Pressor Task Ethically Acceptable in Children?
Teaser: The cold pressor task is a commonly used experimental method of inducing pain, but it poses ethical concerns when used with children. How do researchers, children, and parents perceive it?

Headlines: The Silent Minority--Unpublished Data on Cancer Care
Teaser: Studies that would have had clinical impact if published promptly are coming out of the closet, but may still have an impact . . .

Headlines: Drug Approval Challenges in Personalized Treatment
Teaser: Why is the development of individualized treatment for cancer occurring slowly?

Headlines: 2011 Top Game Changers in Nephrology
Teaser: Our Medscape advisors selected and ranked top studies in 2011 that they felt had a significant impact on nephrology practice.

Headlines: Game Changers in Pediatrics 2011
Teaser: A quick tour of the year's most important new studies and guidelines in pediatrics -- a must read for everyone who cares for children!

Headlines: A Personal Note--40 Years After the Cancer Act
Teaser: The Cancer Act had a mandate "to support research and the application of the results of research, to reduce the incidence, morbidity and mortality from cancer." Has it been effective?

Headlines: Lipid-based Nanoformulation of Irinotecan
Teaser: A liposomal delivery system for the antineoplastic drug irinotecan may improve its effectiveness by providing both antivascular as well as antitumor mechanism of activity.

Teaser: While social networking sites are a tempting place to implement a research study involving young people, special effort must be made to pay attention to consent, confidentiality, and security.

Source: Annals of Clinical Microbiology and Antimicrobials
Headlines: Antimutagenic and Antioxidant Effects of Accacia salicina
Teaser: The authors examine the potential antioxidant and antimutagenic effects of leaf extracts from Accacia salicina, a species of Acacia tree.

Headlines: Major Clinical Advances in Cancer in 2011
Teaser: Twelve major clinical advances and another 42 notable advances are highlighted this year by the American Society of Clinical Oncology.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Company Stock Prices Related to Oncology Drugs
Teaser: How do public announcements regarding experimental anticancer drugs affect stock prices?

Headlines: Use of Genetically Engineered T Cells in B Cell Malignancies
Teaser: Autologous infusions of genetically engineered T-cells that express chimeric-antigen receptors might be a promising new treatment for advanced B-cell malignancies.

Headlines: Finding the Right Drug for the Right Disease
Teaser: Advances in drug screening and drug discovery are changing the way we move new agents from bench to bedside.

Headlines: The State of Osteoarthritis: Where We Are and What to Expect
Teaser: What have been the biggest advances in osteoarthritis in recent years? And what's around the corner?

Headlines: Diabetes Mega-Trials: ‘We Are Entering a New Era of Thinking’
Teaser: Results from ACCORD and other landmark trials have generated a new paradigm for treating patients with type 2 diabetes, reports Dr. Leszek Czupryniak, President of Diabetes Poland.

Headlines: Exercise in a Pill?
Teaser: New ways of looking at fat metabolism and muscle action in obesity have improved our understanding of the mechanisms behind the benefits of exercise. Is exercise in a pill the next step?

Headlines: Bacterial Type I Signal Peptidases As Antibiotic Targets

Headlines: FDA Aims to Enroll More Women in Medical Device Studies
Teaser: The FDA has issued draft guidelines intended to improve the representation of women, as appropriate, in clinical studies of medical devices.

Headlines: Vorinostat Shows Activity as Salvage in Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: A registration phase 3 trial met its primary end point, but the results were not as good as many in the field were hoping for.

Headlines: Red-Wine Researcher Charged With 'Photoshop' Fraud
Teaser: A University of Connecticut investigation found Dipak K. Das, PhD, guilty of falsifying and fabricating images that appeared in published research.

Headlines: Potential New Treatment Target for Retinoblastoma
Teaser: Genetic sequencing has identified an unexpected target for which experimental drugs are already being tested.

Headlines: Apparent Declining Efficacy in Randomized HIV Trials
Teaser: This article discusses the trends in recent HIV clinical trials.

Headlines: Mesoporous Silica Nanoparticles in Targeted Cancer Therapy
Teaser: This report looks at the therapeutic efficacy and safety of mesoporous silica nanoparticles, inorganic particulates under investigation as a drug delivery mechanism for targeted cancer therapy.

Headlines: What's New in Pediatric Oncology?
Teaser: Read about some of the important information presented at the International Society of Pediatric Oncology annual meeting.

Headlines: The Mosaic of Diabetes

Headlines: Clinical Trial Woes: Where Are the Drugs?

Headlines: Sjogren's Syndrome: An Update on Diagnosis and Management

Headlines: Tocilizumab: A Novel Therapy for Large-vessel Vasculitis
Teaser: Is tocilizumab an effective treatment option for large-vessel vasculitis?

Headlines: Healthcare Payers: Gate or Bridge to Personalized Medicine?
Teaser: According to healthcare payers, what are the benefits of pharmacogenomics?

Headlines: Development of Diagnostics for Neuropsychiatric Disorders

Headlines: Disturbance of Cytokine Networks in Sjogren's Syndrome
Teaser: New insights into interconnected cytokines in primary Sjogren's syndrome may lead to new treatments.

Headlines: Hemoglobin A1c, BP With Eye Exam for Diabetic Retinopathy
Teaser: The Diabetic Retinopathy Clinical Research study continues to yield important information about diabetic retinopathy, macular edema, and associated conditions. More studies are planned.

Headlines: Use of Administrative Claims Data for RA Treatment Research
Teaser: A claims-based algorithm to evaluate the clinical effectiveness of rheumatoid arthritis medications seems promising.

Headlines: A Randomized Colorectal Cancer Screening Intervention Trial
Teaser: This article recounts the challenging and sometimes onerous aspects of conducting a practice-based, randomized colorectal cancer screening intervention trial.

Headlines: Drug Shortages for Infectious Diseases Are Increasing
Teaser: A new study shows a rising number of drugs for infectious diseases that are in short supply, with serious consequences.

Source: Annals of Clinical Microbiology and Antimicrobials

Headlines: MDV3100 in Prostate Cancer 'Exceeded Expectations'

Headlines: When is Diabetes Distress Clinically Meaningful?

Headlines: Do Unpublished Data Need an Expiration Date?

Headlines: Drug Development: Lessons From an Undeveloped Drug

Headlines: Immunomodulatory Effects of Antimicrobial Agents. Part I

Teaser: The National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) has some hot topics on its annual conference agenda this year.

Headlines: Asthma Research Needs Standardized Outcomes for NIH Funding

Headlines: ICDs, Guidelines, and National Registries

Headlines: New ART Drugs in Treatment-experienced HIV-infected Patients
Teaser: What is the efficacy of new ART drugs in treatment-experienced patients?

Headlines: Slew of Targeted Cancer Drugs on the Way
Teaser: More targeted cancer drugs, some with companion diagnostic tests to identify patients most likely to respond, are under clinical development.

Headlines: Herbalism Helps Headache
Teaser: This short commentary highlights some novel therapeutic agents derived from natural sources that may prove to be effective against migraine and other forms of headache.

Headlines: Drug Shortages Compromise Oncology Research

Headlines: Bridge Grants Pick Up NIH Slack in Pediatric Cancer Research

Teaser: A new dream team will address resistance pathways for hormone-refractory prostate cancer, with a special emphasis on metastatic disease.

Teaser: Could phages, the viruses that kill bacteria, help fight antibiotic-resistant bacteria?

Headlines: Immunotherapy Highlights From American Society of Hematology

Teaser: Cardiologist Henry Black talks to family physician Robert Morrow about the still missing JNC 8 and whether guidelines should be dependent on clinical trials only.

Teaser: Is TKA more effective when combined with non-surgical treatments? The MEDIC-study investigates.

Teaser: Can this herbal antioxidant reduce the risk of atherosclerosis?

Headlines: Vitamin D Supplementation and the Allergy Pandemic
Teaser: What does a link between vitamin D supplementation and allergy mean for the masses who are vitamin D deficient?

Teaser: Could the new ciclesonide HFA intranasal spray become a useful tool for allergic rhinitis in children?

Headlines: Asians vs Caucasians - Lung Cancer and Systemic Therapy
Teaser: For lung cancer treatment, find out why ethnicity may make all the difference in the design and conduct of a global clinical study.

Headlines: Heart Failure Diagnosis: Not a Death Sentence
Teaser: Medscape interviewed Mihai Gheorghiade, MD, concerning the IMPROVE-HF study that provided support a new paradigm for how heart failure should be viewed and treated.

Headlines: What's Hot at AUA 2012?
Teaser: Here are some of the highlights and offerings of the upcoming meeting.

Teaser: What are the specific ethical issues involved in genotype-driven research recruitment?

Headlines: What's Hot at ASCO This Year?
Teaser: ASCO 2012: This year's theme is 'collaborating to conquer cancer'; a look through the information to be presented shows several drugs with novel mechanisms of action.

Headlines: Proton Pump Inhibitors: The Latest News
Teaser: Dr. David Johnson reviews the up-to-the-minute news, research, and alerts related to proton pump inhibitors, distinguishing what is sound from what is just noise.

Teaser: A better understanding of metabolism has led researchers to explore its role in diabetes, obesity, and cancer. What are the implications for clinical practice?

Headlines: Genomic Medicine in Atherosclerotic Cardiovascular Disease
Teaser: Can pharmacogenomics predict who is at risk for MI?

Headlines: ACE Inhibitors and ARB Blockers for Ischemic Heart Disease
Teaser: Learn more about the comparative effectiveness of ACE-I/ARB in patients with or at high risk for stable ischemic heart disease.

Headlines: Rival Emerges in BRAF Inhibition for Melanoma
Teaser: Efficacy data are still maturing, but skin toxicity is lower with a new agent.

Teaser: Performing clinical trials can get complex. What went wrong in this trial of lupus nephritis patients?

Headlines: Scientific Achievement Award  2011: Defeating Diabesity
Teaser: What if a drug could treat both diabetes and obesity? You might be surprised at the latest in research and drug development.

Headlines: Central Blood Pressure for Guiding Hypertension Management

Headlines: Exceptional Breakthroughs in Melanoma
Teaser: It's another banner year for melanoma research. Dr. Kim Margolin summarizes what you might have missed at ASCO® 2012.

Headlines: A Glimpse Into Medical Reporting
Teaser: How does a neurologist-writer choose what to report on from among the thousands of presentations at AAN?

Headlines: Recent Clinical Trials to Preserve B-Cell Function in T1DM
Teaser: Can pharmacologic interventions delay development of type 1 diabetes? Learn what critical lessons research has taught us.

Headlines: The Future of CCR5 Antagonists in Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: Are CCR5 inhibitors useful in the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis?

Headlines: Toward a Global Oncology
Teaser: The needs of patients with cancer are the same the world over, and cancer clinicians have common aims. An international panel of experts discusses how to improve cancer care worldwide.

Headlines: Publication Bias in Antipsychotic Drug Trials

Headlines: PD-1 Agent 'Breaks Ceiling' in Cancer Immunotherapy

Headlines: T-DM1 Improves Outcomes in HER2-Positive Breast Cancer

Headlines: Pocketbook Influences Cancer Clinical Trial Sign-Up
Teaser: First patient-reported data on income and trials.

Headlines: Journals, Conferences Have Different Publication Criteria

This and other surprising discrepancies warrant further investigation, say the authors.

Headlines: Afatinib Doubles Progression-Free Survival in Lung Cancer

Headlines: What's Hot at the ADA 72nd Scientific Sessions

Headlines: Regorafenib Improves Survival in Drug-Resistant GIST

Teaser: Does DPP-4 regulate adipose inflammation in obesity?

Teaser: How are hormone levels affected by diet in patients with PCOS?

Teaser: Can this mineralocorticoid receptor antagonist reduce PTH secretion?

Teaser: What are the pros and cons of patent foramen ovale closure, when compared to medical management?

Headlines: New Medicines for the Control and Elimination of Malaria
Teaser: What is on the horizon for new therapies in the treatment of malaria?

Teaser: Challenges and recommendations for collecting adequate, representative samples for pharmacogenomic and future research in global trials are identified by the Drug Information Association.

Teaser: This F1000 commentary reports on enzalutamide, a novel antiandrogen in patients with metastatic prostate cancer.

Headlines: Is Neoadjuvant BEV Right for Triple-Negative Disease?
Teaser: Dr. Gunter von Minckwitz reports on intriguing data from the GeparQuinto trial and discusses with Dr. Lidia Schapira the roster of neoadjuvant trials from German investigators.

Teaser: Drs. Fabrice André and Kathy Miller discuss the BOLERO trials and how expanding data on everolimus and mTOR inhibition are changing breast cancer practice and research.

Teaser: An expert panel discusses a new initiative between the National Kidney Foundation and the FDA to make it easier to bring drugs to market sooner.

Headlines: Why Are Only 3% of US Cancer Patients in Clinical Trials?

Headlines: T-Cell Lymphomas: Moving Forward, Improving Outcomes

Teaser: An ex vivo examination seeks to determine whether outflow facility can be increased with a microstent.

Headlines: Modeling Schizophrenia: Uncovering Novel Therapeutic Targets

Headlines: Development of SARS Vaccines and Therapeutics Still Needed
Teaser: The development of vaccines and therapeutics for the prevention and treatment of SARS is still an urgent issue that needs to be addressed.

Teaser: Treatment options for gonorrhea are diminishing rapidly due to antimicrobial resistance. Is an era of untreatable gonorrhea approaching?

Headlines: Endovascular Treatment Following IV tPA in Acute Stroke
Teaser: Find out why this trial was halted.

Teaser: This study enrolled patients with ED-SCLC as well as those with advanced NSCLC. Results for the ED-SCLC cohort are presented here.

Teaser: The utilization of EGF receptor targeting to enhance delivery of chemotherapeutic and diagnostic agents to EGFR-overexpressing cancers is a novel and promising strategy in nanomedicine.

Teaser: Presenters at the American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology meeting will discuss oral and sublingual approaches and the latest on tolerance.

Headlines: RCCT of Atorvastatin in Reducing the Severity of Sepsis
Teaser: Do statin naive patients with sepsis have lower severity of illness with a daily dose of atorvastatin?

Headlines: Novel Drug for Glioblastoma Bombs in Phase 3 Trial
Teaser: A large phase 3 study of a novel investigational agent for glioblastoma has bombed.

Headlines: Nine Cancer Researchers Win New, Big Prizes ($3 Million)
Teaser: Big money is awarded to big stars of science. Not everyone thinks it is a great idea.

Headlines: Nose-to-Brain Nanoparticles for Malaria and Alzheimer'...

Headlines: White Coat Hypertension in the Very Elderly: Worth Treating?
Teaser: Henry Black discusses a study on white coat hypertension in the very elderly, which suggested that treating these patients can still be beneficial.

Headlines: Immune Modulators as Adjuncts in Invasive Fungal Infections
Teaser: Antifungal immunotherapy now includes age-old interventions as well as promising experimental techniques, but transition from the bench to clinical-phase studies just isn't keeping pace. . .

Headlines: Treatment of Hypovitaminosis D With Cholecalciferol
Teaser: Does oral vitamin D3 work just as well as intramuscular vitamin D3?

Headlines: Microbicides for the Prevention of Sexually Transmitted HIV
Teaser: Can microbicide development aid in the prevention of HIV transmission?

Headlines: Dramatic Changes in Treatment Landscape of MDS

Headlines: GlaxoSmithKline Boss Says New Drugs Can Be Cheaper

Headlines: Antibiotics Crisis Prompts Rethink on Risks, Rewards

Headlines: Top Court to Hear Generic Drug Liability Arguments
Teaser: The Supreme Court will hear arguments on in a case that could decide whether generic drugmakers can be held liable for alleged flaws in the designs of their medications.

Headlines: Dietary Protein in Weight Management

Headlines: Biotargeted Nanomedicines for Cancer

Headlines: Anthrax Vaccine Testing in Children: Strict New Guidelines
Teaser: An independent commission has devised a series of steps to minimize risk to children in both pre- and postevent scenarios.

Headlines: American Academy of Neurology (AAN) 65th Annual Meeting

Headlines: Polypharmacology: Drug Discovery for the Future

Headlines: Peptidergic Drugs for Treatment of Traumatic Brain Injury

Teaser: Are pyronaridine-artesunate granules an effective treatment option for children with P. falciparum malaria?

Headlines: Big Pharma Waits Nervously on India Drug Verdict

Headlines: Pharmacogenomics: A Bridge to Individualized Cancer Therapy

Teaser: Find out why the FDA is taking a cautious approach with a new therapy that could help patients with heart failure to stay in tune.

Teaser: How do radiotherapy protocol deviations in clinical trials affect treatment failure and overall mortality?

Teaser: Key to addressing the treatment needs of patients with ADHD is the development of psychometrically validated instruments to measure treatment response.

Teaser: The budget cuts resulting from the sequester brought patients, advocates, and scientists together at a protest rally.

Headlines: A New Standard of Care in Advanced Gastric Cancer
Teaser: Results from a phase 3 trial of an experimental agent indicate that change will come to the clinic.

Teaser: Drs. Black and Ferdinand discuss risk reduction, health disparity, and the imperative to insure patients.

Teaser: Read clinically focused news coverage of key developments from AACR 2013.

Teaser: Waldmann, a pioneer in cytokine biology, reports the first-in-human Phase I trial of Hu-Mikb1.

Headlines: American Diabetes Association (ADA) 73rd Scientific Sessions®
Teaser: Read clinically focused news coverage of key developments from ADA 2013.

Teaser: Don't keep an 'ACE in the hole'. Use it first. Find out why.

Headlines: Artesunate-Mefloquine, Partnerships in Drug Development
Teaser: A safe and efficacious fixed dose combination treatment is now available to treat malaria patients in resource-poor settings.

Teaser: The treatment of chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) takes a step forward with a new class of drug; data on ibrutinib are now published.

Teaser: A new research framework for surgical innovation should help improve the safety and effectiveness of surgical procedures and implantable devices.

Teaser: Are there different 'breath-prints' for asthma, lung cancer, COPD, and cystic fibrosis?

Teaser: Experts have proposed using manufacturers' clinical study reports to publish unpublished trials and correct misreported trials, as well as to let others publish the unpublished data.

Teaser: European regulators will clamp down on 'pay-for-delay' deals in the pharmaceutical sector, fining generic drug manufacturers for limiting access of cheaper products to the market.

Headlines: Cystic Fibrosis: New Assay May Help Individualize Care
Teaser: A simple cell culture assay may facilitate personalized diagnosis and treatment of patients with cystic fibrosis.

Teaser: Two new strategies to overcome barriers to clinical trial enrollment in patients and physicians might help increase accrual.

Teaser: ASCO has issued draft recommendations for the design of trials that provide 'clinically meaningful outcomes.'

Headlines: Funding Cuts Threaten Modernization of Cancer Research
Teaser: Scientific advances are being made, research and the regulatory process are becoming more efficient, but progress is being threatened by federal budget cuts.

Headlines: Ibrutinib: A Step Change in the Treatment of MCL
Teaser: For refractory mantle cell lymphoma, the response rate for ibrutinib is 70%; for chronic lymphocytic leukemia, it is a potential turning point.

Teaser: Do extracts of Artemisia parviflora, a plant belonging to the Aster family,  have antimicrobial and antioxidant properties?

Teaser: What is the most effective way for clinicians to treat glaucoma in patients with ocular surface disease?

Teaser: Is a randomised controlled trial of the management of reduced fetal movement feasible in women after 36 weeks gestation?

Headlines: Virus-Neutralizing Antibodies to Hepatitis C Virus
Teaser: Will new research in the adaptive immune response help scientists develop a vaccine against hepatitis C?

Headlines: Daratumumab Responses High and Durable in Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The investigational agent has shown unprecedented responses in a phase 1 trial, leading to an FDA breakthrough therapy designation for refractory disease.

Teaser: GlaxoSmithKline has opened access to patient-level data from more than 200 clinical trials for use by other research groups.

Teaser: Dolutegravir (DTG) is a newer, potent INI. How effective and tolerable is it in treatment-naïve HIV patients?

Teaser: Tumor vasculature presents an intriguing therapeutic target in a variety of cancers. How might nanotechnology provide strategies for future vascular-targeted therapy?

Teaser: This review focuses on recent progress in understanding the mechanisms of biofilm-specific antimicrobial resistance. What innovative anti-biofilm agents are in the pipeline?

Source: Annals of Clinical Microbiology and Antimicrobials
Headlines: Antibacterial Activity of a Pseudomonas Strain Against MRSA
Teaser: This study investigated the potential antibacterial activity of an extracellular compound derived from Pseudomonas aeruginosa. Could it be effective against MRSA?

Headlines: Treatment and Control of Scabies
Teaser: What options are available for the treatment of scabies?

Headlines: Small Molecules Targeting JAKs in the Treatment of RA
Teaser: Find out more about tofacitinib, which is now the first-in-class compound on the market in the USA for the treatment of RA.

Headlines: Does 'Fantastic' CRC Response Herald a New Era?
Teaser: Dr. David Kerr reports on a provocative phase 2 trial in quadruple wild-type colorectal cancer and surmises that CRC may be catching up with lung cancer as a disease increasingly defined by genotype.

Headlines: 3 Adjuvant Agents Are Plenty in Node-Positive Breast Cancer
Teaser: Dr. Lidia Schapira comments on the definitive NSABP B-38 randomized trial assessing 3 chemotherapy regimens in early node-positive breast cancer.

Headlines: What Is a Clinically Meaningful Effect?
Teaser: From drug makers to patients, stakeholders have different views on what constitutes a 'clinically meaningful effect.'

Headlines: 'Would You Sell Your Soul for $10?'
Teaser: Dr. Bruce Cheson forecasts that the Sunshine Act, requiring physicians to disclose most payment and gifts from industry over $10, will bring showers of misinterpretation and could hinder research.

Headlines: Why Did Radiation Cause Harm in NSCLC Trial?
Teaser: Dr. Mark Kris reviews the disappointing results of 3 radiotherapy trials from ASCO 2013 and stresses the need to understand the harmful results of a trial of high-dose radiotherapy for local control.

Source: Annals of Clinical Microbiology and Antimicrobials
Headlines: New Antibiotics for Bad Bugs: Where Are We?
Teaser: Only one new antibiotic has been approved by the FDA since 2010, and few are in the pipeline -- yet new antibiotics are urgently needed. What's the current status of antibiotic development?

Headlines: 8 Ways to Deal With Antibiotic Resistance
Teaser: What can we do to catch up with Europe in resolving the crisis of antibiotic resistance?

Source: Expert Review of Endocrinology and Metabolism
Headlines: Trying to Make a Difference for Those With Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: Mark A. Atkinson, an international leader in type 1 diabetes research, shares his experiences and thoughts about this 'terrible' disease.

Headlines: Therapeutic Targeting of T Cells in Systemic Sclerosis
Teaser: What is the role of T cells in systemic sclerosis?  Will targeting T cells be an effective treatment solution?

Headlines: ICAAC to Feature Higher Cure Rate Options for Hepatitis C
Teaser: Infectious disease physicians are gearing up for a pivotal change in clinical practice and anticipate that some hepatitis C infections will be cured.

Headlines: Lenalidomide Trial KO'd: A Blow to CLL Patients?
Teaser: Dr. Bruce Cheson discusses the clinical ramifications of the decision to halt the ORIGIN trial, which compared lenalidomide vs chlorambucil in previously untreated elderly patients with CLL.

Headlines: India Revokes GSK Cancer Drug Patent in Latest Big Pharma Blow
Teaser: India has revoked a patent granted to GlaxoSmithKline Plc for breast cancer drug Tykerb, a decision that follows a landmark India court ruling disallowing patents for incremental innovations that was a blow to global pharmaceutical firms.

Headlines: New Cancer Biomarker Tests Stunted by 'Vicious Cycle'
Teaser: The lack of reliable tumor biomarker tests is a roadblock to the full and cost-effective realization of personalized cancer care; here's a remedial plan.

Headlines: HCV: Interferon-Free Regimen Works in Over 50% of Patients
Teaser: More than half (52% - 69%) of patients with HCV treated with faldaprevir combined with deleobuvir plus ribavirin had sustained virologic response 12 weeks after treatment completion.

Headlines: Roche Gives Up on India Patent for Breast Cancer Drug
Teaser: Roche Holding AG has decided not to pursue a patent application for its breast cancer drug Herceptin (trastuzumab) in India, the Swiss company said.

Headlines: Who's in It for the Cure?
Teaser: Dr. John Marshall takes to his electronic chalkboard to tackle the problem of coordinating the separate agendas of cancer stakeholders, and finds a simple yet elegant solution.

Headlines: Lilly Defends Alimta (Pemetrexed) Patent With Unusual Ammo
Teaser: Eli Lilly and Co, now facing one of the worst patent cliffs in its history, could find $15 billion in sorely needed relief if it beats the odds and wins a closely watched patent battle with generic drugmaker Teva Pharmaceutical Industries.

Headlines: Drug Companies Faulted for Not Testing Drugs in Kids
Teaser: The FDA says about 50% of drugs approved for adults also are used in children, even though their safety and effectiveness in that population have not been established.

Headlines: Therapies for Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension in Children
Teaser: This article reviews several recent PAH studies, as well as new therapies for the treatment of PAH in children.

Headlines: Framingham Funding Slashed
Teaser: The presence of an industry rep in the cath lab also tended to drive up procedural costs, a new study suggests.

Headlines: What's Hot at the European Cancer Congress 2013
Teaser: Practice-changing studies, multidisciplinary collaboration, and the future of cancer care in Europe will take center stage at this year's meeting.

Headlines: NIH Approves High-Priority Tasks for the BRAIN Initiative
Teaser: NIH director applauds 'visionary neuroscientists' for providing an 'excellent' set of initial recommendations to guide $40 million in NIH fiscal year 2014 funding.

Headlines: AACR: Cancer Progress Being Made, Research Cuts Must Stop
Teaser: Progress is being made in cancer, but research funding cuts put continued progress in jeopardy, says the American Association for Cancer Research.

Headlines: Cancer Screening Trials Rarely Tally Harms, Says Study
Teaser: A quantitative analysis of screening trials finds that harms, such as false-positive results, are seldom tabulated, but an expert questions the conclusions.

Headlines: Open Access Data Online to Advance Malaria Research
Teaser: As an aim to advance malaria research, accessible and usable malaria data can now be found online.

Headlines: Trial Participation May Affect Care of Nonenrolled Patients
Teaser: Participation in a trial may affect care processes for nonenrolled patients at the same institution, even when care providers are unaware of data collection on nonenrolled patients.

Headlines: Antiviral Protects Against CMV After Stem Cell Transplants
Teaser: An investigational agent shows promise for prophylactic use in patients who have undergone hematopoietic cell transplants.

Headlines: New Immunotherapy Could Be 'Game Changer' in NSCLC
Teaser: A new immunotherapy has shown impressive results in a small group of patients with heavily pretreated nonsmall-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who were taking part in a phase 1 clinical trial.

Headlines: Mens Sana In Corpore Sano Revisited
Teaser: This editorial ponders the credibility of acetylcholinesterase inhibitors as dual action agents for cardiovascular health and cognitive function.

Headlines: Medical Record Abstraction for Orthopedic Research
Teaser: Can researchers with no medical training reliably abstract medical record information for clinical research?

Headlines: Riociguat for Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension
Teaser: Riociguat is the first drug to demonstrate improved hemodynamics and function in patients with chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension.

Headlines: Federal Funding Cuts Have Huge Impact on Cancer Research
Teaser: Young investigators are leaving the field, supportive staff is being laid off, and grants are being cut, all in the wake of federal funding cuts to the NIH and NCI.

Headlines: What's Hot at ASTRO 2013
Teaser: The American Society for Radiation Oncology (ASTRO) 55th Annual Meeting begins September 22 in Atlanta. Here's an early look at the big news.

Headlines: NIH Director: Next 'Cure for Cancer' Lost to Sequester
Teaser: Billions of dollars in research funding and thousands of health-related jobs have been cut, said panelists speaking at a health forum last week.

Headlines: Topol on Medscape Today and Can't-Miss Medical News
Teaser: Medscape Editor-in-Chief Eric J. Topol, MD, details the new Medscape Today and shares some of his favorite articles from the past month.

Headlines: Targeting the Trigeminocervical Complex in Migraine
Teaser: This review explores the hypothesis that dysfunction of neural mechanisms that mediate trigeminovascular activation are at the root of migraine. Could this be a fruitful target for drug development?

Headlines: New Lipid Drugs and Getting Risk to Zero
Teaser: In the first part of a series on what's new in lipids, Henry Black talks to Howard Weintraub about new approaches to lipid therapy and the goal of zero cardiovascular risk.

Headlines: A Valuable Parkinson Disease Resource
Teaser: Medscape talks with Michael J. Fox Foundation CEO Dr. Todd Sherer about the Parkinson's Trial Finder and other advances in Parkinson disease research.

Headlines: Child Psychiatry: New Approaches to Drug Development
Teaser: Dr. Robert Findling discusses a new generation of treatment studies that are challenging paradigms in pediatric psychopharmacology.

Headlines: Does Off-Label Chemo Drive Up Healthcare Costs?
Teaser: Dr. David Kerr on a study that found that off-label use of 10 chemotherapies in the US in 2010 amounted to $14 billion. Is it time to reduce off-label use in the interest of healthcare value?

Headlines: Effect of Eritoran on Sepsis Mortality
Teaser: Greg Martin, MD, analyzes a recent clinical trial that investigates whether eritoran is effective at reducing sepsis-induced mortality.

Headlines: Not-so-negative to Super-negative Trials
Teaser: Dr. Mark Kris comments on 2 lung cancer studies presented at the 2013 annual meeting of ASCO and how the term 'negative trial' encompasses a wide range of results, including harm.

Headlines: Comorbidities: Prequel or Sequel to Cancer?
Teaser: Dr. Maurie Markman reports provocative findings about the prevalence of comorbid conditions in women with ovarian cancer and what they mean to clinical trials -- and the patients enrolled in them.

Headlines: One-Two Punch for Parkinson's
Teaser: A dual-action compound inhibits 2 key enzymes known to activate Parkinson disease.

Headlines: Ascorbic Acid in Charcot-Marie-Tooth-1A
Teaser: It seems to work in mice, but is it futile to pursue the use of ascorbic acid to reduce neuropathy in humans?

Headlines: Yeast Infection Drug Bypassing Fluconazole Resistance Fails
Teaser: An experimental drug designed to treat vulvovaginal candidiasis has failed in a phase 2 trial.

Headlines: FDA's Hamburg on Clearing the Hurdles to Drug Approvals
Teaser: FDA Commissioner Margaret Hamburg, MD, talks with Medscape at the National Health Research Forum in Washington, DC.

Headlines: Treating the Cognitive Symptoms of Schizophrenia
Teaser: Adjunctive medications for the treatment of schizophrenia are an active area of commercial development.

Headlines: Experts Propose Ways to Boost Enrollment in Cancer Trials
Teaser: Researchers from the National Cancer Institute and the American Society of Clinical Oncology have come up with new ideas to promote participation in trials.

Headlines: New Class of Drug May Be Safe, Effective in Asthma and COPD
