Headlines: Hepatitis C to Take Center Stage at the Liver Meeting
Teaser: The American Association for the Study of Liver Diseases meeting will feature cutting-edge information on several hot hepatology topics, but hepatitis C is expected to dominate the conversation.

Headlines: Postmarketing Studies Lag After FDA Approvals
Teaser: Of 20 drugs approved by the FDA in 2008, 8 received expedited review; most postmarketing commitments remained unfulfilled as recently as January 2013.

Headlines: Expanding Role of Allergists in Healthcare Reform
Teaser: This year's American College of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology meeting aims to help specialists strategize in a changing healthcare paradigm.

Headlines: Randomized Clinical Trials: 1 in 3 Not Reported
Teaser: Researchers charged study sponsors and investigators with breaking faith with clinical trial participants by not reporting data from randomized clinical trials; they have asked IRBs to get involved.

Headlines: Innovative Therapy Approach Focuses on Cancer Stem Cells
Teaser: Clinical trials in mesothelioma and ovarian cancer are exploring an investigational agent, defactinib, that homes in on cancer stem cells.

Headlines: 'Exciting Times' With Immunotherapy in Lung Cancer
Teaser: Immunotherapy offers a new treatment paradigm for non-small cell lung cancer, and there is hope for a repeat of the success seen in melanoma.

Headlines: Microtubule-Based Treatment of Disease the Nervous System
Teaser: In this review, the authors investigate the potential of microtubules as therapeutic targets for nerve injury, neurodegenerative diseases, and cancer of the nervous system.

Teaser: How does spinal fusion surgery affect disability and health-related quality of life?

Headlines: Novel Agent Shows Promise in Advanced Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: PEGPH20 tackles pancreas tumors by degrading the protective matrix surrounding them. Early phase 1b results are positive; phase 2 study is ongoing.

Teaser: In this article, the authors focus on the cellular and synaptic alterations that occur with traumatic brain injury. Could synaptic cell adhesion molecules be potential targets for future therapeutics?

Headlines: Research Participants' Expectations
Teaser: Do people who are recruited for clinical research studies generally understand what  they're participating in? This new article explores the issues.

Headlines: Prostate Cancer: Enough 'Me Too’ Drugs
Teaser: What we need are affordability endpoints, effective surrogate endpoints, and better information for our clinical colleagues, contend Drs. Stéphane Oudard and Bertrand Tombal at ECC 2013.

Headlines: Send Us Your Type 2 Patients!

Headlines: The 'Darkest Year Ever' for the NIH?
Teaser: American Psychiatric Association President Dr. Jeffrey Lieberman on how government policies are out of sync with our country's medical needs.

Headlines: MDR TB: CDC Issues Guidelines for Use of New Drug
Teaser: Provisional CDC guidelines cover FDA-approved and off-label uses of bedaquiline in children, pregnant women, or persons with extrapulmonary MDR TB, who were not included in clinical trials.

Headlines: Updated Guidelines for Clinical Research Get Mixed Reviews
Teaser: The World Medical Association has issued updated guidelines regarding ethical principles for conducting research; the new document has received mixed reviews.

Headlines: Can Integrative Oncology Extend Life in Advanced Disease?
Teaser: Early data suggest that it can, although controlled trials are needed to gauge the full impact on survival and quality of life.

Headlines: Psychometrics of CAMPHOR and SF-36 in Pulmonary Hypertension
Teaser: Which tool should you choose for patients with pulmonary hypertension?

Headlines: Published Clinical Trial Reports Lack Patient-Relevant Data
Teaser: Published trials and registry data provide only half of the patient-relevant data found in companies' unpublished clinical study reports, researchers from the German regulatory authority find.

Teaser: Results from a subset of patients show improved outcomes when a MEK inhibitor is used with erlotinib in MEK-positive non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

Headlines: Bevacizumab: Mixed Results in Glioblastoma
Teaser: Prof. Wolfgang Wick reviews the neuro-oncology highlights from ECC 2013, focusing on glioblastoma and mixed results of bevacizumab trials.

Headlines: New Rifamycin Formulation Curtails Traveler's Diarrhea
Teaser: The experimental formulation shortens the duration of symptoms of traveler's diarrhea by about a day.

Headlines: Disclosure of Incidental Genomic Findings Involving Children
Teaser: What are the consequences of disclosing genomic findings to children and their parents?

Headlines: Disney Theme of Excellence Showcased at AAP National Meeting
Teaser: Former Disney cast member and senior vice president of a major medical center with insider experience and a keen eye for cultural comparisons will share insights with physicians on improving care.

Headlines: Special Report: From the 2013 National Health Research Forum
Teaser: Medscape attended Research!America's 2013 health forum in Washington, DC, and interviewed the heads of the CDC and FDA and the keynote speaker.

Headlines: Eli Lilly SVP on Research Hurdles and Drug Development
Teaser: Eli Lilly executive Bart Peterson, JD, talks to Medscape about research hurdles, FDA improvements, and how personalized medicine can coexist with blockbuster drugs.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Using Electronic Surveys in Violence Research
Teaser: The sender of electronic surveys for violence research may influence response rates, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Is Lung Cancer Immunotherapy Clinic-Ready?

Headlines: Personalized Medicine Advancing Rheumatology
Teaser: Attendees at ACR 2013 will hear about biomarkers and genomics in rheumatic diseases and whether to start with biologics or triple therapy in early RA.

Teaser: Do we need a change in our basic approach to cancer pathobiology? This review calls for a new model of collaborative cancer research based on the cancer stem-cell paradigm.

Headlines: Market Removal of Ponatinib Raises Questions, Concerns
Teaser: The sales and marketing suspension of ponatinib raises questions about accelerated drug approvals, the monitoring of cardiovascular toxicity in cancer patients, and the evaluation of risks and benefits.

Headlines: Promising New Era in Hepatitis C Treatment
Teaser: More effective therapies are on the horizon, and the elimination of interferon and ribavirin means fewer toxic effects.

Headlines: Novel Therapy Shows Safety, Efficacy in Hyperkalemia
Teaser: Phase 2 and preliminary phase 3 results show significant reductions in potassium and a good safety profile in patients with chronic kidney disease.

Headlines: 6th Clinical Trials Conference on Alzheimer's Disease (CTAD)
Teaser: Read clinically focused news coverage of key developments from CTAD 2013.

Headlines: Autophagy in EGFR-Independent EGFR-Mutant Lung Cancer
Teaser: Could autophagy inhibitors alone or in combination with tyrosine kinase inhibitors be an effective approach for the treatment of EGFR-mutant lung cancers?

Teaser: Henry Black talks to George Diamond about what 18th-century mathematician Thomas Bayes can teach us about probability and clinical trial analysis.

Teaser: Multiple sclerosis specialists Mark Freedman and Patricia Coyle review the most recent developments in pharmacologic management of MS, including how best to sequence therapies.

Headlines: Heart Failure Takeaways From TCT 2013
Teaser: Dr. Ileana Piña summarizes the heart failure and devices session at TCT.

Headlines: Out With the Old, in With the New: The Best of AAO 2013
Teaser: A panel of experts presents the highlights of this year's American Academy of Ophthalmology meeting, including new ways of managing old problems.

Headlines: Many NHLBI-Funded Trials Never Published

Headlines: Pharmacological Prospects for Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy
Teaser: Recent months have seen exciting developments regarding novel therapeutic agents for Duchenne muscular dystrophy. Where do we stand in finding an effective treatment?

Headlines: Shaping the Future of Acute Heart Failure Trials
Teaser: Will a boost in heart failure research methods translate to better patient outcomes?

Headlines: Dropped: Drug for Myelofibrosis Tipped to Be Next to Market

Teaser: NHLBI researchers recently analyzed 11 years of NHLBI-funded trials looking at time between trial completion and publication. The findings could have     several implications for future research.

Headlines: Day 3 at AHA 2013: AF Ablation, ICDs, CRT, Dabigatran, More
Teaser: Dr John Mandrola does a rapid-fire recap of yesterday's heart-rhythm news.

Headlines: Disease-Free Survival Acceptable End Point in Gastric Cancer

Headlines: Survival 81% at 1 Year With MK-3475 in Melanoma
Teaser: The data are early but impressive on the experimental immune checkpoint blockade agent.

Headlines: Novel Agent Tasquinimod Shows Benefit in mCRPC

Teaser: Among the agents under investigation are topical gels and films, local drug-eluting devices, and long-acting injectables.

Headlines: Emerging Therapeutic Options in the Treatment of Psoriasis
Teaser: This review looks at several therapeutic classes of small molecules, both oral and topical, which are proving to be promising treatment options in psoriasis.

Headlines: Interpreting Trials of Biologic Treatments for Psoriasis
Teaser: How can one properly evaluate the many long-term studies of biologic treatments for psoriasis? This review provides tips on how to compare trial design and effectively analyze data.

Headlines: DCCT and EDIC at 30 Years: Advances and Contributions
Teaser: Read how these trials have improved type 1 diabetes therapy and resulting outcomes in your patients.

Headlines: Repositioning Therapeutic Cancer Vaccines
Teaser: The experience with cancer vaccines in the past has been less than rewarding but has provided critical knowledge to help move immunotherapy in cancer forward.

Headlines: Immunotherapy for Pulmonary TB
Teaser: With the continuous increasing epidemic of multidrug-resistant TB, new drugs and vaccines are urgently needed.

Headlines: Mobilizing and Evaluating Anticancer T Cells
Teaser: What are the pitfalls and solutions for mobilizing and evaluating T cells in immunotherapy?

Headlines: Tuning In to Psychedelics' Therapeutic Potential
Teaser: Decades after psychedelic drugs became popular agents for recreational use and subsequently made illegal, a select group of researchers is revisiting their therapeutic potential for mental illness.

Teaser: Shelley Wood asks Drs Mehran and Smith, how do you extrapolate the latest data to your patient if they weren't represented in the trial?

Headlines: Top Clinical Cancer Advances: ASCO 2013 Report
Teaser: A panel of prominent oncologists highlights what they consider to have been the top clinical cancer advances made during the year since the last review.

Headlines: Antibiotic Development May Not Be Bad Business for Drugmakers

Headlines: Cancer Immunology Named 'Breakthrough of the Year'
Teaser: The paradigm-shifting approach, which has been in development for more than 25 years, has now repeatedly triumphed in clinical trials.

Headlines: Idelalisib With Rituximab Boosts Survival in Relapsed CLL
Teaser: The investigational agent idelalisib, combined with rituximab, improved survival for patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) who were not eligible for cytotoxic chemotherapy.

Headlines: New Dry Eye Drug Gets Mixed Results in 2 Trials
Teaser: Lifitegrast, an experimental ophthalmic solution, improved dry eye signs in 1 trial and symptoms in another.

Teaser: Preliminary results with 2 new targeted therapies suggest efficacy and could expand options for patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), especially those with refractory disease.

Headlines: 'Pay-for-Delay' Generic Drug Deals Fall After EU Crackdown
Teaser: A crackdown by regulators on deals between drugmakers that unfairly delay the launch of cheap generic medicines appears to be working.

Headlines: SABCS May Clarify Some BIG Breast Cancer Issues
Teaser: It's December, and that means the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium is on the way.

Headlines: Novel Vaccine Dramatically Boosts Survival in Glioblastoma
Teaser: Preliminary results show that half of patients in a phase 1 trial survived more than 5 years after diagnosis.

Headlines: New Agent May Be Disease-Modifying in Myelofibrosis

Headlines: Finally! Data in Low-Risk HER2 Breast Cancer
Teaser: Drs. Kathy Miller and Ian Krop talk about why a single-arm study in low-risk cancer is a huge advance for a population of understudied breast cancer patients.

Headlines: Off and On Again Story of Ponatinib in CML

Headlines: Psychiatry Practice Changers: 2013
Teaser: A look back at important advances in the field of psychiatry this year.

Headlines: Oral Antipsychotics vs Long-Acting Injectables
Teaser: A new meta-analysis attempts to determine superiority between oral antipsychotics and long-acting injectable agents for the treatment of schizophrenia.

Headlines: Tailoring CLL Treatment to a TTT
Teaser: In CLL, combinations and sequences of agents are tailored to initial tumor load and response to therapy to optimize outcome, says Dr. Michael Hallek in a Medscape interview from ASH 2013.

Headlines: Keeping Positive About Negative Trials

Headlines: What's Hot at ASH 2013?
Teaser: As well as clinical data that have the potential to change practice, this year's meeting will reveal scientific discoveries that open the door to novel therapies.

Headlines: Life and Times of Leading Cardiologists. Guest: Sidney Smith

Teaser: How does a nanoparticle's shape affect its rate of tumor penetration and therapeutic efficacy in cancer drug delivery?

Teaser: Transmucosal drug delivery is a promising approach, as it is easy to administer, nonpainful, and enhances patient compliance. What recent progress has been made in drug delivery for mucosal surfaces?

Teaser: Is the newly approved novel antidepressant vortioxetine useful in the treatment of generalized anxiety disorder?

Headlines: An Update on Allergen Immunotherapy and Asthma
Teaser: Learn more about the effect of allergen-specific immunotherapy on asthma.

Teaser: Learn about evidence-based therapy use and short- and long-term mortality over time among older patients with non-STEMI.

Headlines: Atrial Fibrillation Management After 2010 ESC AF Guidelines
Teaser: Did the management of AF patients in 2012 adapt to guideline recommendations or go rogue?

Headlines: Mortality of MRSA USA300 vs. Non-USA300 Invasive Infections
Teaser: Are MRSA USA300 infections associated with higher mortality than non-USA300 invasive infections?

Teaser: Besides standard treatments, such as interferon-based antiviral therapy, what are some of the other treatment strategies that can be employed to manage chronic hepatitis C?

Teaser: Which ablation method has the best acute success and lowest overall complication rate for treating paroxysmal atrial fibrillation?

Headlines: Characteristics for Describing Patients With Knee OA
Teaser: A survey of clinical experts identifies the baseline characteristics to appropriately describe patients with knee OA.

Headlines: Sublingual Immunotherapy in Clinical Trials and Real Life
Teaser: Sublingual immunotherapy is effective in allergic rhinitis and asthma, but apart from its efficacy, safety is crucial since it's usually self-administered. . .

Headlines: Effect of Probiotics on Irritable Bowel Syndrome
Teaser: Do probiotics help IBS patients with the management of the various symptoms associated with the disease?

Headlines: NASH: A Case for Personalized Treatment
Teaser: As clinicians begin to better understand the pathophysiology of NASH, what future treatment strategies lie ahead for them to manage the disease in their patients?

Headlines: Optimizing Mouse Models of Neurodegenerative Disorders
Teaser: This review takes a look at the history of model development for neurodegenerative diseases. What has been learned which may improve the design, development and use of mouse models?

Teaser: What is the optimum PCV dosing schedule for the prevention of pneumonia in children?

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes

Teaser: Maraviroc is an approved antiretroviral drug with a unique mechanism of action. How safe is this therapy in treatment-experienced HIV+ patients?

Teaser: Since some medications, such as anti-TNF agents, work better than others in ulcerative colitis, how can clinicians best tailor treatments for their patients?

Source: Medicine and Science in Sports and Exercise

Teaser: Learn more on the potential role exercise therapy can play in managing patients with early abdominal aortic aneurysm disease.

Headlines: Lumbar Disc Replacements and Motion Preservation Devices
Teaser: What do we currently know about lumbar disc replacement and motion preservation devices?

Headlines: As Hispanics Lag in Clinical Trials, Researchers Take Action

Headlines: Comparative Effectiveness of HCV Protease Inhibitors
