Teaser: Bob Harrington and Gregg Stone review the pitfalls of surrogate markers and how to make clinical trials less expensive and more efficient. Can it be done without sacrificing scientific rigor?

Headlines: 2014-2015 CDC Influenza Antiviral Recommendations
Teaser: You've heard about it, but what does 'flu virus drift' mean to vaccination, flu severity, and flu management this season?

Headlines: Myeloma Update -- Part II: ASPIRE, STRATUS, New Antibodies
Teaser: Dr Paul Richardson discusses important myeloma studies from ASH 2014, including results from the ASPIRE and STRATUS trials, as well as the drugs ixazomib, SAR650984, and daratumumab.

Source: Society for Healthcare Epidemiology of America (SHEA)
Headlines: How Clean Is Clean Enough -- And How Do We Get There?
Teaser: Two studies address the effectiveness of a new disinfectant and propose a novel method for comparison of both cleaning processes and products.

Headlines: What Were Pediatric Providers Reading in 2014?
Teaser: What new research did your colleagues find to be the most interesting this year?

Headlines: 2014 Practice Changers and Hot Topics in Hospital Medicine
Teaser: Medscape asked several hospitalists what they thought were the most important topics and events in hospital medicine in 2014.

Headlines: Can Molecular Profiling Lower Cancer Costs?
Teaser: Dr John Marshall asks tough questions of experts at the 2014 Ruesch Symposium about whether information gained from molecular testing can tailor therapy and lower costs.

Headlines: Myeloma Update -- Part 1: Carfilzomib and Panobinostat
Teaser: Dr Sagar Lonial discusses important studies from ASH 2014 on the treatment of multiple myeloma, including data on carfilzomib and panobinostat.

Headlines: Breast Cancer 2014: SOFT Proves Year's Best
Teaser: Dr Lidia Schapira reviews the year in breast cancer, highlighting inroads made in the individualization of care, unprecedented survival data, and the practice-changing results of the SOFT trial.

Headlines: Carbon Monoxide and Risk of Hospitalization Due to COPD
Teaser: Many studies have linked air pollution to increased rates of COPD exacerbations, but surprisingly, ambient carbon monoxide may actually have a beneficial effect.

Headlines: Personalized Medicine for Chronic Disease: COPD as Example
Teaser: Does the technology exist to personalize medicine for chronic diseases like COPD?

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Perception of HIV Risk and Adherence to FEM-PrEP
Teaser: Does perceived HIV risk influence patients' decisions to adhere to pre-exposure prophylaxis?

Headlines: Top Highlights in NAFLD/NASH: The Liver Meeting 2014
Teaser: With fatty liver disease on the rise, learn the latest on its diagnosis and management.

Headlines: Efficacy of Transoral Fundoplication to Treat Chronic GERD
Teaser: Could transoral fundoplication improve clinical outcomes in patients who don't respond well to high-dose proton-pump inhibitors?

Headlines: Variables Associated With Bone Biopsy Tumor Yield in mCRPC
Teaser: Certain variables may impact tumor yield on image-guided bone biopsy in mCRPC. Find out what they are, and which strategies may increase tumor acquisition.

Headlines: Mortality After RBC Transfusion or Inotropes in Septic Shock
Teaser: Find out what kind of punch red blood cells pack, when it comes to treatment for septic shock.

Source: Current Opinion in Allergy and Clinical Immunology
Headlines: Novel Immunotherapy Approaches to Food Allergy
Teaser: Learn more about how immunotherapy comes to the rescue -- when food is the enemy.

Headlines: Heart Failure in Younger Patients
Teaser: How do younger patients with heart failure differ from their older counterparts?

Headlines: Ultrasound Assessment of Pathologies in Psoriatic Arthritis
Teaser: Is an ultrasound assessment useful in the diagnosis of inflammatory and structural pathologies in psoriatic arthritis?

Headlines: Triglycerides Predict Ten-Years All-Cause Mortality in T2DM
Teaser: Are high triglyceride levels associated with CV risk and mortality in patients with type 2 diabetes?

Headlines: 40 Years of Progress in Bone Marrow Transplantion
Teaser: A brief synopsis of topics covered at the annual meeting of the European Society for Blood and Marrow Transplantation, including the latest on stem cell transplantation, fungal infection, and more.

Headlines: Sorting Out Weight Loss Agents
Teaser: Numerous pharmaceutical interventions are available to treat obesity, including some just recently approved. How should you choose what's best for your patient?

Headlines: Circulating Tumor Cells and Circulating Tumor DNA for Precision Medicine
Teaser: Get the most important recent findings in the CTC field, focusing on challenges and opportunities in moving these tools forward in clinical practice.

Headlines: Gender Differences in Pharmacokinetics
Teaser: Why are doses of zolpidem reduced in women? Learn how metabolism of some medications may be affected by gender.

Headlines: Association of Diabetic Retinopathy With Cognitive Function
Teaser: Are patients with diabetic retinopathy at risk for cognitive decline?

Headlines: First Top-flight Evidence of TKI Benefit in AML
Teaser: The first evidence from a randomized trial shows a clinical benefit for younger patients with AML when sorafenib is added to a standard therapeutic regimen.

Headlines: Immunogenicity and Safety of a Heptavalent Infant Vaccine
Teaser: This study investigates the efficacy and safety of a heptavalent combination vaccine for infants to include protection against meningococcal serogroup C.

Headlines: Warfarin Time in the Therapeutic Range: Room for Improvement
Teaser: Dr Samuel Goldhaber reviews a study of nationwide management of warfarin for stroke prevention in atrial fibrillation, showing poor real-world TTRs.

Headlines: The Year in HIV: Prevention, Treatment, Complications, Cure
Teaser: Dr Paul Sax reviews the top stories in HIV medicine in 2014, with a focus on practice-changing clinical trial results.

Headlines: San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium (SABCS) 2014
Teaser: Read clinically focused news coverage of key developments from SABCS 2014.

Headlines: Noninvasive Alternatives to Assess Liver Fibrosis
Teaser: Noninvasive serum biomarkers and imaging techniques could soon replace the liver biopsy to assess fibrosis.

Headlines: SUDEP: Is It in the Genes?
Teaser: Genetic breakthroughs could change the outlook for this highly feared outcome of epilepsy.

Headlines: Weight Loss WINS in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Women overweight when diagnosed with breast cancer have poorer outcomes. Drs Kathy Miller and Jennifer Ligibel discuss how to motivate patients to alter their lifestyles to lower their risk.

Headlines: Peramivir IV for Influenza: Will It Aid In-Hospital Care?
Teaser: Dr Paul G. Auwaerter conveys information on the safety and efficacy of peramivir IV and its potential usefulness -- and drawbacks -- for hospitalized influenza patients.

Headlines: SABCS Wrap-up: Will TNT Quietly Change Practice?
Teaser: Drs Kathy Miller and George Sledge review the surprises and intrigues of SABCS, from its start in 1977 to the best scientific and practice-changing studies presented in 2014.

Headlines: HER2+ Therapy: Getting Less Toxic All the Time
Teaser: Drs Kathy Miller and Clifford Hudis discuss at SABCS 2014 recent advances in HER2+ breast cancer, focusing on the growing interest in lowering the toxicity of therapy.

Headlines: TNT Refines Platinum Use in TNBC
Teaser: Drs Kathy Miller and Andrew Tutt discuss the findings of the important TNT trial, which indicates the significance of knowing BRCA status in using platinums for triple-negative breast cancer.

Headlines: The Year in Gynecologic Cancer: Bevacizumab and Beyond
Teaser: Dr Maurie Markman highlights the most important developments and practice-changing clinical trials of 2014.

Headlines: Primary Care's 2014 Lessons: The Research Changing Practice
Teaser: We asked our experts to tell us about the research, news, and take-away messages from 2014 that every primary care provider should know.

Headlines: Rheumatology Practice Changers 2014
Teaser: A year's worth of advances in rheumatology, with the potential to change practice.

Headlines: Anne Peters: Advances in Diabetes, 2014
Teaser: What were the most important developments in diabetes care this past year?

Headlines: Advances in GI Cancer: 2014
Teaser: Four experts from the Ruesch Center for the Cure of Gastrointestinal Cancers highlight progress made in gastrointestinal cancer in 2014.

Headlines: Young Oncologists Seek Benefits of Larger Practices
Teaser: To avoid the difficulties of running a business, many young oncologists are looking for positions in well-established organizations, including universities, hospitals, and large private practices.

Headlines: A Future Without Hepatitis C?
Teaser: It can be hard to keep up with the latest hepatitis C drugs, but for millions of patients, it's extremely important.

Headlines: Cardiology 2014 Revisited
Teaser: Bob Harrington and Mike Gibson revisit their predictions for the top cardiology stories in 2014. Were they on the money?

Headlines: R-squared Update: Underwhelms in FL, but Impressive in MCL
Teaser: Dr Bruce Cheson and Dr Nathan Fowler discuss lenalidomide clinical trial results at the 2014 ASH meeting, focusing on a trial presented by the Nordic Lymphoma Group.

Headlines: Understanding Inattention: Diagnosis and Misdiagnosis
Teaser: Derick Vergne explores the phenomenon of inattention -- its relationship with neural circuitry and other psychiatric conditions, and the associated diagnostic and treatment challenges.

Headlines: The Year in Hematologic Malignancies
Teaser: Experts in hematologic malignancies comment on the most important developments and practice-changing clinical trials of 2014.

Headlines: Advances in Obesity Management: 2014
Teaser: Dr Fatima Stanford reviews the year's developments in obesity treatment and understanding.

Headlines: Retina Recap: Year in Review
Teaser: A look at this year's exciting new developments in the treatment of retinal diseases and a peek at what's to come.

Headlines: The 2014 Hit Parade: Infectious Disease Stories of the Year
Teaser: John Bartlett shares his insights about the year's ID headlines, from Ebola to Chikungunya, and everything in between.

Headlines: Should Everyone Take Metformin?
Teaser: Two studies highlight the benefits of metformin in people with diabetes, even raising the question of whether these might extend to nondiabetics.

Headlines: Engaging Underrepresented Populations in Medical Research
Teaser: A survey of African American women community leaders about participation in medical research may provide clues to better engage women and minorities in clinical trials.

Headlines: Dual Antiplatelet Therapy: The Long and the Short of It
Teaser: Seth Bilazarian asks Gilles Montalescot to put the seemingly conflicting data from the various trials presented at AHA into perspective.

Headlines: Breast Cancer Prevention Starts in Childhood
Teaser: To prevent breast cancer, women need to take action early -- starting at age 2, to be exact, according to Dr Graham Colditz, recipient of a 2014 AACR award for cancer prevention research.

Source: The National Organization for Rare Disorders
Headlines: Step Up and Advocate for Rare Diseases
Teaser: NORD's vice president for public policy Diane Dorman appeals to the medical community for their help in improving treatments and access to treatments for all rare disorders.

Headlines: The Year in Lung Cancer: CT Screening, More Targeted Therapy
Teaser: Lung cancer experts highlight the most important developments and practice-changing clinical trials of 2014.

Headlines: Stem Cell Transplants May Halt MS Progression
Teaser: High-dose immunosuppressive therapy plus autologous hematopoietic cell transplant can induce sustained remission in patients with MS, interim data suggest.

Headlines: Barrett's Esophagus: First-line Endoscopic Therapy Validated
Teaser: Six-year results from a 500-patient UK registry have confirmed the value of first-line endoscopic mucosal resection before radiofrequency ablation for Barrett's esophagus-related neoplasia.

Headlines: Association Between Psoriasis and Periodontitis
Teaser: Psoriasis and periodontitis are both chronic, inflammatory conditions. Is there a link between the two?

Headlines: Friend or Foe: The Great e-Cigarette Debate
Teaser: Are e-cigarettes a welcome addition to the smoking cessation armamentarium or are they gateway devices to smoking with potentially serious hidden health concerns?

Headlines: Bevacizumab Works in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Subtype
Teaser: New results could reignite interest in the use of bevacizumab in breast cancer, especially in a subtype of triple-negative disease.

Headlines: Progesterone Fails in Traumatic Brain Injury
Teaser: The negative results of two large phase 3 trials dash hopes that neuroprotective progesterone could improve functional outcomes in acute TBI.

Headlines: Pain Med Linked to Hypoglycemia
Teaser: Tramadol, an opioid analgesic, was associated with an increased risk for hospitalization for hypoglycemia, especially in the first month of use, in a new study.

Headlines: Just-Approved Gardasil 9 Packs More HPV/Cancer Protection
Teaser: The new vaccine covers nine types of human papillomavirus, five more than the original Gardasil.

Headlines: Breast Cancer With High TIL Levels: Skip the Trastuzumab?
Teaser: A provocative study suggests that HER2 breast cancer patients with high levels of stromal tumor infiltrating lymphocytes may not need trastuzumab (Herceptin).

Headlines: Exotropia: Patching, Observation Both Effective
Teaser: Children aged 3 to 10 years with intermittent exotropia saw little deterioration in their condition after 6 months, whether treated with part-time patching or observation.

Headlines: PsA: Skin, Synovium Gene Expression Tied to Drug Response
Teaser: Comparison of skin and synovial fluid global gene expression in psoriatic arthritis correlated with drug responses.

Headlines: Entecavir Lowers HBV Reactivation Risk Better Than Lamivudine
Teaser: A new randomized trial has suggested that entecavir is better than lamivudine for preventing HBV reactivation and HBV-related hepatitis in patients with non-Hodgkin lymphoma who are receiving R-CHOP.

Headlines: Hypertension Adds to Genetic Risk in Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: For those carrying the APOE ε4 gene, hypertension increases the risk for brain amyloid accumulation in Alzheimer's disease and in cognitively normal adults over 70.

Headlines: Long-term Treatment of Gout Is Suboptimal
Teaser: Too few eligible patients receive the currently recommended urate-lowering therapy, a new study finds.

Headlines: Glaucoma Drug Shows Visual Preservation Over 2 Years
Teaser: Glaucoma drug trial shows effectiveness in a relatively short amount of time.

Headlines: Experimental Drug May Stop Vascular Leak in Ebola
Teaser: FX06, an experimental drug shown in animal studies to reduce dengue hemorrhagic shock, may improve vascular leak syndrome in Ebola, according to a case study.

Headlines: FDA Approves Liraglutide (Saxenda) for Weight Loss
Teaser: At a higher dose than used for diabetes, liraglutide now becomes the fifth drug available in the United States for treating obesity.

Headlines: Solutions Needed to Stem Cancer Costs, ASH Experts Say
Teaser: Cancer cost is rising, especially for new drugs, and solutions are needed to stem the tide while offering quality care to patients.

Headlines: Endovascular Stroke Therapy Proven at Last: MR CLEAN Published
Teaser: The first trial  to show benefit on functional outcomes of an intra-arterial interventional approach for stroke vs the current standard of care has been published to wide acclaim from experts.

Headlines: 87% Complete Remission Rate With Nilotinib in ALL
Teaser: Low-intensity chemotherapy plus nilotinib was highly effective in older patients, and might be an alternative to stem cell transplantation.

Headlines: AD Diagnosis Not Swayed by Belief in Amyloid Hypothesis
Teaser: Dementia experts would use amyloid PET scan data in diagnosing Alzheimer's, regardless of whether they believe amyloid caused the disease, a study shows.

Headlines: FDA Approves Olaparib (Lynparza) for BRCA Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: The approval follows a resubmission of new data after an advisory committee recommended against approval earlier this year.

Headlines: FDA Approves Viekira Pak for Hepatitis C
Teaser: Depending on its price, the new combo drug could give physicians and patients a less expensive alternative to Sovaldi and Harvoni.

Headlines: Achillion Data Shows Promise of Shorter Hep C Treatment
Teaser: Data from Achillion Pharmaceuticals Inc's hepatitis C drug trials showed the company could develop a shorter-duration treatment rivaling offerings from Gilead Sciences Inc and Abbvie Inc.

Headlines: Hypoglycemia Predicts CV Events in Type 1 and 2 Diabetes
Teaser: Hypoglycemia does not portend well when it comes to the risk for cardiovascular events and death in both type 1 and type 2 diabetes, according to a new     study in a contemporary patient population.

Headlines: 'NEDA' Measure Predicts MS Disability
Teaser: A tool measuring disease activity -- 'no evidence of disease activity' or NEDA --may be moved to the bedside where doctors can use it to individualize care for patients with multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: FDA Approves Nivolumab (Opdivo) for Advanced Melanoma
Teaser: The FDA has granted a highly anticipated accelerated approval to the PD-1 inhibitor nivolumab for advanced melanoma.

Headlines: Ebola Vaccine Trial Halted Temporarily After Joint Pains
Teaser: A clinical trial of an Ebola vaccine developed by Merck and NewLink has been halted temporarily as a precautionary measure after four patients complained of joint pains, the University of Geneva Hospital said.

Headlines: Acute Cardiac Care Doesn’t Suffer During AHA, ACC Sessions
Teaser: Are the big US cardiology meetings good for patient care in unexpected ways? Less PCI while doctors are away doesn’t raise 30-day mortality, so is PCI overused? Some say maybe, others say no.

Headlines: Immunotherapy for GI Cancers: 'More Work to Be Done'
Teaser: Among the new approaches under development are approaches that convert   nonimmunogenic tumors so that they respond to immune-based therapies.

Headlines: IBD Treatment Varies Widely Across Major US Referral Centers
Teaser: The treatment of patients with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) varies widely across major U.S. referral centers, according to a new study.

Headlines: Practice-Changing Study in HIV-Related Lymphoma
Teaser: Patients with HIV infection and lymphoma have been considered unsuitable for stem cell transplantation because of immunosuppression. A new study rewrites that script.

Headlines: First-Time Finding in Posttransplant Hodgkin Lymphoma
Teaser: In high-risk Hodgkin lymphoma patients, the ADC drug brentuximab vedotin extended progression-free survival following transplantation.

Headlines: 'Unprecedented Results' in Relapsed Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: Adding carfilzomib to standard therapy improved progression-free survival in patients with relapsed disease, and may be a new standard of care.

Headlines: What's Hot at American Epilepsy Society 2014
Teaser: Medical marijuana, SUDEP, and generic equivalents and are just some of the topics neurologists and others are expected to discuss at the American Epilepsy Society annual meeting.

Headlines: New Eating Disorder Guidelines Released
Teaser: The first eating disorder guidelines to incorporate DSM-5 diagnostic criteria have been released.

Headlines: EU Green Light for Liraglutide in Diabetes With Renal Disease
Teaser: Drugs for type 2 diabetes that can be used without dose adjustment in patients who also have kidney disease are few and far between. But trials are being     conducted, and one new option has emerged.

Headlines: Gene Testing in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Patients
Teaser: Deleterious gene mutations are found in a large proportion of triple-negative breast cancer patients, emphasizing the importance of gene testing in this patient population.

Headlines: First Drug for Polycythemia Vera Approved by FDA
Teaser: Ruxolitinib has become the first drug for polycythemia vera to be approved by the FDA; the drug is already marketed for use in myelofibrosis, another bone marrow disorder.

Headlines: Selective Laser Trabeculoplasty for Primary Angle-Closure Glaucoma
Teaser: Selective laser trabeculoplasty (SLT) is effective in the short term for treating primary angle-closure glaucoma (PACG), although complete success is more common with prostaglandin analog, a new clinical trial shows.

Headlines: Antacids May Help Improve Outcomes in Head and Neck Cancer
Teaser: Validation is needed, but a new study shows that histamine-2 receptor antagonists and proton-pump inhibitors improved overall survival in patients with head and neck cancer.

Headlines: Wide Variation in Hospital Bleeding Rates Post-PCI
Teaser: Investigators suggest bleeding complications following PCI should be used as a performance measure at hospitals.

Headlines: NCCN Updates Prostate Cancer Guidelines
Teaser: There are major changes in imaging, molecular testing, and the systemic treatment of castration-resistant disease.

Headlines: CDC: Advise Hetero Men, Boys, on HIV Benefit of Circumcision
Teaser: Proposed guidance for clinicians states that the procedure evidently reduces the risk for HIV infection in heterosexual males, but not for men having sex with men.

Headlines: CRP Levels Tied to Statin Effects on Contrast Nephropathy
Teaser: C-reactive protein levels could potentially help identify patients at elevated risk of acute kidney injury related to contrast medium who might benefit from statin protection, researchers say.

Headlines: NIH Shutters the National Children's Study
Teaser: Problems with study design, management, and cost doomed the study, which would have tracked 100,000 children from birth to adulthood.

Headlines: Low GI May Not Add Cardiovascular Benefit to Low-Carb Diet
Teaser: In overweight adults without diabetes, adding the concept of glycemic index to an already-healthy low-carb diet is probably overkill and doesn't provide     further gains, a new study indicates.

Headlines: Bleeding Risk Climbs With Anticoagulant Bridging in AF
Teaser: To bridge or not to bridge? That is the question invoked frequently in clinical practice; another analysis argues against the practice. Upcoming trials could nail down the answer.

Headlines: Everolimus Does Not Overcome Trastuzumab Resistance
Teaser: Inhibiting the PI3K/mTOR pathway did not improve progression-free survival when added to chemotherapy and trastuzumab in women with advanced breast cancer.

Headlines: LMWH Best for VTEs in Cancer, But There's a Catch in US
Teaser: The largest study of its kind found that LMWH was better than warfarin at preventing a recurrence of blood clots in cancer patients. Does the margin of improvement justify the greater cost?

Headlines: Social Media Potentially Addictive, Linked to Substance Abuse
Teaser: A survey of university undergraduates suggests that excessive social media use can be addictive and is linked to substance abuse and problems with emotion regulation and impulse control.

Headlines: DCIS Test Identifies Patients With Low Recurrence Risk
Teaser: A new Oncotype test identifies patients with ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) who are at low risk for recurrence and for the development of invasive breast cancer.

Headlines: Fulvestrant Survival Advantage in Advanced Breast Cancer
Teaser: New survival data from the FIRST trial show a survival advantage for the injectable fulvestrant over the standard of care, oral anastrozole.

Headlines: Stem Cell Therapy May Someday Replace Corneal Transplants
Teaser: Mesenchymal stem cells from human limbus regenerated the stroma of corneas in mice, providing a possible autologous alternative to cornea transplants.

Headlines: New Algorithm for Treatment of Premenopausal Breast Cancer
Teaser: Results from the Suppression of Ovarian Function Trial (SOFT) are practice changing for a subgroup of premenopausal women with breast cancer.

Headlines: PsA: TNF Inhibitors May Reduce Disease Activity Long-term
Teaser: More than two thirds of patients with psoriatic arthritis who were receiving tumor necrosis factor alpha blockers  achieved a state of minimal disease activity in a recent study.

Headlines: Relation of Overall & Abdominal Adiposity to Vascular Health
Teaser: What is the impact of overall obesity on vascular atherosclerotic changes?

Headlines: Cardiac Condition During Therapeutic Hypothermia After CPR
Teaser: Patients may benefit neurologically from therapeutic hypothermia, but could this therapy also improve cardiac function?

Source: Current Opinion in Allergy and Clinical Immunology
Headlines: Sublingual Immunotherapy in Children: Recent Experiences
Teaser: Learn more about sublingual immunotherapy in pediatric patients suffering from allergic rhinitis or allergic rhinoconjunctivitis caused by environmental allergens.

Headlines: Behavioral Intervention to Decrease Obesity in Preschoolers
Teaser: This study evaluated an 18-session family-based behavioral intervention which addressed the unique challenges of obesity in preschoolers.

Headlines: The Gut Microbiome in Health and in Disease
Teaser: As researchers begin to learn more about the gut microbiome, how are they better understanding its connection to the development of certain diseases?

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Breast Cancer Screening and Overdiagnosis Estimates
Teaser: Identifying which breast cancer estimates are reliable is challenging, but now there's an approach that provides a system of checks and balances.

Headlines: Are Add-on to Statins Needed in Hypercholesterolemia?
Teaser: Does combining a statin with a bile acid sequestrant, fibrate or ezetimibe reduce LDL-C and improve glycemic control in patients with diabetes?

Headlines: Rapid Crystal Dissolution in Gout
Teaser: Does more rapid crystal dissolution have any clinical relevance for gout patients?

Headlines: Prognostic Value of Kras Mutations in Stage Iii Colon Cancer
Teaser: Find out more about the pronostic impact of KRAS exon 2 mutations in stage III colon cancer.

Headlines: Mechanical Circulatory Support Devices as Destination Therapy
Teaser: Is mechanical support the wave of the future -- for older and sicker patients ineligible for heart transplant?

Headlines: Reduction in Stroke and Thromboembolic Events in AF
Teaser: Find out about events after blinded study drug discontinuation and transition to open-label vitamin K antagonist -- in ARISTOTLE.

Headlines: Adverse Skeletal Effects of Drugs -- Beyond Glucocorticoids
Teaser: Drugs of all types may increase fracture risk. Which ones are you prescribing?

Headlines: Pre-Operative Pelvic Floor Muscle Training -- A Review
Teaser: Do most men benefit from pelvic floor exercises before surgery?

Headlines: The Distinctive Features of Surgical Oncology as a Specialty
Teaser: Find out how cancer care is evolving from a generalized single provider mode toward a more personalized team approach.

Headlines: Itching and Quality of Life for Patients With Psoriasis
Teaser: Pruritus is one of the most prevalent symptoms in patients with psoriasis. What role does it play in mediating the relationship between improvements in disease severity and HRQOL?

Headlines: Amiodarone in AF With and Without LV Dysfunction
Teaser: Is amiodarone's efficacy in maintaining sinus rhythm and reducing the AF burden similar regardless of whether patients have severe LV dysfunction or not?

Source: Current Opinion in Nephrology and Hypertension
Headlines: Optimal Targets for Blood Pressure Control in CKD
Teaser: Which antihypertensive medications are most effective for patients with advanced CKD, and do clinicians generally agree upon optimal targets for blood pressure control in this subset of patients?

Source: OJIN: The Online Journal of Issues in Nursing
Headlines: Clinical Nurse Preceptors and Intra-Professional Collaboration
Teaser: Graduate nursing preceptors are essential to meet the projected healthcare needs of the future, with wisdom and professionalism.

Headlines: Kidney Stone Risk Following Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass Surgery
Teaser: Find out about the potential risk factors for kidney stone development after Roux-en-Y gastric bypass surgery, and recommendations for reducing the risk.

Headlines: Rational Design of Gold Nanoparticle Toxicology Assays
Teaser: How toxic are gold nanoparticles? This article aims to provide general guidelines for nanotoxicological assays of AuNPs.

Headlines: Cardiovascular Effects of GLP-1 Receptor Agonists
Teaser: Are GLP-1 receptor agonists 'cardiac friendly'?

Headlines: Antiviral Therapy in the Hepatitis C Virus Life Cycle
Teaser: What are the recent advances in our understanding of the HCV life cycle and how have they impacted antiviral therapy?

Headlines: Antimicrobial Photodynamic Therapy Suppresses Dental Plaque
Teaser: Is antimicrobial photodynamic therapy a safe and effective alternative to mechanical approaches for daily plaque control?

Headlines: Stereotactic Laser Ablation of High-Grade Gliomas
Teaser: Laser interstitial thermal therapy promises new hope for the treatment of high-grade gliomas. In this review, the authors present a management algorithm that incorporates LITT in clinical practice.

Headlines: Downregulation of Spleen TK in Hepatocellular Carcinoma
Teaser: The authors explore the role of spleen tyrosine kinase expression in hepatocellular carcinoma. Might it act as a tumor suppressor in HCC cells?

Headlines: OCT for the Diagnosis of Neovascular AMD
Teaser: Is OCT a reliable diagnostic tool for assessing patients with suspected neovascular AMD?

Headlines: Onychomycosis: Clinical Considerations and Recommendations
Teaser: How long should antifungals be given for onychomycosis? Is monitoring necessary?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Net Benefit of Antithrombotic Therapy in AF and CKD
Teaser: How does antithrombotic therapy reduce risk in patients with these 2 comorbidities?

Headlines: Intestinal Permeability -- A New Target for Disease
Teaser: What does the latest research tell us about the clinical significance of the intestinal barrier and intestinal permeability for health and disease?

Headlines: Cardiovascular Toxicities and Tumors Treated With Sorafenib
Teaser: Is sorafenib associated with a higher risk of developing all grade hypertension and bleeding, when compared with controls?

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Stimulant Use and AIDS Progression After HAART
Teaser: Are HIV+ stimulant users at an elevated risk for more rapid HIV disease progression even after the initiation of HAART?

Headlines: Suvorexant for Insomnia: Efficacy and Safety Profile
Teaser: Suvorexant is the first orexin receptor antagonist approved for the treatment of insomnia. What do you need to know before prescribing?

Headlines: Neuroimaging Chronic Pain: What Have We Learned?
Teaser: How does the brain work in the presence of chronic pain?

Headlines: Biosimilars: The Need, The Challenge, The Future
Teaser: What are biosimilars, how are they developed, and how are they poised to change the way diseases are treated in the future?

Source: OJIN: The Online Journal of Issues in Nursing
Headlines: Value of Information Services in Nursing and Patient Care
Teaser: Libraries provide essential resources for literature searches and access to open source and other forms of research based knowledge in healthcare settings.

Headlines: Macrophages and CNS Delivery of Therapeutic Proteins
Teaser: The authors report on novel nanoformulations of nanozymes utilizing macrophages as transporters with the ability to cross the blood-brain barrier for treatment of CNS diseases.

Headlines: Delivery of the HPV Vaccine Through a School-Based Program
Teaser: This study indicates that the availability of HPV vaccination through a free, school-based program is an effective delivery method--but is it sufficient for ensuring high HPV vaccine coverage?

Headlines: Contemporary Health Care Economics: An Overview
Teaser: While much focus is put on health care economics, few clinicians really understand the methods and concepts behind economic evaluation and cost analysis. Learn the basics in this primer.

Headlines: Clinical Characteristics of Trigeminal Neuralgia
Teaser: This study suggests that symptomatology of trigeminal neuralgia consists not only of classic severe stabbing neuropathic facial pain, but may include accompanying autonomic and sensory abnormalities.

Headlines: Obesity Attenuates Gender Differences in CV Mortality
Teaser: How does gender affect cardiovascular disease mortality in obese patients? Who's at higher risk... Men or women?

Headlines: Nonspecific Interstitial Pneumonia: Associations, Outcomes
Teaser: Is idiopathic NSIP a first manifestation of an underlying systemic autoimmune disease?

Headlines: Estrogen and Androgen Receptor in Liposarcoma
Teaser: Might hormonal receptor expression be a factor in liposarcoma, as it is in other cancers such as breast and prostate cancer?

Headlines: Contralateral Mastectomy After Unilateral Breast Cancer
Teaser: This study assess contralateral prophylactic mastectomy outcomes in women with unilateral breast cancer.

Headlines: Where Is Personalized Medicine in Cancer Heading?
Teaser: Learn why molecular imaging is a very promising aspect of personalized medicine for cancer care.

Headlines: Complete Mesocolic Surgery Improves Outcomes in Colon Cancer
Teaser: Complete mesocolic excision, a new way of performing surgery in patients with stage I-III colon cancer, is shown to improve disease-free survival. So why are we waiting?

Headlines: Obama Pushes Genomic Research in State of Union Speech
Teaser: "I want the country that eliminated polio and mapped the human genome to lead a new era of medicine ," the president said.

Headlines: New AHS Review of Acute Migraine Treatments
Teaser: The assessment, which will form the basis of new US clinical practice guidelines, represents the first update to treatment recommendations in 15 years.

Headlines: Palbociclib for Breast Cancer Inches Toward FDA Approval
Teaser: Palbociclib, the first CDK 4/6 inhibitor, has shown a doubling of progression-free survival in postmenopausal women with ER-positive, HER2-negative advanced-stage breast cancer.

Headlines: FDA Approval of 'Novel' New Drugs Up Sharply in 2014
Teaser: The agency credits last year's higher output to various programs designed to speed much needed drugs to market.

Headlines: New Eye Scan Predicts Peripheral Neuropathy in Diabetes
Teaser: Could corneal confocal microscopy represent a new technique for predicting peripheral diabetic neuropathy? The data suggest so, but there are still some     hurdles to overcome.

Headlines: ASCO: 'High-Risk' Project 'Must Be Done'
Teaser: The organization has been claiming that CancerLinQ will revolutionize cancer care for months. Now they have a technology partner to help them.

Headlines: Sunitinib Active in Advanced Thymic Carcinoma
Teaser: Sunitinib is active in advanced thymic carcinoma, concludes the first clinical trial of the drug in heavily pretreated patients.

Headlines: Dalcetrapib Benefits Genetic Subgroup of ACS Patients: Analysis
Teaser: The researchers say the results open the door for a prospective genetic-based clinical trial     testing the CETP inhibitor in appropriate patients.

Headlines: Denosumab an Effective Alternative to Bisphosphonates
Teaser: Physicians should consider the monoclonal antibody denosumab as an effective alternative osteoporosis treatment for postmenopausal women who find it difficult to adhere to oral bisphosphonates, new research shows.

Headlines: Biomarkers Stratify Patients With Acute Graft-Versus-Host Disease
Teaser: A score based on three biomarkers can classify patients with acute graft-versus-host disease (GVHD) into clinically meaningful risk strata, according to research from the Blood and Marrow Transplant (BMT) Clinical Trials Network.

Headlines: Anti-TNF Best at Preventing Postsurgery Relapse in Crohn's
Teaser: Anti-TNF appears to be more effective than mesalamine, antibiotics, and budesonide.

Headlines: Higher-Dose Vancomycin Ups Risk for Pediatric Kidney Damage
Teaser: Clinical trials in children are needed to establish dosing guidelines not extrapolated from those for adults.

Headlines: Oxytocin May Help Frontotemporal Dementia
Teaser: Intranasal oxytocin given twice daily for 1 week showed preliminary signs of improvement in apathy and loss of empathy in patients with frontotemporal dementia.

Headlines: Maternal Depression Linked to Risky Behavior in Kids
Teaser: Children of mothers with depression are at significantly increased risk of engaging in delinquent behaviors and substance abuse in adolescence.

Headlines: CABG Costs More Than PCI but Is a 'Reasonable Value'
Teaser: CABG for stable multivessel disease has a greater cost than PCI, both during the index hospitalization and over the patient's lifetime, but given the     better outcomes with surgery, it is a cost-effective revascularization strategy, say investigators.

Headlines: FDA Okays MRI Contrast Agent (Gadavist) in Infants
Teaser: The gadolinium-based contrast agent gadobutrol (Gadavist, Bayer Healthcare) is the first approved for children under 2 years of age.

Headlines: Molecular 15-Minute Flu Test Cleared for Physician Offices
Teaser: The nucleic acid-based test, more accurate than older rapid influenza tests, had been limited to certain kinds of laboratories. The FDA expects to approve more such molecular tests for medical-office use.

Headlines: New Type of Antibiotic May Be Less Prone to Resistance
Teaser: A novel antimicrobial compound effectively kills gram-positive bacteria, but showed no evidence of resistance in animal tests.

Headlines: e-Cigarettes Need Research and Regulation, Say AACR and ASCO
Teaser: In a joint policy statement, AACR and ASCO have called for further research and more stringent federal and state regulations regarding the use and sale of electronic nicotine delivery systems

Headlines: FDA Okays Carbidopa/Levodopa ER (Rytary) in Parkinson's
Teaser: Approval of the extended-release carbidopa-levodopa formulation was based on positive results in a trio of phase 3 studies of patients with early and advanced PD.

Headlines: New Cancer Diagnosis Linked to Increased Stroke Risk
Teaser: A diagnosis of cancer -- particularly lung, pancreatic, or colorectal cancer -- is associated with an increased short-term risk for stroke, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Biogen Experimental Drug Shows Evidence of Optic Nerve Repair
Teaser: An experimental drug from Biogen Idec Inc showed evidence of biological repair of the optic nerve in a mid-stage study in patients with acute optic neuritis, an inflammation of the optic nerve that can lead to vision loss.

Headlines: FDA Clears Enteral Suspension (Duopa) for Parkinson's
Teaser: Duopa (AbbVie) enteral suspension is given via a portable infusion pump that delivers carbidopa and levodopa into the small intestine for 16 hours to reduce motor fluctuations.

Headlines: Misguided Aspirin Use in 1 in 10 Heart-Clinic Patients
Teaser: Clinicians "should get into the habit of calculating 10-year CVD risk and then having a discussion with the patient as to risk vs benefit," before considering aspirin, a researcher said.

Headlines: Saxagliptin: A Therapy Option in Diabetes and Renal Failure
Teaser: The largest-ever trial to examine use of a diabetes medicine in patients with renal failure has published its findings. Other megatrials in this     population, which is challenging to treat, are ongoing.

Headlines: Statin Benefits Similar in Women, Men at Equal Risk
Teaser: A combined analysis of patient-level data from "all of the large statin trials" should alleviate concerns that women don't benefit from statins nearly as much as men, according to a leading researcher in the field.

Headlines: Israel's BrainStorm Says Stem Cell Drug Benefits Most Patients in ALS Trial
Teaser: Israel's BrainStorm Cell Therapeutics said final results from a clinical trial of its adult stem cell treatment in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) were positive, with most patients showing a slowing in the disease's progression.

Headlines: Clinical Cancer Advances in 2014: CLL Is the Winner
Teaser: This year in its annual review of clinical cancer advances, the American Society of Clinical Oncology has, for the first time, announced a winner.

Headlines: Tapentadol Toxicity in Children
Teaser: Most pediatric patients exposed to this novel analgesic (Nucynta) had no major effects, but there were 2 cases with life-threatening events, poison center reports show.

Headlines: Novel MET Inhibitor Elicits 'Dramatic Response' in GI Cancer
Teaser: In a subset of patients, more than half achieved a response to investigational agent AMG337, in an early-phase study.

Headlines: Seniors Commonly Mix Alcohol With Meds
Teaser: Although many US adults of all ages put themselves at risk by mixing drugs and alcohol, this dangerous practice is especially prevalent in the elderly.

Headlines: Suspend Dozens of Drugs Based on Flawed Studies, EMA Says
Teaser: The drugs recommended for suspension in the EU are commonly prescribed generics. The firm providing the problematic data also figures into drugs approved by the FDA, which as not yet taken action.

Headlines: Robert Califf Named FDA Deputy Commissioner
Teaser: Robert Califf, long affiliated with Duke University, will leave Durham, NC, for Washington, DC, where he will serve in a senior leadership role within the     FDA.

Headlines: Elevated 'Lipid-Years' in Young Adulthood Tied to Later CHD
Teaser: Like pack-years of smoking, "lipid-years" of exposure to high cholesterol is another independent risk factor for CAD in later life, an expert says, based     on new research.

Headlines: FDA Approves Triferic for Iron Replacement in Dialysis
Teaser: The agency, however, did not require the postapproval studies on the agent's extended use that an FDA advisory committee had recommended.

Headlines: Morphine Unsafe for Some Children After Tonsillectomy
Teaser: Ibuprofen in combination with acetaminophen is safe and  effective analgesia for children after tonsillectomy.

Headlines: COPD: Multiple Measures Needed to Avoid Overdiagnosis
Teaser: Patients with a low forced expiratory volume in 1 second/forced vital capacity and a low forced expiratory volume in 1 second may be at higher risk for adverse outcomes, according to a large study.

Headlines: Docs 'Astonished': ED Drugs Tied to Prostate Cancer Return
Teaser: The erectile dysfunction (ED) drugs often used after radical prostatectomy might increase the rate of the cancer's biochemical recurrence.

Headlines: Clopidogrel-PPI Interaction Questioned in Meta-analysis
Teaser: Randomized trials say no such interaction exists but observational studies suggest otherwise, concludes a new analysis. But are the observational studies "hopelessly confounded," as an expert insists?

Headlines: Plan Fails to Cut Ventilator Use in Critically Ill Children
Teaser: Although a sedation protocol resulted in some improvements, the primary outcome of reduced time on mechanical ventilation was not met in a large multicenter trial.

Headlines: Chest Pain, MI Rule-Out? More Noninvasive Testing Unhelpful
Teaser: A study questions the value of a continued predischarge search for ischemia by coronary CT or stress testing in such patients already cleared by ECG and biomarkers.

Headlines: Breast Cancer Timeline: Quiet 100 Years and Then Boom
Teaser: A timeline of developments in the treatment of breast cancer reveals great change in the past 20 to 30 years, according to two experts.

Headlines: Chondroitin-Glucosamine Reduced Pain in Knee Arthritis in RCT
Teaser: A chondroitin sulfate/glucosamine product provided as much relief as celecoxib for patients with moderate to severe knee OA pain in a randomized trial, but some experts were unconvinced.

Headlines: Consent for Biobank Donations High in US Survey
Teaser: Donors want the simple courtesy of knowing how their tissues are being used, says the author of 'The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks.'

Headlines: 'Practice Changing' MRI Recommendations in Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: New recommendations on the use of MRI in the management of multiple myeloma and related disorders are practice changing for one set of patients.

Headlines: Novel Technique Might Enhance Radioguided Surgery
Teaser: A novel tool for radioguided neurosurgery might improve identification of  residual cancer cells and has lower radiation exposure for patients and surgeons.

Headlines: Isolated Systolic Hypertension in Young Adults Ups CVD Risk
Teaser: In younger and middle-aged adults, isolated systolic hypertension is not "benign," as many may have thought until now, new research shows.

Headlines: Darunavir/Cobicistat (Prezcobix) Combo Pill Clears FDA
Teaser: The fixed-dose combination of the antiretroviral drug darunavir (800 mg) and the pharmacokinetic enhancer cobicistat (150 mg) is for adults with HIV-1 infection and no darunavir resistance mutations.

Headlines: FDA Okays Vyvanse for Binge Eating Disorder
Teaser: The FDA announced it has expanded the use of a drug approved for ADHD to treat binge eating disorder.

Headlines: Ethnic Differences in Breast Cancer Survival Due to Biology
Teaser: The variation in breast cancer survival by ethnic group can largely be attributed to intrinsic tumor biology, a new study has concluded.

Headlines: Plaque Types Aid in Identifying Ischemic Lesions
Teaser: A new study suggests the type of atherosclerotic plaque might provide additional information beyond the degree of coronary stenosis. Investigators describe adverse plaque characteristics associated with ischemia-causing lesions.

Headlines: Research Investment Down in United States, Up Globally
Teaser: The percentage of funding coming from the United States has dropped from 57% to 44% in recent years. Meanwhile, China tripled its investment. Experts make a plea for alternative funding streams.

Headlines: Novel Triglyceride Oil May Treat Huntington's
Teaser: The oil is thought to replace key intermediates needed for cellular energy production, which may be deficient in Huntington's disease.

Headlines: TAVR Benefit, Risk Information Deficient on Most Hospital Websites
Teaser: Patients may have unrealistic expectations of the transcatheter procedure from only the website promotions, researchers say, so it's all the more important for cardiologists to offer a balanced view.

Headlines: Testosterone to Treat Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer?
Teaser: A pilot study has shown that pharmacologic doses of testosterone along with etoposide can reduce PSA levels and shrink tumors in some men with asymptomatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.

Headlines: New Test IDs Early-Stage Melanoma With Metastatic Risk
Teaser: A 28-gene signature could help identify patients with stage I or II melanoma who are at risk for future metastases.

Headlines: Hepatitis C: Value of Expanded Screening Unclear
Teaser: Expanded HCV screening in large birth cohorts has been endorsed as cost-effective by some experts, but others have cautioned that screening could do more harm than good.

Headlines: U.S. Proposes Effort to Analyze DNA From 1 Million People
Teaser: The United States has proposed analyzing genetic information from more than 1 million American volunteers as part of a new initiative to understand human disease and develop medicines targeted to an individual's genetic make-up.

Headlines: Third- and Further-line Therapy in Advanced NSCLC Patients
Teaser: Although the benefit of first- and second-line treatment over best supportive care alone has been firmly established, the role of further-line treatment remains controversial. . .

Headlines: Vision and Vision-related Outcome Measures in MS
Teaser: This article presents an overview of vision-associated symptoms in multiple sclerosis, highlighting the importance of vision as a model for outcomes assessment in clinical trials.

Headlines: Current and Future HCV Therapy
Teaser: Interferon-free regimens for hepatitis C have made treatment shorter, safer, and more effective; yet, certain areas require further evaluation to make this possible and cost-effective for all.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: EMS Public Health Implications, Interim Guidance for Ebola
Teaser: Are you prepared to care for a patient with suspected Ebola? Find out the recommended strategies for pre-hospital providers to prevent the spread of infection.

Headlines: Adrenal Insufficiency: Outcomes With Glucocorticoid Therapy
Teaser: Can we manage adrenal insufficiency better? Which aspects of glucocorticoid therapy need improving?

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Nevirapine to Rilpivirine Switch in Suppressed HIV
Teaser: Is substituting nevirapine for rilpivirine safe and effective in virologically suppressed HIV patients?

Headlines: Hypochlorous Acid: An Ideal Wound Care Agent With Potency
Teaser: What's the effect of stabilized hypochlorous acid solution on chronic wound healing?

Source: Genetics and Metabolism Division of Children's National Health System
Headlines: Creating Human Tissues to Test Drugs for Rare Diseases
Teaser: Skip the mice. This technology will allow scientists to predict how drugs will act in human tissues -- a boon to the rare diseases community, which has too few human subjects for testing new drugs.

Headlines: CT Screening for Lung Cancer: A Study in Cost-Effectiveness
Teaser: Dr Andrew Shorr encourages his colleagues to consider new research that analyzes the cost-effectiveness of CT screening patients at risk for lung cancer.

Headlines: Why Is Influenza So Difficult to Prevent and Treat?
Teaser: Drs Andrew Pavia and Greg Poland answer questions about why this season's flu vaccine was less effective, why the public is resistant to being vaccinated, and how antivirals should really be used.

Headlines: A Drug Better Than Nicotine for Smoking Cessation?
Teaser: Is this plant alkaloid better than nicotine when it comes to helping patients stop smoking?

Headlines: Turmeric: Does It Have Antiseizure Activity?
Teaser: What is the effect of this common spice on seizures?

Headlines: An Interview With PARADIGM HF PI, John McMurray
Teaser: Ileana Piña quizzes the principal investigator for the details of this groundbreaking trial in heart failure.

Headlines: Predictions for the Field of Infectious Diseases for 2015
Teaser: John Bartlett admits that predictions are dangerous and there will be surprises, yet he forges ahead with his best guesses for what will make headlines in the field of infectious diseases this year.

Headlines: Topol on Obama's Precision Medicine Initiative
Teaser: Eric Topol explains why Obama's precision medicine initiative is going to be an amalgamation of an enormously valuable information resource going forward.

Headlines: Hypovolemic Shock: Effect of Fluid Choice on Mortality
Teaser: Choosing the right type of fluid resuscitation may affect mortality outcomes in patients with hypovolemic shock.

Headlines: Reconsidering Allopurinol for Hypertension
Teaser: Henry Black explains why we should proceed with caution when it comes to the use of allopurinol in hypertension management.

Headlines: Perils and Pluses of 'Compassionate Use'
Teaser: When a person is dying, there may be lots of pressure to give access to drugs still in development. This happened during the recent Ebola outbreak. But there are serious pros and cons to doing this.

Headlines: Small Bowel Cancer: Scoping Out a Rarity
Teaser: Small bowel adenocarcinoma, although rare, poses a diagnostic challenge. Dr Michael Overman discusses advances in earlier detection and therapeutic strategies that may benefit affected patients.

Headlines: Getting a (Glass) Bead on CRC Metastases
Teaser: Dr David Kerr reports on mounting evidence of the significant antitumor activity of yttrium-90 in hepatic metastatic CRC when Y90 microspheres are delivered via the hepatic artery.

Source: The National Organization for Rare Disorders
Headlines: Registries for Rare Diseases: Involve the Patient
Teaser: Knowledge will expand, care will advance, and outcomes will improve if registries are used to their full potential.

Headlines: Constipation: What Works, What Doesn't
Teaser: Dr David Johnson reviews the supportive evidence and recommendations for all of the available treatments for chronic constipation and irritable bowel syndrome.

Headlines: Redefining the Annual Physical
Teaser: Should we redefine preventive health maintenance? Hint: It involves fearing healthcare rather than disease.

Headlines: The Case for Neoadjuvant Therapy in Lung Cancer
Teaser: Dr Mark Kris discusses the benefits of neoadjuvant therapy for patients with locally advanced lung cancers, from treating micrometastases to assessing response to therapy.

Headlines: Efficacy of a Smartphone Intervention for Schizophrenia
Teaser: A novel smartphone intervention designed to support self-management of schizophrenia can reduce costs and extend the reach of care beyond the clinician's office.

Headlines: A Practical Method for Rapid Measurement of Skin Condition
Teaser: Get an overview of skin breakdown in hospitalized infants along with a validated, visually based method for rapid measurement of skin condition.

Headlines: Salivary Gland Cancer: Teamwork Pays Off
Teaser: Rare but curable, salivary gland cancer requires multidisciplinary teams to eradicate tumor and maximize the preservation of function and appearance, says Dr Bhuvanesh Singh, a surgical oncologist.

Headlines: Rehabilitation of Poststroke Cognition
Teaser: By means of a case example, the authors discuss approaches to cognitive rehabilitation in stroke, focusing on speech and language, functional memory, executive function, and spatial-motor systems.

Headlines: Association of SFRP4 With T2D in Patients With Stable CAD
Teaser: Do these regulators of Wnt-signaling predict cardiovascular outcome in patients with CAD?

Headlines: Molecular Subtype of Breast Cancer Metastases
Teaser: Do tumor characteristics and molecular subtypes in breast cancer metastases confer clinically relevant prognostic information for patients?

Headlines: Personalized Sequencing and the Future of Medicine
Teaser: Advances in the speed and scale of DNA sequencing means it's now practical to produce personalized clinical evaluations. What impact will this have on pharmacogenomics and medicine as a whole?

Headlines: Drugs That Interact With Levothyroxine
Teaser: Which prescription drugs and dietary supplements significantly affect TSH in patients taking levothyroxine?

Headlines: Low-dose Glucocorticoid Treatment in the Patient With RA
Teaser: How safe are low-dose glucocorticoids when used long term for the management of rheumatoid arthritis?

Headlines: The Changing Clinical Profile of Celiac Disease
Teaser: How has understanding the clinicopathological aspects of celiac disease helped to shape patient care over the last couple of decades?

Source: Medicine and Science in Sports and Exercise
Headlines: Sex Differences and Effects of T2DM on Exercise Performance
Teaser: How does exercise performance compare between men and women with type 2 diabetes? This study investigates.

Headlines: Dosage Escalation of Sorafenib in Metastatic RCC
Teaser: Is subsequent dosage escalation of sorafenib effective for patients with advanced renal cell carcinoma?

Headlines: An Update on Intestinal Behcet's Disease
Teaser: What recent developments have been made in the diagnosis, treatment, and prognosis of intestinal Behcet's disease?

Headlines: Management for Treatment-Resistant Depression in Adolescents
Teaser: This review explores the optimal pharmacological and psychosocial interventions for adolescents who do not adequately respond to initial treatment for depression.

Headlines: Risk Factors for Barrett Esophagus
Teaser: Are African Americans more likely to develop Barrett esophagus than non-Hispanic Whites and, if so, what are the reasons?

Headlines: What's New in the Treatment of Serious MRSA Infection?
Teaser: This article reviews several new MRSA-active agents now approved for use.

Headlines: HCV Infection and Post-liver Transplant Diabetes
Teaser: Hepatitis C virus is known to be associated with metabolic manifestations including insulin resistance and diabetes, but could it also increase the risk of post-transplant diabetes?

Headlines: An Outcome Prediction Tool for Patients Considering TKA
Teaser: In this paper, the development of a prediction tool based on patient factors for outcomes after knee replacement surgery is described.

Headlines: Pharmacological Potential of Tocotrienols: A Review
Teaser: Is this lesser-known form of vitamin E a "wonder drug"?

Headlines: Varenicline vs. Nicotine Replacement for Smoking Cessation
Teaser: Which is more effective for quitting smoking in real-world use: nicotine replacement or varenicline?

Headlines: HDL Cholesterol Subclass, MI and Mortality in Prevention
Teaser: What are the connections between HDL subclasses and prognosis in secondary prevention for coronary heart disease?

Headlines: Disorders of Emotional Processing in ALS
Teaser: This review summarizes recent research suggesting that emotional processing dysfunction is common in ALS, including impaired recognition of facial expression and problems with social cognition.

Headlines: Bone Complications Among Prostate Cancer Survivors
Teaser: Long-term use of ADT may be associated with an increased risk of fracture in men with prostate cancer.

Headlines: IFN-free Therapy in Treatment-experienced Patients With HCV
Teaser: Treatment-experienced patients with chronic hepatitis C can now benefit from interferon-free regimens. What are they?

Headlines: Expression of Gut-homing B7 Receptor on T Cells
Teaser: This article analyzes microbial translocation and expression of the gut-homing B7 receptor on peripheral T cells in HIV-1-infected individuals.

Headlines: Palonosetron for Emesis Control in High-dose Chemotherapy
Teaser: Find out how a second-generation 5-HT3RA impacts chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting associated with anti-cancer chemotherapy.

Headlines: The Promise of Pharmacogenomics for Inflammatory Diseases
Teaser: Many patients don't adequately respond to treatment with drugs used in inflammatory diseases. Could predictive biomarkers to drug response--both genetic and non-genetic--be identified?

Headlines: Raising Systolic BP Target May Hike Stroke Risk
Teaser: New observational data show raising the recommended SBP threshold from 140 to 150 mmHg in JNC 8 may lead to more strokes, especially for minorities.

Headlines: No Association Between Metformin Use and Lung Cancer
Teaser: Outcomes differed by smoking history and tumor type, however, although these findings were not significant. More research is needed before any firm     conclusions can be drawn, say the researchers.

Headlines: Do Societies Play It Too Safe With Choosing Wisely Lists?
Teaser: Low-value items on CW lists  may divert attention from procedures that truly drive up costs, experts say. The ABIM Foundation chief says singling out one test ignores the CW program's overall benefit.

Headlines: Lenvatinib Highly Beneficial in Advanced Thyroid Cancer
Teaser: The investigational agent lenvatinib significantly increased progression-free survival and response rates in patients with iodine-131 refractory thyroid cancer in a phase 3 trial.

Teaser: For the first time in 20 years, patients suffering from the eye disease glaucoma may soon have new treatments as several young companies look to shake up the $5.6 billion global market

Headlines: Blood Cancer Drugs May Offer 'Reasonable Value for Money'
Teaser: Despite the outcry over the high cost of many of the new drugs, a new analysis suggests that they 'may provide reasonable value for money.'

Headlines: What's Hot at ISC 2015?
Teaser: An eagerly awaited array of endovascular trials crowd the program this year, and, if positive, could mean a sea change for acute stroke treatment.

Headlines: Axitinib Shown to Be Active in Resistant CML and B-ALL
Teaser: Axitinib, a VEGFR inhibitor used in the treatment of kidney cancer, has surprisingly now shown activity in certain hematologic malignancies.

Teaser: In low-income, urban Latino patients with type 2 diabetes and poorly controlled glycemia, HbA1c levels improved and patients were less distressed when     educators used a "diabetes dashboard."

Headlines: The Utility of Testicular Prosthesis Placement in Children
Teaser: Can testicular prostheses be safely and effectively placed in pediatric patients with testicular disorders?

Headlines: Danish Study: No Excess Pancreatitis Risk in Incretin Users
Teaser: Researchers found that users of all diabetes drug classes had elevated pancreatitis rates, which became nonsignificant after adjustment for confounders.

Teaser: Facing a need for new approaches to treating DKD, researchers turn to pentoxifylline, a drug that has been around for decades.

Headlines: Food Intolerance: Etiology, Diagnosis, Mechanisms, Evidence
Teaser: How does this new article advance our understanding of how certain foods or food components could be implicated in cases of food intolerance?

Headlines: The Definition of AKI and Its Use in Practice
Teaser: How can a universal definition of acute kidney injury help clinicians both gain a better understanding of the disease, and assist them in treating patients?

Headlines: CTCs as Predictors of Metastatic Spread in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Find out about the role of CTC counts as predictors of disease evolution in breast cancer patients with limited metastatic dissemination.

Headlines: 10 Years of Personalizing Medicine: Practice and Policy
Teaser: What challenges are ahead for the next decade of personalized medicine?

Headlines: IFN-free Therapy in Treatment-naive Patients With HCV
Teaser: What therapies, approved and on the horizon, exist to treat treatment-naive patients with hepatitis C?

Headlines: Topical Insect Repellents in Endemic Malaria Populations
Teaser: Do topical insect repellents reduce outdoor biting and morbidity from malaria?

Headlines: Cancer Stem Cells: Responsible for Treatment Failure?
Teaser: Novel animal models may lay the foundation for a new generation of clinical trials aimed at anticipating the benefit to patients of anticancer therapies.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Aspirin Use for Primary Prevention of Cardiovascular Disease
Teaser: How common is inappropriate aspirin therapy use in primary prevention?

Headlines: Challenges in Combining Novel Molecularly Targeted Agents
Teaser: Find out why combining novel molecularly targeted agents is probably one of the most critical and complex challenges in cancer medicine today.

Headlines: Insulin Pump Programming: Preventing Dawn Phenomenon in T1D
Teaser: Is delivery of a fixed increase of early morning insulin a safe or hazardous practice?

Headlines: When Ablation Fails, What Then?
Teaser: Peter Noseworthy and Paul Friedman discuss how to define success in catheter ablation for atrial fibrillation and the options for patients with persistent arrhythmia following ablation.

Headlines: Ebola: Disease, Treatments, and Global Impact
Teaser: Learn where the Ebola outbreak stands right now, its far-reaching impact, and what we can expect in the future.

Headlines: Should Antidepressants Ever Be Used in Bipolar Disorder?
Teaser: Dr Fleischhacker discusses recent study findings that underscore important cautions and best practices regarding the use of antidepressants in bipolar disorder.

Headlines: Liver Disease From Alpha-1-Antitrypsin Deficiency
Teaser: What therapeutic options for liver failure in patients with alpha-1-antitrypsin deficiency are in the pipeline?

Headlines: A Disillusioned Doc Speaks Out
Teaser: Bob Harrington interviews cardiologist Sandeep Juahar, a New York Times contributor and author of Doctored: The Disillusionment of an American Physician.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana: The State of the Science
Teaser: In this comprehensive review of the literature, Dr Michael Schatman discusses the available evidence and current controversies surrounding the use of cannabinoids in medicine.

Headlines: Interview With 'The Big Fat Surprise' Author Nina Teicholz
Teaser: A Q&A with the investigative journalist whose book challenges the conventional wisdom regarding the role of fats and carbohydrates in our diets.

Headlines: Pertuzumab and the Curious Case of Accelerated Registration
Teaser: Drs Kathy Miller, Clifford Hudis, and George Sledge discuss the pros and cons of testing novel breast cancer treatments in the neoadjuvant setting, with special reference to pertuzumab.

Headlines: The Gambling Game: Clot vs Bleeding
Teaser: The risk/benefit trade off that gives Dr John Mandrola gray hairs: which patients with AF and a CHA2DS2-VASc score of 1 should get anticoagulation.

Headlines: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus: Which Drugs and When?
Teaser: Treatment options for SLE are continuing to improve. Which therapies are most promising?

Headlines: Eight Specific Signs of Impending Death in Cancer Patients
Teaser: A study of cancer patients has identified eight clinical signs predictive of death within 3 days, which could help decisions about comfort care.

Headlines: Patient Voices Essential, as Docs Underreport Toxicities
Teaser: The voices of cancer patients are essential when it comes to reporting toxic effects in clinical trials because physicians tend to under-report.

Headlines: Anticoagulate Intermediate-Risk AF Patients, Says Group
Teaser: It's a gray area--whether or not to prescribe oral anticoagulation to AF patients with a CHA2DS2-VASc score of 1 (or 2 for women)--but one expert says the     risk of stroke is high enough to err on the side of prescribing.

Headlines: CADISS: Antiplatelet, Anticoagulant Equal in Cervical Dissection
Teaser: The first randomized comparison of antiplatelet vs anticoagulant therapy for cervical artery dissection finds no difference in recurrent stroke, although event rates were very low.

Headlines: Type 1 Diabetes Increases Psychiatric Risk in Children
Teaser: Children diagnosed with type 1 diabetes have an increased risk for psychiatric disorders, including attempts at suicide, that appear to be connected to the stress of having the disease.

Headlines: Old Age Alone Should Not Rule Out ICDs: Pooled Analysis
Teaser: Based on a pooled analysis of existing clinical-trial evidence, increasing age alone should not nix the implantation of ICDs in suitable candidates.

Headlines: Next-Generation HIV and Hep C Treatment Plans Ahead at CROI
Teaser: Researchers spell out what's next for antiretroviral therapy after excitement about the Mississippi infant fades. Hepatitis C experts target genotype 3 as the next population needing therapies.

Headlines: Younger Women Not in Tune With Heart Health
Teaser: Women in their 30s, 40s and 50s don't seek preventive care for heart disease, aren't very good at gauging their risk for heart attack and often delay seeking treatment for symptoms of acute myocardial infarction (MI), a new study shows.

Headlines: Greater CAD Progression in Poor Responders to Statins
Teaser: A report suggests physicians should continue to monitor LDL-cholesterol levels to determine whether patients are getting the required reductions     suggested in the new guidelines.

Headlines: Latanoprostene Bunod Beats Timolol for Ocular Pressure
Teaser: The experimental drug latanoprostene bunod improves ocular perfusion pressure more than timolol, during both day and night, a new study shows.

Headlines: New Guidance on Managing Anticoagulant-Associated ICH
Teaser: A new study has clinical implications for managing anticoagulant-associated intracerebral hemorrhage in the acute phase and long-term.

Headlines: Pimecrolimus for Eczema May Have No Added Cancer Risk After All
Teaser: Topical pimecrolimus as a treatment for eczema may have no significant cancer risk, contrary to a U.S Food and Drug Administration warning, according to new research published online February 18 in JAMA Dermatology.

Headlines: Vagal Nerve Stimulation Encouraging in Stroke Rehab
Teaser: A preliminary clinical study suggests that vagal nerve stimulation as an aid to rehabilitation in stroke patients is safe and feasible, with some encouraging signs of efficacy.

Headlines: Too Many Scans for Aggressive Lymphoma in Clinical Trials
Teaser: Patients with aggressive lymphoma treated with curative intent should not have to receive the large number of scans that are mandated in clinical trials.

Headlines: 'Game-Changing' Research in Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: The most comprehensive description to date of genomic events in pancreatic carcinogenesis has identified a patient subgroup with exceptional responses.

Headlines: Emanuel Proposes $2B Prize to Address Antibiotic Crisis
Teaser: Offering prize money for the development of new antibiotic classes is a win-win for all, because as of right now, 'the bacteria are winning.'

Headlines: Lenalidomide Now for Newly Diagnosed Multiple Myeloma Patients
Teaser: The FDA has expanded the indication for lenalidomide to include newly diagnosed multiple myeloma patients.

Headlines: Daily 2-Hour Patching Improves Moderate, Severe Amblyopia
Teaser: Daily patching in 3- to 7-year-olds brings 33% of amblyopic eyes within one line of the other eye in moderate amblyopia, and 11% in severe amblyopia.

Headlines: Oral Treatment for Muscle Cramps May Help Patients With MS
Teaser: The idea behind a possible new treatment for spasticity in multiple sclerosis patients came serendipitously -- in a boat on the open sea.

Headlines: Many LGBT Medical Students Stay in the Closet
Teaser: Many lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgendered medical students conceal their sexual or gender identity for fear of discrimination, new research shows.

Headlines: One in 12 Pediatric Emergency Visits Related to Medications
Teaser: Medication-related issues were to blame for 1 in 12 pediatric visits to the emergency department in a recent study; 65% of the visits were potentially preventable.

Headlines: First Vaginal Insert for Fecal Incontinence Clears FDA
Teaser: The Eclipse System includes an inflatable vaginal balloon that puts pressure through the vaginal wall onto the rectal area, thereby reducing fecal incontinence episodes.

Headlines: Alternative to Overall Survival in Prostate Cancer Trials?
Teaser: Radiographic progression-free survival correlates with overall survival in patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.

Headlines: Coronary Sinus 'Stent' Improves Angina in Small Trial
Teaser: It's a stent that narrows, not widens, raising coronary sinus pressure and maybe boosting myocardial perfusion. Experts praise the study's sham control but stress the approach is far from proven.

Headlines: FDA to Simplify 'Compassionate Use' Drug Applications
Teaser: A form that once took as many as 100 hours to complete would take 45 minutes under an FDA proposal to speed unapproved, investigational drugs to patients with life-threatening conditions.

Headlines: Early Menopause Linked to Chemical Exposure in Women
Teaser: Women with the highest levels of endocrine-disrupting chemicals found in a wide variety of household and personal-care products enter menopause earlier     than those with lower levels.

Headlines: Novel Drug Approved for Breast Cancer: Palbociclib (Ibrance)
Teaser: A new drug for breast cancer with a novel mechanism of action was granted accelerated approval by the FDA two months ahead of schedule.

Headlines: Troponin-T Levels Predict New AF in Large Cohort Study
Teaser: Levels of the biomarker may highlight a remodeling process in the genesis of some AF independently of traditional AF risk factors.

Headlines: Head CT Scans May Be Overused in Emergency Departments

Headlines: Defibrotide Significantly Boosts Survival in VOD
Teaser: Defibrotide significantly improved outcomes across all subgroups of patients who developed veno-occlusive disease after stem cell transplant.

Headlines: Add Radiation to Androgen Deprivation for Locally Advanced Prostate CA: Study
Teaser: Radiotherapy added to androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) improves survival with locally advanced prostate cancer, according to eight years' worth of data from a clinical trial.

Headlines: Low Viral Load Ebola May Be Helped by Experimental Drug

Headlines: Gene Variant Linked to Increased Toxicity of Vincristine
Teaser: A previously unknown gene variant has been linked to increased risk and severity of vincristine-induced peripheral neuropathy in children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

Headlines: ARDS: Driving Pressure May Help Predict Survival
Teaser: In patients with acute respiratory distress syndrome who are on ventilators, driving pressure was associated with survival in a recent analysis of data from previously reported trials.

Headlines: FDA Approves Panobinostat for Relapsed Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The first-in-class agent has been granted accelerated approval, despite having been voted down by the advisory committee late last year.

Headlines: CBT, Hypnotherapy, Probiotics May Ease Kids' Tummyaches
Teaser: Several non-pharmacological treatments may be effective for children with functional abdominal pain disorders, according to a systematic review published February 9 in Pediatrics.

Headlines: New Evidence of Varicella-Zoster in Giant Cell Arteritis
Teaser: A new study links varicella-zoster virus to GCA; researchers suggest that antivirals might be added to corticosteroids for treating patients with this condition.

Headlines: Diabetic Macular Edema: Three VEGF Inhibitors Similar

Headlines: Study: Surveillance Is for Middle-Risk Prostate Cancer Too
Teaser: Active surveillance might be useful in 'favorable' intermediate-risk disease, American researchers say about their study of more than 5000 men.

Headlines: Brentuximab as First Salvage Therapy in Hodgkin's Lymphoma
Teaser: Brentuximab vedotin alone or with chemotherapy is effective in preparing patients with relapsed or refractory Hodgkin's lymphoma for transplantation.

Headlines: Multiple HTN Meds a Risk in Frail Elderly With 'Low' Systolic BP
Teaser: Consider comorbidities and frailty with antihypertensive polymedication in the elderly, as the applicable guidelines tend to be based on "more robust elderly individuals," propose researchers.

Headlines: Who Dies From Prostate Cancer?
Teaser: Gain a better understanding of the characteristics and mortality patterns of patients who died of prostate cancer.

Headlines: Carotid Artery Stenting: An Update
Teaser: Get current on the major technology advancements in carotid artery stenting, and peek into a crystal ball for glimpses of its' future.

Headlines: Dolutegravir Efficacy in Treatment-Naive HIV Patients
Teaser: Is dolutegravir effective as a first-line antiretroviral therapy in HIV-positive individuals?

Headlines: PaO2/FiO2 Ratio After Cardiac Surgery to Predict Outcome
Teaser: Can the PaO2/FiO2 ratio be used to predict mortality in patients immediately after cardiac surgery?

Teaser: Are existing guidelines for the screening and follow-up of patients at high risk for cutaneous melanoma adequate? This review makes recommendations for improving the quality of current guidelines.

Headlines: Breath Analysis in Inflammatory Bowel Diseases
Teaser: Are there breath analysis testing methods that could help clinicians to better diagnose and ultimately treat IBD?

Headlines: The Kidney Biopsy in Lupus Nephritis
Teaser: Besides the kidney biopsy, which has traditionally been the gold standard for the diagnosis of lupus nephritis, what other options are available to clinicians?

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health

Teaser: A new study examines the potential role of noninvasive hemodynamic assessments in these critically ill ED patients.

Teaser: Are aspirin and COX-2 inhibitors improving outcomes in stage III colon cancer patients?

Teaser: Is angiography-guided management associated with higher rates of coronary revascularization when compared with FFR-guided management in NSTEMI patients?

Teaser: Which calcified plaque scores best predict all-cause mortality in patients with type 2 diabetes?

Teaser: Learn more about the efficacy of denosumab use for prevention of skeletal complications in patients with CRPC.

Teaser: Cancer patients can be some of the most challenging who come into a hospitalist's care. These 10 tips from oncologists may help.

Teaser: Sharpen your knowledge of bronchoscopic modalities for emphysema and asthma.

Teaser: Are pediatric cancer patients more or less likely to be exposed to tobacco during treatment?

Teaser: Most HPV vaccination programs focus on and cover the cost of vaccination for girls only. Would it be cost-effective to promote HPV vaccine uptake for boys as well?

Teaser: This study explores the characteristics and prognostic factors of GIST.

Headlines: Treatment of IBD: Where We Are and Where We Are Going
Teaser: This new article sheds light on some of the newer therapies on the horizon to treat IBD. How do they differ from older drug regimens?

Teaser: Are primary care physicians disregarding treatment guidelines concerning antibiotic use in acute bronchitis?

Teaser: Colonoscopy is widely used to diagnose and treat colon disorders. How successful is it, and in what particular situations is it most warranted?

Teaser: Is measuring exposure in small hair samples an accurate way to assess HIV PrEP adherence?

Teaser: Just what does recovery from psychosis mean? This study aims to identify areas of consensus in relation to definitions of recovery from a patient perspective.

Teaser: Find out why CV research in pregnancy is both doubly challenging and rewarding, as it involves a special 'vulnerable' group.

Teaser: Which--if any--antipsychotics are effective in augmenting SSRI therapy in treatment refractory obsessive-compulsive disorder?

Teaser: Read about dolutegravir, the most recent antiretroviral approved for treatment of HIV-1 infection.

Teaser: Could vital signs play a role in improving the accuracy of triage categorization during a mass casualty-disaster event?

Teaser: What role does vitamin D play in the prevention of early-onset neonatal sepsis?

Teaser: Find out more about new therapies that show promise in improving overall survival rates in patients with bone metastatic castration resistant prostate cancer.

Teaser: Can ultrasound replace clinical examination for the assessment of disease activity in rheumatiod arthritis?

Teaser: Immunotherapy is a promising option for cancer treatment. How might nanocarriers be utilized for antitumor nanoimmunotherapy?

Teaser: What's the impact of caffeine on supraventricular tachycardia induction?

Teaser: Find out about recent advances in our understanding of how a complex milieu of supporting cells impact the tumor response to hypoxia in NSCLC.

Teaser: Will personalized medicine exacerbate disparities in health care?
