Teaser: Should testosterone be prescribed for midlife women with sexual dysfunction? This new study looks at the evidence.

Headlines: Dexamethasone vs Ondansetron for Postop Nausea and Vomiting
Teaser: Is dexamethasone as safe and effective as ondansetron in preventing postoperative nausea and vomiting in patients undergoing laparoscopic surgery?

Headlines: MRI and Neuroimaging Biomarkers for Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: High-field 7-T MRI shows promise as a noninvasive tool for evaluating three markers for Alzheimer's disease: neuroanatomical atrophy, characterization of hypointensities, and microinfarcts.

Headlines: Rivaroxaban in an Elderly Patient With Pulmonary Embolism
Teaser: This case demonstrates that rivaroxaban can be an effective and safe therapeutic choice in the acute phase of pulmonary embolism, even in elderly patients.

Headlines: Proton Pump Inhibitors and Hypomagnesemia in General Population
Teaser: What's the impact of prolonged PPI use on magnesium levels?

Headlines: Comparing Ex-PRESS to Trabeculectomy
Teaser: How do the outcomes between the Ex-PRESS glaucoma shunt and standard trabeculectomy surgery compare? Is one a better option?

Headlines: Perspective in Thyroid Extracts for Hypothyroidism
Teaser: Learn more about the evolution of hormone therapies to treat hypothyroidism -- and where thyroid extracts fit into the mix.

Headlines: Generalized Anxiety Disorder in Primary Care
Teaser: Generalized anxiety disorder commonly presents in primary care. Is it being properly diagnosed and adequately treated?

Headlines: Risk Factors for Hot Flashes in Menopausal Women
Teaser: What factors are associated with an increased risk of hot flashes in women undergoing the menopausal transition?

Headlines: Estimates of Adults With Indications for PrEP to Prevent HIV
Teaser: How many adults in the United States are candidates for PrEP as laid out in the 2014 U.S. Public Health Service's PrEP guideline?

Headlines: Genetic Etiologies, Outcomes of Pediatric Hypoparathyroidism
Teaser: This study provides some insight into the genetic etiologies and long-term outcomes of hypoparathyroidism in the pediatric population.

Headlines: Controlling Chronic GERD
Teaser: How safe and effective is transoral incisionless fundoplication in comparison to other treatments for the management of chronic GERD?

Headlines: Outcomes of ARDS Survivors Compared With Patients at Risk
Teaser: This study looks at the quality of life and functional status among ARDS survivors six months after hospitalization compared with those who were at risk but did not develop the condition.

Headlines: The Role of iNOS in Cholesterol-Induced Liver Fibrosis
Teaser: Does nitric oxide synthase play a role in cholesterol-induced liver fibrosis? Could its inhibition in cases of liver steatosis have therapeutic benefits?

Source: Seminars in Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine
Headlines: Invasive Aspergillosis: Clinical Aspects and Treatment
Teaser: Invasive aspergillosis remains an often fatal, difficult-to-treat infection in immunocompromised patients, but there's hope . . .

Headlines: Inpatient Multimodal Cardiac Imaging Appropriateness
Teaser: This study examined ordering practices of multiple cardiac imaging modalities used simultaneously in an inpatient environment. Are they being used appropriately?

Headlines: New Drug Review 2015
Teaser: Review the therapeutic profiles of newly approved drugs for psoriasis, type 2 diabetes, opioid-induced constipation, and chronic hepatitis C.

Headlines: A Once-daily NS5A Inhibitor in Patients With Genotype 1-4 HCV
Teaser: What does the latest data tell us about the safety and antiviral activity of GS-5816 in patients with genotype 1-4 hepatitis C infection?

Headlines: Osteoarthritis and Frailty in Elderly Individuals in Europe
Teaser: A new study examines the prevalence of OA and frailty among elderly individuals in European countries -- and explores the possible connection between these two conditions.

Headlines: CT Scans for Statin Eligibility: A Pandora's Box to Avoid
Teaser: Drs Steve Nissen and Peter Libby discuss the 'incidentaloma' effect and other concerns about using calcium scoring to assess whether a patient should take a statin.

Headlines: First Emergency Antidote to 5-FU Chemo in the US
Teaser: This first-of-its-kind product is an emergency antidote for use in cases of unintended overdose or severe adverse reaction to 5-fluorouracil (5-FU).

Headlines: ASH 2015: For Lymphoma, CLL, the Action Is in Combinations
Teaser: Dr Bruce Cheson previews data to be presented at the upcoming ASH 2015 meeting, the most exciting of which are from studies using combination drugs.

Headlines: Vascular Disease Wake-up Call From AHA President Mark Creager
Teaser: Drs Mark Creager and Ileana Piña discuss the importance of addressing vascular health among primary care physicians and their patients, and blood pressure management in light of the SPRINT trial.

Headlines: Opioids for Chronic Pain: Yes or No?
Teaser: From San Francisco, a neurologist and a rheumatologist debate whether or not opioids belong in the management of chronic, noncancer pain.

Headlines: EMPA-REG, PCSK9s, and the Future of Clinical Trials
Teaser: Dr Michelle O'Donoghue interviews Dr Marc Sabatine about the EMPA-REG OUTCOME trial from AHA, the latest on PSCK9 inhibitors, and how clinical trials will be conducted in the future.

Headlines: No Such Thing as Work-Life Balance
Teaser: Three young oncologists from different specialties and practice settings see the elusive work/life balance as less important as work/life choices when aiming for a gratifying life and career.

Headlines: In Lymphoma, Chemo Challenged by New Classes, New Combinations
Teaser: Drs Cheson and Flinn discuss lymphoma clinical trial data presented at the ASH 2015 meeting.

Headlines: IRIS Registry Combs Big Data for Cataract Surgery Outcomes
Teaser: Data from the IRIS Registry has determined the rate of endophthalmitis after cataract surgery to be lower than reported rates from other US data sets.

Headlines: Mandrola's Top 10 Cardiology Stories 2015
Teaser: In what is becoming an annual tradition, Dr John Mandrola reviews his top 10 stories of 2015 in the field of cardiovascular medicine.

Headlines: VTE a Chronic Illness Requiring Long-term Anticoagulation?
Teaser: Two analyses support long-term anticoagulation in patients with VTE. Dr Goldhaber expects the benefits to outweigh the risks in the NOAC era.

Headlines: Cut Clinical Trial Costs the Smart Way
Teaser: Dr Daniel Sargent reports that 40% of the costs of clinical trials go to monitoring data, much of which are irrelevant. By revamping monitoring practices, trial costs can be cut substantially.

Headlines: Cardiology 2015: The Year in Review
Teaser: Drs Harrington and Gibson give their annual review of the highs and lows in medicine with a focus on cardiology.

Headlines: CML Takeaways From ASH 2015: Discontinuing TKIs
Teaser: Live from the ASH meeting floor, Dr Jerald Radich discussed his thoughts on therapy discontinuation for CML patients.

Headlines: After Metformin, What Comes Next? Empagliflozin?
Teaser: Are we any closer to answering the question of what drug should be added when metformin monotherapy needs a boost? Two studies shed some light.

Headlines: Hospital Medicine: 2015 Clinical and Practice Changers
Teaser: What were the biggest stories in hospital medicine in 2015?

Headlines: Myeloma Takeaways From ASH 2015: New Drugs, Regimens
Teaser: Dr Saad Usmani highlights the key takeaways on newly diagnosed and relapsed/refractory myeloma from the 57th American Society of Hematology Annual Meeting.

Headlines: 2015's Unmissable Moments for Primary Care
Teaser: Some of the biggest problems faced by primary care providers in 2015 remain unresolved at year's end.

Headlines: Will 'Value Vehicle' Drive Cancer Costs Down?
Teaser: Drs Lowell Schnipper and John Marshall kick the tires of ASCO's 'value vehicle' and assess public response to its 60-day test drive, as part of the 2015 Ruesch Symposium.

Headlines: A New, Effective Approach to Giant Cell Arteritis
Teaser: Two recent studies offer encouraging results in treating giant cell arteritis.

Headlines: Ebola-Related Uveitis: Treat One, Treat Many
Teaser: Emory University ophthalmologists treated Dr Ian Crozier's eye complications related to the Ebola virus and then took what they learned to West Africa to save the sight of many Ebola survivors.

Headlines: The Evidence for Early Palliative Care in Cancer Patients
Teaser: An increasing body of evidence supports the early introduction of palliative care for cancer patients, as well patient education on the topic.

Headlines: Does 'Right to Try' New Drugs Really Mean 'Right to Beg?'
Teaser: Many states have passed 'Right-to-Try' laws, but do they cause more harm than good? Dr Art Caplan discusses this debatable legislation.

Headlines: San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium (SABCS) 2015
Teaser: Read clinically focused news coverage of key developments from SABCS 2015.

Headlines: The Hepatitis C Revolution Part 2
Teaser: What additional treatment strategies may be employed in difficult-to-treat hepatitis C patients?

Headlines: Mobile Data and the 'Holy Grail' in Obesity Research
Teaser: Eric Topol interviews Donna Spruijt-Metz on how mobile sensors can be used to both understand childhood obesity and change eating behavior.

Headlines: Clinical Trial Enrollment: The United States Needs to Do Better
Teaser: Dr Ileana Piña talks about the frustration with poor enrollment in clinical trials in the United States and what can be done to improve it.

Headlines: Will PCORnet Save US Clinical Research?
Teaser: Drs Harrington and Hernandez discuss the inefficiencies of the US clinical trial system and their involvement in the National Patient-Centered Clinical Research Network's first trial on aspirin dose.

Headlines: Treating Flu: 2015-2016 Antiviral Recommendations
Teaser: CDC updates recommendations for use of available antiviral drugs in the treatment of influenza.

Headlines: Tea Tree Oil for Head Lice
Teaser: What is the evidence that tea tree oil can prevent or treat head lice?

Headlines: Mandelbaum on Grafts, Biologics, and Rehab in ACL Repair
Teaser: In the second of two columns on ACL reconstruction, an eminent surgeon discusses the latest thinking on the use of grafts, biologics, and rehab programs in hastening an athlete's return to play.

Headlines: The Distinct Profile of Lung Cancer in Young Patients
Teaser: Do young patients with lung cancer represent a distinct patient subgroup? Dr Jack West comments on a new study exploring this question.

Headlines: Bodily Distress Syndrome: A New Diagnosis in Primary Care?
Teaser: The authors discuss a new diagnostic category of bodily distress syndrome, which offers a clinically useful, evidence-based path for categorizing patients with functional disorders.

Headlines: Recommendations for Improving the HIV Care Continuum
Teaser: Dr Benjamin Young discusses using currently available treatments and techniques to end the AIDS epidemic.

Headlines: SPRINT: What Does It Mean for Blood Pressure Management?
Teaser: Dr Amy Pollak talks to Dr William Haley of the Mayo Clinic about how to interpret the results from the SPRINT trial and why practitioners should stay tuned for further results.

Headlines: High-Dose Laquinimod Dropped Due to Cardiac Issues in MS
Teaser: Teva has discontinued development of the 1.2-mg and 1.5-mg doses because of eight cardiovascular events in two clinical trials. Investigation with the 0.6-mg dose continues.

Headlines: 'Liquid Biopsy' May Help Guide Treatment in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Single CTC morphology, protein, and genomic characterization are feasible and can be used to assess tumor heterogeneity and potentially guide treatment decisions.

Headlines: Which Kidney Cancer Drug on Progression? Surprising Answers
Teaser: Although cabozantinib has shown the best progression-free survival ever seen, nivolumab improves overall survival and has fewer adverse events.

Headlines: Aspirin and Reduced Risk of Dying From Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Men who take aspirin regularly might have a lower risk of dying from prostate cancer, but aspirin use did not affect the overall incidence of prostate cancer.

Headlines: FDA Reclassifies Vaginal Mesh as a High-Risk Device
Teaser: Already hounded by numerous lawsuits over adverse events, manufacturers have 30 months to prove the safety and effectiveness of these devices for transvaginal repair of pelvic organ prolapse.

Headlines: Filter Mask Might Lessen Diesel-Fume Cardiotoxicity in HF
Teaser: "This trial is the first to show that a filter can reduce both endothelial dysfunction and BNP increases in patients with heart failure during     diesel-exhaust exposure," according to researchers.

Headlines: At Last, Generics for Multiple Sclerosis
Teaser: Dr Jeffrey Cohen discusses results of the GATE Trial, the first phase 3 study of a generic multiple sclerosis disease therapy.

Headlines: Should Dentists Screen Patients for Diabetes?
Teaser: Some people are more likely to see a dentist than a medical provider. With rising rates of prediabetes and type 2 diabetes, Eric Stoopler argues that the dental office is a good place to screen for high blood glucose.

Headlines: Are Dogs an Anxious Child's Best Friend?
Teaser: A pet dog is not a magic bullet for a child's mental health, but early results are promising enough to warrant more study.

Headlines: NAFLD and GUT: An Intriguing Association
Teaser: This case illustrates how metabolic factors and intestinal permeability can be the keys to reversing fatty liver disease.

Headlines: The Impact of Age in Hypertension Care
Teaser: Dr Henry Black sits down with Dr Joseph Izzo to talk about how old is old when it comes to controlling blood pressure, and other controversies in the evaluation and treatment of hypertension.

Headlines: From Bedside to Bench: A New Direction in Breast Cancer Research
Teaser: Past AACR president Dr Carlos Arteaga describes translational studies and emerging therapies that are transforming the clinical practice of breast cancer.

Headlines: From Aedes to Zika: Mosquito-borne Viruses a Growing Concern
Teaser: Chikungunya, dengue, and now Zika viruses pose significant risks to travelers' health, with little defense except mosquito-control measures.

Headlines: Treating High-Need People With Multiple Chronic Diseases
Teaser: This systematic review looked at different models of care to determine which are most effective for people with multiple chronic conditions and high health-care use.

Headlines: Primary Persistent AF: A Distinct Arrhythmia Subentity
Teaser: This study provides new information on a distinct subentity of primary persistent AF. What are its distinguishing characteristics and clinical implications?

Headlines: Combining Radiation With Targeted and Immunotherapy
Teaser: Targeted therapies and immunotherapies have quickly become fixtures in the treatment armamentarium for metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

Headlines: The Best of Retina
Teaser: From anti-VEGF agents to emerging therapies for proliferative vitreoretinopathy, some of the best presentations in retina from this year's American Academy of Ophthalmology meeting are reviewed.

Source: Current Opinion in Nephrology and Hypertension
Headlines: Nutrition, Vitamin D, and Health Outcomes in Hemodialysis
Teaser: What kind of impact do nutritional protein supplements have on dialysis patients?

Headlines: Celiac Disease Risk in Relatives of Patients With the Disease
Teaser: Are first- and second-degree relatives of patients with celiac disease at an increased risk for developing the disease?

Headlines: Febuxostat for Slowing GFR Decline in CKD With Hyperuricemia
Teaser: The xanthine oxidase inhibitor febuxostat was shown to be effective in reducing the rate of GFR decline in patients with CKD and asymptomatic hyperuricemia.

Source: Journal of the International Association of Providers of AIDS Care
Headlines: IAPAC Guidelines for Optimizing the HIV Care Continuum
Teaser: Barriers across the HIV care continuum prevent people living with HIV from achieving the therapeutic and preventive effects of ART. Read about the interventions that could optimize HIV care.

Headlines: NT-proBNP and Cardiac Troponin T for CVD Risk Assessment
Teaser: This study evaluated the utility of cardiac markers NT-proBNP and TnT as predictors of incident CHD and CVD, independent of established risk factors and ethnicity.

Headlines: Tuberculosis Contact Investigations -- US, 2003-2012
Teaser: Enhancing contact investigation activities is essential to achieve the goal of TB elimination. Are contact investigations in the United States achieving their full potential?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Complete Versus Lesion-Only Primary PCI
Teaser: This study sought to determine whether complete revascularization was associated with increased total infarct size compared with an infarct-related artery-only strategy.

Headlines: Acute Kidney Injury Predicts Adverse Outcomes in Diabetes
Teaser: Acute kidney injury, albuminuria, and low eGFR may be prognostic indicators of major adverse events in patients with diabetes.

Headlines: Genetic Predisposition to Weight Loss and Regain
Teaser: This report provides some insights into the genetics of weight loss and unintentional weight regain.

Headlines: Patterns of Domestic Violence and Alcohol Use in Women
Teaser: What is the connection between alcohol consumption among women and patterns of domestic violence, and how could a brief intervention help?

Headlines: Proliferative Diabetic Retinopathy: New Data
Teaser: The first large, prospective trial directly comparing panretinal photocoagulation with anti-VEGF treatment in this population may point to new treatment strategies.

Headlines: Talactoferrin in Severe Sepsis
Teaser: The administration of oral talactoferrin was explored as a therapeutic approach for severe sepsis-- but data shows that perhaps there is more harm than benefit.

Headlines: Naltrexone for Crohn Disease
Teaser: Is the use of low-dose naltrexone effective in the treatment of Crohn disease?

Headlines: The Best of 2015's Pediatric Viewpoints
Teaser: Dr William Basco summarizes the most widely read pediatric viewpoints of 2015. Did you miss any of these?

Headlines: Impact of Rheumatic Disease and Biologics in Plastic Surgery
Teaser: Find out the best ways to ensure optimal perioperative management of rheumatic patients receiving biologic therapy.

Headlines: Timing in Neurorehabilitation: Motor Therapy After Stroke
Teaser: What's the optimal schedule and dosage for motor rehabilitation after stroke? And what factors impact these parameters in the individual patient?

Headlines: Overview of NCI Precision Medicine Trials--NCI MATCH and MPACT
Teaser: Get a detailed view of the Precision Medicine Initiative, a top priority for the National Cancer Institute.

Headlines: Arteriovenous Fistula as an Intervention in Advanced CKD
Teaser: Could the arteriovenous fistula play a therapeutic role in patients with advanced CKD?

Headlines: Folic Acid and Creatine to Lower Blood Arsenic
Teaser: This study suggests that nutritional supplementation can present a low-risk and low-cost treatment option to limit arsenic toxicity in arsenic-exposed populations.

Headlines: Empagliflozin/Linagliptin Single-Tablet Combination
Teaser: Review the clinical application and safety profile of a new therapeutic option for patients with type 2 diabetes: a once-daily, single-tablet combination SGLT2/ DPP-4 inhibitor.

Headlines: Who Should Receive Statin Treatment?
Teaser: How do we decide who to treat or not treat with statins? The author argues that guidelines should include the number-needed-to-treat as a means of aiding the clinical decision.

Headlines: Screening for Thymic and Bronchial Carcinoid Tumors in MEN1
Teaser: Find out what the available evidence tell us about screening for thymic and bronchial carcinoid tumors in patients with MEN1.

Headlines: Potential Mechanisms of Rifaximin in the Management IBD
Teaser: How effective is the antibiotic, rifaximin, in the treatment of different inflammatory bowel diseases?

Headlines: Attributes Associated With Initiating Hepatitis C Treatment
Teaser: What particular attributes do patients keep in mind when considering decisions about hepatitis C treatment?

Headlines: Will Gene Editing Be in Your Medical Future?
Teaser: Researchers have great hope for curing diseases by altering a patient's DNA. But this cutting-edge technology has invited controversy--and still has a long road to travel, experts say.

Headlines: Acquired Resistance in EGFR NSCLC: The Role of Repeat Biopsy
Teaser: Dr H. Jack West discusses new treatment options for EGFR-positive non-small cell lung cancer, including the emerging role of repeat biopsies among patients with acquired resistance.

Headlines: European Commission Pushes for More Reliable mHealth Apps
Teaser: In the US, the FDA evaluates some apps; an NIH-funded study will look at use of mobile health apps in clinical trials.

Headlines: Medical, Behavioral Intervention Improves Arthritis Care
Teaser: A low-intensity combined osteoarthritis patient and provider intervention modestly improved self-reported functional outcome.

Headlines: Journal Editors Say Authors Must Share Clinical Trial Data
Teaser: The proposal calls for access to deidentified patient-level data within 6 months. Such access is an "ethical obligation," the editors say, because study participants have put themselves at risk.

Headlines: FDA Fails to Track Postmarket Drug Studies Sufficiently: GAO
Teaser: Drugs that get expedited approval go on market without strong evidence of effectiveness or safety, but the FDA does not keep good track of required studies, the GAO said.

Headlines: CMV Retinitis After Ruxolitinib Treatment: Case Report
Teaser: Patients treated with ruxolitinib should report any symptoms of reduced or disturbed vision and undergo ophthalmologic examination, say the authors of the case report.

Headlines: Possible Statin Link to Sleep Apnea's Greater CV Risk Observed
Teaser: Statins may block one of the mechanisms behind the vascular proinflammatory effect of obstructive sleep apnea, proposed researchers based their in vitro     preliminary study.

Headlines: Cocaine Kills Brain Cells, but New Agents May Reverse Damage
Teaser: Cocaine induces out-of-control autophagy, and an inhibitor shows promise in thwarting the damage.

Headlines: Stem Cell Transplants Promising in ALS
Teaser: Preliminary results of a small open-label trial show 87% of patients with 6 months of follow-up were responders.

Headlines: Cure for Mantle Cell Lymphoma Within Reach, Says Expert
Teaser: A better understanding of the biology of mantle cell lymphoma and improved treatments in the past 2 decades make a cure for this disease a definite possibility, say leaders in the field.

Headlines: FDA Declines Approval for Drisapersen in DMD
Teaser: The agency concluded that substantial evidence for effectiveness of drisapersen has not been shown, BioMarin announced.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Assessing EM Patient Safety and QI Milestones Using Debates
Teaser: Find out more about 'EM Debates' -- and learn about the promising role they could play in educating EM residents on patient safety issues and quality improvement.

Headlines: Jan 29 Cardiology News
Teaser: A draft proposal for data sharing, women and AF, an ICD lead recall, vasovagal syncope, and prediabetes are discussed by Dr John Mandrola in this week's podcast.

Headlines: Mixed Rotavirus Vaccine Series Safe and Immunogenic
Teaser: Rotavirus vaccination series using either a single vaccine or a combination of the approved vaccines was equally safe and immunogenic.

Headlines: Questions About Protocol After Death in French Trial
Teaser: New disclosures about the phase 1 protocol show European regulations for first-in-human studies may not have been followed.

Headlines: EU Panel Likes Elotuzumab, New Approach for Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The drug is the first immune-based therapy for patients who progress after initial treatment.

Headlines: FDA OKs Zepatier (Elbasvir/Grazoprevir) for Hepatitis C
Teaser: Patients with HVC genotypes 1 gain another cure that does not require concomitant use of interferon. Zepatier can be prescribed with or without ribavirin.

Headlines: Anti-VEGF Therapy for Persistent Diabetic Macular Edema
Teaser: In patients with persistent diabetic macular edema (DME), there may be long-term benefits to be gained from continuing with anti-vascular endothelial growth factor (anti-VEGF) therapy, according to a post hoc analysis of a Diabetic Retinopathy Clinical Research (DRCR) Network trial.

Headlines: Lessons From Genetic Testing in Pediatric Cancers
Teaser: Two studies of gene testing in children and adolescents with cancer that looked for germline and actionable genes provide important lessons for clinical care.

Headlines: Shooting for the Moon: The New Cancer Space Race
Teaser: A private initiative, overshadowed by President Obama's call for action on cancer, has an ambitious plan to put 20,000 patients into clinical trials by 2020.

Headlines: Top US Cancer Centers Call for Greater Uptake of HPV Vaccine
Teaser: NCI-designated cancer centers in the United States have issued a call to action to improve uptake of the human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine across the country in both males and females.

Headlines: Brain BDNF Expression May Explain Cognitive Reserve
Teaser: Boosting BDNF gene expression might be a good therapeutic strategy to prevent Alzheimer's disease, researchers speculate.

Headlines: U.S. Senator Markey Places Hold on Obama's Nominee to Lead FDA
Teaser: Democratic U.S. Senator Edward Markey of Massachusetts said on Monday he has placed a hold on President Barack Obama's nominee to head the Food and Drug Administration until the agency agrees to reform its process for approving opioid painkillers.

Headlines: Depressive Symptoms in Youth With Type 1 or Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: A study finds that symptoms of depression are common among adolescents with diabetes, highlighting the need for routine depression screening in this population.

Headlines: Mortality and Drug Therapy in Patients With COPD
Teaser: Find out how different pharmacological COPD treatments impact overall survival. Which ones were shown to reduce mortality?

Headlines: Physical Activity for Good Spinal Control With Pain or Not
Teaser: What is the relationship between physical fitness, spinal control, and low back pain? This study examines the connection.

Headlines: Polymorphisms Associated With Periodontitis in T2DM
Teaser: Do interleukin genotypes and differences in oral microbiota play a role in chronic periodontitis in patients with type 2 diabetes?

Headlines: Aripiprazole vs Risperidone for First-Episode Schizophrenia
Teaser: Which antipsychotic should be tried first in a patient newly diagnosed with schizophrenia? This study compared the effectiveness and side effects of two commonly used first-line drugs.

Headlines: Opt-Out Screening Can Improve Acceptance of HIV Testing
Teaser: How providers offer patients an HIV test significantly affects the likelihood of them accepting tests, according to a new study.

Headlines: Association of Male Circumcision With Prostate Cancer Risk
Teaser: Is there a link between circumcision and the risk of developing prostate cancer? A new study explores the possible connection.

Headlines: Skip Step 2, Use Low-Dose Morphine for Moderate Cancer Pain
Teaser: The WHO three-step analgesic ladder should be switched to a two-step approach that bypasses weak opioids and goes straight to low-dose morphine for moderate cancer pain, Italian researchers suggest.

Headlines: Big Pharma Pledges to Develop New Antibiotics, With Help
Teaser: Global drug companies call on governments around the world to develop novel economic models to support development of new antibiotics.

Headlines: Eating Berries 'May Prevent Erectile Dysfunction'
Teaser: Eating berries and citrus fruit may reduce the risk of men developing problems getting and maintaining an erection.

Headlines: High ApoB in Young Adults Seen to Predict Later Subclinical CAD
Teaser: Should apolipoprotein B be added to traditional lipid panels? The biomarker may best LDL and non-HDL cholesterol in predicting coronary calcification in middle age, suggests the CARDIA cohort study.

Headlines: Suicide and Eating Disorders: New Data
Teaser: Suicide risk is elevated in persons with eating disorders, but new data show other factors have a strong influence.

Headlines: FDA Panel Gives Cautious Thumbs Up to Opioid Delivery System
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee recommends approval of implant that promises to reduce problem of diversion and abuse.

Headlines: Frozen, Thawed Fecal Microbiota Effective for C difficile
Teaser: Frozen and thawed fecal microbiota transplantation successfully treats Clostridium difficile infections.

Headlines: Eating Potatoes Before Pregnancy Linked to Gestational Diabetes
Teaser: A study suggests that eating potatoes before pregnancy may increase the risk of gestational diabetes; substituting vegetables, legumes, or whole grains for     potatoes may reduce this risk.

Headlines: 'Bipolar' Therapy: New Twist in Advanced Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Challenging current notions, exposing prostate cancer cells alternately to very high and very low levels of testosterone may have clinical benefit and improve quality of life.

Headlines: Risk-Based Tops 'Trial-Based' Primary Statin Therapy in Study
Teaser: That question again: Who should get statins for primary prevention? A analysis supports the controversial ACC/AHA risk-based guidelines, rather than an approach taken directly from the clinical trial experience.

Headlines: Acute Hyperglycemia Affects Remote Ischemic Perconditioning
Teaser: Gain a better understanding of how acute hyperglycemia impacts the cardioprotective effects of remote ischemic preconditioning.

Headlines: New Definition of Status Epilepticus
Teaser: The clarified definition, proposed by an International League Against Epilepsy task force, includes direction on when to treat and when injury might occur.

Headlines: Less Bleeding on Rivaroxaban for AF if Fewer Concomitant Meds
Teaser: Taking five or more meds is common in patients with AF, but for those taking fewer than that, the risk of bleeding was lower with rivaroxaban than with warfarin, in  a  new analysis of ROCKET-AF.

Headlines: Scrambler Therapy Benefit in Cancer-Related Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: Noninvasive scrambler therapy is emerging as a potential option for the treatment of cancer-related neuropathic pain, although uptake remains limited in the absence of major clinical trials.

Headlines: Recro Pharma's Lead Painkiller Succeeds in Mid-Stage Trial
Teaser: Recro Pharma Inc said its lead painkiller reduced pain in post-operative orthopedic surgery patients and was safe and well tolerated, in a mid-stage trial.

Headlines: Transdermal Estradiol Suppresses Testosterone While Sparing Bone in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Transdermal estradiol suppresses testosterone levels while reducing bone mineral density (BMD) loss, compared with luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone agonists (LHRHa), in men with advanced prostate cancer, researchers from the U.K. report.

Headlines: Why Are Cancer Patients Not Enrolling in Clinical Trials?
Teaser: A video tailored to individual patients may improve patient knowledge and decision making about entering clinical trials, but  financial worries are a major issue.

Headlines: After Great Pain, a Cold Cap for Chemo Hair Loss Came
Teaser: Refrigeration expertise and anguish from the adverse effects of breast cancer chemotherapy came together in a British family, and gave rise to technologic innovation.

Headlines: Many Women Overtreated With Osteoporosis Medication
Teaser: The majority of women taking medication for osteoporosis did not have it at a main site, and half of these women lacked any risk factors for the disease.

Headlines: Limits of Gene Variants as Biomarkers Aired in Cohort Study
Teaser: Carriers of two rare high-risk ion-channel gene variants in a cohort study didn't have more arrhythmias. But when patients hear they have one of the     variants, "what do people do with that information?"

Headlines: High-Dose Vitamin D Doesn't Improve Glycemic Parameters
Teaser: A small randomized trial finds no glycemic benefit for 8 weeks of high-dose vitamin D treatment in patients with prediabetes or mild type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: Prenatal Vitamin D Has a Weak Effect on Wheezing
Teaser: Women did not significantly reduce the risk of wheezing in their children by taking vitamin D during their pregnancies in two new studies, but they did reduce the risk for some other lung problems.

Headlines: TTFields Plus Chemo Shows Benefit in Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: A device that delivers tumor-treating fields (TTFields), recently approved for use in glioblastoma, is now showing benefit in advanced pancreatic cancer.

Headlines: NEJM Editor Backtracks on Data-Sharing 'Parasites' Editorial
Teaser: Jeffrey Drazen. MD, restated that NEJM supports the ICMJE proposals after backlash to his original editorial, which suggested data sharing would draw 'parasites.' Some say wider access still needed.

Headlines: After Dust Settles, Mixed Reaction to New US Dietary Guidelines
Teaser: Response to the new 2015-2020 Dietary Guidelines for Americans ranged from neutral to supportive to harsh critique; now that docs have had time to digest     the impact, Medscape gauged reactions.

Headlines: FDA Panel Considers Allergen Immunotherapy Development
Teaser: An FDA panel met to discuss issues around the clinical development of allergen immunotherapy products.

Headlines: Reporting of Mortality After Breast Cancer Radiotherapy Differs Greatly
Teaser: Mortality rates after breast cancer radiotherapy differ strikingly between clinical trial reports and observational data, researchers report.

Headlines: No Difference by Race in Recurrent Stroke Risk
Teaser: The increased risk for a first stroke seen in the young black population seems to disappear when it comes to second strokes, new REGARDS data suggest.

Headlines: Lowering Dietary Glycemic Index Reduces Plasma Uric Acid
Teaser: A diet with a low glycemic index was more effective than a low-carbohydrate diet for reducing uric acid concentrations and should be studied for preventing gout or gout flares, researchers said.

Headlines: One Death, Three Serious Brain Injuries in Phase 1 Trial
Teaser: One man is brain dead and three other previously healthy volunteers were seriously injured in a phase 1 drug trial as French authorities investigate what went wrong.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Making Sense of Statistics in Clinical Trial Reports
Teaser: Review the essentials of statistical analysis and key aspects of the reporting of RCTs in this primer, the first of a 4-part series.

Headlines: Tavaborole 5% Solution for Toenail Onychomycosis
Teaser: The first antifungal in a boron-containing class of drugs with a novel mechanism of action, tavaborole is able to penetrate the nail plate more effectively than other topical agents.

Headlines: Single-Dose Fosaprepitant for the Prevention of CINV
Teaser: What is the role of neurokinin-1 receptor antagonists in nonanthracycline and cyclophosphamide-based moderately emetogenic chemotherapy regimens?

Headlines: Pharmacologic Management of Acute and Chronic Panic Disorder
Teaser: What are the most effective treatment modalities for panic disorder? Explore the various options in this review.

Headlines: Ulnar Artery Interventions Non-Inferior to Radial Approach
Teaser: Is transulnar access a viable alternative to transradial access in a forearm approach to percutaneous coronary procedures?

Headlines: Timing of Intubation and Clinical Outcomes Adults With ARDS
Teaser: When should adult patients with ARDS be intubated? Does timing potentially impact outcomes in these patients?

Headlines: Sevoflurane Versus Propofol During Cardiac Surgery
Teaser: Does sevoflurane or propofol exhibit more favorable cardioprotective effects during cardiac surgery?

Headlines: Screening of Diabetics for NAFLD and Advanced Fibrosis
Teaser: What types of non-invasive screening methods are available for NAFLD and liver fibrosis in diabetic patients, and how safe and effective are they?

Headlines: Clinical Practice Guidelines for Lung Cancer Screening
Teaser: Lung cancer screening with low-dose CT remains the subject of controversy. What do current guidelines recommend?

Headlines: High Visceral Fat Area and the Risk of Vitamin D Deficiency
Teaser: Is there a link between visceral fat area and vitamin D status? A new study explores the possible connection.

Headlines: Triferic Via the Dialysate in Chronic Hemodialysis Patients
Teaser: Triferic administered via dialysate may be effective for delivering iron and maintaining hemoglobin in hemodialysis patients, a new study reports.

Source: Seminars in Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine
Headlines: Trends in the Evaluation, Management of Agitation in the ICU
Teaser: To sedate or not to sedate? A new study examines the sedation practice patterns for agitation in the ICU.

Source: International Journal for Quality in Health Care
Headlines: An Early Warning for Cardiac Arrest During Laparoscopic Surgery
Teaser: Cardiac arrest is a rare, but serious complication of laparoscopic surgery, even in healthy and fit patients. Might bradycardia be a potential red flag?

Headlines: Pathologic Complete Response as Surrogate End Point for Breast Cancer
Teaser: How valid is pathologic complete response as a surrogate marker in breast cancer research trials?

Headlines: Herbal Medicine for Low Back Pain: A Cochrane Review
Teaser: Are herbal medicines a safe and effective option for sufferers of chronic low back pain?

Headlines: Natural Antioxidants for Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease
Teaser: What does the latest research tell us about the potential for natural antioxidants to help in the treatment of NAFLD?

Headlines: Nonhormonal Management of Vasomotor Symptoms of Menopause
Teaser: What are the most common and effective ways of managing the vasomotor symptoms of menopause without the use of hormones?

Headlines: Hepatitis B: 50 Years After the Discovery of Australia Antigen
Teaser: Read this new article to get a further understanding of the changes in the management of hepatitis B 50 years after the discovery of Australia antigen.

Headlines: Weight Loss and Hormones After Menopause: SHAPE-2 Trial
Teaser: Research finds that weight loss has a favorable effect on testosterone and estradiol levels in postmenopausal women.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Cost-Effective Strategies for Stroke Reduction in AF
Teaser: Although both non-warfarin oral anticoagulants and percutaneous LAAC are initially more costly than warfarin for stroke prophylaxis in patients with AF, might they save cost over the long-term?

Headlines: Oxybutynin As a Treatment for Generalized Hyperhidrosis
Teaser: Is the anticholinergic drug oxybutynin effective in reducing symptoms of hyperhidrosis?

Headlines: Comparing Two Lumbar Total Disc Replacements
Teaser: The use of these two metal-on-metal implants for lumbar total disc replacement yielded comparable outcomes at five years, according to a new study.

Headlines: Liver Toxicity in HIV/HCV Patients Receiving Etravirine
Teaser: Do HIV/HCV coinfected patients receiving etravirine have an increased risk of liver toxicity?

Headlines: Optimizing Response to Anti-TNF Therapy in Crohn's Disease
Teaser: How can clinicians best predict and optimize anti-TNF treatment for their patients with Crohn's disease?

Headlines: Hospitalists Around the World
Teaser: Hospitalist programs are expanding world-wide, but models of care may be very different than those in the US.

Headlines: Endodontic Flare-ups and Their Relationship to Risk Factors
Teaser: Are there specific risk factors that might help determine likelihood of flare-ups after root-canal treatment?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Computerized Cognitive Training: Beneficial for Older Adults
Teaser: Do computerized "brain training" products work to stave off dementia? The authors of this commentary believe in their potential--once you get beyond the marketing and the hype.

Headlines: ORBIT: A Simple Bedside Score to Assess Bleeding Risk in AF
Teaser: The authors present a novel bleeding risk score using routinely available clinical information to predict major bleeding in patients with atrial fibrillation.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Statistical Controversies in Reporting of Clinical Trials
Teaser: This paper discuss several controversial statistical issues that are commonly faced in the presentation and interpretation of clinical trial findings.

Headlines: Risk of Gastric Cancer, Gastrointestinal Cancers and Other Cancers
Teaser: Are patients taking proton pump inhibitors at an increased risk for developing gastrointestinal cancers?

Headlines: Characteristics, Disease Burden and Costs of COPD
Teaser: A new study looks at the symptomatic burden and disease management costs among primary care COPD patients initiating long-acting bronchodilator therapy.

Headlines: Effect of Testosterone Therapy on Cardiac Biomarkers in T2D
Teaser: In what ways does testosterone therapy impact cardiac biomarkers in men with T2D at high risk of cardiovascular events?

Headlines: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis: Review
Teaser: The clinical diagnosis of ALS remains challenging, and while treatment options have expanded in recent years, prognosis is still grim. What's the current state of research?

Headlines: Coenzyme Q-10 in Human Health: Supporting Evidence?
Teaser: CoQ10 is a widely used dietary supplement, especially for cardiovascular conditions. Is there evidence to support claims of its therapeutic benefit?

Headlines: Mitochondria: A New Therapeutic Target in CKD
Teaser: Learn more about the role of mitochondria in the development of CKD -- and its potential as a pharmacological target.

Headlines: Musculoskeletal Injections in Primary Care
Teaser: This illustrated, step-by-step guide provides instructions and rationale for joint injections that can be administered in the primary care setting.

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: HIV Care Provider Attitudes Regarding Prescribing PrEP
Teaser: Which HIV providers are more likely to prescribe PrEP?

Headlines: Cigna, Aetna Announce 'Pay-for-Performance' Entresto Contracts
Teaser: The insurers have contracted with Novartis in an agreement that will depend on how well the heart-failure drug improves patient health, including hospitalizations.

Headlines: New EMA Advice for PML Prevention With Tysabri in MS
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency has released new recommendations on PML prevention with natalizumab in multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: A Man With Breast Cancer, Dr Bogler, Entered 'World of Pink'
Teaser: A male professor of neurosurgery is diagnosed with a disease identified with women. Many life changes follow.

Headlines: What's Hot at ISC 2016?
Teaser: After last year's landmark trials making endovascular therapy the standard of care, the stroke community meets in Los Angeles ahead of the Oscars for the International Stroke Conference 2016.

Headlines: Postdischarge Care Worse for MI Patients Sent to PCI Center
Teaser: "This article is showing us something we probably should have realized from the beginning," says an observer: MI patients transferred for PCI "probably have some special considerations when we send them home."

Headlines: Meniscus Surgery Criteria Called Into Question
Teaser: Catching and locking may not provide reliable indications that arthroscopic partial meniscectomy is warranted.

Headlines: FDA Places Clinical Hold on Pacritinib for Myelofibrosis
Teaser: In a clinical trial of the investigational agent, pacritinib-treated patients have died from intracranial hemorrhage, cardiac failure, and cardiac arrest.

Headlines: Age No Barrier to Gastric Bypass Surgery Survival Benefit
Teaser: A new study finds mortality benefit for adults aged 35 to 74 years who undergo gastric bypass, but not for women younger than 35.

Headlines: Similar Outcomes After VA vs Non-VA Admissions for MI, HF
Teaser: Although mortality and readmission rates were significantly different between the two hospital types, absolute differences were relatively small, say     experts, noting that the findings are "reassuring."

Headlines: Atrial-Flutter Ablation Complications Linked to Age, Case Volume
Teaser: "These results underscore the importance of having experienced high-volume centers," write the investigators, noting also the need for a multidisciplinary     approach and better training for supporting staff.

Headlines: Defibrotide's Promise in Rare but Fatal Syndrome Post HSCT
Teaser: Phase 3 data from a trial that used historical controls to assess safety and efficacy of defibrotide show that it confers survival benefits in patients with VOD and multiorgan failure after HSCT.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Vortioxetine for Cognitive Dysfunction in MDD
Teaser: Company successfully showed that the drug improves concentration and other cognitive deficits in patients with major depression, according to FDA advisory committee.

Headlines: Marijuana Use Impairs Verbal Memory
Teaser: Long-term marijuana use may significantly impair verbal memory by middle age, warn researchers, who found that other aspects of cognitive function were unaffected.

Headlines: Validity of Pivotal ROCKET AF Rivaroxaban Trial Questioned
Teaser: The BMJ alleges a faulty INR test likely made the novel oral anticoagulant's bleed risk seem better than was true in the stroke-prevention trial; researchers say the issue didn't affect the trial's main message.

Headlines: Antidepressants in Kids May Double Suicidality, Aggression Risk
Teaser: Antidepressant use in children and adolescents may double the risk for suicidality and aggression, results of a large, systematic review suggest.

Headlines: Early Data for Combo Immunotherapy in Lung Cancer
Teaser: Phase 1 results showed antitumor activity with a combination of investigational checkpoint inhibitors, but toxicity was 'substantial.'

Headlines: Therapy, Antidepressants Similarly Effective for Depression
Teaser: A new ACP guideline recommended that physicians discuss the benefits, potential adverse effects, and costs of both treatments with patients. The guideline also addressed problems with St John's wort.

Headlines: Effect of Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy on Mortality
Teaser: This study aimed to clarify the action and limitations of cardiac resynchronization therapy in relieving myocardial dysfunction.

Headlines: Diagnosis and/or Classification of Vasculitis: Different?
Teaser: Can we separate diagnostic and classification criteria for different forms of vasculitis?

Headlines: Effect of Augmenting Cholinergic Function on Gait and Balance
Teaser: Could augmenting the cholinergic system with a cholinesterase inhibitor improve balance and gait impairment in Parkinson disease?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Challenging Issues in Clinical Trial Design
Teaser: When should you stop a clinical trial early? When should a protocol be amended? These and other challenging issues in trial design are covered in this paper.

Headlines: Preventing Gestational Diabetes by Lifestyle Intervention
Teaser: High-risk pregnant women who participate in a moderate lifestyle intervention may reduce their risk of developing gestational diabetes, a new study reports.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Triple Rule Out vs CT Angiogram, Stress Test for Chest Pain
Teaser: How do these evaluation methods for the assessment of chest pain compare in terms of safety and effectiveness?

Headlines: Molecular Mechanism of Endothelial and Vascular Aging
Teaser: This review focuses on the latest advances in understanding age-related changes of the cardiovascular and cerebrovascular systems from a molecular perspective.

Headlines: Risk of Exacerbation in COPD
Teaser: The authors present a predictive model that can identify patients at high risk of acute exacerbation of COPD.

Headlines: New Drug Approvals and Extended Indications for Pediatrics
Teaser: Which drugs have been newly approved by the FDA for use in pediatric patients?

Headlines: Communication-Focused Therapy for Preschoolers With Autism
Teaser: A parent-mediated, communication-focused therapy for young children with autism may provide some symptom improvement--but is it cost effective over the long-term?

Headlines: Sanofi Launches Hunt for Zika Vaccine as Disease Fears Grow
Teaser: Sanofi has launched a project to develop a vaccine against the Zika virus in the most decisive commitment yet by a major vaccine producer to fight the disease linked to multiple birth defects in Brazil.

Headlines: Stroke of Undetermined Cause: Workup, Secondary Prevention
Teaser: The author presents a new concept of embolic stroke of undetermined source (ESUS), defined as patients with cryptogenic stroke and a high probability for a thromboembolic origin.

Headlines: Califf for Commish? Opposition Rocks Senate Confirmation Process
Teaser: Among the issues: Does Robert Califf's past work involving industry disqualify him for the top FDA post? Depends on who is asked; some say yes, and others say the relationships may be an asset.

Headlines: Frailty a Risk Factor for 1-Year Postoperative Mortality
Teaser: Frail patients aged 65 years and older undergoing major elective surgery had significantly increased risks for death within 1 year for 10 of 11 noncardiac procedures.

Headlines: COPD Drug Does Not Significantly Reduce Ventilator Time
Teaser: However, acetazolamide cut 16 hours off ventilator time, which is clinically important. It has been used for decades, but randomized controlled trial information has not been available until now.

Headlines: First Chemo 'Antidote' Cuts Deaths From 5-FU Toxicity
Teaser: The first and only approved antidote for severe toxicity related to a chemotherapy overdose dramatically reduces mortality.

Headlines: Meta-Analysis Confirms Benefit of Stent Retrievers in Stroke
Teaser: A new meta-analysis of the five recently published studies of stent retrievers in the acute treatment of ischemic stroke confirms that they are associated with a significant improvement of functional independence at 90 days.

Headlines: President Asks for $1 Billion for Cancer 'Moonshot' Funding
Teaser: Taking the cancer moonshot announcement to the next level, the White House is now requesting $1 billion to fund it.

Headlines: Lupus Raises Mortality by 67%; Young Adults at Highest Risk
Teaser: Patients with systemic lupus erythematosus frequently die of circulatory system disease or cancer, just like patients without lupus, but at younger ages, according to a new analysis.

Headlines: Entecavir for Treatment-naive Chronic HBV
Teaser: What does the latest research tell us about the safety and efficacy of the antiviral agent, entecavir, for the management of treatment-naive chronic HBV?

Headlines: Subsequent Lumbar Surgery After Disc Arthroplasty and Fusion
Teaser: A new study reports on the surgical complications and re-operation rates following these procedures for degenerative disc disease.

Headlines: Proton Beam in Medulloblastoma: 'New Benchmark'
Teaser: In children with medulloblastoma, proton-beam therapy has survival rates similar to standard radiotherapy, but fewer systemic toxicities.

Headlines: New Guidance: Bisphosphonate Holidays for Low-Risk Patients
Teaser: High-risk osteoporosis patients, however, are advised to continue therapy; discussion of the risks/benefits is encouraged.

Headlines: Immunotherapy Is ASCO's Advance of the Year
Teaser: The organization's annual report highlights clinical cancer advances that have been made in the past year, and says immunotherapy 'clearly stands out from the rest.'

Headlines: Expert: Induction Chemo Has 'No Role' in H&N Cancer
Teaser: A large new study adds to the evidence that for patients with advanced head and neck cancer, extensive chemotherapy long before radiation does not improve survival.

Headlines: Rapid Stroke Improvement Not Always a Ticket Home
Teaser: Nearly half of patients with rapid neurological improvement of stroke symptoms are not discharged, suggesting the need for close evaluation.

Headlines: US Senate Clears Way for Vote on Califf FDA Nomination
Teaser: Today's cloture vote on the confirmation process for Dr Robert Califf as FDA chief clears holds and a threatened filibuster, making way for a final vote scheduled for later this week.

Headlines: Two Thirds of Clinical Trials Unpublished 2 Years Later
Teaser: Leading academic research centers have done a poor and variable job of disseminating clinical trial results, according to a cross-sectional analysis.

Headlines: Monthly Vaginal Ring Moderately Reduces HIV Risk
Teaser: A vaginal ring inserted monthly helps prevent HIV transmission, two phase 3 sister studies of African women have shown.

Headlines: Hyperthyroidism Raises Breast Cancer Risk
Teaser: Women with hyperthyroidism have an increased risk of developing breast cancer, but hypothyroidism appears to protect against the         disease, new Danish registry data indicate.

Headlines: ASCO on Ovarian Suppression in Young Breast Cancer Patients
Teaser: The latest results on ovarian suppression in premenopausal women with breast cancer,  hailed as practice changing, have now been incorporated into clinical guidelines.

Headlines: Typical Therapies Not Tough Enough to Curb Digital Ulcers
Teaser: Physicians should use more aggressive therapy for patients with systemic sclerosis who are at high risk for digital ulcers, according to researchers who identified a predictor for this complication.

Headlines: 'Releasing the Dogs’ in the Body’s War on Cancer
Teaser: Drs Lou Weiner and Chris Heery vividly describe strategies that prompt the immune system to attack and kill cancer cells, and offer a view from the trenches of cancer immunotherapy.

Headlines: Ventricular Assist Devices Demystified
Teaser: Dr Jeevanandam, cardiothoracic surgeon and VAD expert, discusses low-pulsatility issues and where the field is going.

Headlines: Do We Need a Title IX for Clinical Trials?
Teaser: Women are still underrepresented in cardiovascular trials. Will we be able to adequately power such trials to address safety and efficacy in women and other underrepresented groups?

Headlines: Chemo Combos Hit Pancreatic Cancer With Both Barrels
Teaser: A range of therapeutic approaches are beginning to improve patient outcomes and change clinical practice in advanced pancreatic cancer, as reported by Dr Michael Pishvaian from GICS 2016.

Headlines: How Diet Influences Mental Health: New Findings, New Advances
Teaser: In the first installment of their new Medscape column Brain Food, Drs Ramsey and Deans highlight recent advances in understanding the link between diet and mental health.

Headlines: New Treatments, New Technologies in Parkinson Disease
Teaser: Dr Brian Fiske from the Michael J. Fox Foundation discusses recent developments in understanding, diagnosing, and treating Parkinson disease.

Headlines: REVOKE IV Iron or FIND-CKD Patients?
Teaser: Dr Jeffrey Berns discusses inconsistencies in the clinical trial evidence comparing intravenous iron with oral iron in patients with chronic kidney disease not on dialysis.

Headlines: Comparing First-Line TKI Options for EGFR-Positive NSCLC
Teaser: Are there clinically significant differences among first-line EGFR TKI options for EGFR mutation-positive NSCLC?

Headlines: Rivaroxaban: It's Not Time to Cut the Rope, Yet
Teaser: The warfarin arm of the ROCKET AF trial used a faulty INR device, leading to calls for independent verification of the study. Dr Mandrola     agrees but is reassured by the real-world data on rivaroxaban.

Headlines: Ceftolozane/ Tazobactam for Pseudomonas aeruginosa Infections
Teaser: The days of quick antibiotic prescribing are over, and experts say a team approach is ideal for optimal use of new antimicrobial agents, such as ceftolozane/tazobactam.

Headlines: More Magnesium, More Benefit in Prediabetes?
Teaser: Is supplemental magnesium beneficial for patients with prediabetes?

Headlines: Surveying the Latest Findings in Inflammatory Bowel Disease
Teaser: Dr Stephen Hanauer discusses recent advances in the causation, management, and treatment of ulcerative colitis and Crohn disease.

Headlines: A Return to Specific LDL-Cholesterol Goals
Teaser: Dr Thomas Allison sits down with Dr Francisco Lopez-Jimenez and Dr Steven Kopecky to talk about the use of LDL-C goals, and their approach to cholesterol management following the IMPROVE-IT trial.

Headlines: CRC Builds Up STEAM in Midst of Blizzard
Teaser: After digging out from a blizzard, Dr John Marshall discusses highlights from GICS 2016, including molecular testing, new drugs, and key studies results, plus the STEAM trial in colorectal cancer.

Headlines: To Believe in Science Is to Believe in Data Sharing
Teaser: A proposal to require access to patient-level data from clinical trials has investigators in a tizzy, but like drug testing in sports, it could help     restore faith in scientific research.

Headlines: Benefits of Additional Chemo in Residual Breast Cancer
Teaser: Drs Kathy Miller and Bryan Schneider discuss the surprising CREATE-X findings, which show improved survival using more chemotherapy in triple-negative breast cancer patients with residual disease.

Headlines: Generic vs Brand-Name Epilepsy Drugs
Teaser: Dr Ting talks with Dr Wilner about the results of her study on the bioequivalence of generic and brand-name drugs for epilepsy.

Headlines: Pancreatic Cancer: Adjuvant Chemotherapy, but Not Radiation
Teaser: In the treatment of resectable pancreatic cancer, addition of adjuvant chemotherapy, but not radiation, reduces the risk for distant recurrences, according to a retrospective analysis.

Headlines: Rivastigmine Prevents Falls in  Patients With PD
Teaser: The results are 'very encouraging and exciting' but need to be reproduced in larger trials, lead researcher says.

Headlines: New Staging System for HPV-Positive Oropharyngeal Cancer
Teaser: Researchers propose a new staging system for HPV-positive oropharyngeal cancer that could help improve prediction of survival, treatment selection, and recruitment into clinical trials.

Headlines: Hidradenitis Suppurativa Tied to Higher Mortality
Teaser: Hidradenitis suppurativa (HS) is associated with a significantly increased risk of adverse cardiovascular (CV) outcomes and all-cause mortality, according to Danish researchers.

Headlines: Saliva Test for Lung Cancer
Teaser: A new saliva-based test is able to detect circulating tumor DNA and is about to move into clinical trials.

Headlines: FDA Clears Brivaracetam (Briviact) for Partial-Onset Seizures
Teaser: The levetiracetam analogue is approved for adjunctive therapy for treatment of partial-onset seizures in patients age 16 and older with epilepsy.

Headlines: Less Is More: ARUBA Confirms Intervention Unwise in AVM
Teaser: Five-year follow-up of ARUBA confirms that despite the elevated stroke risk associated with an unruptured arteriovenous malformation, intervention only raises that risk.

Headlines: INFORMS Published: Fingolimod Fails in Primary Progressive MS
Teaser: Full details of the INFORMS trial have confirmed that the multiple sclerosis drug fingolimod did not slow progression of disability or brain volume loss vs placebo in the primary progressive form of the disease.

Headlines: CT Profile Flags Stroke Patients Who May Have More Time
Teaser: Stroke patients found on CT perfusion imaging to have distinctive brain anatomy show good outcomes with intervention even after the 6-hour window.

Headlines: FDA Likely Underestimated Fetal Deaths From Essure: Analyst
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration may have greatly underestimated the number of fetal deaths among women who became pregnant after using Bayer AG's Essure contraceptive device.

Headlines: Dementia Drugs May Help Smokers Quit
Teaser: Cholinesterase inhibitors, which are traditionally used to treat symptoms of Alzheimer's disease, may be repurposed to help smokers quit, new research suggests.

Headlines: IRIS: Diabetes Drug Reduces Recurrent Stroke, MI
Teaser: A randomized trial shows that in patients with insulin resistance but no diabetes and a history of recent stroke or TIA, pioglitazone reduced recurrent stroke and myocardial infarction vs placebo.

Headlines: Upper-Arm Girth Plus BMI May Sharpen HF Risk Prediction
Teaser: Unlike a more commonly used body measurement, arm circumference at the biceps as a proxy for lean body mass complements body-mass index for risk     stratification, at least in a Japanese cohort study.

Headlines: Repeat Laser Trabeculoplasty for Intraocular Pressure Control
Teaser: In eyes with open-angle glaucoma that have already had successful initial selective laser trabeculoplasty (SLT), repeat SLT can restore intraocular pressure (IOP) control, new research suggests.

Headlines: ESAs Do Not Improve HRQoL in Patients With Anemia and CKD
Teaser: Using erythropoietin-stimulating agents to treat anemia in patients with CKD did not significantly improve health-related quality of life, according to a new study.

Headlines: Interstitial Lung Abnormalities Tied to Increased Mortality
Teaser: Interstitial lung abnormalities were associated with increased risk for all-cause mortality, suggesting they might be mild or early idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

Headlines: 'Extraordinary Results' With CAR-T Making Headlines Again
Teaser: 'Unprecedented responses' seen in blood cancer patients who had run out of options are making headlines again, but will this approach ever find a broader use?

Headlines: HCV Relapse Uncommon After Sustained Virological Response
Teaser: Late relapse of hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection is very uncommon after achieving a sustained virological response (SVR), according to a systematic review and meta-analysis including more than 9,000 patients.

Headlines: Cutting Cancer Drug Costs: No Pain, No Gain
Teaser: Public policy changes could help control the escalating cost of cancer drugs, but not without making tradeoffs in the process, say some experts.

Headlines: Proton Pump Inhibitors Linked to Dementia
Teaser: A new study reinforced results of earlier research showing an association between regular use of these drugs to treat gastrointestinal disorders and dementia risk.

Headlines: ACTRIMS Forum 2016: Focus on Progressive MS
Teaser: ACTRIMS Forum 2016, the first stand-alone ACTRIMS meeting, will focus on emerging concepts in MS and the latest data on novel treatment approaches.

Headlines: Physicians Greet New HCV Drug Zepatier Cautiously
Teaser: Lack of familiarity with the drug and its cost, as well as the availability of rival therapies, may help explain the quiet reception of elbasvir/grazoprevir.

Headlines: Surgical Oncologists Descend Upon Boston
Teaser: One of the debates at this year's annual meeting will be of when surgeons should try to discourage women from undergoing contralateral prophylactic mastectomies.

Headlines: First Human Data Show Verapamil Lowers Glucose in Diabetes
Teaser: Early research hints that this old antihypertensive drug may also lower serum glucose, especially in patients with type 1 or late-stage type 2 diabetes who     are on insulin.

Headlines: Stem Cell Transplant in Multiple Sclerosis: Next Steps
Teaser: Hematopoietic stem cell transplant looks promising in relapsing MS, while more biologically cell-based approaches may be needed for progressive forms. Two important studies are in development.

Headlines: Feb 26 Cardiology News
Teaser: Unpublished trials, new CMS rules, statins after cardiac surgery, sudden death in the young, macrolide antibiotics, and FDA Commissioner Dr Robert Califf are discussed this week.

Headlines: Vedolizumab Safe for Inflammatory Bowel Disease
Teaser: Vedolizumab safely treats ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease, researchers report in a study that integrates safety data from six clinical trials.

Headlines: FDA Clears Extended-Release Tofacitinib (Xeljanz XR) for RA
Teaser: Xeljanz XR provides a once-daily oral option for patients with moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis.

Headlines: Eribulin Makes 3: Changing Treatment Landscape for Sarcoma
Teaser: After a 40-year dearth of new treatments, three new drugs have been approved for soft-tissue sarcomas.

Headlines: Another Option for Opioid-Induced Constipation?
Teaser: A new drug in development is superior to placebo in treating opioid-induced constipation and doesn't interfere with analgesic effect.

Headlines: Erythema Nodosum With Estrogen Patch for Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Was the transdermal estrogen this patient received for treatment of prostate cancer the cause of his erythema nodosum?

Headlines: Clinical Experience Using Epidermal Skin Grafts on Wounds
Teaser: Read about epidermal grafting and its potential roles in wound care and closure.

Headlines: Diagnostic Parameters for Obtaining Accurate Data on IPF
Teaser: Patient data should be re-evaluated to ensure the accurate collection of epidemiological data on idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, the authors say.

Headlines: Initial Clinical Experience With the CyPass Micro-Stent
Teaser: Combined with cataract surgery, the implantation of this novel device effectively lowered IOP in patients with open-angle glaucoma.

Headlines: New Treatment Approaches for the Anemia of CKD
Teaser: What is on the horizon for new therapies in the treatment of anemia in chronic kidney disease?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: CT Angiography for Suspected ACS in the Era of hs-Troponins
Teaser: Does a diagnostic strategy supplemented by early coronary CT angiography offer an advantage over diagnosis via high-sensitivity troponin assay in suspected acute coronary syndrome?

Headlines: Preventing Endoscopic Transmission of Carbapenem-Resistant Enterobacteriaceae
Teaser: What is the most cost-effective way for clinicians to prevent endoscopic transmission of carbapenem-resistant enterobacteriaceae?

Source: Current Opinion in Nephrology and Hypertension
Headlines: Sodium Glucose Cotransporter 2 Inhibition in Diabetic Kidney
Teaser: This review explores the therapeutic potential and effects of SGLT2 inhibitors for glycemic control in diabetes.

Headlines: Toxicities of Anti-PD-1/PD-L1 Immune Checkpoint Antibodies
Teaser: How do you manage diarrhea, fatigue, rash, and other adverse effects associated with anti-PD-1/anti-PD-L1 therapies?

Headlines: Toddler Developmental Delays After Extensive Hospitalization
Teaser: What factors are associated with the developmental delay of a toddler after extensive hospitalization?

Headlines: Influence of Obesity on Survival in Early Breast Cancer
Teaser: Does obesity worsen prognosis in triple negative breast cancer?

Headlines: a-Tocopherol-Associated Protein Expression in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Might alpha-tocopherol-associated protein, a vitamin E binding protein, function as a tumor suppressor-like factor in breast cancer? What is its association with clinical outcomes?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Single- vs. Multi-Staged PCI in Multivessel NSTEMI Patients
Teaser: Which is the preferable strategy in patients with NSTEMI and multivessel coronary artery disease: single-staged or multi-staged PCI?

Headlines: Overuse of PPIs in the Hospitalized Patient
Teaser: Are PPIs being overused in the hospital setting? This article presents recommendations for their appropriate use.

Headlines: Managing Dental Patients on Novel Oral Anticoagulants
Teaser: What should you know before performing dental procedures, especially dental surgery, on patients taking novel anticoagulants?

Headlines: Dosing Antiretroviral Medication When Crossing Time Zones
Teaser: These guidelines discuss how to safely dose antiretrovirals when travelling across time zones.

Source: Current Opinion in Allergy and Clinical Immunology
Headlines: SPLUNC1 Suppression in Chronic Rhinosinusitis
Teaser: Gain a better understanding of the role of the epithelium-secreted protein SPLUNC1 in the pathogenesis of chronic rhinosinusitis.

Headlines: Quiz: Identify the Real Clinical Trial Acronym
Teaser: The naming of research studies ranges from the sublime to the ridiculous. Can you identity the real and imaginary acronyms in this quiz?

Headlines: The Alphabet Soup of Clinical Trial Acronyms
Teaser: Cardiologist Christopher Labos takes a humorous look at the evolution and explosion in the use of catchy acronyms for naming clinical research trials.

Headlines: Relationship Between HER2 Expression and Trastuzumab Benefit
Teaser: Will your patient benefit from trastuzumab? New research using quantitative RNA analysis of HER2 may help you find out.

Headlines: Dried Blood Spot Sampling for the Measurement of HbA1c
Teaser: Dried blood spot sampling for HbA1c might be a useful alternative to traditional blood collection for people living in rural and remote areas, or the homebound. Does it provide accurate results?

Headlines: Treating HER2 Lung Cancers: The EUHER2 Cohort
Teaser: Is trastuzumab beneficial in combination with chemotherapy for advanced HER2-positive advanced NSCLC?

Headlines: Ranibizumab for the Treatment of Wet AMD
Teaser: Ranibizumab for wet AMD has shown success in clinical trials, but are those same results achieved in real-world clinical practice?

Headlines: Eviprostat vs Cernilton for Chronic Prostatitis/Pelvic Pain
Teaser: A new study found no significant difference in the effects of Eviprostat vs the pollen extract Cernilton for chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome.

Headlines: Liraglutide Reduces Daytime Sleepiness in Obese Subjects
Teaser: Could treatment with liraglutide help to reduce excessive daytime sleepiness in obese patients with type 2 diabetes?

Headlines: Miglitol Has Potential as a Therapeutic Drug Against Obesity
Teaser: Miglitol, traditionally used as an anti-diabetic drug, may also have a potential therapeutic role in the treatment of obesity.

Headlines: Drug Discovery in Ophthalmology
Teaser: This review discusses the evolution of ophthalmic drug development, the present challenges, and what the future holds.

Headlines: Pathogenesis and Prevention of Asthma Exacerbations in Kids
Teaser: Learn more about the mechanisms involved in severe exacerbations of asthma in children -- and find out the best ways to prevent them.

Headlines: Target-Specific Oral Anticoagulants in the ED
Teaser: Find out what emergency providers need to know about the appropriate use of target-specific oral anticoagulants -- and how to effectively manage patients who are taking these agents.

Headlines: Survival in IPF Acute Exacerbations
Teaser: Steroids are a common approach for the treatment of IPF acute exacerbations -- but are they doing more harm than good?

Headlines: Impact of Certolizumab Pegol in Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: How effective is certolizumab pegol in the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis? This study takes a look at patient-reported outcomes as well as clinical measures of disease activity.

Headlines: Diabetes Mellitus Risk After First-Attack Acute Pancreatitis
Teaser: Are patients who have experienced a first-attack of acute pancreatitis at an increased risk for diabetes mellitus and, if so, why?

Headlines: New Inhaled Formulations for Treating Asthma in Children
Teaser: These new inhaled formulations for the treatment of asthma may improve adherence in children and adolescents.

Headlines: Reliever Salbutamol to Measure Exacerbation Risk in COPD
Teaser: This study evaluates the use of salbutamol as reliever medication to predict the exacerbation risk in COPD. How did it perform?

Headlines: Vaginal Estrogen Use, Urogenital Morbidity in Postmenopause
Teaser: What does the latest research tell us about vaginal estrogen, its effects on quality of life in postmenopausal women, and how often is it prescribed?

Headlines: Coadministration of Meningococcal and Other Vaccines
Teaser: Is it safe to coadminister the quadrivalent meningococcal conjugate vaccine with other routine vaccines?

Headlines: Pioglitazone Plus n-3 Fatty Acids in Metformin-Treated T2D
Teaser: A new study examines the effects of this combined approach on lipid metabolism in type 2 diabetes patients managed with metformin. Is it beneficial?

Headlines: Safety of Empagliflozin in Drug Naive T2D Patients
Teaser: Could this SGLT2 inhibitor help to successfully manage type 2 diabetes in previously untreated patients -- without increasing cardiometabolic risk?

Headlines: Degarelix for Prostate Cancer in a Real-World Setting
Teaser: Do the benefits of this GnRH antagonist for prostate cancer seen in clinical trials translate into real-world clinical practice?

Headlines: Meibomian Gland Dysfunction: Hyperkeratinization or Atrophy?
Teaser: In this review, the authors examine the latest evidence on the roles of gland atrophy and ductal hyperkeratinization in the development of meibomian gland dysfunction.

Headlines: Translating Research to Practice for Children With Autism
Teaser: The number of children with autism is rising. Health care providers must be aware of the best practices to diagnose and manage this growing population.

Headlines: The Current Treatment of Non-cardiac Chest Pain
Teaser: How can different types of non-cardiac chest pain best be managed, both medically and surgically?

Headlines: Preoperative Low T Linked to High-Grade Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Low preoperative serum testosterone may be a predictor of Gleason score upgrading after radical prostatectomy for prostate cancer.

Headlines: The Practice of Evidence-Based Medicine in Spinal Care
Teaser: Evidence-based medicine plays an important role in determining the effectiveness of spinal care interventions.

Headlines: Efficacy, Safety of Apixaban vs. Aspirin in the Elderly
Teaser: This study compared the benefits and risks of apixaban as an alternative to aspirin in elderly patients with AF. Can it reduce the risk of stroke without increasing major bleeding?

Headlines: Patient Beliefs and Satisfaction When Discontinuing ART
Teaser: Do patients' beliefs and satisfaction with therapy influence the durability of the first antiretroviral regimen?

Headlines: Fibromyalgia: Management Strategies for Primary Care
Teaser: What role does the primary care physician play in fibromyalgia management? This review provides insights into diagnosis and management, highlighting the potential role of the PCMH in FM care.

Headlines: Utilization of Hydrophilic-Coated Catheters
Teaser: What are the complication rates, utilization rates, and benefits of hydrophilic-coated urinary catheters?

Headlines: PULSE-SMART: A Novel Smartphone Application
Teaser: Can a simple-to-use smartphone app, which utilizes the smartphone camera for pulse detection, accurately discriminate AF from more benign arrhythmias?

Headlines: Ledipasvir/sofosbuvir for Cirrhotic Patients With Chronic HCV
Teaser: How safe and effective is combination antiviral therapy in the treatment of cirrhosis in patients with HCV, and how do patients report on the outcome?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Person-Centered Care: A Definition and Essential Elements
Teaser: In this position statement, the American Geriatrics Society provides a definition of person-centered care, its essential elements, and barriers to implementation.

Headlines: Alcohol- vs HCV-related Hepatocellular Carcinoma
Teaser: Are there major differences in the way alcohol-related vs hepatitis C-related hepatocellular carcinoma develops, and how does this affect future treatment?

Headlines: The Mammogram Debate: How Much Should Be Spent to Save One Life?
Teaser: The controversy over breast cancer screening continues. Saying more research is needed is dodging the real question, argues Dr Jha. The real question is how much society should spend to save one life.

Headlines: 'It's About Living Better': Palliative Care in Hem/Onc
Teaser: Experts in hematologic cancer describe the need to use palliative care more broadly throughout patients' treatment.

Source: The National Organization for Rare Disorders
Headlines: Rare Diseases and Translational Research at NIH
Teaser: Dr Marshall Summar interviews Dr Petra Kauffman about the National Institutes of Health's initiatives to bring more new treatments to more patients more quickly.

Headlines: Out-of-Pocket Can Mean Cancer Meds Are Out
Teaser: Drs Kathy Miller and Dawn Hershman discuss factors in adherence to cancer medications, including cost and side effects, and what clinicians can do to keep patients on their medications.

Headlines: LDL Cholesterol, hs-CRP Concentrations, and CHD
Teaser: Might LDL-cholesterol concentrations be a moderator of the contribution of hs-CRP to coronary heart disease?

Headlines: Digital Behavioral Counseling in Prediabetic, CVD Patients
Teaser: This report estimates the economic benefit of an internet-based behavioral counseling service designed to promote a healthful diet and physical activity for cardiovascular disease prevention.

Headlines: Biosimilar Infliximab: One Step Closer to the Pharmacy?
Teaser: Dr Jonathan Kay shares his experience at the recent FDA Arthritis Advisory Committee meeting on approval of biosimilar infliximab.

Headlines: Evidence-Based Recommendations for Spine Surgery
Teaser: This article offers a brief summary of some of the latest evidence-based research regarding the treatment of spinal conditions.

Headlines: Nutritional Support Guidelines for Critically Ill Patients
Teaser: A.S.P.E.N. and SCCM provide updated recommendations regarding nutrition therapy in adult critically ill patients.

Headlines: Glaucoma and Cataract Surgery: Two Roads Merging Into One
Teaser: In this review, the benefits and challenges of cataract surgery for managing coexisting glaucoma and cataracts are discussed.

Headlines: Managing CVD Risk in Chronic Inflammatory Diseases
Teaser: An increased risk of CVD has been observed in many chronic inflammatory diseases, not always attributable to traditional risk factors. What might be the mechanism, and how can risk be ameliorated?

Headlines: Genfit Plans to Test Its Drug in Second Liver Disease
Teaser: French drugmaker Genfit SA on Thursday said it would begin a midstage trial this year of its experimental drug elafibranor to treat primary biliary cholangitis, a chronic disease in which bile ducts in the liver are gradually destroyed.

Headlines: Detecting Signals of Seasonal Influenza Severity
Teaser: Can age patterns of influenza-like illness be used to characterize seasonal influenza severity in the United States?

Headlines: Invasive Lobular Carcinoma -- A Distinct Breast Cancer Subtype
Teaser: Genomic studies have highlighted invasive lobular cancer as a distinct subset of breast cancer, which may lead to new treatment approaches in the future.

Headlines: Nonoperative Management of Rectal Cancer Increasing in US
