Teaser: Analysis of a US national database indicates that nonoperative management of rectal cancer has doubled in recent years, but is it a result of disparieties?

Headlines: Post-Lyme-Disease Syndrome: Longer Antibiotics May Not Help
Teaser: Longer courses of antibiotics do not improve health-related quality of life in patients with post-Lyme-disease syndrome, according to a new study.

Headlines: Delayed Visual Improvements in AMD Continue With Ranibizumab Treatment
Teaser: Visual improvements in patients with neovascular age-related macular degeneration (AMD) treated with ranibizumab continue after macular edema resolves, researchers report.

Headlines: 8 Ways to Earn Extra Income From Medical Activities
Teaser: There are ways to add to your revenue without having to leave medicine. Explore some of these.

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Discontinuation of Initial ART in Clinical Practice
Teaser: What are the main reasons for stopping the initial regimen of ART in HIV positive patients?

Headlines: Drugs for Mental Health Problems in Intellectual Disability
Teaser: Patients with intellectual disability may react differently to pharmacotherapy, and adverse effects are more common. What should you know about prescribing psychotropic drugs to these patients?

Headlines: Use of Perampanel for Refractory Seizures in Pediatrics
Teaser: Read about perampanel, a once-daily alternative to traditional antiseizure drugs for adolescents with refractory seizures.

Headlines: A Focus on Hepatitis C: Novel Therapeutic Regimens
Teaser: In the second part of this three-part series, Dr William Balistreri continues his discussion of hepatitis C with a review of new antiviral agents and novel therapeutic strategies.

Headlines: Survival Benefit of SIRT in mCRC Uncertain
Teaser: Dr David Kerr looks at a study of selective internal radiation therapy in hepatic metastatic colorectal cancer, but says the lack of survival data puts the clinical utility of SIRT in question.

Headlines: DPP4-inhibitors vs. Sulfonylureas for Patients With T2DM
Teaser: Are the glucose-lowering effects of sulphonylureas and DPP4 inhibitors equivalent?

Headlines: Is A1c Variability a Useful Measure in Diabetes?
Teaser: Fluctuations in glycated hemoglobin levels have been suggested as an independent risk factor for diabetic complications, but new studies cast doubts on that concept.

Headlines: Meldonium -- The Drug That Brought Down Sharapova
Teaser: What is this banned drug, meldonium, that tennis star Maria Sharapova admitted to using?

Headlines: Prebiotics and Synbiotics: Improving Gut Health
Teaser: Could a diet that includes prebiotics and synbiotics help to improve gut health?

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Safety of HIV PrEP in Individuals With Active Hepatitis B
Teaser: Is HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis safe for individuals with HBV infection?

Headlines: The Potential Trajectory of Carbapenem-Resistant Enterobacteriaceae
Teaser: How much of a public health threat is carbapenem-resistant enterobacteriaceae, and what types of infection control practices should be put in place to help prevent it?

Headlines: Global Cancer Disparities and the Need for New Initiatives
Teaser: In much of the world, a diagnosis of cancer remains a death sentence. How can we overcome global cancer disparities to get individuals the screening and treatment they need?

Headlines: Botox Alleviates Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: A series of two doses of botulinum toxin A relieved neuropathic pain better than did placebo, new randomized findings show.

Headlines: WHO: Zika May Cause 'Severe Public Health Crisis'
Teaser: Zika virus poses severe public health crisis, says the head of the World Health Organization.

Headlines: Reslizumab (Cinqair) Approved to Treat Severe Asthma
Teaser: Patients receive this add-on treatment by infusion every 4 weeks to stave off severe asthma attacks. The most common adverse events seen in clinical trials include anaphylaxis and cancer.

Teaser: The program of the Endocrine Society's meeting will feature odes to past endocrine achievements and the many advances for which they paved the way.

Teaser: In the real world, intravitreal bevacizumab (IVB) for diabetic macular edema (DME) doesn't work as well as it does in clinical trials, according to new research.

Teaser: Fecal microbiota transplantation can induce remission in patients with treatment-resistant ulcerative colitis, but there are still some concerns about safety, according to experts.

Teaser: Studies show that topical calcineurin inhibitors may be effective in treating a variety of skin conditions, and as an alternative to long-term topical corticosteroids. What's the latest evidence?

Teaser: This literature review identifies the most important published research regarding the cervical spine.

Teaser: What does the latest research tell us about the use of allergen immunotherapy for asthma?

Headlines: The Treatment of ED in Patients With Neurogenic Disease
Teaser: This review explores the available treatment options for neurogenic erectile dysfunction.

Headlines: Does Prevagen® Help Memory Loss?
Teaser: Can a dietary supplement whose main ingredient was originally discovered in jellyfish improve memory problems?

Headlines: Monophasic Hyaluronic Acid Filler for Nasolabial Folds
Teaser: The addition of lidocaine to hyaluronic acid dermal fillers may help alleviate injection pain -- but is it safe?

Headlines: Editor-in-Chief's Top Picks From 2015: Part Two
Teaser: Review important research from 2015 in areas of cardiac imaging, metabolic disorders, arrhythmia, statistics, valvular heart disease, and vascular medicine.

Teaser: What does this new article tell us about the relationship between menopausal status and metabolic abnormalities and the connection to hepatitis C management?

Headlines: Clinical, Economic Burden of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis
Teaser: What economic and health care burdens does this disease place on patients and the healthcare system?

Headlines: Concomitant Antibiotics With Scaling for Periodontitis
Teaser: Can the addition of concomitant systemic antibiotics to standard periodontal treatment help improve outcomes?

Headlines: Treatment Options for Microscopic Colitis
Teaser: Microscopic colitis is diagnosed in a 64-year-old woman with a history of watery diarrhea. What is the most appropriate treatment option?

Headlines: Idelalisib Speed Bump: Shifting Gears in CLL
Teaser: Dr Bruce Cheson discusses how the halt of six idelalisib trials because of adverse events, including deaths, affects research and patient management in CLL and follicular lymphoma.

Headlines: Ovarian Suppression in BC: Right or Wrong, Depending
Teaser: Dr Kathy Miller asks ASCO guidelines author Dr Harold Burstein which early breast cancer patients should -- and should not -- receive ovarian suppression, and how best to manage its side effects.

Source: Medicine and Science in Sports and Exercise
Headlines: Seasonal Variation in Children's Exercise and Sedentary Time
Teaser: A study of children's activity behaviors found that more time was spent being sedentary in colder months while physical activity levels were higher in spring and summer.

Teaser: Find out how these two insulin regimens compare in terms of glucose control and hospital outcomes among non-critical patients with type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: 3D Stereoscopic Viewer for Transanal Endoscopic Surgery
Teaser: Read about a new 3D stereoscopic visual display that could improve surgical performance during transanal endoscopic surgery.

Headlines: Smartphone Diagnosis and Health Devices: Legal and Clinical Implications
Teaser: Dr Daniel Kraft demonstrates many new devices that enable home-based and point-of-care diagnosis of common health conditions.

Headlines: Emerging Biotechnologies Are Changing Pediatric Care
Teaser: Dr Daniel Kraft discusses emerging genomic biotechnologies, crowdsourcing medicine, and how compiling and sharing big data can cure diseases.

Headlines: Primary Prevention: What Medicine Can Learn From Monte Carlo
Teaser: With statins for primary prevention, some gain a lot and some a little, and it's not who you think. Dr John Mandrola reviews a study that applies Monte     Carlo simulation to therapeutic decision making.

Headlines: Mandrola Previews American College of Cardiology 2016 Meeting
Teaser: Dr Mandrola peruses the program for hidden gems and reviews the late-breaking clinical-trial line-up.

Headlines: Use of Flucinolone Acetonide for Patients With DME
Teaser: In patients with diabetic macular edema who do not sufficiently respond to other available therapies, fluocinolone implants may help.

Headlines: PCSK9 Inhibitors: A Brief Primer
Teaser: Dr Myerson provides a brief review of the approved PCSK9 inhibitors alirocumab and evolocumab, current indications, and anticipated data.

Headlines: Virtual Visits and Wearable Technology Meet Pediatrics
Teaser: Dr Daniel Kraft discusses the role of technology in shaping virtual visits, and why no one needs to wait for FDA approval on wearable health trackers.

Headlines: Treatment of Gram-Negative Pneumonia in Critical Care
Teaser: Beta-lactam antibiotics have been the standard treatment approach for gram-negative pneumonia in mechanically ventilated patients -- but have they been overused? What are the alternatives?

Source: Annals of Clinical Microbiology and Antimicrobials
Headlines: Clinical Features of C. Difficile PCR-ribotype 176 Infection
Teaser: This study examined the molecular characteristics of C. difficile isolates in patients hospitalized with C. difficile infection, focusing on the features of ribotype 176 strains.

Headlines: The Glucose-Lowering Effect of Metformin Resides in the Gut
Teaser: In this report, the authors examine the glucose-lowering actions of metformin formulations -- focusing on the gut-based mechanisms.

Headlines: Work Productivity of Chronic HCV Patients
Teaser: Do certain medication regimens help to improve the lives of chronic hepatitis C patients so that their work productivity substantially improves?

Headlines: Limiting and Withdrawing Life Support in the PICU
Teaser: Which factors may impact the likelihood of limitation or withdrawal of life support discussions between PICU families and clinicians?

Headlines: Maraviroc Improves Cognition in HIV Neurocognitive Disorder
Teaser: The addition of maraviroc to cART has led to clinically relevant neurocognitive improvement in patients with HIV-associated neurocognitive disorder.

Headlines: Early-Career Docs No Less Likely to Prescribe Antibiotics
Teaser: Contrary to guidelines, Australian trainees prescribed antibiotics for 71.5% of sore throat diagnoses, and they got worse with time: the most experienced trainees wrote the most prescriptions.

Headlines: The Best Decision May Not Be What the Guidelines Say
Teaser: Patients deserve decision tools, but clinicians often balk at using   them. John Mandrola explains why.

Headlines: Statin Use and Outcomes Among Older Patients With CAD
Teaser: Is intensive statin therapy more effective than moderate therapy in older patients with CAD?

Headlines: Diabetic Macular Morphology Changes in Early Diabetes
Teaser: Using optical coherence tomography, the authors examine the early macular morphological changes in type 1 and type 2 diabetes patients.

Headlines: Enhancing the Microbiome Through Diet, Sleep, and Exercise
Teaser: Dr David Johnson reviews the latest data on how relatively simple lifestyle adjustments may help restore balance to the gut microbiome, an emerging strategy in managing certain diseases.

Headlines: The Biggest Thing to Happen to Biomedicine in Decades?
Teaser: Eric Topol talks with pioneering geneticist George Church about his many research interests, including his central role in developing CRISPR, a gene-editing tool that stands to revolutionize medicine.

Headlines: Do Acne Patients on Isotretinoin Need Monthly Blood Tests?
Teaser: Dr Graeme Lipper reviews the results of a new meta-analysis.

Headlines: 'Failing Fast' and Moving Forward in Clinical Cancer Research
Teaser: The goal of clinical research in cancer should not be to conduct trials the fastest or achieve the largest number of positive trials at all costs, argues Dr Jack West.

Headlines: Harnessing the Childhood Brain to Treat Neuropsychiatric Illness
Teaser: Dr Takao Hensch discusses the significance of critical periods in brain development and potential ways that we can 'reopen' these periods to treat neurodevelopmental disorders.

Headlines: Cost Keeps HCV Care Out of Reach
Teaser: The high cost of HCV drugs means that a cure is still out of reach for many infected persons, with huge implications for public health.

Headlines: Weight Loss Surgery for Teens: Ready for Prime Time?
Teaser: At 3 years after bariatric surgery, are clinical benefits measurable in formerly obese teenagers?

Headlines: Electronic Self-Monitoring of Mood in Bipolar Disorder
Teaser: The use of paper-based mood charting instruments to monitor bipolar disorder symptoms is common. Is an electronic self-monitoring tool an acceptable alternative?

Headlines: Treating CDI: Fresh or Frozen Feces?
Teaser: Dr Lundberg describes a recent study of fecal microbiota transplantation for CDI and applauds the lack of FDA interference.

Headlines: Dexamethasone Implant in DME in Real-Life Situations
Teaser: Are intravitreal dexamethasone implants a safe and effective treatment option for diabetic macular edema? New data from real-life experience sheds some light.

Headlines: Edoxaban vs Warfarin in Patients With Nonvalvular AF
Teaser: This study compared 2 dosing regimens of edoxaban, a direct factor Xa inhibitor, with warfarin in patients with non-valvular AF.

Headlines: Fatty Liver Disease and Lifestyle in Youngsters
Teaser: Is there an established connection between certain lifestyle choices, such as diet and sleep, and the risk for developing NAFLD in youngsters?

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Translating Lung Cancer Screening Guidelines Into Practice
Teaser: New lung cancer screening guidelines, as implemented at one community hospital, resulted in a much higher number of follow-ups than anticipated.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Generalizability of SPRINT Results to U.S. Adult Population
Teaser: How will the new SPRINT recommendations impact the prevalence and number of US adults eligible for antihypertensive therapy?

Headlines: Grazoprevir Plus PEG-IFN/RBV in Treatment-naive HCV Patients
Teaser: What does the latest research tell us about the safety and efficacy of grazoprevir therapy in combination with peginterferon and ribavirin for treatment-naive patients with hepatitis C genotype 1?

Headlines: The Impact of NAFLD and MetS on Subclinical Atherosclerosis
Teaser: What is the relationship between NAFLD, metabolic syndrome, and subclinical atherosclerosis markers?

Headlines: Casting a 'NET' to Find New Therapies for Lupus
Teaser: Dr Deane discusses a study that first examined the role of neutrophil extracellular traps in lupus pathophysiology, and then evaluated metformin to reduce disease flares in a proof-of-concept trial.

Headlines: Registry Study Supports TAVR in Select Nonagenarians
Teaser: "The published data show the procedure can be done, albeit with upfront mortality and stroke risk, and for many patients will provide improvement in     length and quality of life," an expert says.

Headlines: Skip Neoadjuvant Tx in Node-Negative Esophageal Cancer?
Teaser: Patients with clinically staged node-negative esophageal adenocarcinoma derive no overall survival benefit from neoadjuvant chemoradiation, new research hints.

Headlines: Tocilizumab Ups Giant Cell Arteritis Remissions in Early Trial
Teaser: Patients with giant cell arteritis treated with tocilizumab were more likely to reach and maintain complete remission and were able to taper off steroids more quickly in a randomized trial.

Headlines: T1D - Reaping the Rewards of a Targeted Research Investment
Teaser: A special funding program for type 1 diabetes research has led to many exciting advances in the understanding, prevention, and management of this disease.

Source: Annals of Clinical Microbiology and Antimicrobials
Headlines: Characteristics of Leptospirosis With SIRS
Teaser: This study demonstrates that in evaluating a patient with SIRS, the clinical and laboratory findings of leptospirosis may be similar to those of sepsis due to other infectious agents.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Heart Failure Associated With Trastuzumab in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Is routine intensive monitoring for heart failure necessary after completion of trastuzumab therapy?

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Electronic Alerts for Frequent ED Users With Opioid Use
Teaser: The use of electronic alerts may help identify high-frequency users of emergency department care and decrease opioid prescribing for these patients.

Headlines: Public Health and Rare Diseases: Oxymoron No More
Teaser: A public health approach to rare diseases may seem unnecessary, or even inapplicable, but this commentary argues that such an approach could greatly benefit affected patients and their relatives.

Headlines: WNT Signaling in Glioblastoma and Therapeutic Opportunities
Teaser: WNT signaling plays a crucial role in both CNS development and cancer. Could targeting WNT signaling be a viable therapeutic approach for glioblastoma?

Headlines: Traumatic ICH Surprisingly Common With AF Anticoagulation
Teaser: All intracranial hemorrhage "is a real risk” in older vets, although so is risk of ischemic stroke, say experts. The findings “underscore that decisions around anticoagulation need to be patient-centered."

Headlines: Safety Data Accumulating for Combination Asthma Drugs
Teaser: The first of a series of safety studies mandated by the FDA suggests that the black-box warning on inhalers might not be warranted; however, patients with the most severe disease were excluded.

Headlines: Common Test May Aid Personalized Depression Treatment
Teaser: Preserved set-shifting capacity may mark a subgroup of older patients with resistant depression who may benefit from aripiprazole augmentation.

Headlines: Topical Anticholinergic Reduces Underarm Hyperhidrosis
Teaser: An investigational anticholinergic gel noninvasively reduces excess sweating with minimal adverse effects, a phase 2b study suggests.

Headlines: One in Four People Worldwide Have Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease
Teaser: As the global obesity epidemic continues to fuel development of metabolic disorders, the clinical and economic burden of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and its more severe form, nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), will become "enormous," researchers warn in a new paper.

Headlines: Metastasis Site Affects Prostate Cancer Survival
Teaser: Results from a multistudy analysis confirm that the site of prostate cancer metastases affects survival, with liver metastases associated with significantly shorter survival times than other sites.

Headlines: Respirators Not More Effective Than Masks in the Workplace
Teaser: Respirators did not prevent acute respiratory infections more effectively than surgical masks, at least as used by healthcare personnel under normal working conditions.

Headlines: Keys to Unlocking Precision Medicine's Potential: IOM Report
Teaser: The IOM calls for creation of a "rapid learning" system that would integrate research on biomarker tests and associated treatments with clinical practice.

Headlines: Neurofibromatosis — Best Data Yet on Risks for Cancer
Teaser: Patients with neurofibromatosis 1 have been reported to be at an increased risk for several malignancies. A Finnish study refines this risk and reports the risk for breast cancer. Survival is also worse for these patients.

Headlines: Mortality With Dual Antiplatelet Therapy After Coronary Stents
Teaser: Is mortality risk with thienopyridine therapy unique to a particular stent type? How does co-administration of aspirin impact the risk?

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Transmitted HIV Drug Resistance Among Recently Infected
Teaser: Transmission of primary HIV-1 drug resistance continues to be an important public health threat. How common is it among newly diagnosed individuals?

Headlines: Dietary Intake in Stargardt Disease and Retinitis Pigmentosa
Teaser: Gain a better understanding of how these two retinal disorders may be affected by dietary intake. What role does vitamin A status play?

Headlines: The Practical Management of Acute Severe Ulcerative Colitis
Teaser: This new article outlines the most current strategies for the management of acute severe ulcerative colitis.

Headlines: Ethical Aspects of Malaria Control and Research
Teaser: There are many major ethical issues surrounding the control and elimination of malaria. How do we combat these issues and the disease itself?

Headlines: Effect of Music Therapy on Symptoms in Schizophrenia
Teaser: While the use of music therapy in schizophrenia is not new, this study examines the most recent data on its efficacy, and explores its impact on specific positive and negative symptoms.

Headlines: Ranibizumab Combined With Ahmed Valve Implant for Glaucoma
Teaser: Does intravitreal ranibizumab prior to glaucoma valve implantation provide any added benefits in the treatment of neovascular glaucoma?

Headlines: Tumor Location of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma
Teaser: Does tumor location influence prognosis after resection of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma?

Headlines: Tenofovir Exposure and Kidney Function in Women With HIV
Teaser: This study examines the relationship between TFV exposure and subsequent kidney function in women living with HIV.

Headlines: Therapeutic Decompressive Craniectomy in Severe TBI
Teaser: Is decompressive craniectomy a better option then craniotomy for patients with severe TBI and mass lesions such as subdural hematoma? This study aims to assess the risks and benefits.

Headlines: Dual-Drug Strategy Reduces Carpet of Polyps in FAP Patients
Teaser: Colon carpeted with polyps in FAP patients can be favorably affected with a novel dual-drug strategy that offers the first really tenable treatment for this condition.

Headlines: Benefit Persists After Prostaglandin Stopped in Glaucoma
Teaser: For patients with primary open-angle glaucoma, the drop in intraocular pressure seen with prostaglandin analog therapy can last for weeks after treatment has been discontinued, new research shows.

Headlines: Circulating DNA as Biomarker in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Will analysis of tumor-associated DNA advance personalized medicine in breast cancer?

Headlines: An Evolutionary Approach: Learning to Live With Cancer
Teaser: Instead of high-dose chemotherapy to shrink the tumor, a new approach suggests using adaptive therapy with low-dose chemotherapy.

Headlines: Aflibercept Best in Diabetics With Bad Baseline Vision?
Teaser: Final results from a trial comparing aflibercept, bevacizumab, and ranibizumab in diabetic macular edema confirm all three drugs are similar, but     aflibercept is best in those with worse baseline vision, says lead researcher.

Headlines: Biosimilars and New Insulin Versions
Teaser: Learn about currently available biosimilars, including new insulin versions, and the clinical impact of these products.

Headlines: Lipofilling Does Not Increase Breast Cancer Recurrence Risk
Teaser: Lipofilling for breast reconstruction after mastectomy for breast cancer is not associated with a higher risk of disease recurrence, a new study reports.

Headlines: ACE Inhibitor/ARB Withdrawal in Advanced Renal Disease
Teaser: How does withdrawal of ACE inhibitor/ARB treatment affect renal function in advanced chronic kidney disease?

Headlines: Pharmacogenomics Education: Student Personal Genomic Testing
Teaser: A novel participatory education model in which pharmacy students undergo personal genomic testing to enhance their understanding of genotyping may be effective, but remains controversial.

Headlines: Long-term Survival in Locally Advanced Prostate Cancer
Teaser: More extensive pelvic lymph node dissection during radical prostatectomy may translate into higher survival rates in patients with locally advanced prostate cancer.

Headlines: Angina Often Missed, Undertreated in Stable CAD Outpatients
Teaser: "I think that every cardiologist would think they are doing a perfect job, and what we found is that the underrecognition rate of angina was incredibly     high," said a coauthor.

Headlines: Biologics Maintain Benefits Long-term in Plaque Psoriasis
Teaser: The newer biologics ixekizumab and secukinumab showed duration of benefit for treating moderate to severe plaque psoriasis over the long term, but cost and number of injections needed are an issue.

Headlines: Time for a New Classification System for Diabetes
Teaser: A new approach to classifying diabetes could better improve the understanding and management of the disease.

Headlines: Hope and Hype Push Liquid Biopsies in Oncology
Teaser: Detecting cancer through tumor DNA circulating in the blood has both possibilities and limitations. Realizing its full potential depends in part on resolving cost and sensitivity issues.

Headlines: Trial Surprise: Rigosertib May Benefit Some MDS Patients
Teaser: There was no significant improvement in overall survival with rigosertib vs usual care in patients with high-risk MDS, but the drug did show promise in a subset of patients.

Headlines: FDA Proposes Tighter Rules for Fecal Transplants
Teaser: The agency would allow the use of fecal transplants for curing C difficile as long as they're made in hospitals with clinician oversight, or by factory-style stool banks meeting IND requirements.

Headlines: Improved Varicella Vaccine Effectiveness With 2-Dose Regimen
Teaser: A two-dose varicella vaccine regimen is more effective than a one-dose regimen in preventing community transmission, researchers report.

Headlines: Gilead Stops Six Trials Adding Idelalisib to Other Drugs
Teaser: The FDA said it would review the findings of the six trials, which saw an increased rate of adverse events, including death.

Headlines: Low-Dose Steroids Generally Safe in Rheumatic Diseases
Teaser: A EULAR task force has concluded that long-term use of glucocorticoid doses of 5 mg/day or less is generally safe in treating rheumatic diseases.

Headlines: Smartphone Responses on Health and Safety Need Major Upgrade
Teaser: Some computerized conversational agents failed to recognize 'I was raped' or 'I am having a heart attack,' a study found.

Headlines: Role for Twitter in Cancer Clinical Trial Recruitment?
Teaser: A pilot study using a sample of tweets about lung cancer found that a surprising amount of these were about clinical trials, suggesting Twitter could be a resource for recruitment.

Headlines: EMA Starts Review of Cancer Drug Idelalisib (Zydelig)
Teaser: The review was prompted by an increased rate of serious adverse events including deaths, mostly due to infections, seen in ongoing clinical trials.

Headlines: FDA Panel Gives Thumbs Up to Parkinson's Psychosis Drug
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee concludes that pimavanserin is safe and effective and that its benefits outweigh its risks.

Headlines: Defibrotide Approved for Serious Disorder After HSCT
Teaser: This is the first treatment approved for a rare but often fatal complication that can occur in cancer patients who receive hematopoietic stem cell transplants.

Headlines: Antipsychotics Linked to Mortality in Parkinson's
Teaser: Comorbidities should be checked, PD drugs adjusted, and perhaps behavioral approaches tried before an antipsychotic is introduced, researchers say.

Headlines: Possible Drug Risks Buried in Delayed FDA 'Watch Lists'
Teaser: The agency has finally posted quarterly reports for 2015 that list drugs with potential signals of serious risk, such as stroke for SGLT-2 inhibitors. FDA critics say its early warning system needs fixing.

Headlines: Obesity Survey Uncovers Striking Clinician 'Knowledge Gap'
Teaser: "The most striking observation...is that it demonstrates a considerable knowledge gap in the indications, efficacy, and safety of currently FDA-approved     drugs for obesity," says one expert.

Headlines: PPIs May Lower GI Events After DAPT With Low-Dose Aspirin
Teaser: Based on new analysis from COGENT, "one could make an argument to consider routine PPIs" in these CAD patients, said the senior author. "But that does go     beyond current guidelines."

Headlines: ACP Issues Policy Statement to Stem Rising Cost of Drugs
Teaser: The American College of Physicians (ACP) is calling for stakeholders to work together to rein in rising drug costs and improve patient access.

Headlines: Investigational Therapeutic Genital Herpes Vaccine Promising
Teaser: Phase 2 data for a novel immunotherapy for genital herpes showed a significant reduction in viral shedding and lesions, although the reduction in lesions was also seen with placebo.

Headlines: Defining Efficacy of Cancer Immunotherapy Is a Challenge
Teaser: Determining the clinical efficacy of immunotherapeutic agents can be a challenge because of pseudoprogression and other distinct immune-related patterns of response.

Headlines: Online Tools Aid Mental Health Wellness, Treatment
Teaser: Internet-based wellness trackers and online tools to monitor patient progress and provide therapeutic interventions may aid development of tailored therapies and improve symptoms.

Headlines: New Scan for Diabetic Eye Disease Is Better, but at a Cost
Teaser: Telescreening trial in remote areas of the Indian Health Service finds that new ultrawide field imaging may cut the number of people referred unnecessarily     for diabetic retinopathy follow-up, but at a price.

Headlines: Very Low-Calorie Diet May Trigger Type 2 Diabetes Remission
Teaser: A study finds that an 8-week very low-calorie diet followed by intensive support in weight maintenance can put type 2 diabetes into remission for 6 months.

Headlines: Death in French Drug Trial: Family Demands Answers
Teaser: New developments in the investigation into the phase 1 trial that went terribly wrong for five participants includes a formal complaint from the family of the man who died during the trial.

Headlines: Marijuana for Cancer: No Benefit, but Don't Tell Patients
Teaser: As more states approve medical marijuana, oncologists should be prepared to field questions from patients, but the available scientific data are limited.

Headlines: Top-Line Data Show CV Benefit for Liraglutide in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: Liraglutide is the third diabetes drug to show CV benefit and the first for the GLP-1 class.

Headlines: Novel 'Gene Silencer' Shows Promise in Huntington's
Teaser: The first clinical trial of a second-generation antisense oligonucleotide that targets the cause of Huntington's disease is underway after promising results in animal testing.

Headlines: Women at Risk of Missing Out on Oral Anticoagulation for AF
Teaser: One possible reason: being female may be underappreciated as a thromboembolic risk factor, "despite having similar weight within the risk-stratification tool," say researchers based on NCDR data.

Headlines: Could a 'Default Option' Improve Cancer Care?
Teaser: Introducing a 'smart default' into electronic health record systems would steer physicians to evidence-based choices, but would also allow other choices.

Headlines: With Diabetes, BP Treatment Goal May Depend on Starting Line
Teaser: A meta-analysis of published and unpublished data may give pause about aiming too low in blood-pressure treatment for diabetes patients.

Headlines: Unilateral ECT Equal to Bilateral Approach for Major Depression
Teaser: Twice-weekly high-dose unilateral ECT for severe depression is as effective as bilateral ECT, with fewer cognitive side effects, new research shows.

Headlines: New Training Guidelines for Endovascular Stroke Therapy
Teaser: New international guidelines have been drafted setting out minimum training requirements for physicians performing endovascular thrombectomy procedures for acute stroke patients.

Headlines: Prescription Drug Costs Increasing; So Are TV Ads Promoting Them
Teaser: Spending on consumer advertising by drugmakers has increased 62 percent since 2012.

Headlines: Efficacy of DHEA on Dyspareunia and Vaginal Dryness
Teaser: How effective is intravaginal DHEA on moderate to severe dyspareunia and vaginal dryness in menopausal women?

Headlines: Lack of Psychiatric Drug Research Creates Clinical 'Crisis'
Teaser: A lack of investment into researching new psychiatric medications is driving at least one clinician to turn to nonpsychiatric medications to treat various mental disorders.

Headlines: Oral Anticoagulants Remain Underused in US for AF
Teaser: "Even cardiologists need to heed this wake-up call," said a researcher based on PINNACLE registry findings that, regardless of stroke risk, only about half     of eligible AF patients get such treatment.

Headlines: FDA Clears Factor VIII Product Kovaltry for Hemophilia A
Teaser: Studies show routine prophylaxis with Kovaltry helps controls bleeds and reduces frequency of bleeding episodes in children and adults with hemophilia A.

Headlines: For Arthritis Pain: Diclofenac Best, Acetaminophen Worst
Teaser: Diclofenac was most effective and acetaminophen least effective for relieving pain in knee or hip osteoarthritis.

Headlines: Antibodies in Infliximab-Treated Patients Bind CT-P13
Teaser: Antibodies that develop in infliximab-treated patients bind to the biosimilar CT-P13, indicating that switching patients to the biosimilar will be ineffective.

Headlines: Artificial Pancreas Success in Type 1 Diabetes in Pregnancy
Teaser: Use of an "artificial pancreas" overnight in a home setting in pregnant women with type 1 diabetes resulted in 2 extra hours a day in target blood glucose     range, compared with insulin-pump use alone.

Headlines: Shortened Hep C Combo Passes Real-World Test
Teaser: An 8-week regimen of combination ledipasvir and sofosbuvir appears to clear the hepatitis C virus as well as a 12-week schedule, even in patients with very high viral loads, new research shows.

Headlines: Optimizing Biologic Treatment in IBD
Teaser: What parameters should be monitored during induction therapy, maintenance therapy, and after loss of response in patients with IBD?

Headlines: Amniotic Membrane Allograft for Chronic Diabetic Foot Ulcers
Teaser: Is dehydrated amniotic membrane allograft safe and effective in the management of chronic diabetic foot ulcers?

Headlines: Immune Microenvironment of Breast Ductal Carcinoma In Situ
Teaser: This study investigates the immunobiology of DCIS breast cancers. How does the antitumor immune response evolve as tumors progress from in situ to invasive and then metastatic lesions?

Headlines: Surgically Ablated Thyroid Cancer Does Not Need Adjuvant RAI
Teaser: In patients with intermediate-risk thyroid cancer that has been surgically ablated, adjuvant radioiodine therapy may not be necessary.

Headlines: Aspirin for Primary Prevention of Cardiovascular Disease
Teaser: The use of aspirin for primary prevention in patients with no history of cardiovascular disease remains controversial. Do the benefits outweigh the risks?

Headlines: Simeprevir and Sofosbuvir to Treat Chronic HCV Genotype 1
Teaser: Is the combination of simeprevir and sofosbuvir well-tolerated and effective in patients with hepatitis C genotype 1, and does its "real world" results mirror those in the clinical trials?

Headlines: Periprosthetic Joint Infections Controlled by Daptomycin
Teaser: This protocol uses daptomycin-impregnated cement combined with systemic daptomycin, to safely and effectively treat periprosthetic joint infections caused by methicillin-resistant Staphylococci.

Headlines: Meeting Information Needs for Patients With PTSD
Teaser: The authors developed a patient decision aid designed to help educate and inform patients with PTSD as to their treatment options.

Headlines: Prognostic Factors, Risk Stratification in CRPC on Docetaxel
Teaser: Could certain prognostic factors help predict overall survival in castration-resistant prostate cancer patients treated with docetaxel?

Headlines: Efficacy of Sitagliptin in Diabetes With High CVD Risk
Teaser: Does sitagliptin provide cardioprotective effects? This study examines the benefits among type 2 diabetes patients at high risk for cardiovascular disease.

Headlines: Endocrine Disorders in HIV+ Women Associated With Viral Load
Teaser: New research looks into the prevalence of endocrine abnormalities in HIV-infected women and the association between endocrine dysfunction and viral load.

Headlines: Monoclonal Antibodies for Hypercholesterolemia
Teaser: Learn about treating hypercholesterolemia with the recently approved PCSK9 inhibitors in this review. When should they be used, and what are their risks and benefits?

Headlines: Maternal Glucose and Birth Weight in Obese Women With T2D
Teaser: Maternal glucose, fatty acids, and birth weight -- what is the relationship? This study examines the possible connection among obese women with pre-gestational type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: Adrenocortical Cancer: Mortality and Prognostic Markers
Teaser: What do we know about this rare cancer? Could certain markers help predict prognosis?

Headlines: Targeting CDK 4/6 in ER-Positive Breast Cancers
Teaser: Learn about small molecule CDK4/6 inhibitors in clinical development. Are they effective, safe, and tolerable?

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Recommendations for Prehospital Care in Acute Stroke
Teaser: This article provides guidance for EMS personnel on the prehospital evaluation and treatment of patients with suspected stroke.

Headlines: BF Spiromax Compared to BF Turbuhaler for Persistent Asthma
Teaser: A new study compares the use of two inhalers for delivering budesonide and formoterol in patients with persistent asthma. How do they stack up?

Headlines: An Update on Pharmacologic Management of COPD
Teaser: What's new in drug treatments for COPD? Find out the most recent developments in pharmacologic management of this disease.

Headlines: CT-P13 vs Reference Infliximab in Ankylosing Spondylitis
Teaser: Is CT-P13 a safe and effective treatment option for patients with ankylosing spondylitis?

Headlines: Loss of Antigenicity With Tissue Age in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Breast cancer specimens are often archived for many years for research or follow-up purposes. Do expression and detection of target biomarkers degrade over time in FFPE tissues?

Headlines: Non-invasive Models of Predicting Fibrosis in NAFLD
Teaser: How accurate and reliable are non-invasive methods of predicting fibrosis in patients with NAFLD?

Headlines: Nutritional Consequences of Long-term Acid Suppression
Teaser: Could the long-term use of proton-pump inhibitors cause nutritional consequences, such as vitamin deficiencies? This new article investigates.

Headlines: Direct-acting Antivirals in New Era of Hepatitis C Therapy
Teaser: How are the newer direct-acting antivirals changing the landscape of hepatitis C treatment?

Headlines: Partially Hydrolyzed Guar Gum in the Treatment of IBS
Teaser: The prebiotic properties of partially hydrolyzed guar gum may help alleviate some symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome.

Headlines: Role of Clinical Practice Guidelines in Pharmacy Education
Teaser: While clinical practice guidelines are certainly important to health care, does taking them at face value undermine clinical growth for pharmacy students?

Headlines: Dupilumab, a Monoclonal Antibody for Atopic Dermatitis
Teaser: Learn about a novel biological therapy for atopic eczema, dupilumab, which is on a fast-track to FDA approval. How is it clarifying our understanding of the pathogenesis of this chronic disease?

Headlines: Duration of IV Zolendronate and Success of Endodontic Therapy
Teaser: Does the duration of bisphosphonate therapy impact the success of root canal treatment in patients requiring endodontic procedures?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Canagliflozin in Individuals Aged 75 and Older With T2DM
Teaser: Is the SGLT2 inhibitor canagliflozin safe to use in elderly diabetic patients?

Headlines: Pain Management for Neuropathic Pain in Fabry Disease
Teaser: Debilitating neuropathic pain is one of the key features of Fabry disease. What pain management strategies may be most effective?

Headlines: Plastic Surgery Myths: Postop Management of Surgical Drains
Teaser: What factors should be considered before pulling a postoperative drain?

Headlines: Dexketoprofen/Tramadol 25 Mg/75 Mg
Teaser: This new oral combination of two analgesics with different mechanisms of action may be very useful in managing post-op pain.

Headlines: Drug-Induced Bilateral Secondary Angle-Closure Glaucoma
Teaser: Find out which types of drugs may play a role in the development of drug-induced bilateral secondary angle-closure glaucoma.

Headlines: Treatment of Actinic Keratosis With Ingenol Mebutate Gel
Teaser: A novel topical medication, produced from the sap of a common plant, shows promise in clearing actinic keratosis.

Headlines: Revascularization Strategy in Acute MI With Cardiogenic Shock
Teaser: What is the optimal revascularization strategy in patients with multivessel disease and acute myocardial infarction complicated by cardiogenic shock?

Headlines: E-Consultations: Improving Primary Care-Specialty Interface
Teaser: Can e-consultation referrals increase access to specialty care for underserved populations?

Headlines: Alcohol Consumption and Perception of Attractiveness
Teaser: Does consumption of alcohol influence the perception of attractiveness? This study aimed to validate the so-called "beer-goggles" effect of social drinking.

Headlines: Improving Appropriate Prescribing in Older Patients
Teaser: What role could pharmacists play in reducing inappropriate prescribing -- particularly among hospitalized dementia patients?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: CVD and Death, Dementia, and CHD in Patients 80+ Years
Teaser: Does a delay or prevention of peripheral atherosclerosis result in the reduction or slowing of progression of brain neuropathology and possible incidence of dementia in older persons?

Headlines: Insulin Protocol for Glucocorticoid-Induced Hyperglycemia
Teaser: This study examines two insulin protocols for treating glucocorticoid-induced hyperglycemia in non-critical hospitalized patients. Which more effectively achieves glycemic control?

Headlines: Aspirin Is Associated With Lower Indices of Liver Fibrosis
Teaser: Could aspirin use help to lower the risk of liver fibrosis in patients with liver disease?

Headlines: New Therapeutic Options for Skin and Soft Tissue Infections
Teaser: Read about the new approved drugs for the treatment of MRSA complicated skin and soft tissue infections.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Role of PCPs for Treating Cataracts and Macular Degeneration
Teaser: Can primary care physicians improve the quality of life in older patients with uncorrectable vision loss?

Headlines: Caries Remineralisation in Children by Applied Fluoride
Teaser: How effective is professionally applied, topical sodium fluoride in remineralizing early enamel caries in children?

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: ED-Based Intimate Partner Violence Intervention Research
Teaser: Does 'assessment reactivity' impact the outcomes of research on ED interventions for intimate partner violence?

Headlines: Infection Control Strategies to Prevent TB -- Nigeria, 2015
Teaser: The success of a pilot CDC program in Nigeria, focused on training health care workers and identifying TB infection control gaps in the healthcare setting, could have global implications.

Headlines: The Year in Cardiology 2015: Prevention
Teaser: The year 2015 gave us many game-changing studies pertaining to CVD prevention. Review the top contenders in this synopsis.

Headlines: Vitamin D Supplements and Fall Rate in Postmenopausal Women
Teaser: Should clinicians be recommending isolated vitamin D supplementation for menopausal women in order to lower the incidence of falls and to improve postural balance?

Headlines: Microbiota and Arthritis: Correlations or Cause?
Teaser: What changes occur in the microbiota of people with arthritis?

Headlines: Severe Hypoglycemia Requiring Medical Intervention
Teaser: Understanding the trends in the incidence of severe hypoglycemia requiring medical attention may help clinicians identify which patients are at higher risk of developing this condition.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Valve Hemodynamic Deterioration After Transcatheter AVR
Teaser: What factors are associated with valve hemodynamic deterioration after transcatheter aortic valve replacement? How might the risk be reduced?

Headlines: Prebiotics and Probiotics Before Liver Transplantation
Teaser: The administration of prebiotics and probiotics prior to liver transplantation may help protect against post-transplant infections.

Headlines: ICAT for Predicting ICU Needs After Thrombolysis in Stroke
Teaser: The ICAT score may be helpful in predicting the critical care needs of acute stroke patients after IV thrombolysis.

Source: Current Opinion in Nephrology and Hypertension
Headlines: Complications and Management of Hyponatremia
Teaser: What types of complications are associated with hyponatremia -- and how are they best prevented and managed?

Headlines: HCV Council -- Critical Appraisal of Data
Teaser: This new article summarizes the very latest data regarding best practices for managing patients with chronic hepatitis C virus. What do we learn?

Headlines: Prebiotics in Patients With NAFLD: Trial Protocol
Teaser: Can prebiotics modulate gut microbiota and hepatic health in patients with NAFLD? Read about a new trial that will find out.

Headlines: Hemodynamic Therapy and Postoperative Renal Function
Teaser: Goal-directed hemodynamic therapy was not superior to good clinical care in terms of renal outcome after major abdominal surgery, a new study reports.

Headlines: Topical Steroids vs. PPIs for Eosinophilic Esophagitis
Teaser: How do proton pump inhibitors measure up to topical steroids in the treatment of eosinophilic esophagitis?

Headlines: Breakthrough Neuropsychiatric Drugs
Teaser: Breakthrough status has recently been granted for novel drugs to treat Parkinson's disease psychosis as well as movement disorders precipitated by antipsychotics, such as tardive dyskinesia.

Headlines: Adherence Therapy vs Routine Care in Schizophrenia
Teaser: Can a motivational interviewing-based adherence therapy improve medication adherence in people with schizophrenia?

Headlines: High Hope for Medical Marijuana in Digestive Disorders
Teaser: Does science suggest that medical marijuana could be effective in the treatment of various digestive disorders, and could legalization provide an avenue for further research into its benefits?

Headlines: Interventions to Improve the Psychological Well-Being of GPs
Teaser: The stress of workforce and workload issues threatens the mental health and well-being of primary care physicians. Are there any interventions that have proven helpful?

Headlines: Smoking Impacts Morbidity Risk After Lumbar Spine Surgery
Teaser: The deleterious health effects of smoking are well proven, but could it also negatively impact outcomes after lumbar spine procedures?

Headlines: Long-term Outcome Following Tracheostomy in Critical Care
Teaser: In this article, the long-term outcomes and complications associated with surgical tracheostomies and percutaneous techniques are examined. How do they compare?

Headlines: Levothyroxine Replacement in Obese Hypothyroid Females
Teaser: Obesity may factor into finding the optimal regimen for levothyroxine replacement in hypothyroid patients after thyroidectomy.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Preclinical Efficacy of T-DM1 in the Brain Microenvironment
Teaser: Can T-DM1 overcome resistance to trastuzumab in treatment of brain metastases associated with HER2 positive breast cancer?

Headlines: Impact of Universal ICU Staphylococcus Aureus Decolonization
Teaser: Is ICU decolonization coordinated across hospitals in a region enough to eradicate MRSA completely in that region? This new study investigates.

Headlines: Dual Antiplatelet Therapy Duration With Drug-Eluting Stents
Teaser: What is the optimal duration of dual antiplatelet therapy in patients who have drug-eluting stents? The answer may depend on which generation stent was used.

Headlines: Adjunctive Noninsulin Antihyperglycemic Therapy in T1D
Teaser: This article provides an overview of the newer anti-hyperglycemic agents available for the adjunctive treatment of type 1 diabetes.

Headlines: In-Hospital TAVR Outcomes Improve as Case Volume Goes Up
Teaser: "We base many of our guidelines and . . . current practices on absolute differences in outcome of 1%." So mortality differences of 1% to 1.5% "are quite     game changing," noted one expert.

Headlines: microRNA-10b Is a Prognostic Biomarker for Melanoma
Teaser: The authors sought to identify which microRNAs might have prognostic value in melanoma. Is there a place for microRNA analysis in stratifying melanoma for therapy?

Headlines: Everolimus Data for Seizures in Tuberous Sclerosis 'Exciting'
Teaser: The new results may open the door to eventually being able to treat epilepsy, not just seizures, researchers say.

Headlines: Doubts Over PD Inhibitor Plus TKI Combo in NSCLC
Teaser: Combining checkpoint inhibitors with tyrosine kinase inhibitors in non-small cell lung cancer adds little benefit but substantially increases serious adverse events.

Headlines: Behavior After Bariatric Surgery Key, Study Finds
Teaser: Evaluating weight control practices and eating behaviors after bariatric surgery can markedly influence the amount of weight loss postsurgery, according to a new study.

Headlines: Aspirin 'Helps Cancer Survival After Treatment'
Teaser: Taking low-dose aspirin after cancer treatment can help improve survival by up to 20%, according to a Cardiff University's School of Medicine analysis.

Headlines: Marijuana Use Before Acute MI May Give Survival Edge in Hospital
Teaser: The composite outcome was not met, but several individual components were. And although marijuana users had more mechanical ventilation risk, one expert     blames the smoke rather than the substance.

Headlines: FDA Approves Micra, First Leadless Pacemaker for US Patients
Teaser: The approval comes almost 2 months after an advisory panel met to work out the technology's practice implications. Both the Micra and Nanostim devices are already available in Europe.

Headlines: Positive Interim Results for Novel ALS Drug
Teaser: Interim analysis of a phase 3 randomized controlled trial shows positive outcomes with masitinib on all primary and secondary endpoints, the company reports.

Headlines: ALPS: No Overall Survival Increase From Amiodarone, Lidocaine
Teaser: Although no benefit was found in the full group assessed, subgroup analysis showed significantly improved survival rates for both drugs vs placebo in those     with witnessed out-of-hospital cardiac arrest.

Headlines: NCCN: Shorter RT Course 'Preferred' for Breast Conservation
Teaser: The latest NCCN guidelines for breast cancer urge the use of hypofractionation, in which radiation is delivered for 3 rather than 5 weeks.

Headlines: Empowered Pharmacists Lower Patients' Cardiac Risk in RxEACH
Teaser: "Engaging pharmacists could bring another 450,000 helping hands in the United States and Canada to help reduce the burden of cardiovascular disease,"     researchers say.

Headlines: FDA Approves Impella Heart Pumps for Cardiogenic Shock
Teaser: The entire family of Impella left side heart pumps has been approved for cardiogenic shock.

Headlines: Plant-Derived Bacterium Shows Antiobesity Effect
Teaser: A plant-derived lactic acid bacterium, Pediococcus pentosaceus LP28 (LP28), may have an antiobesity effect, at least when heat killed, Japanese researchers report.

Headlines: Esophagus Regeneration Successful in Human Patient
Teaser: Metal stents plus an acellular matrix and autologous platelet-rich plasma regenerated functional esophageal epithelium over a 5-cm gap and enabled the patient to eat normally.

Headlines: Worldwide Virtual 'Race' Keeps Adults Moving, Off Chairs
Teaser: "We think that the social camaraderie represents a critical driver of participation in the program," said researchers, and that it seems effective "in both high-income and low-middle-income" countries.

Headlines: ASCO Urges Aggressive Efforts to Increase HPV Vaccination
Teaser: Despite many American medical professional bodies strongly recommending HPV vaccination, uptake remains low. Now oncologists are being told to get involved.

Headlines: More Vitamin D Equals Less Cancer?
Teaser: Higher levels of vitamin D have again been linked to a reduced cancer risk, but experts approached for comment say the link is unclear.

Headlines: What's Hot at AAN 2016?
Teaser: A rundown of changes to the program and expected highlights of the American Academy of Neurology 2016 Annual Meeting in Vancouver, Canada.

Headlines: FDA Clears First Blood-Based Colorectal Cancer Screening Test
Teaser: The Epi proColon test is indicated for CRC screening in average-risk patients who opt not to be screened by colonoscopy or a stool-based fecal immunochemical test.

Headlines: Sitagliptin is 'Safest' DPP-4 Inhibitor for Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: Detailed assessment of heart-failure outcomes from TECOS study with the type 2 diabetes drug sitagliptin is published and confirms that this DPP-4     inhibitor has the safest cardiovascular profile.

Headlines: OTC Antihistamine Promotes Remyelination in MS
Teaser: The first randomized trial showing efficacy for a remyelinating agent in MS suggests it is possible to repair injury to nerve cells.

Headlines: Surgery Tops Drugs for Glycemic Control at 5 Years: STAMPEDE
Teaser: The study "confirms the ongoing benefit of bariatric surgery," said one observer in an interview. Now, "what we really need to know now is health economics and cardiovascular outcomes."

Headlines: World's Largest Imaging Project Aims to Shed New Light on Disease
Teaser: A new project in the UK aims to make significant strides in understanding and treating major diseases by creating a vast library of scans of people's bones and internal organs.

Headlines: Studies Suggest Ways to Improve Gestational Diabetes Outcomes
Teaser: Screening women earlier for gestational diabetes and treating those who meet lower diagnostic criteria may reduce adverse maternal and neonatal outcomes, according to two new studies.

Headlines: Brain Imaging 'Growth Chart' May Flag Early Attention Problems
Teaser: Children with ADHD show distinct patterns in brain maturation that are evident on neuroimaging, suggesting the potential to develop a neurologic growth chart similar to other types of growth charts.

Headlines: EMA Panel Likes Daratumumab for Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency (EMA) has recommended granting conditional marketing authorization for daratumumab for the treatment of adults with relapsed and refractory multiple myeloma.

Headlines: HOPE-3: Statins Lower CV Events in Intermediate-CHD-Risk Patients
Teaser: UPDATED // Alone or with blood-pressure-lowering therapy, at least in those with elevated baseline BP, rosuvastatin lowered composite end points by 24% to 29% vs     placebo.

Headlines: GAUSS-3: Evolocumab Cuts LDL-C in Statin-Intolerant Patients
Teaser: UPDATED // "We have established that you can use PCSK9 inhibitors successfully" in this patient population, said the lead author. "And that has regulatory and     practice implications."

Headlines: Morphine at Acute MI May Blunt Short-Term Antiplatelet Response
Teaser: "Once morphine is given, we may consider giving other IV agents that bypass the gastric emptying, such as GP IIb/IIIa inhibitors or bivalirudin," propose investigators after their prospective study.

Headlines: EU Regulators Favor 'Bubble Boy' Gene Therapy (Strimvelis)
Teaser: The treatment corrects a genetic defect in patient's' blood-forming stem cells that causes a form of severe combined immunodeficiency.

Headlines: Early Alzheimer's Pathology May Trigger Diabetes
Teaser: The early pathologic processes of Alzheimer's disease may lead to insulin resistance in the hypothalamus and subsequently trigger some cases of type 2 diabetes, new research suggests.

Headlines: Technology Rekindling the Doctor-Patient Relationship
Teaser: Note bloat and the antisocial manner of some electronic health record keepers has given digital tools a bad rap, according to experts who say social media is powering a revolution in healthcare.

Headlines: ATMOSPHERE: Aliskiren Not Superior to Enalapril in HF
Teaser: The negative trial came with a regulatory wrinkle, resulting in three responses being published with the study. The deputy editor admits this was "a bit usual," but so were the circumstances.

Headlines: Fingolimod Easier to Swallow Than Dimethyl Fumarate?
Teaser: Patients with multiple sclerosis are more likely to discontinue dimethyl fumarate than fingolimod after 2 years or less, largely because of tolerability issues, a real-world study has found.

Headlines: PCI-Related Bleeding Rates a Performance Measure? Not So Fast
Teaser: A lack of impact on hospital-level bleeding events with bleeding avoidance measures including radial artery access has some experts calling for change.

Headlines: 'Well-Managed Warfarin' Good Enough in Atrial Fib: Analysis
Teaser: Reopening the warfarin-vs-NOAC debate in atrial fibrillation, low complication rates on the older drug in a Swedish national cohort study impressed, but are they generalizable?

Headlines: New Drug For New Target: LOXO-101 for NTRK Gene Fusions
Teaser: An investigational agent has shown dramatic responses in patients with a variety of different tumors that tested positive for NTRK gene fusions.

Headlines: Small-Fiber Neuropathy in Prediabetes Less Benign Than Believed
Teaser: Nerve-fiber length is not a predictor of which neurons will degrade first in diabetic neuropathy, new data hint. Nor is prediabetes as benign as thought.     But editorialists question the findings.

Headlines: Natalizumab Misses Endpoint in Secondary Progressive MS
Teaser: In the ASCEND trial, treatment did not delay disease progression, the primary endpoint, although there was a benefit on upper-extremity function.

Headlines: Obesity Rates Climbing in US Youth, Especially in Adolescents
Teaser: There is no evidence to suggest obesity rates in children and adolescents in any age group are declining in the US, and, in fact, rates of severe obesity     are increasing among teens.

Headlines: FDA Panel Finds Evidence Inadequate for Eteplirsen in DMD
Teaser: Despite emotional testimony from patients and families, an FDA advisory panel concluded evidence for an investigational drug in Duchenne muscular dystrophy was not sufficient to recommend approval.

Headlines: Colorectal Cancer Screening: Not All It's Cracked Up to Be?
Teaser: Colorectal cancer screening works, but other factors are at play as the incidence and mortality of the disease drops in the United States, say a pair of experts.

Headlines: RA: MTX Underdosed in Biologics Trials?
Teaser: Authors of a systematic review of trials comparing biologics with MTX said doses of MTX were too low and favor the biologics, but other experts called foul and said there is no evidence of bias.

Headlines: Gene Therapy for Choroideremia Improves Vision After 3.5 Years
Teaser: Gene therapy for choroideremia continues to improve some patients' vision 3.5 years after treatment.

Headlines: WHI Informs on Links Between Diabetes, Metformin, and Cancer
Teaser: A new analysis from the Women's Health Initiative indicates that postmenopausal women with type 2 diabetes are at a higher risk for invasive cancer and     cancer death. But the good news: metformin may help.

Headlines: Gene Therapy Stabilizes Disease in Cerebral ALD
Teaser: Interim results show autologous stem cell Lenti-D gene therapy provides neurologic, radiographic, and clinical disease stabilization in cerebral adrenoleukodystrophy.

Headlines: Now Novo Says Semaglutide Cuts CV Risk: SUSTAIN-6 Top-line Data
Teaser: For the second time in just over a month, Novo Nordisk releases positive data for a GLP-1 agonist for type 2 diabetes; this time it's for the once-weekly     injection semaglutide, which is not yet approved.

Headlines: More Positive Results for Ocrelizumab in Relapsing MS
Teaser: Using a combo of imaging and clinical outcomes indicating 'no evidence of disease activity,' a new analysis again shows how the investigational drug is 'a giant step forward,' researchers say.

Headlines: EMA Panel Backs Daclizumab (Zinbryta) for Multiple Sclerosis
Teaser: Daclizumab, a once-monthly injection, offers a targeted mechanism of action that is not expected to cause broad and prolonged immune cell depletion.

Headlines: FDA Okays Pimavanserin for Hallucinations, Delusions in PD
Teaser: The drug is the first one approved to treat hallucinations and delusions associated with psychosis in Parkinson's disease.

Headlines: Meta-Analysis: Age, Sex No Barrier to Beta-Blockade in HF
Teaser: The benefit of beta-blockers is retained in heart-failure patients with reduced EF regardless of sex or age, calling into question the practice of     "withholding such treatment in women or elderly patients," the authors said.

Headlines: Kids With More Daily Stress Have More Nightly Asthma Awakenings
Teaser: A stressful day may make a child more prone to an asthma attack that night - with worse than usual asthma symptoms the next day as well, a small U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Surgery for DCIS: If Inadequate, Recurrence Skyrockets
Teaser: When margins are not good after DCIS surgery, recurrence rates at 10 years are double (or more) those of patients who have good margins.

Headlines: Sex Matters in the Diagnostic Performance of CAD Testing
Teaser: "Women may derive greater positive prognostic value from CTA than from stress testing," the author of a sex-specific analysis of the PROMISE trial said,     but more data are needed before clinical practice shifts.

Headlines: CoreValve High-Risk Study at 3 Years: TAVR Advantage Sustained
Teaser: In this high-risk population with severe aortic stenosis, patients were less likely to die or have a stroke within 3 years if they had percutaneous rather     than surgical valve replacement.

Headlines: Immunotherapies for NSCLC 'Perform Well in Real World'
Teaser: The anti-PD-1 agents nivolumab and pembrolizumab achieve real-world outcomes comparable to that seen in trials, although survival is closely linked to patient performance status.

Headlines: More Patients Living Longer: Latest Immunotherapy Data
Teaser: The latest data for survival on nivolumab are better than those previously seen with ipilimumab, and both show that some patients live for years.

Headlines: New AAN Guideline on Use of Botulinum Neurotoxins
Teaser: The American Academy of Neurology has released new recommendations on the use of botulinum neurotoxin products in the treatment of blepharospasm, cervical dystonia, adult spasticity, and headache.

Headlines: Propranolol in the Treatment of Infantile Haemangiomas
Teaser: This large cohort study assesses the safety and efficacy of oral propranolol for treatment of infantile hemangioma, analyzing data from 39 European centers.

Headlines: Sorafenib a Possible Option for Medullary Thyroid Carcinoma?
Teaser: Sorafenib might be a suitable option for treating advanced MTC, when the standard drugs are not available.

Headlines: Implantable Device May Select Appropriate Cancer Therapy
Teaser: A microdevice implanted into tumors may have the potential to select the most appropriate therapy for cancer patients.

Headlines: Hope for Advanced HNSCC at Last From Immunotherapy
Teaser: Nivolumab significantly improved survival for patients with advanced refractory head and neck cancer.

Headlines: 'Remarkable' Responses in Rare Merkel-Cell Skin Cancer
Teaser: The first-ever positive clinical trial in the rare Merkel-cell carcinoma shows the highest responses to immunotherapy yet seen, in 56% of patients.

Headlines: Children's Type 1 Diabetes Prevention Trial Beginning
Teaser: A trial has launched in Scotland to try to prevent type 1 diabetes in children who are at risk of developing the condition.

Headlines: New FDA Chief Tops Most Influential Physicians List
Teaser: Robert Califf, MD, could 'redefine how drugs, medical devices, tobacco, food safety and controlled substances are regulated in the 21st century.' He is a newcomer to the Modern Healthcare list.

Headlines: High Troponin Levels Associated With Mental-Stress Ischemia
Teaser: Elevated high-sensitivity troponins give "biological evidence of an ongoing myocardial injury" in CAD patients, note investigators about the largest US     study yet to assess this type of ischemia.

Headlines: Eating Pulses 'Could Help With Weight Loss'
Teaser: Eating one serving of pulses each day could contribute to modest weight loss, according to a new study.

Headlines: Metastectomies: Local Approaches to Breast Cancer Metastases
Teaser: In expert panel reported on the increasing the use of radiation therapy and surgery to control low-volume metastatic disease in patients with breast cancer, as part of the 2016 EBCC in Amsterdam.

Headlines: Big Data vs Breast Cancer Trials Raises Big Issues
Teaser: Using big data in place of clinical trials to answer clinical questions may sound progressive. But judging from the results of a recent study, it raises big issues, says Dr Kathy Miller.

Headlines: Predictors of Nonadherence in Multiple Sclerosis
Teaser: From the AAN Annual Meeting, Medscape speaks with doctoral candidate Kyla McKay about predicting treatment nonadherence in patients with multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: Beeps, Blips, and a New Class of Medicine: Video Games
Teaser: Can video game therapy fend off cognitive decline and help treat other disorders of the brain? Dr Adam Gazzaley discusses.

Headlines: ATMOSPHERE and the RAS Blockade Ceiling in Heart Failure
Teaser: Dr Pina interviews Prof McMurray about the trial on aliskiren and enalapril in HF and the perils of retrospective subgroup analyses.

Headlines: Rate vs Rhythm for Post-op AF: Neutral Trial, Positive Message
Teaser: Drs Mandrola and Gillinov discuss the ACC late-breaking clinical trial testing rate- vs rhythm control for the management of atrial fibrillation after cardiac surgery.

Headlines: Is Breast Cancer Research Geared to Our Patients?
Teaser: Dr Piccart-Gebhart reviews the progress made in HER2-positive breast cancer and asks whether the 'fragmented' efforts of research answer--or even address--the questions most important to patients.

Headlines: STICHES: CABG Boosts 10-Year Survival in Severe LV Dysfunction
Teaser: "It's a very clear indication that if you have low ejection fraction that you should seriously consider whether revascularization is feasible," says an expert observer.

Headlines: Schizophrenia International Research Society (SIRS) 2016 Biennial Meeting
Teaser: Read clinically focused news coverage of key developments from SIRS 2016.

Headlines: Vitamin D Disappoints
Teaser: Two studies fail to find an effect of prenatal vitamin D supplementation on wheezing in offspring.

Headlines: Oral Health and Nutraceuticals: Can Green Tea Treat Herpes?
Teaser: A topical green tea product is compared with placebo in patients with recurrent herpes labialis.

Headlines: If Shared Decisions Can Make It in the ED, They Can Make It Anywhere
Teaser: Dr John Mandrola recounts the results of the Chest Pain Choice Trial, where low-risk patients in the emergency helped make the decision on how to         proceed.

Headlines: Surveying the Latest Data in Fatty Liver Disease
Teaser: The recent Liver Meeting featured a wealth of studies on nonalcoholic fatty liver disease and steatohepatitis. Dr William Balistreri shines a light on those most likely to affect your practice.

Headlines: Tough Talks With Cancer Patients: Dealing With Challenges
Teaser: Skilled communication is imperative for oncologists. Here are some common hurdles for having difficult conversations with patients, and how to overcome them.

Headlines: Update: The Latest Evidence on Reducing CV Risk and Mortality
Teaser: Dr Michael Blaha discusses the importance of coronary artery calcium in the MESA risk score calculator and the role of preexisting physical fitness in reducing later cardiovascular mortality.

Headlines: When Desensitization Makes Sense and When It Doesn't
Teaser: Dr Berns and kidney transplant specialist Dr Deirdre Sawinski discuss how developments in allocation practices and the potential for donor swaps may reduce the need for desensitization and its risks.

Headlines: Progress Noted in Treatment of Several Common Liver Diseases
Teaser: Dr William Balistreri provides an overview of the latest data on such disorders as alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency, drug-induced liver injury, and parenteral nutrition-associated cholestasis.

Headlines: Taking Brain Health to Heart
Teaser: Drs Black and Gorelick discuss the growing link between Alzheimer disease and cardiovascular risk factors, such as high blood pressure, and the importance of educating patients about prevention.

Headlines: American Association for Cancer Research (AACR) 2016 Annual Meeting
Teaser: Read clinically focused news coverage of key developments from AACR 2016.

Headlines: PCSK9 Inhibitors for Statin Intolerance, Early Beta Blockade in AMI?
Teaser: Drs Harrington and Ohman debate PCSK9 inhibitors for statin intolerance and the use of early beta blockade in acute MI in the context of the GAUSS-3 and Early-BAMI late-breaking studies from ACC.

Headlines: Physical Therapy in Parkinson Disease
Teaser: In this viewpoint, Dr Barclay surveys results from a recent randomized study assessing the efficacy of physiotherapy in patients with Parkinson disease.

Headlines: Novel Drug May Offer Hope in Prader-Willi Syndrome, Obesity
Teaser: Beloranib reduces weight and hyperphagia in Prader-Willi syndrome and may also hold promise for other severe obesity conditions, but first the company must     prove that it doesn't raise thrombotic risk.

Headlines: Primary Care Reaching Saturation Point in England
Teaser: Workloads increased 16% in 7 years, which may explain, in part, why burnout rates are so high among primary care physicians in the United Kingdom and the United States, experts said.

Headlines: FDA Okays Third, Gentler Form of Tenofovir for HIV (Descovy)
Teaser: The new drug is identical to Truvada except that tenofovir alafenamide replaces tenofovir disoproxil fumarate.

Headlines: Physician Aid in Dying: Oncologists Grapple With New Law
Teaser: California's new law allowing physician aid in dying opens access to one in 10 Americans to this end-of-life option, and oncologists are testing the waters.

Headlines: TAVR Superior to Surgery in Intermediate-Risk Patients: SAPIEN 3
Teaser: The results "are clinically meaningful and some of the best observed outcomes we've ever witnessed," said an expert. Another predicted that surgery "won't     be done much" in this population in the future.

Headlines: Bladder Preservation High With 'Trimodal' Cancer Therapy
Teaser: A trimodal treatment approach to localized bladder cancer using adaptive radiotherapy had high rates of bladder preservation and survival.

Headlines: From Vancouver, an Update on Multiple Sclerosis
Teaser: Drs Krieger and Fox review some of the trends and outcomes in multiple sclerosis research at the American Academy of Neurology (AAN) 2016 Annual Meeting in Vancouver.

Headlines: ASCO's TAPUR Study: Off-Label Drugs for Actionable Mutations
Teaser: Dr Edward Kim, a principal investigator in ASCO's TAPUR study, describes the trial's unique approach to evaluating the efficacy of targeted cancer therapies prescribed off-label.

Headlines: NICE Recommends Three Diabetes Treatments
Teaser: The National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) is issuing guidance recommending three existing drugs as individual treatments for type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: Nivolumab for Metastatic Melanoma
Teaser: This brief profile gives an overview of nivolumab, a human monoclonal antibody against PD-1 receptor, approved for treatment of unresectable or metastatic melanoma that is unresponsive to other drugs.

Headlines: Strain-time Curve Analysis by Echocardiography in CRT
Teaser: This echocardiographic study analyzed the contraction pattern of CRT patients with the aim of identifying predictors of non-response, despite favorable pre-procedural characteristics.

Headlines: CVD Risk Associated With Antidiabetic Drugs in T2D Patients
Teaser: Certain anti-diabetic drugs have been linked to an increased risk of cardiovascular disease, leading clinicians to weigh the risks and benefits.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Infarct Size and Outcomes Following Primary PCI
Teaser: This study looked at the prognostic value of infarct size in patients with ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction.

Source: Current Opinion in Nephrology and Hypertension
Headlines: Management of Bone Mineral Disorders in CKD and ESRD
Teaser: What are the latest developments in the management of mineral bone disorders in patients with CKD and ESRD? This new article summarizes the latest research.

Source: Annals of Clinical Microbiology and Antimicrobials
Headlines: Mortality Predictors of Staphylococcus aureus Bacteremia
Teaser: What factors might influence mortality and outcome in patients with S. aureus bacteremia?

Headlines: Ocular Hypertension Following Intravitreal Anti-VEGF Therapy
Teaser: Ocular hypertension can be a potential side effect of treatment with anti-VEGF agents. What role does intraocular nitric oxide have in the development of this complication?

Headlines: Do Ball-ended Probes Cause Less Damage Than Sharp Explorers?
Teaser: This study aimed to compare ultrastructural defects caused by ball-ended probes with damage by sharp explorers during tactile exams of primary teeth.

Headlines: Harness Patient Innovation to Make Big Data Useful
Teaser: Patients and families have valuable personal experience that, when aggregated, can help connect people and information and move science forward, said Presidential Adviser Claudia Williams.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Novo Nordisk Insulin-GLP-1 Combination, IDegLira
Teaser: The committee said that it was uncertain about which patients would most benefit from the combination.

Headlines: FDA Panel OKs Sanofi Insulin-GLP-1 Combo for Diabetes
Teaser: The committee was concerned about the pen injectors used to deliver the medication as well as the potential for allergic reactions.

Headlines: FDA Approves Afstyla for Adults, Children With Hemophilia A
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has approved Afstyla for adults and children with hemophilia A for routine prophylaxis and on-demand treatment of bleeding episodes.

Headlines: Second ESO Stroke Conference Gets Off to Flying Start
Teaser: A host of major new -- and possibly practice-changing -- randomized trials were presented at the first day of the European Stroke Organisation's second conference, being held in Barcelona this week.

Headlines: Chemo for Adult Sarcomas: Murky Data and Experts' Insights
Teaser: The paucity of data on the relative benefits of chemotherapy in adult soft-tissue sarcomas muddies the clinical decision-making waters, say sarcoma experts, who offer some advice, anyway.

Headlines: IPD Reoperation Rates Still Hamper Benefit in Spinal Stenosis
Teaser: The latest randomized trial again shows similar outcomes to surgery with a percutaneous interspinous process device in patients with lumbar spinal stenosis, but with increased reintervention.

Headlines: Women Aren’t Taking First Place in Top Medical Journals
Teaser: Women scientists get first author credit on medical studies much less often than their male coauthors. That has career implications and could even be skewing the study of women’s health.

Headlines: Gene Variant Tied to Lower Non-HDL-Cholesterol Levels, CAD Risk
Teaser: The ASGR1 mutation's benefit/risk ratio exceeded what would be predicted from its non-HDL-C effect, suggesting its protection "goes beyond the lowering of serum cholesterol," according to researchers.

Headlines: TAVR With Moderate Sedation Up, Results Better: US Registry
Teaser: Are gains due to less general anesthesia or to other progress in "minimalist" transcatheter aortic-valve replacement? Either way, TAVR outcomes are getting better with experience, experts say.

Headlines: Extended-Range Intraocular Lens Improves Visual Acuity
Teaser: An extended-range-of-vision intraocular lens improves visual acuity better than a monofocal intraocular lens, and is just as safe, new research shows.

Headlines: Drugs for Multiple Myeloma, Melanoma Approved in Europe
Teaser: The European approvals are for elotuzumab (multiple myeloma) and nivolumab in combination with ipilimumab (advanced melanoma).

Headlines: MS Drug Linked to Colorectal Cancer Risk
Teaser: Despite its cardiotoxicity -- and now possibly colorectal cancer risk -- mitoxantrone might still be an appropriate therapy in carefully selected patients, researchers say.

Headlines: Patient Input Evolves From Superficial to Scientific
Teaser: Patient input has evolved in recent years from a seat on a hospital committee to a measurable science that is steering major decisions in the future of medicine.

Headlines: LEADERS FREE: Adieu to Bare-Metal Stents for High-Bleed-Risk ACS
Teaser: Bare-metal stents should not be used for high-bleeding-risk ACS patients undergoing PCI, the authors say, but left unanswered is whether dual-antiplatelet     therapy can be cut short with drug-eluting stents.

Headlines: Relapses Rebound in Patients With MS Stopping Fingolimod
Teaser: As seen with natalizumab, a new study shows patients may experience rebound in relapses after stopping fingolimod.

Headlines: Where Cancer Care Falls Short, According to Patients
Teaser: Despite believing their medical care is excellent, US cancer patients often feel inadequately informed about a lot of things, according to new polling of 3000 adults with cancer.

Headlines: Giant Cell Arteritis: Ustekinumab Shows Activity in Early Trial
Teaser: Ustekinumab was associated with lower steroid doses in some patients with GCA and reduced arterial wall thickening.

Headlines: FDA OKs Buprenorphine Implant (Probuphine) for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: The new buprenorphine subdermal implant could be 'game changer' in the battle to combat opioid use disorder.

Headlines: Hormones, Metabolism, and Cancer Take Center Stage at ECE 2016
Teaser: Testosterone trials, new guidelines on adrenal incidentaloma, ovarian transplant, and the bionic pancreas are just a few of highlights at ECE 2016, appealing to clinicians         and research scientists alike.

Headlines: Urinary Studies to Monitor Bladder and Urological Diseases
