Teaser: The biomarkers contained in urine can provide important clues regarding the diagnosis and prognosis of urological diseases.

Headlines: Combo May Help Stave Off Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome
Teaser: Early intervention in the emergency department improves outcomes for patients with hypoxemia, who are at high risk for acute respiratory distress syndrome, new research shows.

Headlines: Communicating Statin Evidence to Support Shared Decisions
Teaser: This essay highlights the principles of evidence-informed shared decision-making in the context of statin guidelines, but is widely applicable to other clinical decisions.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Use of Antimuscarinic Medications in Individuals With OAB
Teaser: How prevalent is potentially inappropriate use of anticholinergic OAB medications? What impact does inappropriate use have on healthcare costs for older adults?

Headlines: IOP in the Fellow Eye After Glaucoma Surgery in One Eye
Teaser: How is intraocular pressure in the untreated fellow eye impacted after glaucoma surgery?

Headlines: PPIs, Elimination Diet, and/or Budesonide for EoE
Teaser: Do patients with eosinophilic esophagitis sustain remission from disease with PPIs, an elimination diet, and/or budesonide?

Headlines: Diagnosing Sepsis Is Subjective and Highly Variable
Teaser: What accounts for the variability in the diagnosis of severe sepsis -- and what approaches may help improve consistency?

Headlines: Tapering and Discontinuation of TNF-a Blockers in RA
Teaser: Can clinical and ultrasound-based remission be used to select patients with rheumatoid arthritis eligible to taper and discontinue TNF-a blockers?

Headlines: Light Alcohol Consumption: Predictor of Fatty Liver in MetS
Teaser: New research studies whether minimal alcohol intake is protective against fatty liver in women with metabolic syndrome.

Headlines: Precision Medicine and Research Ethics
Teaser: Precision medicine is improving through genetics and genomics research, but also raises new ethical challenges.

Headlines: How Precise Is Precision Medicine for Schizophrenia?
Teaser: While precision medicine has made great strides in other fields, such as oncology, its viability depends on identifying consistent biomarkers. Where do we stand on feasible targets in schizophrenia?

Headlines: Weight Loss Programs in People With Prediabetes
Teaser: Can programs such as Weight Watchers reduce weight among persons with prediabetes as effectively as an individual counseling program?

Headlines: Recent Advances in Status Epilepticus
Teaser: This review discusses advances in the understanding of the mechanisms of status epilepticus and its current treatment approaches.

Headlines: Biomarkers to Guide Clinical Therapeutics in Rheumatology?
Teaser: Better biomarkers are needed to guide clinical decision making in rheumatology.

Headlines: C. difficile Within and Outside Healthcare Settings
Teaser: This study compares the transmission rates of C. diff infection among patients in the hospital with persons in the community.

Headlines: A Treatment Vaccine for Low-Risk Prostate Cancer
Teaser: A planned phase 2 trial will test a PSA protein-based immunotherapeutic vaccine in men at the time of clinical presentation with early-stage prostate cancer.

Source: Plastic Reconstructive Surgery-Global Open (PRS Global Open)
Headlines: Inframammary Fold Reconstruction: A Biomechanical Analysis
Teaser: A head-to-head comparison of fixation methods for inframammary fold reconstruction found that an absorbable anchor system is biomechanically superior to the standard suture method.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: First-Pass Success in Pediatric Intubation in the ED
Teaser: Which factors may predict a successful first intubation attempt in children?

Headlines: SmartTouch Contact-Force Sensing Fails to Fire in AF Ablation
Teaser: Knowledge of contact-force sensing data did not improve paroxysmal atrial fibrillation outcomes, suggesting it may be time for new CF parameters, the     authors said.

Headlines: Global Vaccine Safety Assessment
Teaser: Vaccine safety research is a key component of effective, responsible and sustainable immunization programs. What are the challenges and benefits we are facing with vaccine safety research?

Headlines: Fracture Healing: An Overview of Existing Concepts
Teaser: Gain a better understanding of the fracture healing process -- and find out about the current options for managing patients with fractured bones.

Headlines: Neoadjuvant Chemoradiotherapy and Surgery in Rectal Cancer
Teaser: A longer waiting interval between the end of neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy and surgery may increase the rate of pathological complete response in rectal cancer.

Headlines: Guidelines for the Management of Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: The management of neuropathic pain can be challenging. Are these guidelines any help in optimizing patient care?

Headlines: Guided Tapering of Antidepressants During Pregnancy
Teaser: Is guided tapering of SSRIs with concurrent preventive cognitive therapy feasible as an alternative to continuation of SSRIs during pregnancy?

Headlines: Repetitive TMS May Help Core Features of Autism
Teaser: Repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation, known to be successful in refractory depression, can ameliorate some core features of autism, new research shows.

Headlines: Personalized Medicine Delivers Better Outcomes: More Proof
Teaser: A large meta-analysis found that a personalized strategy was an independent predictor of improved outcomes even in phase 1 trials.

Headlines: Endoscopic Advances and the Microbiome Featured at DDW 2016
Teaser: Sessions on full-thickness endoscopic resection and the use of fecal microbiota transplantation in patients with ulcerative colitis will be among the presentations at Digestive Disease Week 2016.

Headlines: 'Moderate' Drinking Linked to LV Dysfunction in HTN Patients
Teaser: One to two alcoholic drinks a day was enough to worsen the risk of left ventricular diastolic dysfunction in people with hypertension but no history of alcohol addiction, in a study conducted in Italy.

Headlines: Positive Topline Results for Military-Related PTSD Drug
Teaser: Reformulated cyclobenzaprine taken sublingually at bedtime appears to significantly reduce  military-related PTSD symptoms, a phase 2 study shows.

Headlines: Big Difference in Colorectal Cancer on Right vs Left Side
Teaser: A new analysis shows a big difference in colorectal cancer when it occurs on the right side compared with the left side, with implications for treatment.

Headlines: Genome Association of Anti-TNF Response in Patients With RA
Teaser: Can genetic biomarkers predict anti-TNF response in RA patients?

Headlines: Non-COPD Lung Disease Still Spells Trouble for Smokers
Teaser: Even when lung function does not meet criteria for COPD, smokers can still have functional impairment and exacerbations.

Headlines: AVERT Device Cuts Contrast-Agent Use at PCI, Renal Benefit Unsure
Teaser: Sparing use of contrast agent is a cath-quality metric, but a 15% drop didn't mean less contrast-induced kidney injury; it may take a steeper cut to show clinical benefit, propose researchers.

Headlines: Just 2 Years of Tamoxifen Ups Breast Cancer Survival
Teaser: For premenopausal women with primary breast cancer, taking tamoxifen for only 2 years is better than not taking it at all, according to a Swedish study.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Continuous Estrogen Plus Progestin and Endometrial Cancer
Teaser: Does addition of progestin to estrogen therapy really reduce risk of endometrial cancer? Find the answer here.

Headlines: Alginate vs Placebo as Add-on Therapy in Reflux Patients
Teaser: Can alginate reduce persistent reflux symptoms despite treatment with once-daily PPI?

Headlines: Acquired Resistance in Lung Cancer: When to Switch Agents
Teaser: Rociletinib and osimertinib appear to be on the verge of approval. Dr Mark Kris discusses how their arrival may affect clinical decisions at the time of acquired resistance in lung cancer.

Headlines: What Is the Current Value of Fitness Trackers?
Teaser: Dr Greg Weidner suggests that urging patients to use wearable health trackers could motivate them to better health because it's a social activity.

Headlines: The Perils of Reliance on Industry Funding of Medical Research
Teaser: As the incremental benefits of new therapies diminish, perhaps the next big innovation in cardiovascular medicine is basic lifestyle changes. But     how will we know if no one funds that research, argues Dr Mandrola.

Headlines: Four Major Neurology Updates
Teaser: Dr Merino discusses hot topics at this year's AAN meeting.

Headlines: TAF/FTC Approved: Benefits and Limitations in Clinical Practice
Teaser: Dr Paul Sax talks about the recent FDA approval of the third tenofovir alafenamide coformulation for the treatment of HIV, and discusses circumstances in which it should be used with caution.

Headlines: HER2+ Colorectal Cancer: Slicing the Pie Into Curable Portions
Teaser: Dr John Marshall views a study of dual targeting in HER2+ CRC as an argument for combining broad molecular testing and precision medicine to slice the cancer pie into curable portions.

Headlines: EP by the Bay: San Francisco Hosts HRS 2016
Teaser: Only one city, but all of cardiac electrophysiology starting May 4, including an invited speaker the Heart Rhythm Society wants as a muse in confronting     its "most important education challenge."

Headlines: The Brave New World of Biosimilars
Teaser: The FDA answers Medscape's questions about biosimilars: how they are defined, evaluated, approved, and regulated.

Headlines: Psoriasis, Obesity, and Diabetes May Share Genetic Link
Teaser: A Danish twins study has found a strong association between psoriasis, type 2 diabetes, and obesity, with some indication there may be a modest genetic     link between the three.

Headlines: Are All Relationships With Industry Inherently Bad?
Teaser: Is the growing backlash that physicians and trialists face in their relationships with industry warranted in all cases?

Headlines: Yoga vs Standard Care for Schizophrenia
Teaser: Is yoga effective in the treatment of schizophrenia?

Headlines: Radiofrequency Ablation in Patients With Barrett Esophagus
Teaser: Is radiofrequency ablation considered to be a safe and effective treatment for patients with Barrett esophagus with low-grade dysplasia, and does it prevent progression to esophageal cancer?

Headlines: 5 Key Ophthalmology Takeaways: ASCRS 2016
Teaser: Attendees in New Orleans were greeted with innovative theories and technologies that may change our treatment of glaucoma, cataracts, corneal ectasia, and other ophthalmic conditions.

Headlines: Improving Drug Trials: Lessons Learned From Aripiprazole
Teaser: Dr Lieberman discusses the FDA's recent warning about the side effects of aripiprazole, what we can learn from this, and how we can better manage a new drug's uncertain potential in the future.

Headlines: NOACs Best Warfarin in Mortality Meta-analysis
Teaser: Dr Goldhaber comments on a study that shows a lower risk for early mortality in patients who took NOACs compared with those who took warfarin.

Headlines: Toward a Salivary Biomarker for Huntington Disease
Teaser: A new study assesses the potential of a peripheral biomarker for Huntington disease.

Headlines: What Is Compassion in Healthcare?
Teaser: Investigators ask cancer patients to define compassion, with a goal of perhaps using the findings to screen clinicians for compassion and challenging educational systems to offer training in compassion.

Headlines: How Pill Color Affects Drug Adherence
Teaser: From the AAN Annual Meeting, Medscape speaks with Dr Tricia Ting about her study exploring the influence of pill color on medication adherence.

Headlines: Making Sense of Information Overload
Teaser: Drs Harrington and Butte discuss the overwhelming amount of data generated in contemporary healthcare and how it can be harnessed to deliver precision medicine.

Headlines: AF Ablation at HRS: Two Stars Fade and One Shines
Teaser: Three late-breaking clinical trials at the Heart Rhythm Society (HRS) 2016 Scientific Sessions on contact-force catheters, FIRM ablation, and reisolation     of pulmonary veins may change AF ablation strategies. Dr Mandrola reviews.

Headlines: Hypertension in Elderly Patients: Treating the Individual
Teaser: Drs Black and Materson discuss the special considerations required in prescribing antihypertensive drugs to elderly patients -- a far from homogenous group.

Headlines: Medicine's Future, From a Leader in Genome Editing and Stem Cells
Teaser: Eric Topol speaks with Chad Cowan, of the Harvard Stem Cell Institute, about how regenerative medicine may soon cure diseases like type 1 diabetes and Parkinson disease.

Headlines: Should the FDA Rush Drug Approvals When Patients Demand It?
Teaser: Patients insist that eteplirsen improves mobility in Duchenne muscular dystrophy. The FDA has refused to approve it prematurely. An ethicist says that a compromise is still possible.

Headlines: New (and Cheaper) HCV Therapy: Option for HIV Coinfection?
Teaser: A recently approved once-daily combination product for HCV offers a new option for coinfected patients. Dr Paul Sax compares it, and its price, with existing therapy.

Headlines: Dean Ornish on Love and Connection (the Touchy-Feely Stuff)
Teaser: Dr Dean Ornish discusses what he considers the most important and least understood part of lifestyle medicine--the power of love and connection.

Headlines: Corneal Crosslinking: Advancing the Treatment of Keratoconus
Teaser: Corneal transplantation has been the only curative treatment for progressive keratoconus until now. Drs Rapuano and Feldman discuss a newly approved treatment option that is available.

Headlines: Added Benefits Seen With Early Initiation of Anti-VEGF Agents for Diabetic Retinopathy
Teaser: Dr Charles C. Wykoff reviews recent data showing that more timely treatment has a significant upside.

Headlines: Metformin and Insulin Combo Cuts Mortality in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: Patients with type 2 diabetes treated with the combination of insulin and metformin have a reduced risk for mortality and major adverse cardiac events vs     insulin alone.

Headlines: Bone Changes After Bisphosphonate Therapy 'Drug Holiday'
Teaser: Understanding the bone changes that occur after discontinuing bisphosphonate therapy for osteoporosis may help clinicians decide the optimal time to resume treatment.

Headlines: Compounded Non-FDA-approved Menopausal Hormone Therapy
Teaser: What is compounded hormone therapy, are there specific risks with it, and how often is it being prescribed for menopausal women?

Headlines: 'Right to Try' Bill in Senate for Terminally Ill Patients
Teaser: A new bill introduced in the Senate is designed to increase access to experimental drugs for dying patients and circumvent the FDA.

Headlines: AACE Celebrates Silver Anniversary With Golden Program
Teaser: Speakers from 1991 will revisit topics from past to present to future; other highlights include new obesity guidelines, diabetes technology, transgender     medicine, and help on new payment models.

Headlines: Is Surgery Needed for Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer?
Teaser: The debate is perhaps less important than treating many more patients with curative intent than is currently done.

Headlines: Physical Exercise May Improve Depression in Teens
Teaser: A systematic review and analysis of 11 studies shows that physical exercise appears to improve depressive symptoms in adolescents.

Headlines: Adjuvant Whole-Brain Radiotherapy: End of an Era?
Teaser: Updated data from the N0574 study confirm no improvement in overall survival but greater cognitive deterioration with adjunct whole-brain radiotherapy in patients with one to three brain metastases.

Headlines: Use Nonfasting Blood for Routine Lipid Profiles, Says EAS/EFLM
Teaser: Although US guidelines write that a fasting sample is preferred, "I would argue that all of us are saying very close to the same thing. It really does     depend on the question you're asking," says one expert.

Headlines: Concussion Biomarker Useful Up to 7 Days After Injury
Teaser: A new study has been described as a 'substantial step' toward validation and ultimate clinical usefulness of two biomarkers for mild traumatic brain injury

Headlines: Researchers Make Progress in Unraveling Uveal Melanoma
Teaser: Two studies from the University of Miami Miller School of Medicine shed light on physiological and genetic factors associated with uveal melanoma (UM).

Headlines: ToxT Adds Time Dimension to Assess AEs of Cancer Treatment
Teaser: A new analytic approach, known as Toxicity over Time (ToxT), incorporates the dimension of time into adverse event reporting in oncology clinical trials.

Headlines: VANISH: Ablation for Recurrent VT Bests Intensified Amiodarone
Teaser: UPDATED // Catheter ablation reduced the primary outcome compared with aggressive drug therapy and should be the preferred treatment in this population, the authors     said.

Headlines: Antibiotic Trials for COPD in Spotlight at Thoracic Meeting
Teaser: The role of antibiotics in COPD and an endobronchial coil to help patients with advanced emphysema will be among the findings featured at the American Thoracic Society 2016 International Conference.

Headlines: FDA Panel: Physician Opioid Training Should Be Mandatory
Teaser: A 2-day FDA advisory panel meeting this week focused on ways to modify the opioid analgesic Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategies.

Headlines: Patients' Own Health Assessment Gaining Importance in Treatment
Teaser: As patient-centered medical care has taken hold in recent years, there’s a growing interest in finding ways to use outcomes reported by individuals to help guide care.

Headlines: Food: The Main Course to Wellness and Illness in IBS
Teaser: How will dietary treatments for IBS evolve in the future? This new article takes a look at "functional foods" and their role in alleviating symptoms of the syndrome in patients.

Headlines: $5 Japanese Toy May Change Male Infertility Testing
Teaser: UPDATED WITH VIDEO Clipping a small magnifying glass onto a smartphone's camera makes it a powerful microscope that could be used by men with fertility issues in the privacy of their own homes.

Headlines: PCI Quality Initiative Cuts Bivalirudin Use, Cost, and Bleeding
Teaser: "Perhaps more important, by using a risk-directed approach to coronary intervention, we were able to cut our bleeding rate nearly in half," the study     author stressed.

Headlines: Consensus Report: Osteoporosis Meds Okay for Fracture Patients
Teaser: Osteoporosis medications can be safely given as soon as possible in patients with both vertebral and nonvertebral fractures, concludes a new consensus     report from International Osteoporosis Foundation.

Headlines: Therapeutic Substitution Could Save Nearly 10% in Drug Costs
Teaser: In just 2 years, 'branded drug overuse' cost the US healthcare system an extra $73 billion, but physicians are increasingly in favor of generics, new studies showed.

Headlines: BRAF Inhibitor Improves Radiosurgery Outcomes in Melanoma
Teaser: BRAF-carrying patients with melanoma and brain metastases treated with BRAF inhibitors and SRS show improved survival, but timing of treatment matters.

Headlines: Persistent Diabetic Macular Edema: Converting Eyes to Aflibercept
Teaser: In patients with persistent diabetic macular edema, switching from an older VEGF inhibitor to a newer one may improve outcomes. Conversion to aflibercept     may now be another option.

Headlines: 'Major' Ketamine Discovery May Lead to New Antidepressants
Teaser: A 'major' discovery that explains how ketamine produces its swift antidepressant effect may lead to the development of rapid-onset agents that have none of the harms typically linked to the drug.

Headlines: Parkinson's Cell Transplant Shows Good Reinnervation at 24 Years
Teaser: A postmortem report showing transplanted dopaminergic cells survived for almost a quarter of a century provides hope for future stem cell therapy, researchers say.

Headlines: Risk Profiles, PCI Outcomes Worse in Younger Women Than Men
Teaser: "The study gives an insight into the risk profile in young women compared with men, and an insight into how we as clinicians are making decisions," especially about antiplatelet therapy, researchers say.

Source: Cancer Control: Journal of the Moffitt Cancer Center
Headlines: Prognostication of Survival in Patients With Advanced Cancer
Teaser: Prediction of survival in advanced cancer is often overestimated. Which methods predict survival more accurately?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Should TAVR Be Performed in Nonagenarians?
Teaser: An increasing number of nonagenarians present with severe aortic stenosis. Can they benefit from transcatheter aortic valve replacement?

Headlines: Efficacy of PPIs in Patients With Esophageal Eosinophilia
Teaser: Do proton pump inhibitors induce clinicohistologic remission in patients with symptomatic esophageal eosinophilia?

Headlines: Pharmacotherapies in Cardiac Critical Care
Teaser: What do we know about the currently available sedative and analgesic agents for pediatric cardiac ICU patients?

Headlines: Immunohistochemistry to Predict Anti-PD1/PDL1 Activity
Teaser: Which patients with lung cancer will respond to anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapies?

Headlines: LAA Excision Disappoints in Persistent-AF Surgical Ablation
Teaser: After posting positive benefits in long-standing persistent AF, left atrial appendage excision failed to reduce AF recurrence in persistent AF, but experts viewed the data warily.

Headlines: Placental Morphology May Identify Specific Stillbirth Causes
Teaser: Can quantitative analysis of different aspects of placental structure, such as syncytial nuclear aggregates, proliferative cells, and blood vessels, help determine causes of stillbirth?

Headlines: New Acute, Chronic HF Guidelines Debut at ESC Heart Failure 2016
Teaser: The art of medicine as it applies to heart failure will be on display in Florence for 4 days, as new European guidelines debut with fanfare along with     thousands of research presentations.

Headlines: 'Promising' Cell-Therapy Trials for Clinical CAD Halted Early
Teaser: RENEW's plug was pulled for financial reasons, not safety or efficacy issues, say researchers, or it might have led to a groundbreaking US approval; hopes for it and the ATHENA trials had been high.

Headlines: EU Regulators OK Two Hepatitis C Drugs, One for All Genotypes
Teaser: Both drugs achieve high cure rates in 12 weeks without requiring concomitant use of interferon, known for its harsh adverse events.

Headlines: FDA Approves Daclizumab (Zinbryta) for Multiple Sclerosis
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has approved daclizumab for treatment of patients with MS who are not responsive to other agents; the approval comes with a Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy.

Headlines: What's Hot at ASCO 2016?
Teaser: Continuing excitement over immunotherapy and new research on precision medicine are among the highlights. Come and visit Medscape at booth 6053.

Headlines: EMA Launches Major Review After Fatal French Drug Trial
Teaser: The agency will review existing guidelines for first-in-human clinical trials with the aim of identifying areas that need revision, with the ultimate goal of making the trials safer.

Headlines: EU Says No to Myeloma Drug, But Likes Cancer Generics
Teaser: Ixazomib was recently approved in the United States for use in relapsed and/or refractory multiple myeloma, but a European review panel did not see enough evidence of benefit.

Headlines: Tools Refined to Assess Catastrophizing in Chronic Pain
Teaser: The response to a key catastrophizing measure can predict the risk for opioid misuse, a new study suggests.

Headlines: RELAX-REPEAT: Multiple Doses of Serelaxin Safe, Tolerable for CHF
Teaser: The study "speaks to the question surrounding the serelaxin program: is it possible for a 48-hour infusion of an acute therapy to actually have long-term     benefits?" noted one expert.

Headlines: Stem Cells, B Cells, and T Cells in Focus at CMSC
Teaser: Presentations at the upcoming Consortium of Multiple Sclerosis Centers meeting will also shed light on working with patients using alternative treatments, such as medical marijuana and dietary supplements.

Headlines: High-Dose EPO Not Neuroprotective in Very Preterm Infants
Teaser: High-dose erythropoietin given to very preterm infants does not improve neurodevelopmental outcomes by age 2 years, according to a new randomized clinical trial.

Headlines: Mobile Technology and the Digitization of Healthcare
Teaser: Which digital devices are helping to solve clinical problems? How will patients use and engage with these devices? These and other questions on the future of mHealth are addressed in this article.

Headlines: Deoxyribonuclease I in End-stage Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: Might the endonuclease DNase 1 be a beneficial treatment for severe cognitive impairment in Alzheimer disease? The response in this patient was very encouraging.

Headlines: Coronary CTA for Identifiying Ischemia-Causing Lesions
Teaser: Utilizing coronary CTA, this study examined the relationship between coronary plaque volumes and lesion-specific ischemia.

Headlines: Promising Oral Compounds for the Treatment of MS
Teaser: What new agents are under investigation for the treatment of MS? This review highlights promising oral compounds and dietary factors that are in the early development stages.

Headlines: Amyloid Biomarkers: Pushing the Limits of Early Detection
Teaser: Recent studies involving amyloid biomarkers are yielding important insights into the dynamics of Alzheimer's disease, as well as revolutionizing the design of clinical trials.

Headlines: Infection Control in Implantation of CIEDs
Teaser: CIED-related infection can be a devastating complication of this procedure. This review presents the current evidence for perioperative prophylaxis and protocols for infection control.

Headlines: Lung Cancer Sessions Focus on Immunotherapy, Genomics
Teaser: From diagnosis using molecular markers to targeted treatment, Dr Mark Kris details which studies from ASCO 2016 he thinks will help clinicians and patients fight lung cancer.

Headlines: Encouraging News for Patients on TNF Inhibitors
Teaser: Dr Jonathan Kay reviews a recent analysis of Scandinavian registry data from more than 100,000 patients.

Headlines: We All Have Hearts -- Let's Help Them Work
Teaser: Drs Black and Borer talk about the main issues in clinical cardiology and the need for prevention, more research, and new knowledge.

Headlines: Why We Need Racial Diversity in Clinical Trials
Teaser: Patients deserve information that allows them to predict how new therapies for menopausal symptoms will perform in women like themselves, Dr Kaunitz says.

Headlines: A Primer on Smoking Cessation in Primary Care
Teaser: What are the most effective techniques to help today's smokers to quit?

Headlines: Left Ventricular Heart Failure and Pulmonary Hypertension
Teaser: This review examines the complex pathophysiology of pulmonary hypertension as it relates to left ventricular heart failure. What are the diagnostic pitfalls, and current therapeutic options?

Headlines: 'Think Different' About Clinical Cancer Research
Teaser: In the wake of Vice President Biden's talk at ASCO 2016, Dr David Graham suggests a new approach to collect data at the point of care to guide future clinical cancer treatments.

Headlines: Astrovirus MLB2, a New Gastroenteric Virus
Teaser: Find out the role next-generation sequencing played in identifying these cases of astrovirus MLB2 infection.

Headlines: Cabozantinib a Possible New Standard in Second-line Metastatic RCC
Teaser: Dr David Graham reviews the METEOR trial in metastatic renal cell carcinoma, one of the most important studies on genitourinary malignancies presented at ASCO 2016.

Headlines: Cancer Moonshot Effort Unveils Dozens of Initiatives
Teaser: Federal officials outlined plans to collaborate more with the private sector in an acknowledgment that government funding would not be enough.

Headlines: Midostaurin Works in Advanced Systemic Mastocytosis
Teaser: Desperately needed treatment for advanced systemic mastocytosis seems to have been found in the investigational multikinase inhibitor, midostaurin.

Headlines: Zika Vaccine Clinical Trials to Start in Humans This Month
Teaser: A Zika virus DNA vaccine has entered phase 1 testing in humans, and two other Zika vaccines that protected mice from infection after a single dose are heading for human studies this year.

Headlines: Psychosis Induced by Amphetamines
Teaser: Recent studies on amphetamine-induced psychosis provide updated knowledge about precipitating factors, the complex relationship between amphetamine-induced and primary psychosis, and treatment.

Headlines: Identifying Migraine 'Protectors'
Teaser: A new data platform creates individual profiles aiming to identify which factors trigger migraine headaches, and which may protect against them.

Headlines: All Eyes at Optometry's Meeting Will Be On Buzz Aldrin
Teaser: Moon-walking astronaut Buzz Aldrin will kick off the 5-day event celebrating the best of science, education, and the practice of optometry.

Headlines: As Little as a Free Meal Influences Prescribing, Data Suggest
Teaser: Physicians who accept a free meal from a drug company appeared more likely to prescribe the promoted, brand-name drug instead of a less expensive, generic drug, new data showed.

Headlines: Can Patients Discontinue Immunotherapy and Still Benefit?
Teaser: Overall, there are few data on whether to and when to discontinue immunotherapy, but clues from trials show continued benefit.

Headlines: Insulin-Statin-PCSK9 Links Point to New Treatment Horizons
Teaser: An intricate dance with the PCSK9 molecule played out by statins, diabetes, and risk markers may explain the prowess of evolocumab and alirocumab on LDL-C     and points to a hypothetical use for the agents.

Headlines: Single Rituximab Injection Delays RA in High-Risk Patients
Teaser: A single infusion of the anti-CD20 antibody rituximab, intended to deplete the B-cell population, delays the onset of rheumatoid arthritis in high-risk patients, results from the PRAIRI study suggest.

Headlines: New Tool Predicts Cancer Patient Survival Time
Teaser: A new statistical method provides useful information for estimating how long a cancer patient may survive.

Headlines: Empagliflozin Slows Progression of Renal Disease in Diabetes
Teaser: The long-awaited renal outcomes from the EMPA-REG trial with the SGLT-2 inhibitor for type 2 diabetes, empagliflozin indicate that the drug slows     progression to kidney disease.

Headlines: Unprecedented, But Puzzling, Results in Advanced Sarcoma
Teaser: In soft tissue sarcoma, the investigational antibody olaratumab improved overall survival by a large margin and progression-free survival by a considerably smaller margin, which is unusual.

Headlines: NYU Studies Stopped After 'Violations' Exposed, PI Resigns
Teaser: The New York University School of Medicine has shuttered eight studies of an experimental marijuana-like drug, resulting in the resignation of the principal investigator, the New York Times reports.

Headlines: How Is Empagliflozin Working in Type 2 Diabetes in EMPA-REG?
Teaser: Theories abound as to the mechanisms by which empagliflozin is reducing cardiovascular death and renal events in the EMPA-REG OUTCOME study; some of these     were outlined at the recent ADA conference.

Headlines: Diabetes: Confronting the 'Invisible' Disease
Teaser: Eight million Americans have diabetes and don't know it. How can we persuade the public, the government, and the scientific community to focus on this invisible epidemic?

Headlines: TAUSSIG Hints at Fewer CV Events on Evolocumab in Homozygous FH
Teaser: No control group, but also no deaths and only four CV events in 1.7 years in 106 patients on the PCSK9 inhibitor. "Which is remarkable" in HoFH, says a     researcher; still, all urge caution interpreting the results.

Headlines: Bugs in the GI Tract: The Microbiome's Link to Diabetes
Teaser: Is the microbiome the next frontier in diabetes prevention and control?

Headlines: Immunotherapy 'Plus': Adding Radiation and Chemo to Immune Therapies
Teaser: As data on single-agent immunotherapies mature, oncologists are beginning to turn their attention to combination approaches.

Headlines: Cancer Moonshot: We Have Liftoff
Teaser: Initial reaction to the Moonshot ranged from cynicism to guarded optimism, but no one denies that momentum is building for this national cancer initiative -- and Big Data are the rocket boosters.

Headlines: Trastuzumab Biosimilar: An Understudy Waits in the Wings
Teaser: Drs Miller and Rugo talk about the trastuzumab biosimilar and what it could mean for patient care worldwide, the lessons from a failed vaccine study, and a practice change that can prevent stomatitis.

Headlines: Emerging Therapies for Metastatic Breast Cancer
Teaser: Therapeutic options are set to increase for patients with refractory HR-positive or HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer, as evidenced by presentations at ASCO 2016.

Headlines: Will Organs on Chips Revolutionize Drug Trials?
Teaser: Organ-on-chip technology has the potential to save drug developers time and money (and also help personalize medicine).

Headlines: Novel Treatment Options Explored at EULAR Congress
Teaser: Alternative therapies for rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis, and systemic lupus erythematosus will be presented at the upcoming European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR) Congress 2016.

Headlines: Calling All Twentysomethings: Your DNA Could Help Cure Disease
Teaser: Dr Jonathan Kay discusses the importance of biobanks in advancing basic science research and the need for more and younger people to provide samples.

Headlines: Mayo Clinic Gets $142 Million for Precision Medicine Biobank
Teaser: The US President's plan to build the world's biggest biobank of data and specimens for widely shared science is being launched at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota.

Headlines: Saturday at ASCO: Liquid Biopsy Matches Tissue Biopsy
Teaser: The results from a 'liquid biopsy' measuring circulating tumor DNA in blood matched up to these from conventional tissue biopsies.

Headlines: One-Hour Window for hs-Troponin MI Rule-out Backed in Studies
Teaser: They bolster new European guidelines for such very early rule-out decisions based on hs-Tn and should inspire US clinicians, who still are waiting for the high-sensitivity tests to be approved.

Headlines: VP Biden Addresses Oncologists, Urges Collaboration
Teaser: Speaking at the annual ASCO meeting, Vice President Joe Biden urged oncologists and researchers to collaborate with their peers and share data.

Headlines: Early Removal of Nanostim Leadless Pacemaker Appears Safe
Teaser: "It's even easier to retrieve the device than implant it," the author said.

Headlines: Evidence Backing Approval of Drug for Alcohol Misuse 'Weak'
Teaser: An in-depth look at studies on the alcohol-dependence drug nalmefene raises questions about efficacy and the approval process, researchers say.

Headlines: Duodenal Mucosal Resurfacing Shows Early Promise in Diabetes
Teaser: If these findings are reproduced in larger studies, clinicians may someday be able to offer certain diabetic patients this minimally invasive treatment     rather than gastric-bypass surgery.

Headlines: Bill Gates, Jennifer Doudna Will Take Podium at ASM Microbe
Teaser: More than 10,000 delegates are expected at the American Society for Microbiology (ASM) Microbe 2016 conference, where Bill Gates and DNA-editing revolutionary Jennifer Doudna will take the stage.

Headlines: FDA Simplifies Compassionate Use Application and Drug Costs
Teaser: The new form should take physicians far less time to fill out, the agency says. The FDA also issues guidance on costs for the drugs.

Headlines: 8 Controversies in Bipolar Disorder Addressed
Teaser: Drs Ghaemi and Strakowski discuss eight controversies surrounding the diagnosis and management of bipolar disorder.

Headlines: Cancer Drug Global Sales Grow, But 'Tension in the System'
Teaser: An unprecedented and sustained surge in innovative oncology therapeutics reaching the market is creating challenges for health systems and oncologists.

Source: Current Opinion in Nephrology and Hypertension
Headlines: New Strategies to Tackle Diabetic Kidney Disease
Teaser: Find out about the new therapeutic options for diabetic kidney disease. What is working and which new treatments are on the horizon?

Headlines: Valeant Psoriasis Drug's Suicide Risk Hard to Assess -FDA Staff
Teaser: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc's experimental drug to treat psoriasis carries a potential risk of suicide that is challenging to assess due to limited data, a preliminary review by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Friday.

Headlines: Apixaban Effective, Safe in AF with Declining Renal Function
Teaser: Renal function declined in 13.6% of atrial-fibrillation patients over time, prompting one expert to call for experts to serve as a "hovering cloud" to address inpatient direct oral anticoagulant concerns.

Headlines: HF With 'Recovered' LVEF: Distinct, Deserves More Scrutiny
Teaser: "A new phenotype of heart failure has emerged," say expert observers of an analysis pointing to unique outomes in treated outpatients with ejection fractions that had risen from 40% or lower to >40%.

Headlines: Juno's CAR T-Cell Study Restarts, Without Fludarabine
Teaser: The clinical trial was halted after two patients died, but the deaths were related to the use of fludarabine in the preconditioning regimen.

Headlines: Ipilimumab Shows Impressive Activity After HSCT Failure
Teaser: In patients with hematologic malignancies, ipilimumab, the CTLA4 inhibitor, showed impressive responses after disease relapse following allogeneic transplant.

Headlines: D-Cycloserine Augmentation Ineffective in Pediatric OCD
Teaser: Contrary to earlier findings, D-cycloserine administered before CBT sessions does not boost the efficacy of CBT in children and adolescents with OCD, a large randomized controlled trial shows.

Headlines: Biosimilar to Humira Recommended by FDA Panel
Teaser: The FDA's Arthritis Advisory Committee voted unanimously to recommend licensure of ABP 501 as a biosimilar product to US-licensed Humira (adalimumab).

Headlines: Variable LDL-C Tied to Worse Memory-Test Scores, MRI Findings
Teaser: The study adds to "emerging evidence that vascular factors are of importance to brain health and underscores that LDL-C variability might be a useful risk marker,"   the lead author says.

Headlines: NIH's Fauci on Combating Zika
Teaser: The number of travel-related cases is growing, and public health officials -- especially in states such as Florida -- predict it is only a matter of time until the first locally transmitted case is confirmed.

Headlines: 'Visionary' Psychiatrist New NIMH Director
Teaser: Joshua Gordon, MD, PhD, is a 'visionary psychiatrist and neuroscientist with deep experience in mental health research and practice,' the NIH says.

Headlines: New Data Shine a Light on Liver Disease
Teaser: A roundup of the most impactful research on nonalcoholic fatty liver disease, chronic cholestatic liver diseases, and hepatotoxicity, as presented at this year's Digestive Disease Week.

Headlines: A Game Changer in the Treatment of Dry Eye
Teaser: Drs Rapuano and Nagra from Wills Eye discuss the recently approved drug lifitegrast (Xiidra), the only one indicated to treat the signs and symptoms of dry eye, and a promising new option for patients.

Headlines: Genomics Project Heralds Democratization of Cancer Research
Teaser: A direct-to-patient nationwide study requesting saliva, tissue samples, and input from patients is setting a new direction for cancer research, in sync with goals of the cancer Moonshot initiative.

Headlines: CAR T-Cell Leukemia Trial Put on Hold After Two Deaths
Teaser: The deaths in Juno Therapeutics' ROCKET trial are blamed on neurotoxicity stemming from the addition of fludarabine to the preconditioning regimen.

Headlines: Blockbuster Hopes Grow for Ablynx Arthritis Drug Backed by Abbvie
Teaser: Ablynx's hopes for a potential multibillion-dollar drug were boosted on Thursday by strong clinical trial results in rheumatoid arthritis, vindicating a $175 million bet placed on the product by U.S. pharma group AbbVie in 2013.

Headlines: New Devices Will 'Revolutionize' T1 Diabetes Care
Teaser: The complex ritual of dosing insulin will be vastly simplified with the impending arrival of closed-loop systems, better known as 'artificial pancreas.

Headlines: Titanic Shift in Attitude Anticipated at AIDS 2016
Teaser: Since the International AIDS Conference was last held in South Africa, politics have caught up to science, and access to treatment and prevention will now be on the agenda.

Headlines: Serial BMD Tests Show Osteoporosis-Drug Effects, Fracture Risk
Teaser: "The important thing is there is value in doing some repeat testing [of bone-mineral density] in women receiving treatment" for osteoporosis, according to     the lead researcher.

Headlines: CV Care for the Patient With HIV: What You Need to Know
Teaser: Cardiovascular disease is becoming the leading cause of morbidity and mortality for patients infected with HIV. Learn what you need to know to care for patients.

Headlines: Treating Early Psychosis in the 'Real World'
Teaser: Four experts discuss how a new community-based treatment program can successfully help manage patients with first-episode psychosis.

Headlines: Ten Years of Safe Protection From Cancer: The HPV Vaccine
Teaser: Ten years ago, the first vaccine to prevent cancer was licensed.

Headlines: Will Real-World 'Bias' of Big Data Improve Cancer Care?
Teaser: Drs Kathy Miller and Peter Yu discuss how big data can complement the evidence derived from clinical trials, and why the 'bias' of big data is a valuable reflection of real-world practice.

Headlines: Does Too Much Sleep Increase Diabetes Risk?
Teaser: For the last 30 years scientists have been telling us that not getting enough sleep may be a cause of type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: Regulatory Endpoints for Approval: ORR, OS, or PFS?
Teaser: Has the recent move toward accepting objective response rates as an  endpoint in oncology trials been a success?

Headlines: Two Drugs 'Graduate' From Novel I-SPY 2 Breast Cancer Trial
Teaser: A novel trial design, the I-SPY 2 collaboration, predicts that neratinib and veliparib-carboplatin will be successful in phase 3, but questions remain about endpoints.

Headlines: Expensive Eye Meds Cost Medicare ‘Billions’
Teaser: Many U.S. ophthalmologists are prescribing expensive eye medications for Medicare patients despite evidence that a lower cost drug may be just as effective, researchers report.

Headlines: 'Can Do' Collaborations Speed Progress in GI Cancers
Teaser: Dr John Marshall reports on two initiatives that harness the collective efforts of advocacy groups, academic researchers, and industry to advance research in GI cancers.

Headlines: What Is Chromosome 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome?
Teaser: Dr Donna McDonald-McGinn discusses how research into this microdeletion syndrome is shining a light on related conditions like autism, schizophrenia, and congenital heart disease.

Headlines: Are You (True or False) Positive That It's Recurrent PCa?
Teaser: Accuracy may be an issue with a new radioactive diagnostic agent used to evaluate men suspected of recurrent prostate cancer.

Headlines: Vemurafenib Shows Activity in Refractory Thyroid Cancer
Teaser: The  BRAF inhibitor has shown activity in patients with papillary thyroid cancer with BRAF mutations refractory to radioactive iodine.

Headlines: GLP-1 Agonist Lixisenatide (Adlyxin)    Okayed for T2DM in US
Teaser: The latest GLP-1 agonist for the treatment of type 2 diabetes to gain approval in the US is lixisenatide; it's already approved under the brand name     Lyxumia in more than 60 countries.

Headlines: No Confusion: Alcohol Causes Seven Cancers
Teaser: A new literature review reaffirms alcohol as a cause of cancer and discusses why there is 'confusion' about this relationship.

Headlines: Costs of Treating Blood Disorders Explored
Teaser: The costs of treating hematologic malignancies and nonmalignant blood disorders are similar, but there is substantial variation in direct healthcare costs between countries.

Headlines: Robot vs Human Prostatectomy: It's a Tie, at Least So Far
Teaser: Early results showed no significant oncologic or functional differences at 12 weeks, including return of early urinary and sexual function.

Headlines: New Checklist Tests Behavior Change as First Sign of Dementia
Teaser: Mild behavioral changes, not memory problems, may be a harbinger of cognitive decline, new research shows.

Headlines: CCTA Can Track Noncalcified Plaque Regression by Statin Therapy
Teaser: CT angiography can potentially be used to identify any coronary calcifications in higher-risk patients for deciding whether to consider intensification of statin therapy, according to researchers.

Headlines: Breast Cancer Clinical Trials Must Include Older Patients
Teaser: Older adults continue to be underrepresented in clinical trials investigating new cancer therapies, despite the fact that they make up a large proportion of cancer patients.

Headlines: Same Old, Same Old Cold or Something More?
Teaser: Data about the typical pattern of pediatric URI and sinusitis are helpful in dissuading clinicians and parents from resorting to unnecessary antibiotics.

Headlines: Genomics in Clinical Practice: The Rise of Multiplex Gene Testing
Teaser: The first in a series of three articles on the most important clinical issues in multiplex assays and genomic testing in cancer care.

Headlines: Risk Calculator Predicts Conversion to Psychosis
Teaser: A new risk calculator predicts the probability of high-risk patients converting to full psychosis within 2 years, new research shows.

Headlines: Soluble/insoluble Fibre vs. Psyllium for Chronic Constipation
Teaser: Fiber supplements are useful in the treatment of chronic constipation, but which type is most effective, and best tolerated?

Headlines: Biacuplasty vs Conventional Management for Lumbar Back Pain
Teaser: Is one of these treatment methods for lumbar discogenic pain more effective than the other?

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Switching From EFV/FTC/TDF to EVG/COBI/FTC/TDF
Teaser: How are the pharmacokinetics influenced after the regimen switch?

Headlines: Oral HPV in HIV Patients Is Not Reduced by Initiating ART
Teaser: ART initiation did not decrease the incidence of oral HPV infection among treatment-naive HIV patients, a new study reports.

Source: Journal of Perinatology : Official Journal of the California Perinatal Association
Headlines: Live Neonates Born to Mothers With Ebola Virus Disease
Teaser: This review provides insight into the outcomes of live neonates born to pregnant women with Ebola virus disease.

Headlines: Upper Normal Values of BP Response to Exercise in Athletes
Teaser: What are the normal values and upper limits of blood pressure in response to exercise in healthy, elite athletes?

Headlines: Long-term Safety of Nucleotide Analogues in HBV Infection
Teaser: What's the current data on long-term safety of entecavir and tenofovir disoproxil fumarate in the treatment of chronic HBV infection?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Antipsychotic Drugs and Risk of Hip Fracture in Older Adults
Teaser: Might the use of antipsychotic drugs contribute to hip fractures in older adults? This study looked at different classes of antipsychotics to assess the risk.

Headlines: Care for Mothers With Chronic HBV Diagnosed During Pregnancy
Teaser: Screening of pregnant women for HBsAg is now routine, and ensures postexposure prophylaxis for the newborn. But are these HBV-infected mothers receiving adequate follow-up care?

Headlines: Drug-coated Balloon for Lower Extremity Vascular Disease
Teaser: This position paper presents evidence-based recommendations for the use of drug-coated balloon technology in peripheral artery disease management.

Headlines: Statins and Risk of Bleeding: Evaluating Possible Bias
Teaser: Statins have been associated with protection against bleeding risk during treatment with vitamin K antagonists, but might those results--and other study outcomes showing incidental benefit--be biased?

Headlines: Cardiovascular Health Status in Baby Boomers With T2DM
Teaser: Are baby boomers with T2DM faring worse in terms of obesity and cardiovascular health than their counterparts in the previous generation?

Headlines: Lower Sodium Intake and Risk of Headaches in the Elderly
Teaser: Headaches have been associated with elevated blood pressure--as have high sodium diets. Can lowering sodium intake lead to a reduction in headaches in older persons with hypertension?

Headlines: Effects of Vibration Therapy in Pediatric Immunizations
Teaser: Could vibration therapy effectively help ease immunization pain in children?

Headlines: 10-Year Outcomes After Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass
Teaser: How do patients fare after undergoing Roux-en-Y gastric bypass surgery in terms of long-term weight loss and comorbidity reduction?

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: HIV Drug Resistance in Adults Failing Early ART
Teaser: Does ART failure after the early initiation of treatment increase the risk of HIV drug resistance?

Headlines: What Is an Acceptable Advanced Pharmacy Practice Experience?
Teaser: Are today's pharmacy graduates achieving an adequate level of proficiency for entering into practice?

Headlines: Nelfinavir and Cancer Incidence in HIV-Positive Individuals
Teaser: This study examined the rates of cancer among HIV positive patients exposed to nelfinavir.

Headlines: Inflammatory Cytokines in Atherosclerosis
Teaser: This review explores the role of inflammatory cytokines in atherosclerosis, and the emerging role of cytokine-targeted treatment.

Headlines: Applying the Chronic Care Model to Ostomy Self-Management
Teaser: A nurse-led ostomy self-management program can play an important role in supporting these patients and helping them adjust to daily care requirements.

Headlines: Eliminating Breast Cancer Surgery in Exceptional Responders
Teaser: Is surgery redundant in breast cancer patients who had a complete response to neoadjuvant chemotherapy?

Headlines: Novel Mechanisms in the Pathogenesis of Atrial Fibrillation
Teaser: This review focuses on a variety of novel mechanisms in the pathogenesis of AF. What therapeutic options are currently available and on the horizon which target these mechanisms?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Recent Endovascular Stroke RCTs: Their Impact on Stroke Care
Teaser: There have been five recently published RCTs of endovascular therapy versus medical management in the treatment of acute stroke, with positive findings. How will they transform stroke care?

Headlines: Options for Reversing the Effect of Oral Anticoagulant Drugs
Teaser: The absence of a reversal agent for the direct oral coagulants has been a barrier to their wider use, but three new reversal agents are either under development or have been recently approved.

Source: Journal of Perinatology : Official Journal of the California Perinatal Association
Headlines: HRF and Pulmonary Hypertension in the Neonate
Teaser: This review explores the challenges to developing effective therapies and discusses future research priorities in the field of neonatal hypoxemic respiratory failure and pulmonary hypertension.

Headlines: Adrenoceptor Blockade for Hormonally Functional Pheo/PGL
Teaser: A new study examines whether patients with hormonally functional pheochromocytomas and paragangliomas (pheo/PGLs) are receiving the appropriate pharmacological treatment.

Headlines: Correlation of VAS Pain Scores After Treatment in RA and OA
Teaser: Changes from baseline in VAS pain scores may predict response to NSAID treatment in patients with RA and OA.

Headlines: miR-211 Detection as an Ancillary Test in Melanoma Diagnosis
Teaser: The results of this study suggest that the detection of miR-211 expression by miRNA in situ hybridization could be a valuable aid in the diagnosis of melanoma.

Headlines: New Therapies for Psoriasis and Psoriatic Arthritis
Teaser: Read about the new therapies that are now available for patients with psoriatic disease.

Headlines: Bacterial Biofilm in Breast Implant-Associated ALCL
Teaser: What role does bacterial biofilm play in breast implant-associated anaplastic large-cell lymphoma?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Drug Utilization, Inappropriate Prescribing in Centenarians
Teaser: Are centenarians being inappropriately medicated? This study utilized EHR data to explore the epidemiology of drug prescribing in persons over 100 years of age.

Headlines: Treatment Intensification With Insulin Degludec/Aspart
Teaser: How do these treatment intensification algorithms with insulin degludec/insulin aspart compare in terms of safety and efficacy?

Headlines: Vitamin D and Risk of Non-alcoholic Steatohepatitis in NAFLD
Teaser: Is vitamin D deficiency associated with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease? This study explores the molecular pathways that contribute to the relationship of vitamin D and NAFLD.

Headlines: Probiotics Are Helpful in Hepatic Encephalopathy
Teaser: This study evaluates the efficacy of probiotics in the management of both minimal and overt hepatic encephalopathy. How did probiotics fare in comparison to no treatment or placebo?

Headlines: Leveraging Advances in Tuberculosis to Address NTM Disease
Teaser: Could recent advances in the diagnosis and treatment of tuberculosis also provide new options for nontuberculous mycobacteria-associated disease?

Headlines: Alectinib -- New Management for ALK-positive Lung Cancer
Teaser: Is this next generation ALK inhibitor a good option for patients resistant to crizotinib?

Headlines: Rectal Indomethacin Does Not Prevent Post-ERCP Pancreatitis
Teaser: New research finds that prophylactic rectal indomethacin does not reduce incidence of post-ERCP pancreatitis. Should published guidelines be reconsidered?

Headlines: Bordetella Pertussis: Concepts in Pathogenesis and Treatment
Teaser: This review offers new insight into the pathogenesis of this infectious disease and discusses new and current treatment options.

Headlines: Emerging Therapies for Mitochondrial Disorders
Teaser: Several new approaches are currently under investigation for the treatment of mitochondrial diseases, on both the molecular and cellular level. Which hold the most promise?

Headlines: Describing Activity in Primary PCI
Teaser: The authors demonstrate the validity of the HEAT-SEALED pathway, an algorithm which offers a practical and comprehensive solution to the problem of describing denominators in STEMI and PPCI.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Immunotherapy Combined or Sequenced With Targeted Therapy
Teaser: The newer immune checkpoint inhibitors are increasing treatment strategies for melanoma. Are they also increasing long-term survival?

Headlines: Intestinal Congestion and Right Ventricular Dysfunction
Teaser: What might be the mechanisms that contribute to cachexia in heart failure? This study investigates the potential involvement of intestinal congestion.

Headlines: Generic Medications for Hepatitis C
Teaser: While recent developments in direct-acting antiviral agents have proven a game-changer for treating hepatitis C, their high cost remains a barrier for many. Can--and should--generics take their place?

Headlines: Defining Disease Severity in Inflammatory Bowel Diseases
Teaser: The authors propose three domains of criteria which could be used to develop a validated severity index for inflammatory bowel disease: impact, inflammatory burden, and disease course.

Headlines: Critical Care Management of Intracerebral Hemorrhage
Teaser: The authors discuss the neurocritical care management of intracerebral hemorrhage based on current evidence and guidelines, highlighting prevention and management of medical complications.

Source: Medicine and Science in Sports and Exercise
Headlines: Exercise for ADHD and Disruptive Behavior Disorders
Teaser: What benefits could regular physical activity offer children with ADHD and disruptive behavior disorders?

Source: Current Opinion in Allergy and Clinical Immunology
Headlines: Biologic Therapy in the Management of Asthma
Teaser: What benefit does biologic therapy offer patients with asthma? A new review examines the current role of these agents in managing this disease.

Headlines: Biomarkers Related to Disease Activity in Sjogren's Syndrome
Teaser: The authors have identified serum biomarkers that may play a key role in evaluating disease activity in primary Sjogren's syndrome.

Headlines: ECMO for Cardiac Indications in Children
Teaser: What do we currently know about the use of extracorporeal membrane oxygenation in children with heart disease?

Headlines: The Science and Questions Surrounding CTE
Teaser: Does the presence of cerebral tau protein equal a diagnosis of CTE? Is CTE a progressive disorder? These and other common questions regarding CTE are addressed in this article.

Headlines: Predicting Work Productivity in Patients Infected With HCV
Teaser: Can specific pre-treatment clinical and patient-reported factors predict work productivity impairment in HCV-infected patients?

Headlines: Novel Therapies for Hepatitis B Virus Cure
Teaser: Will hepatitis B be eradicated in the near future? What are the major barriers to cure?

Headlines: The HPV Vaccine: Then and Now
Teaser: The short history of the HPV vaccine has been eventful. Will the first vaccine to prevent cancer survive this rocky patch?

Headlines: Why All the Drama About the New Definition for Sepsis?
Teaser: In the wake of publishing new definitions for sepsis, many dissenting voices were heard. What's all the fuss about?

Headlines: The Potential Dark Side of Data Sharing
Teaser: Letting non-trialists at clinical trial data is like letting the uneducated run education, according to Dr Ohman in this discussion with Dr Harrington on open data.

Headlines: The Pros and Cons of Clinical Trial Data Sharing
Teaser: Drs Harrington and O'Donoghue discuss clinical trial patient-level data sharing in light of a proposal by the ICMJE to require it as a condition of publication.

Headlines: Updated Heart Failure Guidelines: Where Do New Drugs Fit In?
Teaser: Dr Ileana Piña reviews the recent updates to both US and European guidelines on the management of heart failure that include the new ARNI drug and ivabradine.

Headlines: Timeline: 10 Years of the HPV Vaccine
Teaser: While hailed as a game-changer for women's health, the HPV vaccine has seen its share of ups and downs.

Headlines: Ebola Virus Disease and Critical Illness
Teaser: Find out what there is to know regarding the critical care management of Ebola-infected patients.

Headlines: Blood Eosinophil Markers to Predict Severity of Asthma
Teaser: Are measuring blood eosinophil levels an effective way to determine disease severity in asthma?

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Interaction Between EE2/DSG and LPV/r in HIV+ Adolescents
Teaser: Could oral contraceptives containing ethinyl estradiol/desogestrel compromise the effectiveness of lopinavir/ritonavir-based therapy?

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Colon Cancer With Microsatellite Instability: Adjuvant Chemo
Teaser: Is deficient mismatch repair colon cancer resistant to adjuvant 5-fluorouracil plus oxaliplatin?

Headlines: Zika DNA Vaccine Enters Phase 1 Trial
Teaser: The National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, which developed the novel vaccine, is also developing other candidates to immunize people against the Zika virus.

Headlines: Models for Sharing Trial Data Abound, but With Little Consensus
Teaser: Authors of perspectives published in the NEJM differ on time frames for releasing data and who should make sharing decisions. An outside expert said none of the models goes far enough.

Headlines: Mission: Lifeline Extends Guideline STEMI Care to More Patients
Teaser: Greater regional coordination of leadership, protocols, and feedback can help to bring more STEMI treatment times within national guidelines, suggests a new analysis.

Headlines: Acupuncture May Improve Memory in Mild Cognitive Impairment
Teaser: Although a new meta-analysis suggests acupuncture alone or as an adjunctive therapy to nimodipine can increase cognitive and memory scores in patients with MCI, investigators urge caution.

Headlines: Do Elevated Lipids Protect Against Diabetes? Clues in Gene Study
Teaser: The study findings "will no doubt fuel the controversy on the causal association of major plasma lipids with type 2 diabetes," experts assert.

Headlines: Half of Pediatric Trials Go Unfinished or Unpublished
Teaser: Recruiting enough children was the top reason for the waste of financial and human resources. Industry-sponsored trials were less likely to be halted, but more likely to result in nonpublication.

Headlines: Independent Pathways Connect Brain and Gut in Irritable Bowel Syndrome
Teaser: There might be independent gut-to-brain and brain-to-gut pathways in patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), researchers from Australia report.

Headlines: Infection Linked to Large Increased Risk for Death by Suicide
Teaser: Infection requiring hospitalization has been linked to a 43% increased risk for death by suicide, a large population-based Danish cohort study shows.

Headlines: Real-World Anti-VEGF Data Disappointing
Teaser: Administered under real-life circumstances, anti-VEGF treatments produce much worse results than they do in clinical trials, according to an analysis of 750,000 patients in the US.

Headlines: The Latest in Lupus, Arthritis, and Ankylosing Spondylitis
Teaser: A productive meeting in London yields important new results in rheumatoid arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, and lupus. Dr Ioannis Parodis gives an overview of his top studies.

Headlines: Surge in Bare Metal Stent Use Not Tied to Higher Risk of Revascularization
Teaser: The surge in bare metal stent use that occurred after regulators expressed concerns about drug-eluting stents was not associated with a higher risk of revascularization or other adverse outcomes in adults over age 75, researchers have found.

Headlines: Alzheimer’s Association Announces Clinical Trial Competition
Teaser: Four projects related to brain inflammation receive $1 million each but compete for additional $3 million.

Headlines: A Morphine Alternative With Less Overdose Risk?
Teaser: Scientists are testing an experimental drug that's designed to have the painkilling power of morphine without some of the side effects that can lead to overdose deaths.

Headlines: Oral Contraceptives Don't Impair Sexual Function, at Least Overall
Teaser: Still, use of a levonorgestrel-based contraceptive in a trial had modest but significant adverse effects on measures of arousal and pleasure, and "for     individual women, we believe it could be of clinical importance."

Headlines: Topical Antibiotics Unnecessary for Intravitreous Injections
Teaser: Topical antibiotics are unnecessary in patients receiving intravitreous injections, but povidone-iodine is important for preventing endophthalmitis, according to results from the Diabetic Retinopathy Clinical Research Network.

Headlines: Donor Fecal Transplant More Effective Than From Self
Teaser: Fecal microbiota transplant was found to be effective in a randomized controlled clinical trial, but efficacy of control self-transplant differed in the two study locations.

Headlines: Prescription Drug Costs: Why Do They Keep Going Up?
Teaser: A new paper examines the reasons for the continuing rise of drug costs in the US and offers several strategies to control pricing.

Headlines: Sanofi's GLP-1/Insulin Combo LixiLan Faces 3-Month Delay in US
Teaser: US approval of the GLP-1 receptor agonist lixisenatide and insulin glargine combination LixiLan is delayed over concerns about the delivery device; a     decision is now due by November.

Headlines: Sports-related TBI: Connecting Pathology to Diagnosis
Teaser: A better understanding of the pathology and molecular changes associated with sports-related head trauma may lead to innovations in imaging techniques and new biomarkers, according to this article.

Headlines: Effectiveness and Safety of Oral HIV Preexposure Prophylaxis
Teaser: Is preexposure prophylaxis a safe and effective preventive strategy against HIV infection?

Headlines: FDA Delays Approval Decision for Factor Xa Inhibitor Antidote
Teaser: The agency is seeking further manufacturing information and data from ongoing clinical trials prior to potential approval of Portola's andexanet alfa.

Headlines: Psychotropic Drugs for Woes of Surviving Testicular Cancer
Teaser: The cure of testicular cancer is one of the great success stories of cancer research, but young survivors carry the burden of heavy morbidity from cisplatin chemotherapy for the rest of their lives.

Headlines: The Life and Science of Priscilla K. Brastianos, MD
Teaser: Dr Priscilla Brastianos is racing to prevent brain metastases in breast cancer patients. Meet a young investigator who is advancing science for the sake of her patients -- and two others in her life.

Headlines: Bioresorbable Stents and Polymers: Do We Need Better DES?
Teaser: Interview with Robert Byrne on the rationale for innovations in stent technology, the data on the FDA-approved stents with bioresorbable technologies, and whether current-generation DES can be beat.

Headlines: Treatment of Cluster Headache: AHS Evidence-Based Guidelines
Teaser: New evidence-based guidelines from the American Headache Society provide recommendations for the abortive and preventive treatment of cluster headache.

Headlines: Lung Cancer in COPD, It Is Not Just the Cigarette Smoke
Teaser: The development of lung cancer in patients with COPD has been linked with tobacco exposure, but other factors may also play a role.

Headlines: Procalcitonin in Early Post Pediatric Cardiac Surgery
Teaser: What can postoperative procalcitonin levels tell us about outcomes after cardiac surgery in children?

Headlines: Long-term Quality of Life Among Survivors of Severe Sepsis
Teaser: How does sepsis impact quality of life? New research looks into how patients who survived severe sepsis fared in the long-term.

Headlines: Treatment Options in the Young Patient With Graves' Disease
Teaser: In this review, the advantages and disadvantages of available treatment options for young patients with Graves disease are discussed.

Headlines: Cancers and Infections in Patients With and Without PSA
Teaser: Are the rates of cancers and opportunistic infections higher among patients with psoriatic arthritis -- compared with those without the condition?

Headlines: Chronic Pruritus in the Absence of Skin Disease
Teaser: Chronic pruritis in the absence of skin disease can be distressing to the patient, challenging to diagnose, and equally challenging to treat. What's the best approach to diagnosis and management?

Headlines: Virologic Failure After Treatment Initiation in Acute HIV
Teaser: What do we know about viral dynamics after the initiation of antiretroviral therapy during acute HIV infection?

Headlines: Chronic HCV: Patient-Reported Outcomes With Anti-Virals
Teaser: Which anti-viral regimens had the least negative impact on self-reported outcomes and quality of life in patients with chronic hepatitis C?

Headlines: Atypical Parkinsonism -- New Advances
Teaser: The author reviews the most recent advances in our understanding of the genetics and pathophysiology of atypical parkinsonism. Are we getting closer to a neuroprotective treatment?

Headlines: Entecavir/Tenofovir Therapy in Drug Resistant Chronic HBV
Teaser: This study evaluated the antiviral efficacy and safety of entecavir plus tenofovir combination therapy in multidrug-resistant chronic hepatitis B patients.

Headlines: Combination Artificial Dermis and Basic FGF for Skin Defects
Teaser: What are the effects of this combined therapy on skin defects?

Headlines: Cardiac Power Parameters During Hypovolemia
Teaser: Might dynamic and non-dynamic cardiac power parameters track hypovolemia better than equivalent flow- and pressure parameters?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Mainstream or Extinction: Saving Geriatrics
Teaser: Is there a future for geriatrics? This commentary examines what's wrong with current strategies and suggests changes to increase the survival of geriatrics as a specialty.

Headlines: GS-9190: Antiviral Response in Treatment-Naive HCV
Teaser: This phase 1b study of the investigational drug GS-9190 monitored its resistance profile when used as monotherapy in treatment-naive HCV-infected patients.

Headlines: Concurrent Treatments in IPF With Respiratory Failure
Teaser: What benefits could combined treatments offer IPF patients with a rapid progression of respiratory failure?

Headlines: Antibiotic Strategies in the Era of Multidrug Resistance
Teaser: These strategies for the appropriate antibiotic management of ICU patients will help prevent further development of drug resistance.

Headlines: Inflammatory and Immune Responses to Surgery
Teaser: Gain a better understanding of the postoperative inflammatory and immune responses in surgical patients and find out how they may impact clinical outcomes.

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: RPV and DOR Efficacies Against NNRTI-Resistant HIV-1 Mutants
Teaser: Find out how these two non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors compare in the combat against NNRTI-resistant mutations.

Headlines: Induction Immunosuppression in Kidney Transplants With HIV
Teaser: Should induction immunosuppression therapy be considered for HIV-positive kidney transplant recipients?

Source: Seminars in Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine

Teaser: Get up-to-date on the current state of knowledge in the field of liver transplantation.

Headlines: Atrial Fibrillation and Risk of Stroke
Teaser: Atrial fibrillation is a well-established risk factor for ischemic stroke. But how much of that risk is dependent on concomitant stroke risk factors?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Caring for Older Adults With HIV
Teaser: An increasing number of older adults are HIV positive. How might treatment strategies in this unique population differ from those for their younger cohorts?

Headlines: Single vs. Multiple Ablations in Ventricular Tachycardia
Teaser: Are multiple catheter ablation procedures necessary in order to achieve long-term clinical success in ventricular tachycardia?

Headlines: Ixekizumab for Moderate-to-Severe Plaque Psoriasis
Teaser: The anti-IL-17 monoclonal antibody, ixekizumab, is a recently approved biologic therapy for moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis. What are the findings from the latest clinical trials?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Natural History Study of Coronary Atherosclerosis Using FFR
Teaser: Can stenosis severity as assessed by fractional flow reserve serve as an independent predictor of lesion-related outcome?

Headlines: Antithyroid Drugs During Breastfeeding
Teaser: What do we know about the use of antithyhroid medications during lactation?

Headlines: LDV/SOF and Patient-reported Outcomes in HCV/HIV Co-infection
Teaser: Do HIV/HCV patients treated with the recently approved fixed-dose combination of ledipasvir and sofosbuvir feel the regimen significantly improved their health-related quality of life?

Headlines: Outcomes in Belatacept-vs CsA-Treated ECD Kidney Recipients
Teaser: How did these immunosuppressive regimens measure up in terms of efficacy and safety?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Knowledge Gaps in Cardiovascular Care of Older Adults
Teaser: This joint statement summarizes current guideline recommendations for cardiovascular care as they apply to older adults. What critical knowledge gaps still need to be addressed?

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Course of Fluoroquinolones in Outpatient Males With a UTI
Teaser: Can men with UTIs be successfully treated with a 5-day course of levofloxacin instead of the longer course which is currently recommended?

Headlines: RCTs vs. Observational Studies: Why Not Just Live Together?
Teaser: While RCTs are generally regarded as the gold standard to evaluate the efficacy of an intervention, the authors of this commentary make a case for the value of observational studies as well.

Headlines: Opioids for Cancer Patients in the Last Year of Life
Teaser: Are cancer patients receiving adequate opioid pain control in their last months?

Headlines: Tiotropium Respimat vs Tiotropium HandiHaler in COPD
Teaser: These inhalers provide two options for the delivery of tiotropium in patients with COPD. Find out how they compare.

Headlines: Ketamine Infusions for Pediatric Sedation and Analgesia
Teaser: Ketamine is commonly used for procedural sedation and analgesia. How safe is it in children?

Headlines: Oral Fumaric Acid Esters for Psoriasis
Teaser: Are fumaric acid esters safe and effective for the treatment of psoriasis? This Cochrane review examines the best available evidence.

Headlines: Predictors of Chemotherapy Efficacy in NSCLC
Teaser: Can biomarkers predict the efficacy of conventional chemotherapy, such as gemcitabine and pemetrexed, for treatment of NSCLC?

Headlines: Noninvasive Brain Stimulation and Pain Control in Migraine
Teaser: Might noninvasive brain stimulation techniques, such as transcranial magnetic stimulation or transcranial direct current stimulation, provide relief for migraine pain?

Headlines: Immunotherapy in Genitourinary Malignancies
Teaser: What is our current understanding regarding the use of immunotherapies in the treatment of genitourinary malignancies? Find out what there is to know.

Headlines: Better Sleep in the ICU: Blue Pill or Red Pill... or No Pill?
Teaser: What is the best way to improve sleep in the ICU? Does pharmacologically induced sleep offer more benefit than sedation--or should we be focusing on promoting a non-drug approach?

Headlines: Accuracy of Colon Capsules in Detection of Colorectal Polyps
Teaser: Can a new generation of capsule used in colon capsule endoscopy mitigate the criticisms of earlier versions, which were found to have suboptimal accuracy?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Influenza Vaccine Strategies for Elderly Adults
Teaser: There are now four different influenza vaccines available in the United States for persons aged 65 and older. Are the newer iterations worth their additional cost?

Headlines: Deep Brain Stimulation for Treatment-Refractory Depression
Teaser: While deep brain stimulation has shown promise in treating resistant depression, it is still considered experimental. What is the latest evidence regarding its use in depression?

Headlines: Psychiatric, Substance Use Disorders in HIV/HCV Coinfection
Teaser: This study looks at the prevalence of psychiatric disorders and substance abuse among coinfected patients. Do the patterns differ according to individual HCV status?

Headlines: Factors Associated With Diabetes Among Patients With HF
Teaser: Has the association between diabetes and heart failure been under recognized? This study examined the prevalence of diabetes among US adults hospitalized with heart failure and its impact on outcomes.

Source: Journal of the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons
Headlines: Pediatric and Adolescent Forearm Fractures
Teaser: Current guidelines for managing forearm fractures in children and teens remains controversial. Can these fractures be safely treated nonoperatively?

Headlines: CPX-351: Better Outcomes in Older High-Risk AML Patients
Teaser: CPX-351 -- a liposomal formulation of cytarabine and daunorubicin -- achieves better results than the standard formulation in acute myeloid leukemia (AML).

Headlines: New Therapies for Old Ailments
Teaser: Dr Bansal discusses several key clinical trials that were presented at the American Society of Nephrology's 2016 Kidney Week conference.

Headlines: Mandrola's Top 10 Cardiology Stories of 2016
Teaser: It's that time of the year again when Dr John Mandrola makes his picks of the top stories in cardiology for 2016. Did your favorite study make the     list?

Headlines: Cardiology 2016: The Practice of Medicine
Teaser: Another year, another roundup of major cardiology news from Drs Harrington and Gibson. In part 1, they discuss the new studies that will affect clinical practice and those that missed the mark.

Headlines: Remarkable Developments in Lung Cancer Treatment Call for New Game Plans
Teaser: Pembrolizumab's remarkable impact means 'we now have to change our approach to every single patient with adenocarcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma,' argues Mark Kris.

Headlines: New Options for Treating Genital Atrophy
Teaser: These treatments improve symptoms of genital atrophy without causing appreciable elevations in serum estradiol levels.

Headlines: Tofacitinib Shows Promise for Treating Severe Alopecia Areata
Teaser: The Janus kinase (JAK) inhibitor tofacitinib shows promise for treating severe alopecia areata and its variants in adults and adolescents, according to two retrospective studies.

Headlines: CAR T Cells Motoring to  Market -- by Next Year?
Teaser: Pivotal registration trials for CAR T cell therapies have now been completed, and two products could be approved by the end of 2017.

Headlines: Grab Bag of Goodies in 21st Century Cures Act
Teaser: A breakdown of winners — and a few losers — in the sprawling Cures Act approved by the House.

Headlines: Congress Passes 21st Century Cures Bill
Teaser: The Senate joined the House in approving the omnibus healthcare bill that speeds up drug approvals, funds research, strengthens mental healthcare, and combats opioid abuse.

Headlines: Pembrolizumab 1st-Line in NSCLC Also Boosts Quality of Life
Teaser: Along with its groundbreaking improvement in survival, pembrolizumab also improves quality of life when used first line in non-small cell lung cancer.

Headlines: 10 Rheumatology Advances From 2016
Teaser: Dr Kevin Deane reviews new trials, new treatments, and other major breakthroughs in rheumatology over the past year.

Headlines: Next Big Thing in ER+ Breast Cancer: For Early-Stage Too?
Teaser: Inhibition of cyclin-dependent kinases 4 and 6 is now an option for the treatment of estrogen receptor-positive metastatic breast cancer. Is this approach going to work in earlier-stage disease?

Headlines: Watson vs Oncologists: 90% Agreed on Treatment (Eventually)
Teaser: A double-blinded validation study found a high level of concordance between an artificial intelligence system and members of a cancer center tumor board, after some extrahuman effort.
