Headlines: 10 Tech Advances That Can Change Medicine
Teaser: Medscape editor-in-chief Eric Topol outlines the best technological advances in medicine of the last year.

Headlines: Myeloma Data at ASH 2016 Focus on Novel Combinations
Teaser: The presentations at ASH 2016 for multiple myeloma focused on novel drug combinations in various settings, including newly diagnosed myeloma and refractory disease.

Headlines: At ASH, New Approaches Suggest 'Major Advances' Against AML
Teaser: After years of little progress, a number of new drug classes show promise for patients with AML.

Headlines: Ribociclib Increases Survival in HR+ Advanced Breast Cancer, But…
Teaser: Ribociclib + letrozole improves PFS in HR+ breast cancer, but Dr Lidia Schapira says more data are needed to identify which patients should receive endocrine therapy alone or combination therapy.

Headlines: ASH16 Preview: New CAR T-cell Data Come at a Pivotal Moment
Teaser: Dr Miguel-Angel Perales summarizes key recent developments in the field of CAR T cells and outlines the most important CAR T cell trials to follow at the 2016 ASH Annual Meeting.

Headlines: Medical Debate Belongs in the Public Space
Teaser: Dr John Mandrola strenuously disagrees with those who argue that medicine should hold its scientific debates behind closed doors.

Headlines: SMAC AF: BP-Lowering Alone Won't Improve Ablation Success
Teaser: Drs Mandrola and Piccini compare the SMAC AF trial with the ARREST-AF trial on risk factor modification to improve catheter ablation success rates in patients with atrial fibrillation.

Headlines: An Extraordinary Legislative Gain for Mental Health Care
Teaser: The 21st Century Cures Act is broad in scope and potential impact on mental health care and research--and 'a marvelous synergy of good legislation,' declares Dr Lieberman.

Headlines: Major Increase in Cancer Funding 'a Global Priority'
Teaser: Two leading cancer organizations from Europe and the United States have called on governments and policy makers to fund cancer research in order to capitalize on recent discoveries.

Headlines: The March of the Biosimilars Continues
Teaser: Dr Jonathan Kay reviews the status of four biosimilars and stresses the importance of healthcare providers to understand their efficacy and to make them available as an additional choice for therapy.

Headlines: Life and Times of Leading Cardiologists: Thomas Lüscher
Teaser: Dr Thomas Lüscher describes his journey from basic scientist to interventional cardiologist and editor-in-chief of European Heart Journal, and the people who touched his life along the way.

Headlines: Bendamustine Toxicity in FL Raises Eyebrows -- and Questions
Teaser: Results from the GALLIUM study in follicular lymphoma (FL) showed that fatal toxicity was higher with bendamustine compared with other regimens. What does this mean for clinical practice?

Headlines: Psilocybin May Be a Psychiatry Game Changer
Teaser: Findings from landmark research in late-stage cancer patients suggest that a single, high dose of the psychedelic drug psilocybin has rapid, lasting effects on mood and anxiety.

Headlines: New Cancer Drugs With No Benefit 'Should Be Withdrawn'
Teaser: Many new cancer drugs were approved by the FDA on the basis of preliminary surrogate endpoints, and postmarketing studies do not support any real benefit.

Headlines: 'Meaningful' Responses With Ibrutinib in Chronic GVHD
Teaser: A very high response rate was observed in patients treated with ibrutinib, including those with multiple organ involvement.

Headlines: Icotinib Doubles PFS in NSCLC Patients With Brain Metastases
Teaser: Non-small cell lung cancer patients with brain metastases have major improvements in progression-free survival with the EGFR TKI icotinib compared with whole-brain radiotherapy, shows a phase 3 trial.

Headlines: Obstetricians Balk at FDA Warning on Anesthesia in Pregnant Women
Teaser: Repeated or lengthy use of general anesthetic and sedation drugs in infants, toddlers and pregnant women in their third trimester might damage children's developing brains, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration warned this month.

Headlines: CAR T Cells Produce Dramatic Remission in Glioblastoma
Teaser: A patient with recurrent and rapidly progressing glioblastoma experienced a complete regression of his cancer for more than 7 months with CAR T-cell therapy.

Headlines: Most Psychiatric Drug Use Is Long-term With Few Safety Data
Teaser: One in six adults report psychiatric drug use. Rates are significantly higher in older adults, and long-term use is reported in the majority of cases, despite a lack of evidence of long-term safety.

Headlines: 21st Century Cures Bill: A Win or Loss for Healthcare?
Teaser: The sweeping healthcare legislation will increase funding for disease research, improve mental healthcare, and streamline the regulatory system for drugs and medical devices.

Headlines: Improving Long-term Outcomes of Crohn's Disease
Teaser: Changes in the medical management of Crohn's disease over the past two decades have been paralleled by improvements in long-term outcomes, researchers from the Netherlands report.

Headlines: Liquid Biopsy Monitors Response in Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: New data suggest that circulating tumor DNA can be used to monitor treatment response in ovarian cancer.

Headlines: Medical News Stories Lack Qualified Independent Commentators
Teaser: Only one in six media stories on medical research findings included commentary from independent sources; lack of appropriate expertise and academic and financial conflicts of interest were common.

Headlines: Stronger 'Superbugs,' and No New Drugs to Fight Them
Teaser: For nearly two years, a killer stalked the patients of Providence Alaska Medical Center.  It was a bacteria called Acinetobacter baumannii, a common cause of infections in hospitals. This one was different.

Headlines: New Guidelines to Define Schizophrenia Response, Resistance
Teaser: Consensus guidelines that operationalize criteria for determining treatment resistance and response in schizophrenia patients should guide the next generation of clinical trials, researchers say.

Headlines: Urgent Need for More, Better Medical Marijuana Research
Teaser: Support for legalization of marijuana, also known as cannabis, for both medical indications and recreational use, is increasing in the US, but there is scant evidence from RCTs that it actually works.

Source: OJIN: The Online Journal of Issues in Nursing
Headlines: Why Causal Inference Matters to Nurses
Teaser: The authors discuss the importance of causal inference in nursing research, focusing on the causal pathways between nurse staffing and patient outcomes.

Headlines: Maternal Influenza Immunization and Adverse Birth Outcomes
Teaser: Are studies affirming the magnitude of fetal benefit conferred by maternal influenza immunization accurate--or is the methodology flawed?

Headlines: Brain Networks: Robustness and the Impact of Lesions
Teaser: Approaching the brain as a complex network, the authors examine what types of damage the brain can withstand--its "robustness"--and how tumors, stroke and TBI might impact network function.

Headlines: A Critical Appraisal of Aspirin in Secondary Prevention
Teaser: This article examines the viability of the continuing role of aspirin in secondary prevention of cardiovascular disease. Is it time to revisit aspirin as the cornerstone of antithrombotic therapy?

Headlines: Ribavirin Revisited in the Era of DAAs for HCV Infection
Teaser: What is the role of ribavirin in interferon-free, direct-acting antiviral HCV treatment? For which group of patients might it continue to provide clinical benefit?

Headlines: Association Between Time of ICU Discharge and Mortality
Teaser: When it comes to reducing the risk of in-hospital mortality among critically ill patients, does ICU discharge time matter?

Headlines: Factors and 25(OH)D Responses to Vitamin D Supplementation
Teaser: A new study examines how genetic and nongenetic factors may impact responses of vitamin D supplementation.

Headlines: Adverse Events Leading to Dolutegravir Discontinuation
Teaser: Might the potential neurotoxicity associated with dolutegravir be the reason for higher discontinuation rates of this antiretroviral agent?

Headlines: Alarm Bell as Chinese With Diabetes 'Losing 9 Years of Life'
Teaser: Chinese adults with diabetes lose an average of 9 years of life due to the     disease, often from complications and associated conditions that point to     poor clinical management, suggests a large survey.

Headlines: Caloric Restriction Effects on Muscle Mitochondrial Function
Teaser: In this study, the changes in muscle mitochondrial function after long-term caloric restriction are evaluated.

Headlines: A Protagonist View From the SPRINT Trial
Teaser: In this point-counterpoint, the authors make the case for providing older hypertensive patients at high cardiovascular risk with intensive treatment to a target systolic blood pressure of <120 mm Hg.

Headlines: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome -- Advancing Research and Education
Teaser: This overview addresses the public health impact of myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome, as well as current best evidence as to its cause and clinical approach.

Headlines: The Management of Hypertension in People With Dementia
Teaser: Might antihypertensive therapy do more harm than good in some patients with dementia?

Headlines: Open-label Placebo Treatment in Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: Can a placebo treatment improve chronic low-back pain--even when the patient is aware that it's a placebo?

Headlines: BMI >35 Is Associated With Severe C. Difficile Infection
Teaser: This study examines the correlation between body mass index and C. difficile infection severity.

Headlines: HPV Vaccination and Prevalence of Cervical Dysplasia
Teaser: How has the prevalence of low- and high-grade cervical lesions in young women been impacted by the availability of the HPV vaccine?

Headlines: Drug Trials by Authors With Pharma Ties More Often Positive
Teaser: Authors and editorialists call for more transparency, including turning over data sets, bringing back independent reviews of major randomized controlled trials, and better vetting by journal editors.

Headlines: Bleeding Risk Following PCI in Diabetic Patients on DAPT
Teaser: Do patients with diabetes mellitus have an increased risk of bleeding when prescribed dual-antiplatelet therapy following PCI?

Headlines: A Spoonful of AI Helps the Medicine Go Down
Teaser: A new app that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to monitor adherence to medication can lead to higher-quality data from clinical trials and can help high-risk patients in real time.

Headlines: Post-Marketing Study Supports Efficacy of Upper Airway Stimulation for OSA
Teaser: Upper airway stimulation using an implanted device appears safe and effective for obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) in routine clinical practice, researchers from Germany report.

Headlines: Europe Clears Tenofovir Alafenamide (Vemlidy) for Chronic HBV
Teaser: The efficacy of once-daily Vemlidy is similar to that of tenofovir disoproxil (Viread) with fewer bone and renal side effects, the company says.

Headlines: Schizophrenia Directly Linked to Diabetes
Teaser: Patients with first-episode schizophrenia have impaired glucose homeostasis, highlighting the need to consider diabetes prevention from the onset of illness, new research suggests.

Headlines: Marker for Prostate Cancer That Needs Aggressive Therapy
Teaser: Surrogate marker identifies men undergoing treatment for prostate cancer who are at high risk for all-cause mortality despite lack of overt PSA failure.

Headlines: CLA and Metformin Effects on Insulin Sensitivity
Teaser: Could metformin and conjugated linoleic acid help improve insulin sensitivity among children with obesity?

Headlines: Real-Life Experience With Sorafenib for HCC in HIV Patients
Teaser: A new study provides insight into the real-life efficacy of sorafenib among HIV-infected patients with hepatocellular carcinoma.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Causes of Death in Anticoagulated Patients With AF
Teaser: This study aimed to analyze and compare causes of death in patients with atrial fibrillation receiving direct oral anticoagulants or warfarin for prevention of stroke and thromboembolism.

Headlines: Metabolic Disorders Linked to Severe, Refractory Depression
Teaser: A large proportion of patients with severe, refractory depression have neurometabolic disorders that, once treated, appear to cause depressive symptoms to remit over the long term.

Headlines: Sharing Genetic Data With Study Participants
Teaser: Dr Maurie Markman explains that sharing genetic data with study participants encourages greater clinical trial involvement.

Headlines: Venetoclax Plus Rituximab: 'Unprecedented' Efficacy in CLL
Teaser: A new chemo-free combination, venetoclax and rituximab, has shown  complete response rates in half of patients with refractory or relapsed chronic  lymphocytic leukemia (CLL).

Headlines: Drug Lobby, Under Criticism, Starts Media Campaign
Teaser: The largest lobbying organization for pharmaceutical companies began running TV ads on Monday morning to improve the industry's image as criticism from U.S. President Donald Trump increases.

Headlines: Two-Year Disease-Free Survival Bodes Well in Lymphoma
Teaser: Two years after first-line treatment, patients with diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) in remission have a generally favorable outlook, according to Danish researchers.

Headlines: Breath Test for Early Diagnosis of Upper GI Cancer
Teaser: An exhaled breath test that measures just five chemicals could offer an inexpensive alternative to endoscopy in the diagnosis of esophageal and gastric cancers.

Headlines: Transfused Blood Age Impacts Outcomes in Major GI Surgery
Teaser: The use of older packed red blood cells for transfusion may negatively impact postoperative outcomes of gastrointestinal surgery, a new study reports.

Headlines: Calcium Plus Vitamin D Supplementation and Height Loss
Teaser: Might calcium along with vitamin D supplementation prevent height loss in postmenopausal women?

Headlines: Esophageal Cancer -- Two Separate Diseases
Teaser: Genomic study suggests esophageal squamous cell carcinoma and adenocarcinoma are separate diseases, which could lead to the development of new targeted therapies.

Headlines: Zinc-Coated Foam With NPWT for Treating Challenging Wounds
Teaser: The use of zinc-coated foam in conjunction with negative pressure wound therapy was shown to be a safe and effective option in the treatment of challenging wounds.

Headlines: Amphetamine Orally Disintegrating Tablets for ADHD
Teaser: A newly approved extended-release orally disintegrating amphetamine tablet may be another option for the treatment of ADHD.

Headlines: Secondary Stroke Prevention in Nonvalvular AF
Teaser: This review offers evidence-based guidance to clinicians on appropriate stroke prevention therapies in patients with nonvalvular atrial fibrillation, along with a cost-effectiveness analysis.

Headlines: Elevated Natalizumab Levels in MS May Not Be Linked With PML Risk
Teaser: In multiple sclerosis (MS) patients treated with natalizumab, the risk of developing progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML) does not appear to be associated with high blood levels of the drug, preliminary research from the Netherlands suggests.

Headlines: Is Radical Surgery Needed in Rectal Cancer for All Patients?
Teaser: For patients who have a complete response to chemoradiation, a debate is ongoing whether or not radical surgery is needed in all cases.

Headlines: Sorafenib Survival Effect in Liver Cancer May Depend on HCV-Status
Teaser: Treatment with sorafenib is associated with improved overall survival in hepatitis C virus (HCV)-positive patients with hepatocellular cancer (HCC), according to a meta-analysis of clinical trials in which sorafenib was the control arm.

Headlines: Drug Costs -- The No. 1 Challenge in Cancer Care
Teaser: The number one challenge for cancer care practices is the cost of drugs, according to the latest survey from the Association of Community Cancer Centers.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Avoiding Myalgia With Statin Therapy in Exercising Adults
Teaser: What's the best strategy for minimizing symptoms of statin-induced myopathy in adults who wish to continue exercising?

Headlines: Phase 2 Trials in Pancreatic Cancer: Missing the Mark
Teaser: Across all oncology, the probability of a phase 2 trial leading to drug licensure is 16% or 1 in 6, but for pancreatic cancer, that rate is 5 times lower, at about 3% or 1 in 30. Why?

Headlines: Delirium Speeds Cognitive Decline
Teaser: Delirium has been identified as a risk factor for accelerated cognitive decline and has a synergistic effect in the presence of  neuropathologic findings associated with classic dementia.

Headlines: Launching a Psychiatry Program (and a Med School) From Scratch
Teaser: Dr Stephen Strakowski describes an innovative new medical school and its unique model for psychiatric training and care.

Headlines: Improving Drug Adherence in the Latino Patient With Diabetes
Teaser: Undefined socioeconomic barriers are suspected in high rates of     noncompliance in Latino patients, including those with Spanish-speaking     physicians.

Headlines: 6 Major Advances in Ophthalmology
Teaser: Take a look back at some of the top innovations that advanced the field of ophthalmology in 2016.

Headlines: Cardiology 2016: The Politics of Medicine
Teaser: In part 2 of their yearly review of cardiology news, Drs Harrington and Gibson focus on the politics and policy of medical practice --what will happen to the ACA under President Trump?

Headlines: Alzheimer's Disease and Amyloid: Time to Move On?
Teaser: 2016 ended with the failure of yet another antiamyloid agent, but ongoing late-phase trials continue to target amyloid despite increasing pressure to look at other therapeutic targets.

Headlines: The HPV Vaccine: Skip the Third Dose?
Teaser: A study assesses whether HPV type-specific antibody responses are the same for the two-dose and three-dose series.

Headlines: For Patients Who Can't Sleep, Could Valerian Help?
Teaser: Herbal infusions or 'teas' containing valerian have been promoted to help with insomnia -- but is it safe and effective?

Headlines: 2016 Stroke Research Highlights
Teaser: Dr Christoph Diener focuses on the 2016 studies that most expanded our understanding of stroke prevention and treatment.

Headlines: New Studies Highlight Increasing Prevalence of NAFLD/NASH
Teaser: Dr William Balistreri shows how recent data act as a wake-up call to this expanding public health issue, while also revealing some promising interventions.

Headlines: New Drugs Seek to Further Improve Outcomes in Hepatitis C
Teaser: At the recent Liver Meeting, the spotlight was on next-generation interferon- and ribavirin-free regimens. Dr William Balistreri highlights the most interesting results.

Headlines: New Hope for Metastatic Sarcoma With Olaratumab
Teaser: Exciting results from a study of the combination of olaratumab plus doxorubicin could point to a brighter future for patients with metastatic sarcoma.

Headlines: When Is the Right Time to Change Practice? The Pembro Example
Teaser: Dr Mark Kris recounts the quick timeline of reports discussing the efficacy and approval of pembrolizumab.

Headlines: Francis Collins, MD, to Stay On as NIH Director Under Trump
Teaser: At first noncommittal, Dr Collins has accepted the offer to stay at his post, at least temporarily.

Headlines: Breast Cancer Survivorship: Can We Get It Right?
Teaser: Providing essential care for 3 million US breast cancer survivors is challenging, prompting Dr Lidia Schapira to summarize new data on symptom management, risk assessment, and questionable therapies.

Headlines: Cellular Immunotherapy for Multiple Myeloma Advancing Rapidly
Teaser: Multiple myeloma may be a singularly promising target for cellular immunotherapies, according to data presented at the most recent ASH annual meeting.

Headlines: Transcranial DC Stimulation: Ready for Use in Depression?
Teaser: Dr Peter Yellowlees discusses how the latest positive data do not make up for a lack of well-designed studies.

Headlines: Obesity Is a Disease That Needs to Be Taken Seriously
Teaser: More than one third of US adults are obese, but medications for obesity are used for only 2% of patients. It's time to make a change.

Headlines: Genomic Study IDs New Drug Targets for Cervical Cancer
Teaser: The largest genomic study so far of cervical cancer has identified new mutations and a small HPV-negative subgroup of endometrial-like tumors.

Headlines: U.S. House Panel to Take Up Bill to Spur Generic Drug Development
Teaser: A U.S. House of Representatives subcommittee will take up bipartisan legislation next week to foster generic drug development, the committee's chairman, Representative Greg Walden, said on Thursday.

Headlines: Immunotherapy Is 'Advance of the Year' for Second Year
Teaser: For the second time, the American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) has chosen immunotherapy as its clinical cancer advance of the year, but it also highlights other progress.

Headlines: Music and Meditation May Slow Cognitive Decline
Teaser: In a small pilot study, adults with subjective cognitive decline who were trained to meditate or who listened to classical music showed improvements in memory and cognitive performance after 6 months.

Headlines: Sodium Zirconium Cyclosilicate Gets Positive EU Recommendation
Teaser: The Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use recommendation was based     on results of three clinical trials and one ongoing open-label trial.

Headlines: Medical Conference Leaders Address Travel Ban Consequences
Teaser: Cognitive Behavioral Analysis System of Psychotherapy (CBASP), a disorder-specific psychotherapy, bested nonspecific psychotherapy in a randomized trial and is a 'viable option' for chronic depression.

Headlines: Two More Phase 3 Trials of Alzheimer's Drug Idalopirdine Fail
Teaser: Organizers of upcoming medical conferences say the restrictions threaten the exchange of scientific ideas, which could hurt people, rather than protect them. Some scientists are boycotting US meetings.

Headlines: Antibiotics May Impair Cancer Immunotherapy
Teaser: Following September's announcement of failure in its first phase 3 trial of the drug, two more trials didn't reach significant efficacy and don't support 'regulatory submission,' reports Lundbeck.

Headlines: Immunomedics in Up to $2 Billion Licensing Deal With Seattle Genetics
Teaser: Antibiotic use in the month before a metastatic kidney cancer patient starts immunotherapy may reduce efficacy, but new results need prospective confirmation.

Headlines: Several Molecular Biomarkers Useful in Colorectal Cancer Evaluation: Guideline
Teaser: Drug developer Immunomedics Inc said it entered into a development and licensing deal for its experimental cancer drug with Seattle Genetics Inc for a potential payment of up to $2 billion.

Headlines: Disorder-Specific Psychotherapy Effective for Chronic Depression
Teaser: The issue of slow recruitment into randomized trials in the stroke field, which has long been a problem, has not improved over the past 25 years and if anything is getting worse, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Pharma Industry Shuns Trump Push for Radical Shift at FDA
Teaser: Cancer care delivery has been mostly unchanged for the past 50 years but now needs a new model, a centaur, say Stanford University academics.

Headlines: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy 'Sufficient' in Endometrial Cancer
Teaser: U.S. President Donald Trump's vow to roll back government regulations at least 75 percent is causing anxiety for some pharmaceutical executives that a less robust Food and Drug Administration would make it harder to secure insurance coverage for pricey new medicines.

Headlines: Schizophrenia Linked to Increased Breast Cancer Risk
Teaser: The largest study to date showed that sentinel lymph node biopsy is as accurate as full lymph node dissection in early endometrial cancer.

Headlines: Take With Food, Cut $9000 Prostate Cancer Pill Cost by 75%
Teaser: Women with schizophrenia have a nearly twofold increased risk for breast cancer compared to women without schizophrenia, a finding that underscores the need for improved screening in this population.

Headlines: Killed Oral Cholera Vaccine Appears Safe in Pregnant Women
Teaser: As with so many newer cancer drugs, abiraterone, for advanced castration-resistant prostate cancer, is very expensive. Here's a tip that may reduce cost greatly and does not appear to hurt efficacy.

Headlines: Iluvien Implants Yield 12-month Benefit for Diabetic Macular Edema
Teaser: The anatomical and visual benefits of intravitreal fluocinolone acetonide implants in patients with chronic diabetic macular edema (DME) persist up to 12 months, a small study suggests.

Headlines: Active Surveillance for Metastatic Cancer? Just This One
Teaser: Active surveillance is almost exclusively used in the management of low-risk cancers. But it's also being used in one -- and only one -- metastatic cancer.

Headlines: Better Survival After Breast Conservation Than Mastectomy
Teaser: Performing breast-conserving therapy may offer survival benefits over mastectomy, particularly in older women who have earlier-stage disease and other conditions, suggests a large observational study.

Headlines: Stroke Clinical Trial Recruitment Still a Challenge
Teaser: Cellectis has won U.S. regulatory approval to run an early clinical trial using its gene edited cell therapy product UCART123 for blood cancers, boosting the French biotech firm's ambitions in the hot area of cancer research.

Headlines: Introducing the Human-Machine 'Centaur' for Cancer Care
Teaser: Several biomarkers are useful for making treatment decisions and assessing prognosis in colorectal cancer (CRC), but others lack evidence-based support for their use outside of clinical trials, according to a new guideline.

Headlines: Biotech Leaders Rail Against Trump Immigration Order
Teaser: There is increased use of mental health services after mild traumatic brain injury (mTBI) in children, but mostly by children with a preexisting mental health diagnosis, a new study shows.

Headlines: Predicting Long-term Functional Outcomes in Ischemic Stroke
Teaser: How does longitudinal National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale measurement compare to other early markers of stroke severity in predicting 90-day stroke outcome?

Headlines: Cellectis Gets U.S. Go-ahead to Test 'Off-the-Shelf' Cell Therapy
Teaser: Founders and CEOs from 166 biotech companies signed a letter saying Trump's order is causing uncertainty and fear among foreign-born employees and disrupting a sector that drives economic growth.

Headlines: Life and Times of Leading Cardiologists: Kim Eagle
Teaser: When working as a fly fishing guide, Dr Eagle met the mentor who changed his life and paid for his medical training. He tells Dr Magnus Ohman how this lucky encounter inspired a life of philanthropy.

Headlines: Crowdsourcing: A New Era in Breast Cancer Research
Teaser: Over 3000 patients have responded to an online request from Boston researchers to contribute tumor tissue and saliva for the purpose of accelerating research on metastatic breast cancer.

Headlines: Reprogramming Beta Cells in Diabetes
Teaser: Once considered only the realm of science fiction, scientists are trying out ways to reprogram pancreatic cells to become productive beta cells, which is now approaching the realm of the possible.

Headlines: Unmatched After Match Day -- What's Next?
Teaser: Although most medical students find a residency match on Match Day, some do not. What comes next?

Headlines: New CML Data Post Signs on Route to Treatment-Free Remission
Teaser: Specific milestones of response over the first 12 months of treatment are now being recognized as critical to predicting which CML patients hold the most promise for treatment-free remission.

Headlines: Reducing Cardiovascular Mortality in Kidney Disease: Time to Focus on Heart Failure?
Teaser: Dr Bansal discusses several key clinical trials examining cardiovascular disease risk in patients with chronic kidney disease.

Headlines: The Primary Endpoint Is Positive: What More Do You Need?
Teaser: Dr Gregg Stone reviews the questions to ask before accepting the results of a 'positive' clinical trial.

Headlines: The Primary Endpoint Is Negative: What Happens Now?
Teaser: Stuart Pocock reviews 12 key considerations when the outcome of a clinical trial is negative, using familiar trials to illustrate these points. Can the data be salvaged, or is it a 'no-hoper'?

Headlines: Preventing Pediatric Migraine: What Treatment Is Best?
Teaser: Where do the disappointing CHAMP trial findings leave clinicians and patients?

Headlines: Cancer Patients and Research Could Suffer After Brexit
Teaser: Six leading British academics warn that cancer treatment and research could suffer if plans are not made to safeguard access to Europe following the country's Brexit vote.

Headlines: Hormone Therapy Prolongs PFS in Low-grade Serous Cancer
Teaser: Hormone maintenance therapy prolongs progression-free survival, if not overall survival, in low-grade serous carcinoma following surgery and chemotherapy compared with routine observation alone.

Headlines: Academia and Generics: Can They Reduce Cancer Drug Costs?
Teaser: A new approach is needed to curtail the cost of cancer drugs, and a group of experts suggest a partnership between academia and generic drug companies.

Headlines: Cempra's Bacterial Skin Infection Drug Succeeds in Key Study
Teaser: Cempra Inc said on Friday that its oral experimental drug to treat acute bacterial skin infections met the main goal of a late-stage study, sending the company's shares surging about 40 percent in premarket trading.

Headlines: Extrafine pMDI Beclometasone/Formoterol in Asthma
Teaser: An extrafine pMDI formulation containing a fixed dose combination of beclometasone and formoterol may be a viable therapeutic alternative to inhaled corticosteroids for asthma.

Headlines: Identifying Inaccurate Cause of Death Reporting
Teaser: This study revealed substantial overreporting of certain conditions and underreporting of others as underlying causes of hospital deaths, which can lead to skewing of mortality statistics.

Headlines: Tenofovir Disoproxil Fumarate Safety for Women and Infants
Teaser: What does available safety data tell us about preexposure prophylaxis with tenofovir disoproxil fumarate during pregnancy and lactation?

Headlines: Revisiting the Use of Pioglitazone in the Treatment of T2D
Teaser: Is it time to reconsider the role of pioglitazone in the management of type 2 diabetes?

Headlines: Mild TBI May Exacerbate Existing Mental Health Problems in Kids
Teaser: With the widespread loosening of marijuana laws, researchers should step up efforts to consider the potential for cannabinoids in the treatment of addiction, experts say.

Headlines: Age, Time Living With Diagnosed HIV, and Self-Rated Health
Teaser: This new study examines the impact of age at diagnosis and time living with HIV on quality of life among people living with the virus.

Headlines: Hyperthyroidism and Hyperprolactinemia
Teaser: A new study explores the possible connection between these two conditions in women. What role do prolactin levels play?

Headlines: The Effects of a Take-Home Educational Video
Teaser: A take-home educational video benefits both prostate cancer patients and urology practitioners. Find out how.

Source: Current Opinion in Allergy and Clinical Immunology
Headlines: Allergen Immunotherapy: An Updated Review of Safety
Teaser: What does the latest safety data tell us about the use of allergen immunotherapy?

Headlines: Early Age at Start of ART for Better Virologic Control
Teaser: Initiating ART earlier in life may help improve virologic outcomes among infants and children with HIV.

Headlines: Brodalumab for Moderate-to-Severe Plaque Psoriasis
Teaser: The investigational drug brodalumab, an IL-17 receptor antagonist, has proven highly effective for the treatment of moderate-to-severe psoriasis; but questions remain concerning its safety.

Headlines: Hepatotoxicity of Statins and Other Lipid-lowering Agents
Teaser: How common is liver injury associated with statins? This review summarizes current knowledge on the hepatotoxicity associated with statins and other lipid lowering drugs.

Headlines: Consumption of Unprocessed and Processed Red Meat and COPD
Teaser: Consumption of both processed and unprocessed red meat has been associated with an increased risk of several chronic diseases. Should COPD be included in the list?

Headlines: Weight and QoL and Health Outcomes in Children With Asthma
Teaser: In what ways may weight impact quality of life and health outcomes among children with asthma?

Headlines: Readiness to Change Predicts Drinking
Teaser: This study examined whether three RTC measures--RTC, importance of change, and confidence in ability to change--had predictive value for alcohol use in patients with an alcohol use disorder.

Headlines: HIV-Positive People's Attitudes Towards Cure Research
Teaser: How do people living with HIV feel about the importance of and risks involved in HIV cure research?

Headlines: Phenotypes and Treatment Response
Teaser: In this commentary, the author examines the role of sensory phenotyping in our effort to understand the underlying pathophysiology of pain. How can these findings be translated to clinical practice?

Headlines: Antihistamine Updosing in Chronic Urticaria
Teaser: Is updosing of second-generation H1-antihistamines justified in all patients with chronic urticaria who don't respond sufficiently to standard dosages?

Headlines: Adiposity Markers and Lung Function in Smokers
Teaser: What is the association between adiposity markers and lung function? This study examines the connection among smokers without respiratory disease.

Headlines: 12 Weeks of Ledipasvir-Sofosbuvir for Genotype 1 Hepatitis C
Teaser: Does real-world experience with ledipasvir-sofosbuvir for genotype 1 HCV mirror the sustained viral response rates observed in clinical trials?

Headlines: New Data on Bias in Depression Trials
Teaser: Dr Peter Yellowlees talks about sponsorship bias in the comparative efficacy of psychotherapy and pharmacotherapy for adult depression.

Headlines: Case Presentation or Single-Patient Trial?
Teaser: Dr David Kerr views a case of engineered T cells in a CRC patient with pulmonary metastases as an example of a single-patient clinical trial, neatly illustrating the potential of precision medicine.

Headlines: 'I'm Mad as Hell!': Healthcare in America Today
Teaser: Dr Lieberman offers perspective on the healthcare landscape in America, repeal of the Affordable Care Act, and fiscal implications associated with clinical research and NIH funding.

Headlines: FOURIER/EBBINGHAUS: So Far, So Good. But Can We Afford It?
Teaser: Drs Harrington and Yancy review the efficacy and cognitive safety data for the PCSK9 inhibitor evolocumab, presented at the American College of Cardiology sessions.

Headlines: FOURIER Presenter, Dr Marc Sabatine, Interviewed
Teaser: Dr Mandrola gets the details on the PCSK9 inhibitor evolocumab, and asks the $64,000 (or is that $14,000) question about cost-effectiveness.

Headlines: Why Volume-Controlled Ventilation May Not Be Safe
Teaser: Dr Holley reviews a new study that investigated volume-controlled ventilation in animal models and one patient case.

Headlines: The Most Transformational Biologist of Our Era?
Teaser: Dr Eric Topol interviews CRISPR scientist Feng Zhang about his journey from China to the gene editing labs of America.

Headlines: One Doctor's Mission to Personalize Alzheimer Prevention
Teaser: Through a combination of risk assessment and personalized care, Dr Richard Isaacson hopes that Alzheimer disease can be halted in its tracks.

Headlines: Ketamine for Depression: Key Efficacy, Safety Questions Remain
Teaser: Ketamine and other glutamate-modulating agents may be the first major advance in treating major depression in years, but fundamental questions remain unanswered.

Headlines: Curing the Precision Deficit Disorder in Cancer Medicine
Teaser: Precision medicine is a work in progress that stands to reach its potential through the integration of diverse and unique approaches to cancer treatment.

Headlines: New Diabetes Drugs in Development
Teaser: Dr John Buse highlights some of the new drugs and devices being developed for type 2 and type 1 diabetes.

Headlines: Early Social Intervention Offers Hope for Autism Patients
Teaser: Dr Peter Yellowlees talks about parent-mediated social communication therapy for young children with autism.

Headlines: CDK Inhibitors, Guidelines: Brightest Stars in the MBC Sky
Teaser: Dr Fatima Cardoso names the top advances in metastatic breast cancer for 2016, noting CDK inhibitors for ER-positive patients and international guidelines as the brightest stars in the MBC sky.

Headlines: The VA System: An Integrated Healthcare Example for All
Teaser: The Veterans Health Administration is the largest integrated healthcare system in the US with a common EHR. Dr Harrington learns the advantages for cardiology practice and research.

Headlines: Flawed Studies Define International Stroke Conference
Teaser: Dr Christoph Diener explains why the latest findings from several major studies failed to impress.

Headlines: What Makes a Physician Leader?
Teaser: Some common themes emerged in interviews with more than 40 world-leading cardiologists on the secrets of their success. There are lessons for anyone with medical or nonmedical career ambitions.

Headlines: Emerging Drug-Resistant Gonorrhea: What's New and What Now?
Teaser: We are starting to lose our last line of defense against drug-resistant gonorrhea. What can be done?

Headlines: Is Precision Oncology Really Precise?
Teaser: Without a gold standard for myriad parameters, precision oncology is imprecise, at best, argues Dr Lundberg.

Headlines: Antibiotics for AOM in Kids Under 2: Must We Go Long?
Teaser: A randomized trial answers an important clinical question about the management of acute otitis media in young children.

Headlines: Calls to Boycott US Meetings Over Travel Ban May Hurt, Not Help
Teaser: Stronger international ties, not boycotts of US meetings or journals are needed in the face of travel ban, argues editorial.

Headlines: Anxiety Therapy Better for Depression Than CBT?
Teaser: Metacognitive therapy, a psychotherapeutic approach targeting rumination and negative thought processes, has a large effect size when used to treat depression and may offer an alternative to CBT.

Headlines: Defining Endoscopic Response in Ulcerative Colitis Trials
Teaser: These international recommendations represent the first consensus on measurement indices for endoscopic outcomes in ulcerative colitis.

Headlines: Hot Topics for 2017 in Orthopedics
Teaser: Dr Albert discusses the current hot topics, recent surgical advances and innovations in orthopedic surgery, including new treatments for the cervical spine.

Headlines: HER2 and Decision Making in Gastroesophageal Adenocarcinoma
Teaser: This new guideline provides specific recommendations for assessment of HER2 status in patients with advanced gastroesophageal adenocarcinoma.

Headlines: Antidepressant Efficacy in Teens Clouded by Industry Trials?
Teaser: The diuretic bumetanide improved the core symptoms of autism spectrum disorder in a phase 2b study and will be tested in an upcoming phase 3 study in Europe.

Headlines: EU Recommends Suspending Hundreds of Drugs Tested by Indian Firm
Teaser: A large number of poor-quality, industry-funded studies overwhelm the few high-quality positive studies that demonstrate the efficacy of antidepressants for teen depression, an expert says.

Headlines: New Drug Target for Opiate Use Disorder Discovered
Teaser: A new study provides the first direct evidence of opiate-related epigenetic alterations in the brain and points to a potential new drug target for opiate use disorder.

Headlines: Cancer Researcher, Under 'Review' in Ohio, Wins AACR Award
Teaser: At its annual meeting, the American Association of Cancer Research will honor Carlo Croce, MD, with a leadership award. Dr Croce is being investigated by his own university after a news article raised questions about plagiarism and research fraud.

Headlines: New Insomnia Med a Safer Option for Older Adults?
Teaser: The insomnia drug suvorexant appears to be safe and effective in older adults, without some of the risks and side effects commonly associated with of other pharmaceutical agents, new research suggests.

Headlines: EU Rapid Drug Approval Plan Worries Some National Agencies
Teaser: A push by the European Medicines Agency to speed up the approval of new drugs that show promise is running into resistance from some of the national agencies that will ultimately decide whether the medicines are worth buying.

Headlines: Schizophrenia, ALS Share Genetic Roots
Teaser: A genome-wide association study shows significant overlap in genetic susceptibility between schizophrenia and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.

Headlines: Full FDA Approval for Osimertinib for PFS Benefit in NSCLC
Teaser: The targeted drug has now shown an improvement in progression-free survival when compared to chemotherapy in certain NSCLC patients.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Trending Cardiovascular Nutrition Controversies
Teaser: What do we know about the potential cardiovascular benefits of popular food and dietary trends?

Headlines: Delirium in Critically Ill Children Common, May Go Undetected
Teaser: About a quarter of children admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) will develop delirium, according to the first large international study to assess delirium prevalence in critically ill children.

Headlines: Juno Permanently Halts CAR T-Cell Study
Teaser: After five patient deaths and other issues cited by the company, Juno has given up development of the chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) product JCAR015.

Headlines: New Biologic is 'Potential Blockbuster' for Eczema Treatment
Teaser: Dupilumab safely and effectively controls the symptoms of moderate to severe eczema over the long-term, 1-year data show. FDA approval of the biologic is expected soon, the lead investigator reports.

Headlines: Seattle Genetics to Resume Trials as FDA Lifts Clinical Hold
Teaser: Seattle Genetics Inc said on Monday the U.S. Food and Drug Administration lifted a clinical hold on several early stage studies testing its experimental cancer drug.

Headlines: TG Therapeutics' Leukemia Drug Clears Key Study, Shares Soar
Teaser: TG Therapeutics Inc said a combination of its experimental cancer drug ublituximab and AbbVie Inc's ibrutinib (Imbruvica) outperformed Imbruvica alone in high-risk leukemia patients, sending its shares up 63.5 percent in premarket trade.

Headlines: Probiotic in Yogurt May Improve Depressive Symptoms
Teaser: Lactobacillus, a probiotic bacteria found in live-culture yogurt, appears to reverse symptoms of depression in mice, and investigators believe these findings should hold true in people.

Headlines: Mobile Phone Research Feasible in Patient Study
Teaser: A Mount Sinai study based on ResearchKit used a free app to recruit, enroll, and study a large cohort of patients with asthma; results support quality of patient-reported data.

Headlines: Metastases, Not Death, New Benchmark in Prostate Cancer?
Teaser: Prostate cancer experts argue in favor of changing the primary endpoint of active surveillance trials to metastatic disease to reflect what is clinically meaningful to men.

Headlines: Trump Proposes Huge Budget Cuts for NIH, Other HHS Agencies
Teaser: The White House said the cuts were needed to offset a $54 billion increase in military spending. Medical leaders warned that they would cripple biomedical research.

Headlines: SPIRE Trials: Immune Response Thwarts PCSK9 Inhibitor Bococizumab
Teaser: In the trials, which were halted early, a immune response in many patients     diminished the drug's potent LDL-lowering effects. In another analysis,     immunogenicity was much less of an issue for alirocumab.

Headlines: Genes May Boost Infants’ Risk of Heart Defects Linked to Maternal SSRI Use
Teaser: Common variants in certain maternal and infant genes can heighten the risk of congenital heart defects in the offspring of women who use selective serotonin receptor inhibitors (SSRIs) in early pregnancy, when the fetal heart is developing, new research suggests.

Headlines: Clinical Outcomes Trials Put iFR in Same League With FFR
Teaser: Less patient discomfort, shorter procedures, and potential cost savings         favor iFR, but will that be enough to increase physiological-guided         revascularization or simply shift those already sold on FFR?

Headlines: Universal Cancer Vaccine -- Still a Pipe Dream?
Teaser: A broad vaccine targeting many different tumors has been a 'holy grail' of cancer therapy, but the seemingly limitless genetic diversity of cancer means it is unlikely, say researchers.

Headlines: Informed Consent: Ethical and Legal Considerations
Teaser: As patient advocates, nurse practitioners can play a key role in the informed consent process. Find out the ethical and legal aspects to be aware of.

Headlines: Suicide Deaths With Opioid Poisoning in the US: 1999-2014
Teaser: Are suicides involving opioids on the increase?

Headlines: PTSD: Misconceptions and the Latest Treatments
Teaser: Dr Sonya Norman, of the US Department of Veteran Affairs, discusses the PTSD therapies that seem to produce the best results.

Headlines: Vasopressin and Terlipressin for Pediatric Refractory Shock
Teaser: How does the safety and efficacy of asopressin and terlipressin therapy compare with that of conventional therapy?

Headlines: Insufficient Cardiovascular Research & Development Funding
Teaser: In this commentary, the author addresses disparities and deficiencies in research for cardiovascular disease, with a focus on the paucity of R&D funding in the European Union.

Headlines: Switching From ATV or LPV to DRV Improves Kidney Function
Teaser: HIV patients who switched their protease inhibitor to darunavir realized an improvement in renal function.

Headlines: Hydrocortisone in Managing Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia
Teaser: Is hydrocortisone a safe and effective treatment option for the prevention and treatment of bronchopulmonary dysplasia?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Safety of Very Low LDL Cholesterol Levels With Alirocumab
Teaser: New lipid-lowering drugs such as alirocumab can reduce LDL to levels below 25mg/dl. Do these very low levels have safety implications?

Headlines: Treatment of HCV Genotype 2 With Sofosbuvir and Ribavirin
Teaser: Sofosbuvir and ribavirin have been suggested as the new standard therapy for HCV genotype 2, but the results of this study suggest an alternative treatment strategy may be needed.

Headlines: Simeprevir+Sofosbuvir in Patients With HCV Genotype 4
Teaser: The OSIRIS study assessed the efficacy of simeprevir plus sofosbuvir for HCV genotype 4-infected patients, on either an 8 or 12 week regimen.

Source: Medicine and Science in Sports and Exercise
Headlines: Weight Loss and Lean Mass, Strength, Bone, Aerobic Capacity
Teaser: How does weight loss impact these parameters among overweight sedentary adults?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Proposed Neurological Endpoints for Cardiovascular CTs
Teaser: The Neurologic Academic Research Consortium has developed pragmatic definitions and assessments for neurological injury following cardiovascular procedures and interventions.

Headlines: Mesenchymal Stem Cells: 'Guardians of Inflammation'
Teaser: Find out how human mesenchymal stem cells might help protect against inflammation -- and learn how this knowledge can apply to the treatment of chronic wounds.

Headlines: Major Unanswered Questions in the Clinical Gout Field
Teaser: Advancing research has contributed to the understanding of gout and the development of new therapies, but certain questions remain.

Headlines: Anesthesia Impact on Arterial O2 During Thoracoscopic Surgery
Teaser: Is either desflurane-remifentanil or propofol-remifentanil anesthesia preferable in terms of oxygenation during one-lung ventilation for thoracoscopic surgery?

Headlines: Surgery for Vertebral Metastases: A Benefit in Lung Cancer?
Teaser: Surgical intervention for spinal metastasis has been considered less appropriate in lung cancer than in other cancers, but recent gains in expected survival may change that supposition.

Headlines: Turbulent Reign Over: Top Exec at Top Cancer Center Resigns
Teaser: MD Anderson's embattled president, Ronald DePinho, is leaving the top job, leaving behind a controversial legacy.

Headlines: EVG Concentrations in Seminal Plasma in HIV-1-Infected Men
Teaser: A new study examines elvitegravir concentrations in the semen of men who switched antiretroviral therapy to EVG/COBI/FTC/TDF. What are the implications for HIV suppression?

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Psychiatric Symptoms in Patients Receiving Dolutegravir
Teaser: Which psychiatric symptoms may be associated with the use of this antiretroviral drug -- and how often do they occur?

Source: Current Opinion in Nephrology and Hypertension
Headlines: Renal Denervation for Uncontrolled Hypertension
Teaser: Is renal denervation an effective option for managing uncontrolled hypertension?

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Prognostic Tests for Prediction of Breast Cancer Recurrence
Teaser: Which prognostic assay best predicts which patients may need adjuvant chemotherapy after endocrine therapy?

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Industry-Related Payments to Oncologists in 2014
Teaser: Research finds that financial relationships between oncologists and biomedical industries are common. Should we worry about conflict of interest?

Source: Current Opinion in Allergy and Clinical Immunology
Headlines: Strategies to Alter the Natural History of Childhood Asthma
Teaser: A new review examines recent evidence regarding approaches that may help alter the course of childhood asthma. What have we learned?

Headlines: Biosimilars in IBD: Facts and Fears of Extrapolation
Teaser: Can clinical data obtained on the efficacy of anti-TNF biosimilars in rheumatologic populations be confidently extrapolated to patients with inflammatory bowel disease?

Headlines: New ADA Chief Scientific and Medical Officer Has Many Missions
Teaser: Dr William T. Cefalu brings research, clinical, administrative, and editorial skills to the job.

Headlines: Advances in Translational Research in Arthroplasty
Teaser: Dr Bostrom shares his views on pain and instability in arthroplasty, host/implant interactions and infections of the knee, and the driving forces of healthcare economics in orthopedics.

Headlines: Which Patients Will Progress to Kidney Failure After Surgery?
Teaser: Dr Badani describes a novel surgical procedure for treating kidney cancer and provides insight on the recent advances in predicting which patients will progress to kidney failure after surgery.

Headlines: Open-Data Momentum Builds; Trialist Resistance May Be Futile
Teaser: A summit on data sharing hosted by NEJM pitted open-data evangelicals against protectionist clinical trialists. The takeaway is that the times they are a-changin', whether trialists like it or not.

Headlines: Pharmacotherapy for Alcohol Dependence
Teaser: Find out more about the pharmacotherapeutic options for alcohol dependence and learn which patients would most benefit from drug treatment.

Headlines: Bedside Glucose Monitoring--Is it Safe?
Teaser: A new study examines the question of whether a bedside glucose monitoring system is accurate and safe for use in critically ill patients.

Headlines: EEG as a Prognostic Tool After Cardiac Arrest
Teaser: What prognostic information can be obtained by continuous EEG monitoring and routine EEG after cardiac arrest?

Headlines: Emerging and Investigational Drugs for Premature Ejaculation
Teaser: Find out what there is to know about the newest agents for the pharmacologic treatment of premature ejaculation.

Headlines: Ejaculatory Dysfunction -- Evolution of a New Understanding
Teaser: How has our understanding of premature ejaculation evolved in recent years, and how has it changed approaches to diagnosis and treatment?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Impaired Orthostatic BP Recovery and Falls
Teaser: To what extent does orthostatic hypotension contribute to falls in the elderly?

Headlines: Trends and Patterns in HIV-1 Transmitted Drug Resistance
Teaser: What do we know about the prevalence of HIV-1 transmitted drug resistance in the UK in recent years? This report examines the trends.

Headlines: Women Less Likely Than Men to Be Full Professors in Cardiology
Teaser: Statistics show that gender bias is still prevalent in academia. What barriers persist for women's career advancement in academic cardiology?

Headlines: Subclinical Hypothyroidism and Cardiometabolic Biomarkers
Teaser: A new study explores the possible relationship between subclinical hypothyroidism and cardiometabolic abnormalities in women.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: 2016 Annual Report of The STS/ACC TVT Registry
Teaser: This annual report provides an update regarding the trends and outcomes of transcatheter valve procedures.

Headlines: Can BMI Predict Clinical Outcomes in Acute Lung Injury/ARDS?
Teaser: A new study explores the ways in which a patient's BMI may impact outcomes in acute respiratory distress syndrome.

Headlines: Is Propofol Injection Pain Really Important to Patients?
Teaser: Pain on injection of propofol is a common occurrence, but do patients generally recall it, and does it negatively impact their experience?

Headlines: Hormone Therapy and Changes in Menopausal Symptoms Over Time
Teaser: This study compared the efficacy of two forms of menopausal hormone therapy in alleviating vasomotor symptoms, insomnia, and irritability in early postmenopausal women over a period of 4 years.

Headlines: Precision Medicine in Children
Teaser: Review applications in Autoimmunity, Asthma, Infectious Disease, and Many Other Critical Areas

Headlines: Biosimilars in Rheumatology: Understanding the Development
Teaser: This article provides an overview of the development of biosimilars for the treatment of rheumatologic conditions.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Potent P2Y12 Inhibitors in Men Versus Women
Teaser: Do women and men derive comparable benefit from antiplatelet therapy with potent P2Y12 inhibitors such as prasugrel, ticagrelor and cangrelor?

Headlines: Maternal 25-hydroxyvitamin D Correlated With Fetal Serotonin
Teaser: A new study explores the associations between maternal serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D concentrations during pregnancy and fetal serotonin.

Headlines: Treatment of Parkinson's Disease Psychosis
Teaser: What is the best approach to treating delusions and hallucinations in patients with Parkinson's disease? A recently approved antipsychotic provides a new option.

Headlines: Tofacitinib for Rheumatoid Arthritis and Plaque Psoriasis
Teaser: Review the latest data on the oral immunosuppressant tofacitinib, recently approved for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis, and currently in Phase III trials for treating chronic plaque psoriasis.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Osteoporosis Treatment Efficacy for Men
Teaser: While osteoporotic fractures are most often studied in women, men are affected as well. Which osteoporosis treatment options offer the best protection for men?

Source: Medicine and Science in Sports and Exercise
Headlines: Instability Resistance Training in Parksinson's Disease
Teaser: Find out about the neuromuscular benefits instability resistance training may offer patients with Parkinson's disease.

Headlines: Pharmacists and Pharmacy Education in Point-of-Care Testing
Teaser: What are the issues and challenges for pharmacists surrounding point-of-care testing, particularly when performed outside traditional health care settings?

Source: Cancer Control: Journal of the Moffitt Cancer Center
Headlines: Management of Oropharyngeal Cancer in the HPV Era
Teaser: The incidence of head and neck cancer associated with HPV has increased at an epidemic rate. Review prevention and management strategies here.

Headlines: Assessment of Treatment Response in NASH Using Advanced MRI
Teaser: How well do MRI derived measures of liver fat and volume correlate to histological features of non-alcoholic steatohepatitis over time?

Headlines: Direct-Acting Antivirals in HCV and HCV/HIV Coinfection
Teaser: Does the success of oral direct-acting antivirals seen in clinical trials translate to real-world clinical practice?

Headlines: Clinical Investigation of New Glaucoma Procedures
Teaser: How effective are the new glaucoma procedures for targeting aqueous outflow? A review of current evidence provides some insight.

Headlines: Body Composition Changes After Low-Calorie Ketogenic Diet
Teaser: In what ways is the body composition of obese patients impacted after following a very-low-calorie ketogenic diet?

Headlines: Optimizing the Diagnosis of Celiac Disease
Teaser: This review provides a summary of recent advances in the diagnosis of celiac disease, focusing on diagnostic challenges and the phenotypical characterization of celiac subtypes.

Headlines: Has Precision Prevention Arrived in Alzheimer Disease?
Teaser: Dr Isaacson provides a wide-ranging overview of important concepts for Alzheimer's disease risk reduction using precision medicine.

Headlines: New Approaches Needed for Peritoneal Metastases in CRC
Teaser: Dr David Kerr challenges the oncology community to come up with rational, meaningful clinical trials to clarify the biology of metastatic peritoneal disease in colorectal cancer.

Headlines: Costs for Neurologic Diseases Soar
Teaser: Dementia, stroke, and other neurologic diseases collectively cost some $800 billion annually, and experts warn that the economic impact will worsen without increased research funding.

Headlines: HIV Pioneer Mark Wainberg, PhD, Dies Unexpectedly
Teaser: The HIV researcher and social activist drowned while swimming in Bal Harbour, Florida.

Headlines: Cancer Therapy Shortages -- Switch Can Harm Patients
Teaser: Shortages of generic injectable drugs, and the resultant switching to alternative chemotherapy, are jeopardizing patients' physical and financial health, say experts.

Headlines: Cardiovascular Safety of Ranibizumab for Diabetic Macular Edema Still Unclear
Teaser: Uncertainty lingers about the cardiovascular safety of intravitreal ranibizumab injections for diabetic macular edema, a pooled analysis of clinical trials shows.

Headlines: Absence of Amyloid in MCI Still Means Functional Decline
Teaser: A longitudinal analysis underscores differences in progression to dementia when amyloid is, or is not, present.

Headlines: And They're Off! CAR T Cells Race Toward Market
Teaser: CAR T cell therapies were once thought to be destined for use only at academic centers, but two companies have now filed for US approval.

Headlines: Home-based Macular Degeneration Monitoring Appears Cost Effective
Teaser: Home telemonitoring of people at risk for age-related macular degeneration (AMD) is potentially cost-effective, according to an economic analysis using a simulation model.

Headlines: Increase in Childhood Cancer, but Survival Rates High
Teaser: The incidence of childhood cancers has increased in recent decades.

Headlines: New US Report Calls for Scientific Integrity Panel
Teaser: Proposals by a National Academies of Science, Engineering, and Medicine committee include establishing an independent, nonprofit research integrity advisory board with dues-paying members.

Headlines: Common Antibiotic May Treat, Prevent PTSD
Teaser: The antibiotic doxycycline appears to block the formation of negative thoughts and fear memories, suggesting a potential use in the treatment and prevention of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

Headlines: How Sherlock Holmes Could Restore Faith in Science
Teaser: Smithsonian Secretary Dr David Skorton explains why he believes that scientists are partly to blame for the loss of public trust in research and how Sherlock Holmes could help.

Headlines: Drugmakers Help Turn Patients With Rare Diseases Into Lobbyists
Teaser: The pharmaceutical industry is teaming up with advocacy groups that are training and even paying for patients who need their medicines to promote their causes in Washington.

Headlines: Why This Scientist Won't Be Attending the 'Science March'
Teaser: The March on Science is more focused on politics than science, a microbiologist argues.

Headlines: New Cholera Vaccine for Adult Travelers
Teaser: Here's what you need to know for adult patients who are traveling to cholera outbreak areas and who may be candidates for the new cholera vaccine.

Headlines: Precision Medicine Pioneer Targets Earlier Cancer Detection
Teaser: Innovative oncologist Brian Druker talks about breaking out of one-size-fits-all thinking in cancer screening and prevention.

Headlines: How Should Physicians Respond to Latest Alopecia Research?
Teaser: Dr Lipper discusses evidence and strategy for treating patients with alopecia areata.

Headlines: ASCO Does Not Support 'Right-to-Try' Laws
Teaser: ASCO's all in favor of helping cancer patients gain better access to experimental drugs in their time of need, but not through 'right-to-try' legislation, which they feel could be harmful.

Headlines: Trump's FDA Pick Vows Scientific Integrity at Hearing
Teaser: Scott Gottlieb, MD, also said the nation needed to "accept no for an answer" regarding the discredited link between childhood vaccines and autism.

Headlines: Transplantation for Myeloma Patients -- Can It Wait?
Teaser: Following induction, PFS and response rates are higher for myeloma patients when transplant is part of consolidation therapy. Survival is similar to that in patients receiving transplant after relapse.

Headlines: What Will the March for Science Mean for Medicine?
Teaser: Participating physicians list support for evidence-based medicine, funding for the National Institutes of Health, and public health vigilance among the issues at stake.

Headlines: Physicians Make Themselves Heard at the March for Science
Teaser: As both march speakers and participants, physicians expressed concern for public health and research funding but also voiced hope for the beginning of a movement to elevate the role of science in society.

Headlines: Cloud Over Pediatric Oncologist and Brain Cancer Vaccine
Teaser: While the details are still unclear, Stefaan Van Gool is being investigated for ethical violations revolving around the use of an experimental cancer vaccine.

Headlines: Troubles of the Billionaire 'Moonshot' Doctor
Teaser: Only months after being in the spotlight as a potential player in the Trump administration, a wealthy doctor is beset by a rash of controversies

Headlines: NASH: The Next Untapped Pharma Market Gives Investors Many Options
Teaser: Large drugmakers with piles of cash are on the hunt for promising medicines being developed by small companies to treat non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), a progressive fatty liver disease poised to become the leading cause of liver transplants by 2020.

Headlines: British Cancer Drugs Fund: No Value to Patients
Teaser: The Cancer Drug Fund was established to provide access to drugs not available through the UK's National Health Service, but a new study finds that its value is questionable.

Headlines: Implications of Subclinical Leaflet Thrombosis in TAVR/SAVR
Teaser: Dr Makkar provides more insights from the SAVORY and RESOLVE registries on the phenomenon of bioprosthetic valve leaflet thrombosis seen on 4D CT.

Headlines: Treating, Preventing Hip and Groin Problems in the Athlete
Teaser: After an athlete has been diagnosed with a sports hernia or a hip impingement, what is the best course of treatment?

Headlines: Opioid Addiction: 'Alarming' Death Rate in Primary Care
Teaser: Opioid-related deaths have been attributed largely to overdoses. This study shows surprisingly high rates of mortality from medical causes that affect opioid addicts in primary care settings.

Headlines: Digoxin: Clues to a Threshold for This Last-Resort Drug
Teaser: Dr De Ferrari provides details on a substudy of the ARISTOTLE trial that examined digoxin blood levels and mortality in patients with and without heart failure.

Headlines: Scientists Develop Fluid-filled Artificial Womb to Help Premature Babies
Teaser: Scientists in the United States have developed a fluid-filled womb-like bag known as an extra-uterine support device that could transform care for extremely premature babies, significantly improving chances of survival.

Headlines: A Simple Intervention to Improve Patient Education and Adherence in Gout
Teaser: A rheumatologist and a social worker discuss major gaps in patient knowledge about gout, and also a novel approach to care that can help.

Headlines: Cannabis May Combat Age-Related Cognitive Decline
Teaser: Long-term administration of low-dose THC, the main ingredient in marijuana, rejuvenates the aging brain in mice, and a clinical trial in elderly adults is planned.

Headlines: Testosterone Therapy and Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Is testosterone therapy safe to use in men with a history of prostate cancer?

Headlines: Fire Simulation and Cardiovascular Health in Firefighters
Teaser: Why do firefighters experience such a high rate of myocardial infarction during fire suppression activity? This study examines the pathogenic mechanisms behind the heightened risk.

Headlines: Current Trends in Orthobiologics and Shoulder Surgery
Teaser: Get up to date on the latest trends in the use of biologics for the treatment of shoulder disease.

Headlines: PCR-RFLP Method for Genotyping in Patients With Chronic HCV
Teaser: The authors present a rapid, inexpensive, and easy to perform method for genotyping of the IFNL4 rs368234815 polymorphism in hepatitis C.

Headlines: Valbenazine Approval Highlights Lessons for Researchers
Teaser: A New England Journal of Medicine editorial notes that the recent FDA approval of valbenazine for tardive dyskinesia shows how to effectively and quickly develop a much-needed treatment.

Headlines: Guselkumab for Moderate-to-Severe Plaque Psoriasis
Teaser: Guselkumab, an interleukin-23 inhibitor currently in Phase III trials, is a promising new therapy for moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis. What do we know so far?

Headlines: AF and Risk of Invasive Breast and Colorectal Cancer
Teaser: Is there an association between atrial fibrillation and breast or colorectal cancer--and if so, how might it be explained?

Source: Journal of the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons
Headlines: Patellar Tendinopathy: Diagnosis and Treatment
Teaser: Learn more about the differential diagnoses for patellar tendinopathy and the surgical and non-surgical treatment options.

Headlines: Alopecia Areata: Current Practices vs. New Directions
Teaser: Many treatments for alopecia areata are available, but none have been validated or are FDA approved. This paper reviews therapies currently under investigation and novel modalities which show promise.

Headlines: Drug Interactions Between Hormonal Contraceptives and ART
Teaser: Could antiretroviral drugs for the treatment or prevention of HIV adversely impact the contraceptive efficacy of hormonal birth control methods?

Headlines: Effect of Physical Activity or Healthy Eating on GDM Risk
Teaser: Could engaging in regular physical activity and a healthier diet help prevent gestational diabetes mellitus?

Source: Journal of the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons
Headlines: Lumbar Spinal Stenosis: How Is It Classified?
Teaser: A unified classification system for lumbar spinal stenosis is needed to help guide appropriate treatment for the condition.

Headlines: Erectile Dysfunction, Masculinity, and Psychosocial Outcomes
Teaser: A new review provides insight into the physical and psychosocial impacts of prostate cancer treatment.

Headlines: Switch of NIV to CPAP in Obesity Hypoventilation Syndrome
Teaser: What benefits could switching from non-invasive ventilation to CPAP treatment offer patients with obesity hypoventilation syndrome?

Headlines: Upadacitinib Showing Promise in Refractory Crohn's Disease
Teaser: Rates of clinical and endoscopic remission were better with an experimental oral JAK1 inhibitor than with placebo in the 'most refractory' Crohn's disease population ever studied.

Headlines: Minimal Disease Activity and Impact of Disease in PsA
Teaser: What is the association between minimal disease activity and the impact of psoriatic arthritis?

Headlines: AEIOU Advances Uninterrupted NOAC Strategy in AF Ablation
Teaser: The preliminary data don't prove fully uninterrupted apixaban is equivalent or better than holding a single dose of the factor Xa inhibitor but offers reassurance both strategies are reasonable.

Headlines: The Benefits of Individualizing Ovarian Stimulation for IVF
Teaser: Dr Kovacs reviews a study comparing individualized dosing using a new recombinant FSH with conventional ovarian stimulation for IVF.

Headlines: Large Study Shows Reduced Oral HPV Infections With Vaccine
Teaser: Rates of oral HPV infection were reduced in young adults who had been vaccinated, suggesting protection from oropharyngeal cancer.

Headlines: A New Measure of Engagement in Out-Patient HIV Care
Teaser: The authors describe the development and implementation of a new measure of engagement in HIV care.

Headlines: Multiclass HCV Resistance to DAA Failure
Teaser: This study aimed to define the pattern of clinically relevant resistance-associated substitutions associated with real-life DAA virological failures.

Headlines: Facial Contouring by Targeted Restoration of Facial Fat
Teaser: The authors describe a grafting technique for the targeted restoration of midface fat compartment volume.

Headlines: Immunotherapy in Urothelial Carcinoma
Teaser: A new review examines the role of immunotherapy in the treatment of urothelial bladder carcinoma.

Headlines: Use of a Single Cutpoint to Identify High BP in Adolescents
Teaser: This study evaluated the risk for misclassification when using the International Diabetes Federation single-cutpoints criteria for high blood pressure in adolescents.

Headlines: Alzheimer's Disease: Focus on the Brain, Not Just Molecules
Teaser: Several recent failed trials have dealt a blow to the development of Alzheimer disease therapies aimed at molecular targets of amyloid and tau. Where do we go from here?

Headlines: Fecal Microbiota Transplantation for Recurrent C. difficile
Teaser: How do different donor products compare overall and in terms of resolution of C. difficile infection?

Headlines: Antipsychotics: No Evidence of Long-term Harm
Teaser: An expert panel finds strong support for the benefits of initial and maintenance antipsychotic therapy and little evidence of long-term harm for patients with schizophrenia.

Headlines: BMI, Other Patient Factors Help Pinpoint Best Antidepressant
Teaser: Current antidepressant prescribing is imprecise, with low remission rates, but individual patient factors, including BMI and individuals' sex, can inform decision-making and improve outcomes.

Headlines: Anti-VEGF Therapy May Reduce Diabetic Retinopathy Severity for Up to Two Years
Teaser: Treating diabetic macular edema with anti-vascular endothelial growth factor (anti-VEGF) may lead to improvements in diabetic retinopathy severity for up to two years, particularly in patients with nonproliferative disease, researchers say.

Headlines: New Biomarker Signals Poor Response in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: A new test identifies men with castration-resistant prostate cancer who have a poorer response to abiraterone and enzalutamide.

Headlines: Ads, Not Research, Create Some Pharma Best-Sellers
Teaser: A look at how and why strategic, star-studded advertising brought a drug for a little-known neurological condition into your home.

Headlines: NIH and War on Opioid Abuse Fare Well in Spending Bill
Teaser: The NIH would get a $2 billion raise in a spending bill that funds the government through September. Lawmakers also put their money where their mouth is on battling the opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Novel Drug Shows Promise for Binge Eating Disorder
Teaser: Novel agent significantly reduced episodes of binge eating compared to placebo, new research shows.

Headlines: Gilead's HIV Drug Meets Goal in Four Late-Stage Studies
Teaser: Gilead Sciences Inc said on Tuesday a combination of its experimental HIV drug with existing therapies met the main goal in four late-stage studies.

Headlines: 'Unacceptable' -- Proposed Cuts to Cancer Research
Teaser: Major cancer organizations unanimously oppose the proposed cuts to federal agencies, which they believe will dramatically impair research and affect patients.

Headlines: Radiation Boosts Immunotherapy Benefit in NSCLC
Teaser: Patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who underwent radiotherapy before receiving pembrolizumab had significantly better clinical outcomes compared with those who did not.

Headlines: Evidence Accumulates Outside of Randomized Controlled Trials
Teaser: Investigators are making the case that observational studies and large datasets are a better way to advance some research questions than conventional randomized controlled trials.

Headlines: QoL With Mini vs. Conventional Implant Retained Dentures
Teaser: Can mini implants provide a cost-effective alternative to conventional implants for denture patients with total tooth loss?

Headlines: Zuckerberg Biohub Mapping All Human Cells to Fight Disease
Teaser: Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg and his wife, Priscilla Chan, MD, a pediatrician, are investing $3 billion to help cure, prevent, or manage all disease.

Headlines: NIH Precision Medicine Initiative Set to Launch Amid Turmoil
Teaser: The National Institutes of Health Precision Medicine Initiative, first announced by President Obama, will roll out in a political climate that is drawing attention to medical biases.

Headlines: Trump Budget Revives Malpractice Damage Caps
Teaser: The White House said tough tort reform measures would save the federal government $55 billion over 10 years, part of the $3.6 trillion it's trying to cut.

Headlines: FDA Approves Sarilumab for Adults With Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: The drug will be marketed in self-injectible prefilled syringes and pens to be used once every 2 weeks. It offers an alternative to drugs such as methotrexate.

Headlines: High Rates of Anxiety in Syrian Kids, Moms Resettled in US
Teaser: Overall, just 30% of adult refugees at a Michigan clinic had full-blown PTSD. But the disorder disproportionately affected mothers and children, said researchers.

Headlines: Very Low Seroconversion Rates After Occupational Exposure to HCV or HIV in Body Fluids
Teaser: Healthcare workers exposed to body fluids contaminated with hepatitis C virus (HCV) or the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) face very low rates of seroconversion, researchers report.

Headlines: Vedolizumab Exposure in Pregnancy: Outcomes in IBD
Teaser: What does current safety data tell us about the effects of exposure to vedolizumab in pregnancy?

Headlines: Safety Events Common in Newly Approved Drugs
Teaser: More than 30% of new drugs approved by the FDA during a 10-year period are affected by a postmarket safety event.

Headlines: Milk, Fruit, Vegetable, and Antioxidant Intake and Mortality
Teaser: Might high milk consumption shorten life span through increased oxidative stress? Can the risk be modified by fruit and vegetable intake or total antioxidant intake?

Headlines: Palbociclib With Letrozole for ER-positive Breast Cancer
Teaser: Addition of this CDK inhibitor to aromatase inhibitor therapy may increase PFS in patients with ER+ advanced breast cancer.

Headlines: Supplemental Oxygen No Help in Some Forms of COPD
Teaser: Supplemental oxygen yields unexpected outcomes in COPD with moderate desaturations.

Headlines: Life and Times of Leading Cardiologists: P.K. Shah
Teaser: Dr P.K. Shah arrived in the US with $8, a suitcase, and a medical degree that cost about $70. The suitcase was stolen, but he went on to become an internationally recognized educator and researcher.

Headlines: Everything We Ought to Know About the USPSTF
Teaser: Everyone's heard of the USPSTF, but who are they? Is it a government body? What do they do? All of your questions are answered here.

Headlines: The Scoop on the New Syncope Guidelines
Teaser: Drs Win-Kuang Shen and Peter Noseworthy discuss key recommendations on the diagnosis and management of syncope as published in the new ACC/AHA guidelines.

Headlines: Culture Eats Strategy: Evidence-Based Practice
Teaser: Evidence-based practice makes sense every way you look at it. So what's stopping nurses and others from adopting this patient care strategy?

Headlines: Delays From First Medical Contact to Antibiotic in Sepsis
Teaser: Might delays in antibiotic administration contribute to a greater risk of in-hospital mortality among sepsis patients?

Headlines: The Therapeutic Landscape of Non-alcoholic Steatohepatitis
Teaser: What drugs are available for the treatment of non-alcoholic steatohepatitis? This review summarizes those currently in use as well as novel pharmacological options in ongoing trials.

Headlines: CT-P13, a Biosimilar of Anti-TNF-a for IBD
Teaser: Can CT-P13, a biosimilar of infliximab, be used safely in patients with inflammatory bowel diseases--and with comparable efficacy?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Aging, the Medical Subspecialties, and Career Development
Teaser: What progress has been made in integrating geriatrics and aging research into other medical subspecialties? This report summarizes recent collaborative work with several subspecialty associations.

Headlines: Assessment of Periodontitis Using Subgingival Pathogen Levels
Teaser: Can characterization of the bacterial content of subgingival plaque recovered from the deepest pockets be used to assess disease progression in chronic periodontitis patients?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Bioprosthetic Valve Thrombosis
Teaser: This article reviews the diagnostic challenges of bioprosthetic valve thrombosis, and details available therapeutic options, particularly within the rapidly expanding field of TAVR.

Headlines: Poor Outcome Predictors After Out-of-Hospital Cardiac Arrest
Teaser: Find out which independent predictors may indicate a poor long-term outcome among survivors of out-of-hospital cardiac arrest.

Headlines: Perioperative Anesthesia Care and Tumor Progression
Teaser: Might the perioperative anesthesia care of patients with cancer impact the immune system, and how might that affect tumor growth and long-term oncological outcomes?

Headlines: Reference Equations for Spirometric Indices
