Teaser: Long-duration androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) is widely underused in men, especially African Americans, who are undergoing definitive external beam radiotherapy (EBRT) for high-grade prostate cancer, a new U.S. study has found.

Headlines: 'No Smoking' at Home May Not Apply to Vaping
Teaser: Parents who use both traditional and e-cigarettes may vape around kids at home and in cars even when they don't smoke around their kids, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: FDA Approves Pfizer's Biosimilar to Roche's Herceptin
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Monday it approved Pfizer Inc's biosimilar to Roche AG's blockbuster breast cancer treatment Herceptin (trastuzumab).

Headlines: Gene-Expression Signature in Blood Predicts Kidney Graft Rejection
Teaser: A multivariable gene-expression signature in peripheral blood of kidney-transplant recipients allows early identification of T cell-mediated rejection, according to results from the KALIBRE study.

Headlines: T Cell Clonal Expansion Linked to Postop Recurrence of Crohn's in Smokers
Teaser: Among smokers with Crohn's disease, increased T cell clonal expansion, especially in the CD8 compartment, is exaggerated and is associated with an increased rate of disease recurrence after ileocolonic resection, according to results from the REMIND Study Group.

Headlines: Remote Surveillance of Pacemakers, Defibrillators Adequate for at Least 2 Years
Teaser: Remote monitoring and remote interrogation every six months provide safe and efficient surveillance in patients with pacemakers and implantable cardiac defibrillators (ICDs), researchers from Spain report.

Headlines: Beyond Cancer: CAR T-Cell Therapy Now Investigated in Lupus
Teaser: CAR T-cell therapy extended survival and deferred manifestations of lupus in mouse models.

Headlines: Trump Budget Seeks 12% HHS Cut, Medicaid Work Rules, FDA Boost
Teaser: The White House on Monday unveiled a budget request that proposes changes in Medicare, including its payment approach for physician services provided in offices owned by hospitals.

Headlines: Eye Exam Detects Signs of Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: Using an ultrasensitive scanning technique, researchers can detect signs of Alzheimer's disease in the tiny blood vessels at the back of the eye, according to a new report.

Headlines: Hip Exercises May Improve Walking, Pain With Knee Arthritis
Teaser: Patients with knee osteoarthritis can add hip-strengthening exercises to their workout to improve the ability to walk and maybe reduce pain, according to a research review.

Headlines: Dutch Join Backlash at Expensive Drugs by Making Their Own
Teaser: In a radiation-proof room at the Erasmus Medical Center in Rotterdam, Emar Thomasa sits behind shielded glass as he carefully measures and mixes lutetium octreotate, an intravenous treatment for certain types of cancer.

Headlines: Hidden FDA Reports Detail Harm Caused by Medical Devices
Teaser: The Food and Drug Administration has let medical device companies file reports of injuries and malfunctions outside a widely scrutinized public database, leaving doctors and medical sleuths in the dark.

Headlines: Resources Needed to Give DiRECT T2D Remission Hope to All
Teaser: More dietetics training and long-term follow-up are needed to take the T2D remission rates in DiRECT beyond the NHS England pilots, say UK clinicians who point to cost benefits with the approach.

Headlines: Low-Dose Aspirin May Not Reduce Prostate-Cancer Mortality
Teaser: Low-dose aspirin does not appear to reduce overall post-diagnosis prostate-cancer mortality, but it might reduce mortality several years from cancer diagnosis, according to results from the Danish Cancer Registry.

Headlines: Drug Concentrations, Immunogenicity Predict Anti-TNF Treatment Failure
Teaser: About one-quarter of patients with active luminal Crohn's disease (CD) do not respond to anti-tumor necrosis factor (TNF) drugs, while about two-thirds don't achieve remission, according to new research.

Headlines: Knee Surgery for Torn Cartilage May Not Be Worthwhile
Teaser: Many middle-aged and older adults with a meniscal tear and knee pain are not likely to benefit from arthroscopic partial meniscectomy (APM), a review of past studies suggests.

Headlines: Repeated Mass Treatment With Ivermectin Curbs Malaria in Young Children in West Africa
Teaser: Repeated mass administration of ivermectin in Burkina Faso reduced childhood malaria episodes by 20% during the transmission season without significantly increasing adverse events, according to a proof-of-principle study.

Headlines: More U.S. Youth Seeking Help During Psychiatric Emergencies
Teaser: The number of young people visiting U.S. emergency rooms with psychiatric problems is rising, driven largely by a surge in teens and minority youth seeking urgent help for mental illnesses, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Childhood Cancer Survivors at High Risk for Skin Malignancies
Teaser: As adults, childhood cancer survivors have a 30-fold higher risk than the general population of developing basal cell carcinoma, a Dutch study suggests.

Headlines: Cancer Drugs Dominate Top 10 Best-Selling Drugs in 2018
Teaser: But Humira is the top seller in US 2 years running, while two immune checkpoint inhibitors break into the top 10.

Headlines: No End in Sight, Bladder Cancer Drug Shortage Takes a Toll
Teaser: The immunotherapy BCG is in short supply in the United States. The American Urological Association and other groups have responded with a set of treatment strategies for clinicians, but problems are piling up.

Headlines: EU Panel Backs Risankizumab (Skyrizi) for Plaque Psoriasis
Teaser: The interleukin-23 inhibitor is for treatment of moderate to severe plaque psoriasis in adults who are candidates for systemic therapy.

Headlines: Aerobic Exercise Eases Depression, Even in Chronically Ill
Teaser: People with chronic health problems who suffer from depression may find their mood improve when they do aerobic exercise, a research review suggests.

Headlines: Allergan Depression Treatment Fails Studies
Teaser: Allergan Plc said on Wednesday its experimental add-on treatment for depression failed three late-stage studies, casting doubts over its drugs pipeline.

Headlines: Prospect of Bright Light Therapy for MDD in Parkinson Dims
Teaser: Researchers report results from a randomized clinical trial to illuminate the effect of bright light therapy for the treatment of major depression in Parkinson disease.

Headlines: Cellulitis Readmissions Common, Costly, Preventable
Teaser: Readmission after hospitalization for cellulitis is "common and costly and may be preventable," researchers say.

Headlines: WHO Chief Unveils Reforms, With More Science, Apps and an Academy
Teaser: The World Health Organization unveiled a landmark reform on Wednesday that targets billions of people around the globe and puts a stress on primary care for all rather than "moonshot" projects like eradicating diseases.

Headlines: Bayer Launches Combination Insecticide to Fight Resistant Malaria
Teaser: German drugmaker Bayer AG launched on Wednesday the world's first combination indoor insecticide in Africa to help fight insecticide-resisant strains of malaria that have frustrated global attempts to stamp out the disease.

Headlines: Single-Patient Trials Help Find Best Medication for Hypertensive Kids
Teaser: There is no single blood pressure-lowering drug that works for most hypertensive children, but single-patient randomized crossover trials (n-of-1 trials) can be used to optimize their management, researchers report.

Headlines: Female Scientists Get Smaller First-Time Grants Than Men
Teaser: Women in science receive smaller research grants than men even when they have similar qualifications, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Genes May Explain Why Some Women on the Pill Still Get Pregnant
Teaser: It's long been assumed that women who get pregnant on birth control pills somehow erred, possibly by forgetting a dose. But a new study suggests some women may inherit genes that break down contraceptive hormones more rapidly, leaving them with hormone levels that are too low to prevent pregnancy.

Headlines: Rapid Weight Loss Keeps Promise of T2D Remission for 2 Years
Teaser: Two-year DiRECT data underlines how type 2 diabetes patients who achieve remission after rapid weight loss can remain disease-free and reduce their medication reliance and CVD risk, say UK clinicians.

Headlines: Deep Electrodes May Outperform Subdural Grids in Epilepsy Localization
Teaser: Stereoelectroencephalography (SEEG) appears to be more versatile and have better procedural morbidity than subdural electrode (SDE) implantation for identifying the source of seizures in patients with intractable epilepsy, according to a comparative analysis.

Headlines: Explanted Mesh Doesn't Need Microscopic Assessment
Teaser: There is no value to sending a mesh specimen for microscopic pathology evaluation, regardless of the reason for removal, nor can any clinical claims be made based on pathology findings from explanted mesh, researchers say.

Headlines: Early Response to PD-1 Blockade Predicts Melanoma Outcomes
Teaser: The response to a single dose of neoadjuvant PD-1 blockade predicts clinical outcomes in patients with stage III/IV resectable melanoma, researchers report.

Headlines: Residual Disease May Predict Multiple Myeloma Prognosis
Teaser: Measuring minimal residual disease before, during, or after transplant may offer useful prognostic information for multiple myeloma patients, say US scientists.

Headlines: Philippines to Charge Officials of Sanofi, Gov't Over Deaths Linked to Vaccine
Teaser: The Philippine Department of Justice said on Friday it has found probable cause to indict officials from French drugmaker Sanofi and former and current Philippine health officials over 10 deaths it said were linked to use of a dengue vaccine.

Headlines: Low Rates of Viral Suppression Among Young Black Men With HIV
Teaser: Young black men with HIV have far lower rates of viral suppression than others with HIV, according to results from the Medical Monitoring Project (MMP).

Headlines: Lactobacilli Reduce Wheat-Induced Intestinal Inflammation in Mice
Teaser: Lactobacilli reduce wheat-induced intestinal inflammation in mice by degrading wheat amylase trypsin inhibitors (ATI), researchers report.

Headlines: New Consensus Statement on MS Imaging Strategies
Teaser: The North American Imaging in Multiple Sclerosis Cooperative has released a consensus statement and summary of benefits and limitations for 17 different imaging techniques.

Headlines: New Risk Score Helps Predict Intra-Abdominal Abscess in Crohn's Disease
Teaser: A new, five-parameter risk score accurately predicts intra-abdominal abscess in Crohn's disease (CD) patients presenting to the emergency department (ED), researchers from Israel report.

Headlines: Sleep Apnea Common in Pregnant Obese Women
Teaser: Undiagnosed, mild obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) is common in late pregnancy among women who are obese, U.S. researchers report.

Headlines: J&J Prices Ketamine-Like Depression Treatment at $590-$885 for Two Doses
Teaser: Johnson & Johnson said on Wednesday its nasal spray depression treatment, called Spravato, will be priced at $590 for a 56 mg dose and $885 for 84 mg.

Headlines: User-Friendly Visual-Acuity Chart Shows Good Agreement With Existing Charts
Teaser: The Runge near-vision card is user-friendly and shows good agreement with the Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) and Snellen visual-acuity charts, researchers report.

Headlines: Living Alone Does Not Appear to Worsen Heart Disease
Teaser: The Serious Illness Care Program helps oncologists have better serious-illness conversations with patients without creating anxiety or depression, according to results of a cluster-randomized clinical trial.

Headlines: Program Improves Communication Between Oncology Clinicians and Patients
Teaser: The FDA issued a partial hold on all ongoing clinical trials evaluating venetoclax in multiple myeloma because of an excessive number of deaths seen in the BELLINI study.

Headlines: Knee Replacement in Younger Patients Has Higher Complication Rate
Teaser: In the absence of whole-brain radiation, neurosurgical resection in patients with brain metastases may boost pachymeningeal seeding, a new study hints.

Headlines: Brain Surgery for Metastasis Tied to Distinctive Tumor Spread
Teaser: Sleep disturbances predict suicidal ideation in adolescents, according to a new systematic review and meta-analysis.

Headlines: Sleep Problems Linked to Suicidal Thoughts in Youth
Teaser: It would be irresponsible for any scientist to conduct human gene-editing studies in people, and a central registry of research plans should be set up to ensure transparency, World Health Organization experts said on Tuesday.

Headlines: WHO Panel Calls for Registry of All Human Gene Editing Research
Teaser: A semiautomated fact-checking tool, the Seek & Blastn tool, has found numerous errors in nucleotide-sequence reagents in biomedical research publications, researchers report.

Headlines: Fact-Checking Finds Many Errors in Published Nucleotide-Sequence Reagents
Teaser: In a comparison of gas versus needle, a new pragmatic trial has shown that using a volatile anesthesia agent during elective coronary-artery bypass grafting (CABG) did not produce fewer deaths after one year.

Headlines: No Survival Benefit for Volatile Anesthesia in Elective CABG Surgery
Teaser: A new study in patients with rifampin-resistant tuberculosis (TB) is providing the first strong evidence that the Bangladesh protocol for treating multidrug-resistant (MDR)-TB, which is used for 9 to 11 months, is not inferior to the standard regimen recommended by the World Health Organization, which requires treatment for 20 months.

Headlines: Hopes Dashed for Aducanumab in Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: The phase 3 ENGAGE and EMERGE trials, which were assessing the novel amyloid-B-targeting agent aducanumab for Alzheimer's-related dementia, have been discontinued due to futility.

Headlines: Shaving 10 Months Off Treatment Not Inferior Against Rifampin-Resistant TB
Teaser: Testosterone replacement therapy decreased the risk for biochemical recurrence in some men and delayed time to recurrence in others, findings that took investigators by surprise.

Headlines: Algorithm Automatically Detects Major Thoracic Diseases on Chest X-Rays
Teaser: A new deep-learning-based automated-detection (DLAD) algorithm accurately classifies major thoracic diseases on chest x-rays, researchers from South Korea report.

Headlines: Improvised Nasal Naloxone Devices Might Deliver Insufficient Medication
Teaser: Improvised nasal naloxone devices (INND) commonly used by first responders and the general public deliver significantly less naloxone than regulator-approved devices, according to a study from the National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA).

Headlines: Weight Gain, Blood Pressure Rise Seen With JAK Inhibitor Therapy
Teaser: Pharmacologic inhibition of Janus kinases (JAK) 1 and 2 is associated with significant weight gain and increased systolic blood pressure, according to a review of patients treated with the JAK1/2 inhibitor ruxolitinib.

Headlines: Enucleation Might Be Better Option for Men With Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia
Teaser: Enucleation might be a better option than resection of the prostate for men with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH), according to a new meta-analysis.

Headlines: HCV Infection is Associated With Insulin Resistance
Teaser: A new study examines the tissue-specific contribution to insulin sensitivity in hepatitis C. Does insulin sensitivity improve with viral eradication?

Headlines: New Antibiotics for Community-Acquired Pneumonia
Teaser: The treatment of community-acquired pneumonia has become increasingly challenging due to antibiotic resistance, but the availability of new agents may offer more options.

Headlines: Tighter SBP Target Could Harm Smokers With Severe Hypertension
Teaser: Intensive management of hypertension in smokers may increase their risk of cardiovascular events, according to a new secondary analysis of data from the Systolic Blood Pressure Intervention Trial (SPRINT).

Headlines: Artesunate Now First-Line Treatment for Severe Malaria in US
Teaser: With quinidine discontinued and no longer available in the US, artesunate is now the first-line treatment for severe malaria in the US, according to the CDC.

Headlines: Overturning Dogma -- Using Testosterone in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Persistent chemotherapy-induced alopecia (pCIA) is often more severe than endocrine-induced alopecia after chemotherapy (EIAC), but both conditions are associated with a "negative emotional effect," researchers say.

Headlines: Seizure Freedom in TLE Tied to Piriform Cortex Resection
Teaser: Results from a study of individuals with temporal lobe epilepsy (TLE) who underwent surgery could have important implications in terms of a target for drug development and deep brain stimulation.

Headlines: Clinical Trials With Venetoclax on Hold Because of Deaths
Teaser: Total knee replacement (TKA) is increasingly being performed in younger patients and new research suggests that these patients have a higher risk for complications than older patients.

Headlines: IVIG Plus Cyclosporine Boosts Heart Outcomes in Resistant Kawasaki Disease
Teaser: Adding cyclosporine to intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG) may prevent adverse coronary artery outcomes in Kawasaki disease patients at risk of not responding to IVIG alone, researchers say.

Headlines: Common Simple Tests for Dehydration Don't Work for Older Care-Home Residents
Teaser: Looking at someone's eyes, skin, the inside of their mouth, or asking them if they're thirsty, tired, or have a headache, doesn't reveal dehydration in older people living in care homes, according to new research from the U.K.

Headlines: New US Reference Standard for Amniotic Fluid Volume
Teaser: A new chart based on observations from more than 1,700 women can serve as a U.S. reference standard for amniotic fluid volume, researchers report.

Headlines: Better Lymphoma Outcomes With Bendamustine-Rituximab Combination
Teaser: The combination of bendamustine and rituximab provides better progression-free survival (PFS), event-free survival, and duration of response in patients with indolent non-Hodgkin lymphoma and mantle-cell lymphoma, compared with other regimens, according to five-year results from the BRIGHT follow-up study.

Headlines: Pulmonary Fibrosis Foundation Warns Against Stem Cell Infusions
Teaser: The foundation calls for-profit stem cell centers 'the modern-day equivalent of snake oil' and warned against having stem cell treatments except in clinical trials.

Headlines: TWiST Strengthens PARP Inhibitor Role in Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: New analysis of the NOVA trial confirms clinical benefit from niraparib for patients with recurrent ovarian cancer. The benefit occurred both in patients with and in those without BRCA mutations.

Headlines: From Bench to Bedside: ENDO 2019 Ties Science to Clinical Care
Teaser: 'What distinguishes ENDO from other meetings is that you get a curated view of what is the newest, hottest, and best in science, which you know...is going to be impacting care.'

Headlines: Chemo for Early-Stage Prostate Cancer? RTOG 0521 Says Maybe
Teaser: In major clinical trial, docetaxel, which is typically used in metastatic disease, improved outcomes in high-risk, early-stage disease. However, the survival results fell short of the trial target.

Headlines: TAVR Low-Risk Studies Get Standing Ovation at ACC
Teaser: The success of the two trials of transcatheter aortic valve replacement in low-surgical-risk patients stole the show at the ACC today.

Headlines: Diagnosis, Treatment of Opioid Use Disorder in Pregnancy Tied to State Laws in US
Teaser: Patterns of diagnosis and treatment of opioid use disorder (OUD) in pregnant women in the U.S. vary significantly by region and by whether the disorder is criminalized by state laws, researchers say.

Headlines: Mosquito-Killing Drug Offers New Tool for Fighting Malaria
Teaser: Primary clinical outcomes were similar for catheter ablation and meds-only in the atrial fibrillation trial. But secondary ablation advantages could help inform shared decision-making, say observers.

Headlines: CABANA Published: Mixed Results, Helpful Insights
Teaser: Adult survivors of childhood cancer tend to have an incorrect perception of their infertility risk and need ongoing fertility care, a large single-site longitudinal study suggests.

Headlines: Childhood-Cancer Survivors Get Infertility Risk Wrong, Require Long-Term Fertility Care
Teaser: Having more than one pregnancy has long been linked to lower odds of breast cancer, and a new study suggests that may hold true even for some women with genetic mutations that put them at high risk for these malignancies.

Headlines: Atezolizumab Safe in Advanced Urothelial Cancer
Teaser: The SAUL phase 3b trial met its primary safety endpoint, but the comparative efficacy of the anti-PD-L1 agent in a broader population is still up in the air.

Headlines: Long-Term Cancer Survivors at Higher Risk of Hospitalization for Other Diseases
Teaser: Survivors of the 12 most common cancers are at higher risk for a wide range of diseases that require hospitalization and should be monitored for new illnesses during follow-up visits, researchers say.

Headlines: Pregnancies Tied to Breast Cancer Odds for High-Risk Women
Teaser: Certain women with breast cancer and untreated osteoporosis show accelerated progression of bone metastasis, according to a new study from Taiwan.

Headlines: Untreated Osteoporosis May Hasten Progression of Bone Metastasis
Teaser: The emails, tweets and blog posts in the "abuse" folder that Michael Sharpe keeps on his computer continue to pile up. Eight years after he published results of a clinical trial that found some patients with chronic fatigue syndrome can get a little better with the right talking and exercise therapies, the Oxford University professor is subjected to almost daily, often anonymous, intimidation.

Headlines: New Studies Support Dropping Long-term Aspirin After Stenting
Teaser: The STOPDAPT-2 and SMART-CHOICE trials both suggest extended therapy with clopidogrel or another P2Y12 inhibitor alone may be preferable to dual antiplatelet therapy.

Headlines: Higher Total Body Radiation Dose Before Haploidentical BMT Cuts Graft-failure Rates
Teaser: A higher dose of total body irradiation (TBI) before haploidentical transplant in patients with severe hemoglobinopathy can reduce graft failure rates without increasing transplant-related morbidity and mortality, according to results from a prospective clinical trial.

Headlines: Meet the Whistleblower Who Just Cost Duke $112.5 Million
Teaser: Joseph Thomas turned frustration about faulty research into more than $30 million -- and is hopeful for the future of scientific integrity.

Headlines: ADA and ACP Docs Debate Diabetes Goals: Outcome Is Surprise
Teaser: 'A reasonable HbA1c goal for many nonpregnant adults with diabetes is < 7%.' Debate follows controversy last year when the American College of Physicians issued looser HbA1c guidelines than ADA.

Headlines: What the HPV Vaccine Achieved in Only 6 Years
Teaser: The impact of HPV type 16/18 vaccination: Dr Maurie Markman discusses recent results from a study of cervical precancers from 2008 to 2014.

Headlines: Back to the Future: Relearning How to Use Human Insulin
Teaser: Jay Shubrook and Anne Peters describe best-practice strategies for using human insulin in patients who cannot afford analogues.

Headlines: On Causality, Confounders, and Lots of Rosé
Teaser: Are you seeing that study through rosé-colored glasses? Dr Perry Wilson talks about confounding and how it can mess with a study's assessment of causality.

Headlines: Is CREDENCE a Game Changer for Diabetic Nephropathy?
Teaser: The medical community is marveling at the results of the CREDENCE trial. But can one study really change clinical practice? Perry Wilson shares his thoughts.

Headlines: ISCHEMIA: Do Baseline Data Hint at Triumph for OMT?
Teaser: The success of OMT and the decline of patients with severe ischemia may make it difficult for ISCHEMIA to show benefit for revascularization, predicts Mayo Clinic's Raymond Gibbons, MD.

Headlines: Calling Time on the Failure in Heart Failure
Teaser: Optimal medical therapy and recent advances show that heart failure is preventable and not obligatory, Clyde Yancy tells Bob Harrington.

Headlines: The Ever-Changing MS Treatment Landscape
Teaser: After being involved in some of the most pivotal trials in multiple sclerosis, Dr Cohen looks ahead to what may be next.

Headlines: Should We Be Doing Molecular Testing at the Time of Acquired Resistance?
Teaser: A study of ALK-positive lung cancer raises questions about the role of repeat biopsies, as well as the relative value of tissue versus plasma molecular testing.

Headlines: MitraClip for Secondary MR: Patient Selection Will Be Key
Teaser: Wayne Batchelor, MD, and Catherine Otto, MD, discuss MitraClip for secondary MR. With FDA approval for this indication, how should cardiologists select patients to ensure COAPT-like results ?

Headlines: Vaping for Weight Loss? 5 FAQs
Teaser: At least some of your patients are probably turning to vaping as a way to lose weight. What should you know about it?

Headlines: Criminal, Socially Inappropriate Behavior More Common With Frontotemporal Dementia
Teaser: Medical marijuana users gradually shift to cannabis formulations higher in tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) over time, according to new findings.

Headlines: Surrogates Speed Cancer Drug Approvals, but Only by 11 Months
Teaser: Is a 12% reduction in time to market worth the uncertainty of overall survival, researchers ask. A commenter says the cost savings and potential benefit to patients and healthcare are worth the risk.

Headlines: Peanut Oral Immunotherapy Safe for Preschoolers in Real-World
Teaser: The investigational test, based on differential responses to hyperosmotic stress, may serve as a low-cost diagnostic for myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS).

Headlines: Universal Ultrasound in Late Pregnancy May Be Cost-Effective, Potentially Life-Saving in the UK
Teaser: Oral immunotherapy for peanut allergy is safe in preschool-aged children when given as routine treatment in a hospital or clinic, a new study has found.

Headlines: Dozens of Clinics Market Risky Cell Therapies to Treat Eye Disorders
Teaser: Scores of clinics across the United States directly advertise expensive - but unproven - stem cell therapies to patients with serious eye diseases, often with devastating results, a new study warns.

Headlines: Fecal Microbiome Signature Detects Cirrhosis in Nonalcoholic Fatty-Liver Disease
Teaser: A fecal microbiome signature accurately detects cirrhosis in patients with nonalcoholic fatty-liver disease (NAFLD), researchers report.

Headlines: Indoor Tanning May Trigger Gene Mutation That Boosts Melanoma Risk
Teaser: Indoor tanning is associated with a higher risk of developing the deadly skin cancer melanoma at younger ages, and a recent study suggests the ultraviolet (UV) light in tanning beds may be triggering genetic mutations that can lead to skin malignancies.

Headlines: Hospitalized Teens Not Getting Needed Reproductive-Health Care
Teaser: Healthcare providers are missing numerous opportunities to identify and address the reproductive-health needs of hospitalized teens, a study by U.S. researchers has found.

Headlines: Biogen SMA Drug Price, Novartis Estimates for Its Treatment Far Too High -U.S. Group
Teaser: Biogen Inc should slash the price of its spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) drug, and the $4 million to $5 million Novartis has said its experimental gene therapy for the disease is worth is excessive, an independent U.S. organization that reviews the value of medical treatments said on Wednesday.

Headlines: ITP and B-cell Lymphoma Feature in Latest BSH Guidance
Teaser: Recommendations on tackling osteoporosis in immune thrombocytopenia and mediastinal B-cell lymphoma management are the latest guidance by the British Society for Haematology in a prolific year.

Headlines: Endoscopic Clip Closure After Large Polyp Resection in Right Colon Reduces Bleeding
Teaser: Endoscopic clip closure after resection of large sessile polyps in the proximal colon reduced the risk of post-procedure bleeding in a multicenter randomized trial, researchers say.

Headlines: Adjunctive IV Nitroprusside of No Value in Treatment-Resistant Schizophrenia
Teaser: Adjunctive intravenous sodium nitroprusside (IV SNP) is not effective for individuals with schizophrenia who have a history of treatment resistance, results of a proof-of-concept clinical trial reveal.

Headlines: Lenalidomide Plus Rituximab Ups Response in Relapsed Indolent Lymphoma
Teaser: In patients with relapsed or refractory indolent non-Hodgkin lymphoma, adding lenalidomide to rituximab improves response, according to a placebo-controlled trial.

Headlines: University of Illinois Missed Warning Signs of Research Going Awry
Teaser: UIC has played down its shortcomings in overseeing the work of a prominent child psychiatrist, but newly obtained documents show that the school acknowledged its lapses to federal officials.

Headlines: Elite Hospitals Plunge Into Unproven Stem Cell Treatments
Teaser: Critics are concerned about the explosion in controversial stem cell procedures offered by clinics and, increasingly, respected hospitals.

Headlines: Chlorhexidine Does Not Reduce MDR Organisms in Non-ICU Hospital Areas
Teaser: Chlorhexidine bathing is no better than routine bathing for preventing multidrug-resistant organisms and all-cause bloodstream infections in non-critical-care hospital patients, according to results from the ABATE Infection trial.

Headlines: Study Points to New Antibody Approach to Tackling Ebola, Other Infections
Teaser: For people with celiac disease, even tiny amounts of gluten in foods can cause trouble, and restaurants may be the hardest places to avoid the hidden protein, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Novo Nordisk and Gilead Team Up to Test Fatty Liver Disease Treatment
Teaser: Novo Nordisk and Gilead Sciences will join forces on a clinical trial combining drugs from the two pharmaceutical firms to treat a progressive fatty liver disease known as NASH.

Headlines: Insulin Pump No Better Than Multiple Daily Injections in Kids With Diabetes
Teaser: Continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion (CSII) provides no benefit over multiple daily injection (MDI) regimens in children and young people newly diagnosed with type 1 diabetes, researchers from U.K. report.

Headlines: HIV-1 Envelope Protein Opening Exposes Antibody Targets
Teaser: An asymmetric opening of the HIV-1 envelope protein (Env) exposes targets that induce antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (ADCC), researchers report.

Headlines: Cool but Confused: Social Entrepreneurs Find It Harder to Explain Their Work
Teaser: Two rarely encountered genetic variants that already have roles in dementias also appear to be associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD), according to a large genetic study.

Headlines: Childhood Mortality Declining Globally but Disability on the Rise
Teaser: Children today are more likely to survive to early adulthood than they were in years past, but progress has been concentrated in higher-income countries and a growing number of kids worldwide are living with disabling health problems, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Deep-Learning Model May Help Predict NSCLC Outcomes, Survival
Teaser: A deep-learning model that uses serial imaging scans of tumors from patients with non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) may predict treatment response and survival better than standard clinical parameters alone, researchers say.

Headlines: Rare Genetic Variants Tied to Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: Targeted drug delivery (TDD) reduces costs and healthcare utilization when added to conventional medical management (CMM) for patients with cancer-related pain, according to new findings.

Headlines: Getting Ready for Resistance to First-Gen NTRK Inhibitors
Teaser: Just a few months ago, larotrectinib was approved for treating any NTRK+ tumor. Already, there are studies in place to address any mutations that emerge with the first-generation TRK-targeted agent.

Headlines: New Nursing Home Patients May Wait to See a Doctor
Teaser: When Medicare patients are discharged from a hospital to a skilled nursing facility, the time it takes for a doctor or advanced-level practitioner to see them for a first evaluation can vary widely, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Activated Charcoal Bag Tied to Big Rise in Proper Disposal of Unused Opioids After Surgery
Teaser: Post-op patients given an activated charcoal bag upon discharge showed close to a four-fold increase in appropriate disposal of unused opioids, researchers say.

Headlines: Couple-Focused Program Reduces Risky Sex for Men Under Community Supervision
Teaser: A couple-based intervention for prevention of HIV and sexually transmitted infection (STI) reduces risky sexual behavior among men in community-supervision programs (CSPs), a new randomized clinical trial shows.

Source: Journal of the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons
Headlines: Medial Unicompartmental Arthroplasty of the Knee
Teaser: Learn more about the benefits of medial unicompartmental knee arthroplasty, how to identify suitable surgical candidates, and how it compares with total knee arthroplasty.

Headlines: HRQoL in Giant Cell Arteritis Treated With Tocilizumab
Teaser: How might the addition of tocilizumab impact health-related quality of life among giant cell arteritis patients?

Headlines: Strategy for Treatment of Stage IV HER2+ Gastric Cancer
Teaser: This case presents a patient successfully treated with a novel strategy for stage IV HER2-positive gastric cancer, which usually has a poor prognosis.

Headlines: Menstruation and QoL in Women With Sickle Cell Disease
Teaser: This study aimed to elucidate the clinical features of menstruation in young women with sickle cell disease, and their impact on quality of life.

Headlines: Efficacy and Safety of IDegLira in Older Patients With T2D
Teaser: IDegLira is an insulin degludec/liraglutide combination that has been shown to improve glycemic control in type 2 diabetes. Is it a safe and effective option for older patients?

Headlines: Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir in Chronic HCV Genotype 3 Infection
Teaser: Is glecaprevir/pibrentasvir effective in patients with chronic HCV genotype 3 infection and compensated cirrhosis?

Headlines: Emerging Drugs for Residual CV Risk in Statin-Treated Adults
Teaser: Learn about the many novel therapeutics recently approved or under development which target LDL-C and/or triglycerides via different mechanisms than do statins.

Headlines: Depression, Lifestyle Factors and Cognitive Function in HIV
Teaser: How does cognitive function differ between HIV-positive and HIV-negative individuals -- and what role might depressive symptoms and lifestyle factors may play in these differences?

Headlines: Oral Anticancer Therapy: Management of Drug Interactions
Teaser: This in-depth review summarizes notable DDIs associated with TKIs and other oral anticancer agents and provides evidence-based management strategies.

Headlines: Gabapentin and Pregabalin for Pain in Children, Adolescents
Teaser: What is the current evidence for the safety and efficacy of gabapentin and pregabalin for neuropathic and postoperative pain in children and adolescents?

Headlines: Hormonal Contraception and Peak BMD Accrual in Adolescents
Teaser: In what ways might the use of combined hormonal contraceptives impact BMD accrual among adolescents?

Headlines: African American Women at Higher Risk of Revascularization, MI After PCI
Teaser: African American women are three times as likely as white women to have a myocardial infarction (MI) in the year following stent placement, and their risk of target vessel revascularization is almost doubled, new research shows.

Headlines: Study Designs for Surgical Interventions in Cerebral Palsy
Teaser: Certain study designs used in cerebral palsy research may impact the validity of the extracted evidence. Should alternative study designs be considered?

Headlines: Pembrolizumab May Help Some With Advanced Non-Small-Cell Lung Cancer
Teaser: Pembrolizumab (Keytruda, Merck) may have ongoing benefits for people with advanced non-small-cell lung cancer expressing programmed death ligand 1 (PD-L1), extended follow-up of an open-label study shows.

Headlines: New Monitoring System Reduces Blind Spots During Esophagogastroduodenoscopy
Teaser: The new WISENSE monitoring system reduces blind-spot rates during esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD), researchers from China report.

Headlines: Older Diabetes Patients Often Unaware of Hypoglycemia
Teaser: Older adults with type 1 diabetes typically spend more than an hour a day in the hypoglycemic range, while those who aren't aware their blood sugar is low can spend more than 100 minutes a day in the hypoglycemic range, a new study suggests.

Headlines: IVF Tied to Slight Increased Risk of Rare Childhood Cancers
Teaser: Certain rare childhood cancers may be more common in children conceived via in vitro fertilization (IVF), a U.S. study suggests, but parents needn't lose sleep over this finding, according to the researchers.

Headlines: Margin Guidelines Affect Breast-Cancer Surgical Trends
Teaser: Rates of breast-conserving surgery for early-stage breast cancer increased and repeat surgery decreased following dissemination of 2014 margin guidelines, according to new findings.

Headlines: DART: Success Story in High-Grade Neuroendocrine Carcinomas
Teaser: Patients with high-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas benefit from dual checkpoint inhibition with ipilimumab and nivolumab after single-agent checkpoint inhibition has failed. Is dual checkpoint blockade ready for prime time?

Headlines: Ig Overused in Immune Thrombocytopenia, Flash Mob Audit Shows
Teaser: A novel form of audit that pooled data from a large number of centres over a short period of time has revealed that many UK immune thrombocytopenia patients are not receiving recommended therapy.

Headlines: Rituximab Fails to Improve Symptoms in ME/CFS
Teaser: New findings in treating myalgic encephalomyselitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS) contradict previous observations and preliminary trial results; illness heterogeneity was cited as a research challenge.

Headlines: Dana-Farber Opens First Center Devoted to Lynch Syndrome
Teaser: The new center will provide genetic testing, coordinated care, and research for individuals with Lynch syndrome.

Headlines: Combination Therapy for PTSD Provides No Added Benefit
Teaser: In the head-to-head PROGRESS trial, there were no significant differences in PTSD outcomes at 24 weeks for trauma-focused psychotherapy plus sertraline vs either treatment alone.

Headlines: Sleeping Pill Use Linked to Later Increase in BP Meds
Teaser: The use of sleeping tablets by older hypertensive patients was linked to a subsequent increase in the use of antihypertensive medication in a new study.

Headlines: Dosing Calculations May Be Off in Children With Obesity
Teaser: Methods for calculating ideal body weight (IBW) are inconsistent in obese children and could lead to sub-therapeutic dosing of medications, according to new research.

Headlines: GH Dosing and Prepubertal Height Velocity in Short Children
Teaser: Prepubertal children with short stature who receive a reduced dose of GH may be able to maintain a normal height velocity.

Headlines: Higher Radiation Doses Tied to Increased Longevity in Node-Negative Lung Cancer
Teaser: Patients with node-negative stage-II non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who receive higher radiation doses survive longer, researchers have found.

Headlines: Targeted Drug Delivery for Cancer Pain Cuts Costs, Hospital Time
Teaser: Aripiprazole lauroxil once every 2 months provided similar significant improvement in schizophrenia symptoms as once per month paliperidone palmitate.

Headlines: Patch Testing May Reveal Allergy to Implanted Cardiac Device
Teaser: Contact allergy to implanted devices is rare, but should be considered and tested for in certain situations, researchers say.

Headlines: IBD Survey Accurately Captures Patient-Reported Symptoms
Teaser: The Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) Symptom Inventory accurately captures patient-reported symptoms and can be used to monitor patients in clinic or research settings, researchers from Canada report.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court Rejects Allergan Bid to Use Tribe to Shield Drug Patents
Teaser: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday cast aside pharmaceutical company Allergan Plc's unorthodox bid to shield patents from a federal administrative court's review by transferring them to a Native American tribe.

Headlines: Extensive Repeat Biopsy May Be Useful for Some on Active Surveillance for Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Extensive transrectal repeat biopsy with anterior sampling lacks utility for general use in men on active surveillance for low-risk prostate cancer, but it may be appropriate for those with higher prostate-specific antigen (PSA) density, researchers from Sweden report.

Headlines: Multidrug-Resistant Bacteria Found on Patient Hands, Surfaces
Teaser: Multidrug-resistant bacteria were found on many hospitalized patients' hands and on commonly touched surfaces in their rooms. They could be a reservoir for hospital-acquired infections, a study indicates.

Headlines: Tool Calculates Competing Risks of Death in Older Women With Early Breast Cancer
Teaser: A risk calculator incorporating age, comorbidities and estrogen receptor status can estimate competing risks of death for older women with stage 1 breast cancer, potentially aiding therapeutic decision making, researchers say.

Headlines: Simplified MRI Index Assesses Crohn's Disease Activity and Severity
Teaser: A simplified four-item MRI-based index of activity (MARIAs) quickly assesses Crohn's disease (CD) activity and response to therapy, researchers from Spain report.

Headlines: Immune Signatures Differ Between Healthy Vs Complicated Lupus Pregnancies
Teaser: Healthy and uncomplicated lupus pregnancies have similar immune signatures that differ from those in complicated lupus pregnancies, researchers report.

Headlines: Gene Signature Linked to Survival After Pancreatic-Cancer Surgery
Teaser: In patients with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) presence of two single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) may help predict surgical outcome, according to European researchers.

Headlines: Recordati to Seek Canadian Approval for Kidney Disease Drug
Teaser: Italy's Recordati said on Tuesday it plans to seek Canadian approval for its drug Cystagon, which treats a rare kidney disease, in a potential blow to Horizon Pharma, which makes the only drug approved for treatment in Canada.

Headlines: Multiple Hep B Targets in Development for New Treatments
Teaser: Hepatitis B is a complex, 'clever' virus so several simultaneous approaches might be needed to eliminate it, experts say.

Headlines: MRI Identifies Rectal-Cancer Patients Suitable for Primary Surgery
Teaser: MRI criteria can be used to identify "good prognosis" rectal-cancer patients for primary surgery (without chemoradiotherapy first), according to results from the QuickSilver clinical trial.

Headlines: Yale Study Revives Cellular Activity in Pig Brains Hours After Death
Teaser: Yale University scientists have succeeded in restoring basic cellular activity in pigs' brains hours after their deaths in a finding that may one day lead to advances in treating human stroke and brain injuries, researchers reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Tailored Program Might Help Some With Severe Mental Illness Quit Smoking
Teaser: A smoking-cessation program tailored to people with schizophrenia and bipolar disorder may help some quit, new findings show.

Headlines: IBD Patients Who Switch From Infliximab to Biosimilar See Mixed Results
Teaser: Patients with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) can safely switch from infliximab to the biosimilar CT-P13, though they may face a higher risk of clinical relapse, researchers from Spain report.

Headlines: Rapid Initiation of Single-Tablet, Quadruple Anti-HIV Therapy Effective
Teaser: A high proportion of patients with newly diagnosed HIV-1 infection achieved an undetectable viral load through 48 weeks after starting Symtuza (Janssen) within two weeks of diagnosis, according to new data from the DIAMOND study.

Headlines: Reminder Bell Improves Incentive Spirometer Use After CABG
Teaser: Following coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) surgery, compliance with incentive spirometer use was improved by the SpiroTimer, an add-on use tracking device that sounds a reminder bell, researchers say.

Headlines: Higher State Minimum Wage Tied to Lower Suicide Rates
Teaser: Suicide rates grow more slowly in states that increase their minimum wage, according to a U.S. study that suggests this might be one strategy for curbing deaths by suicide.

Headlines: Alnylam, Regeneron to Partner for RNAi Treatments
Teaser: Cognitive grief treatment surpasses antidepressants alone for complicated grief, but sleep disturbances, which are common, can derail treatment.

Headlines: PET Using Prostate-Specific Ligand Accurately Localizes Recurrent Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Alnylam Pharmaceuticals Inc and Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc said on Monday they agreed to jointly develop treatments for eye and central nervous system diseases using gene-silencing technology RNA interference (RNAi).

Headlines: Up to 1 in 13 Boys in US Have Sex Before Adolescence
Teaser: PET using a gallium-labeled prostate-specific membrane antigen (68Ga-PSMA-11) as ligand accurately localizes recurrent prostate cancer, according to a new prospective study.

Headlines: Zogenix's Seizure Drug Filing Fails to Pass U.S. FDA Scrutiny
Teaser: While it's possible that as many as one in 13 boys in the U.S. have sex before reaching their teens, the chance that they will do this varies widely depending on where they live, a study suggests.

Headlines: Medical Cannabis Use Differs for Patients With, Without Cancer
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Monday refused to fully review the marketing application for Zogenix Inc's treatment for seizures associated with Dravet syndrome, a rare form of childhood epilepsy.

Headlines: Esophageal Reflux Common After Sleeve Gastrectomy
Teaser: About one in four patients will develop gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) after sleeve gastrectomy, but few will require conversion to gastric bypass for severe reflux, according to a systematic review and meta-analysis.

Headlines: Genetic Testing Under-Utilized in Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: Only a minority of women with ovarian or breast cancer undergo recommended genetic testing, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Earlier MMR Shot Linked to Faster Decline in Protection
Teaser: Children vaccinated early during a measles epidemic show a sharper drop-off in antibody concentrations over time than children vaccinated at the recommended time, according to new findings.

Headlines: Gilead's NASH Drug Fails to Meet Late-Stage Study Goal
Teaser: Gilead Sciences Inc's experimental drug aimed at treating nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) failed to meet the main goal of a late-stage study on Thursday, two months after it failed another.

Headlines: Long-Acting Injectables Yield Similar Benefit in Schizophrenia
Teaser: A molecular classifier based on RNA-sequencing data from transbronchial lung biopsies can recognize an expression signature associated with usual interstitial pneumonia (UIP), the defining pathology of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF).

Headlines: Molecular Classifier Helps Spot Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis
Teaser: Fewer than one in 10 family caregivers receive training for assisting older adults with disabilities, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Few Family Caregivers Get Formal Training
Teaser: Scientists have mapped the genome of a strain of cholera extracted a century ago from a sick British soldier during World War One and found clues to how some cholera bacteria strains cause epidemics today.

Headlines: Century-Old Bacteria From Sick Soldier Offer Clues to Cholera Epidemics
Teaser: Babies who consume nothing but breast milk for their first three months of life may have healthier cholesterol levels by adolescence than infants who drink formula, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Exclusive Breastfeeding Tied to Healthier Cholesterol in Teens
Teaser: Extensive intraoperative peritoneal lavage (EIPL) during resection of peritoneal metastasis from gastric cancer increases safety and reduces short-term complications, according to Chinese researchers.

Headlines: Extensive Peritoneal Lavage Cuts Complications From Gastric-Cancer Surgery
Teaser: Imaging studies in children with unilateral sensorineural hearing loss (USNHL) generally don't yield clinically useful information, according to new findings.

Headlines: Evolocumab Lowers LDL-C in Diabetic Patients on Maximum Statins
Teaser: In patients with type 2 diabetes and hyperlipidemia or mixed dyslipidemia on a maximally tolerated statin, treatment with evolocumab lowers low-density-lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) and improves levels of other lipids, researchers say.

Headlines: Budget Limits Major Constraint on Heart-Failure Research
Teaser: Insufficient funding is generally the most important of limitations on heart-failure research, but enrolling subjects and contract completion are also significant obstacles, according to a survey by the Heart Failure Society of America (HFSA).

Headlines: Certain Factors Predict Celiac Disease Risk in Children With Positive Serology but Negative Biopsy
Teaser: In children with "potential" celiac disease - positive serology but negative biopsy - who are not on gluten-free diets, factors that may help predict risk for eventual villous atrophy include age at diagnosis, gamma delta lymphocytes and HLA haplotype, researchers say.

Headlines: Lower Dose of Pfizer-Lilly Painkiller Misses Main Goals in Late Stage Study
Teaser: A lower dose of non-opioid painkiller developed by Pfizer Inc and Eli Lilly and Co failed to meet main goals in a late-stage study in patients with moderate-to-severe osteoarthritis of the hip or knee, the companies said on Thursday in releasing topline results of the study.

Headlines: Research Needed on Long-Term Osteoporosis Drug Therapies
Teaser: A variety of drugs are effective for preventing osteoporotic fractures, but there are gaps in the evidence supporting their safety and effectiveness beyond three years, according to a National Institutes of Health Pathways to Prevention Workshop.

Headlines: Dads' Smoking Linked With Fetal Heart Problems
Teaser: Unborn babies are at higher risk of heart defects not just when mothers smoke, but when fathers smoke, too, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Non-Adherence to Antiplatelet Therapy After PCI Ups Risk of MACE in Anemic Patients
Teaser: In anemic patients who have undergone percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI), non-adherence to dual antiplatelet therapy (DAPT) - but not physician-recommended discontinuation - is associated with a higher risk of major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) in the two years following the procedure, researchers say.

Headlines: Merck's Keytruda Wins FDA Approval as Combination Therapy for Kidney Cancer
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has approved Merck & Co Inc's cancer therapy Keytruda (pembrolizumab) as part of a combination therapy for previously untreated patients with the most common type of kidney cancer, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: Promising Results in Mice Prompt Human Trial of Novel Lymphoma Vaccine
Teaser: An in situ vaccine (ISV) combined with immune stimulants and radiotherapy showed efficacy in mice, prompting a phase 1 trial of patients with advanced indolent non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (INHL), researchers say.

Headlines: Promising Strategy Identifies Triple-Negative Breast Cancers That Might Respond to Tamoxifen
Teaser: Triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) tumors with estrogen receptor-beta and a mutated p53 tumor suppressor might be responsive to tamoxifen, a series of preclinical studies suggests.

Headlines: Cancers, Infectious Diseases Get Large Portion of New Drugs
Teaser: A report also shows that nearly half of all drugs launched in 2018 were approved after trials with fewer than 500 participants, as the need grows for niche treatments. Mean development is 13.7 years.

Headlines: Teva Scraps Cluster Headache Program
Teaser: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd said on Tuesday it would stop developing its migraine drug, Ajovy, for treating cluster headaches.

Headlines: Therapy by Phone or Web Improves Patient-Reported Outcomes in IBS
Teaser: Cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) delivered by phone or online leads to improvements in patient-reported outcomes in irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), according to a clinical trial from the U.K.

Headlines: Pesticide Exposure Linked to Worse Outcomes in Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma
Teaser: Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) patients exposed to pesticides on the job have worse overall survival (OS) and event-free survival (EFS) and are less likely to respond to treatment, according to new findings.

Headlines: Osteoporotic Fracture Rates Similar With Denosumab, Alendronate in Real World
Teaser: Rates of osteoporotic fracture were similar three years after starting either denosumab or alendronate in a real-world Danish population-based cohort study.

Headlines: Adverse Skin Effects Tied to Anti-PD1 Response in Melanoma
Teaser: Cutaneous toxic effects (CT) following treatment with anti-programmed-cell-death 1 (anti-PD-1) inhibitors may be encouraging news in patients with advanced melanoma, a retrospective review suggests.

Headlines: German Scientists Create See-Through Human Organs
Teaser: Researchers in Germany have created transparent human organs using a new technology that could pave the way to print three-dimensional body parts such as kidneys for transplants.

Headlines: Emicizumab Prevents Bleeds in Hemophilia Regardless of FVIII-Inhibitor Status
Teaser: Emicizumab given every four weeks provides adequate bleeding prophylaxis in hemophilia patients, regardless of coagulation factor VIII inhibitor status, a phase 3 trial shows.

Headlines: China Draws Up Tighter Rules on Human Gene and Embryo Trials - Xinhua
Teaser: China's top legislature will consider tougher rules on research involving human genes and embryos, the first such move since a Chinese scientist sparked controversy last year by announcing he had made the world's first "gene-edited" babies.

Headlines: Biomarker May Be a Diagnostic Test for ME/CFS
Teaser: Both drugs have received a positive opinion from the European Medicine Agency's Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use, which is the first step in obtaining marketing approval in the European Union.

Headlines: Studies of Hyaluronic Acid in Wound Care
Teaser: Does a review of current literature support the use of esterified hyaluronic acid in the treatment of difficult or chronic wounds?

Headlines: NGS in Lung Cancers With Insufficient Tumor Samples
Teaser: How effective is next-generation sequencing of ctDNA for detection of actionable variants in advanced lung cancer?

Headlines: Flunarizine as Prophylaxis for Episodic Migraine
Teaser: Although not approved in the US, the calcium channel blocker flunarizine has been used for 30 years as a prophylactic drug in migraine. This meta-analysis examined its safety and efficacy.

Headlines: Detection and Management of DILI in NASH Clinical Trials
Teaser: This paper provides a framework for the approach to assessment and management of suspected acute drug-induced liver injury during clinical trials in patients with NASH.

Headlines: Lung- and Diaphragm-protective Ventilation in ARDS
Teaser: The authors of this paper propose a novel approach to mechanical ventilation in the ICU, integrating both lung-protective and diaphragm-protective considerations.

Headlines: The Safety of Vasopressin Receptor Agonists in Septic Shock
Teaser: What do we currently know about the effects and safety of vasopressin receptor agonists in septic shock patients?

Headlines: Metabolomic Profiles in IBS, UC, and Healthy Controls
Teaser: This study aimed to determine whether urinary metabolite profiles might be useful for differentiating IBS patients from healthy controls and IBD patients.

Headlines: Management of Acute Ischemic Stroke: Guideline Updates
Teaser: This paper summarizes 2018 guidelines by the American Heart Association/American Stroke Association outlining optimal treatment for early management of patients with acute ischemic stroke.

Headlines: Effects of Carbohydrate Restriction in Prader-Willi Syndrome
Teaser: A new study compares the concentrations of hormones and metabolites among Prader-Willi children who consumed either a low carbohydrate or a low-fat diet. How did they differ?

Source: Medicine and Science in Sports and Exercise
Headlines: Morning vs Evening Aerobic Training Effect on Blood Pressure
Teaser: Might the time of day influence the hypotensive effect of aerobic training?

Source: Current Opinion in Nephrology and Hypertension
Headlines: New Therapies for Hyperkalemia
Teaser: Learn more about the emerging new therapies for the management of hyperkalemia.

Headlines: Management of Antipsychotic-Induced Tardive Dyskinesia
Teaser: Newer generation antipsychotics have reduced, but not eliminated, the risk of antipsychotic-induced tardive dyskinesia. What are the best management options for this debilitating adverse effect?

Headlines: Clinical Trials of ART Interruption in HIV-Infected People
Teaser: What have we learned from recent HIV clinical studies regarding antiretroviral treatment interruption?

Headlines: A Brief Review of the Pharmacology of Hyperkalemia
Teaser: This article reviews the pathophysiology and common causes of both acute and chronic hyperkalemia, and summarizes the many approaches to treatment of this electrolyte abnormality.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: The Burden of Childhood Atopic Dermatitis in the PC Setting
Teaser: This study sought to determine the prevalence of atopic dermatitis in children attending primary care, and describe skin care practices used by parents on their children both with and without AD.

Headlines: Baloxavir Marboxil: A Flu Antiviral With a Novel Mechanism
Teaser: Baloxavir marboxil is a newly approved treatment for influenza. Learn more about the antiviral mechanism of action of this agent.

Headlines: The Effects of EMONO in Pediatric Dentistry
Teaser: This study examined the effects and acceptability of EMONO, an equimolar mixture of oxygen and nitrous oxide, when used in dental care for infants, children and adolescents.

Headlines: Atopic Dermatitis: The Skin Barrier and Beyond
Teaser: This review sheds light on the complex pathophysiology of atopic dermatitis, encompassing genetic risk factors, environmental triggers, skin barrier disruption, and immunological dysfunction.

Source: Journal of the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons
Headlines: OITE Performance and Research Productivity Among Residents
Teaser: Which factors may predict whether a candidate will perform well on the OITE -- or who will be more likely to continue research during residency?

Headlines: IBD: Optimized Infliximab Monotherapy vs Combination Therapy
Teaser: This study compared the clinical efficacy and cost of two different IBD treatment strategies for the introduction of infliximab: 6-12 months in combination with azathioprine versus optimized monotherapy.

Headlines: Complications Following Vaginal Laser Treatment for Atrophy
Teaser: Is laser therapy safe and effective for treating genitourinary syndrome of menopause? This paper presents four cases with complications due to unapproved use of lasers for vaginal symptoms.

Headlines: Adverse Effects of Topical Photodynamic Therapy
Teaser: While topical photodynamic therapy is a widely used and generally well tolerated treatment, there can be adverse effects. What are the most common, and how are they best managed?

Headlines: Advances in Dry Eye Disease Treatment
Teaser: Get up-to-date on the latest treatments available for dry eye disease including new medications, procedures, and device options.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Polypharmacy and Outcome in Patients on Vitamin K Antagonists
Teaser: What impact does polypharmacy have on the quality and outcome of anticoagulation therapy with Vitamin K antagonists?

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Barriers to Cancer Clinical Trial Participation
Teaser: Despite all the potential benefits associated with cancer research, why aren't more patients participating in clinical trials?

Headlines: CT, MRI Don't Change Therapy in Children With Hearing Loss
Teaser: Patients with frontotemporal dementia (FTD) are more likely than patients with Alzheimer disease to manifest criminal or socially inappropriate behavior, according to a Swedish medical records review.

Headlines: Role of Biomarkers in Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer
Teaser: Preliminary evidence shows the promising potential of circulating biomarkers in the diagnosis, staging, and monitoring of non-muscle invasive bladder cancer.

Headlines: HRQoL Varies in Different Respiratory Disorders
Teaser: How does health related quality of life vary between several different respiratory diseases? A new study provides insight.

Headlines: The Role of Bowel Preparation in Colorectal Surgery
Teaser: What role does bowel preparation play in reducing the risk of infectious complications in colorectal procedures? Is the combined use of mechanical and antibiotic preparation the best option?

Headlines: OCT for Diagnosis of Basal Cell Carcinoma
Teaser: This review explores how optical coherence tomography, a noninvasive near-infrared light imaging technology, might improve the diagnosis and management of basal cell carcinoma.

Headlines: Implication of Residual TILs in TNBC After Neoadjuvant Chemo
Teaser: Do residual disease tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte levels help predict survival after neoadjuvant chemotherapy for TNBC?

Headlines: AMP-Activated Protein Kinase: Potential Target for TNBC
Teaser: Metformin, fluoxetine, and other AMPK agonists significantly inhibit TNBC. Will targeted therapy finally become an option for this aggressive disease?

Headlines: Saturated Fat, Inflammation, and Insulin Resistance in PCOS
Teaser: In what ways might saturated fat impact inflammation and insulin resistance in PCOS?

Headlines: Immunosuppressants and Less Steroids in Graves' Orbitopathy
Teaser: Could combined immunosuppressive therapy help reduce steroid doses in graves' orbitopathy?

Headlines: Cognitive Complaints in Memory Clinic and Depressive Patients
Teaser: How do cognitive complaints differ among cognitively normal older adults, memory clinic patients, and patients with depression; and which are suggestive of prodromal Alzheimer disease?

Headlines: Immunotherapeutics in the Management of Metastatic Melanoma
Teaser: Advances in immunotherapeutics in the last decade have drastically changed the outlook for patients with metastatic melanoma. Review the currently available immunotherapies in this update.

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Changing ART in Pregnancy and Impact on Viral Suppression
Teaser: A new study examines the question of whether changing ART during early pregnancy affects virological outcomes.

Headlines: Anti-Neutrophil Cytoplasmic Antibodies in Systemic Sclerosis
Teaser: A new study examines the clinical associations of anti-neutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies in systemic sclerosis. What have we learned?

Headlines: Predicting Flare Risk After Stopping Adalimumab in RA
Teaser: A new study examines the question of whether adalimumab trough and antidrug antibody levels predict flare among rheumatoid arthritis patients who have stopped adalimumab.

Headlines: Mindfulness Improves Eating Behavior and Weight Loss
Teaser: A new study examines the beneficial effects of mindfulness-based eating behavior strategies among patients who attended an obesity service.

Headlines: Blood Pressure Perturbations after Abdominal Surgery
Teaser: This study found that potentially serious postoperative hypotension or hypertension is common after abdominal surgery, and often goes undetected.

Headlines: Functional Outcomes in Combat-related Penetrating Brain Injury
Teaser: This study aimed to characterize the long-term outcomes of military personnel who sustain combat-related penetrating brain injury. What clinical characteristics led to worse functional outcomes?

Headlines: Anabolic Steroid Use and Body Image Disorders in Young Men
Teaser: The use of anabolic-androgenic steroids among young men is on the rise, despite regulatory efforts and reported adverse health effects. What can be done to stem the epidemic?

Headlines: Hyperoxia Effects on Mortality in Critically Ill Patients
Teaser: Is there an association between hyperoxia and increased mortality among patients admitted to the ICU?

Headlines: Durable Response of Checkpoint Inhibitors vs Other Therapies
Teaser: Patients receiving immune checkpoint inhibitors may experience durable response over two times more frequently than those receiving other drug classes.

Headlines: Interventions for Infantile Hemangiomas of the Skin
Teaser: Infantile hemangiomas can become problematic or cause mental distress to children and parents. Which treatments are most effective?

Headlines: Causality Between NAFLD and Risk of CVD and Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: This study explores the evidence for a possible causal relationship between non-alcoholic fatty liver disease and type 2 diabetes or cardiovascular disease.

Headlines: Epidemiology and Response to DAA Therapy in Genotype 6 HCV
Teaser: A new review provides insight into the epidemiology and virologic outcome of direct-acting antiviral regimens in HCV genotype 6 patients.

Headlines: Cannabis for Chronic Pain in Patients With Fibromyalgia
Teaser: This experimental study explored the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of cannabis in chronic pain patients with fibromyalgia. How did it fare in reducing pain compared with placebo?

Headlines: Combined Immunosuppression in Adults >60 With Crohn's Disease
Teaser: Older adults with Crohn's disease have tended to be treated less aggressively than younger patients. Is a treatment strategy of combined immunosuppression safe and effective in those 60 and over?

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Surveillance After Treatment of Localized Breast Cancer
Teaser: Is it time to bring circulating tumor cell assays to the forefront of breast cancer surveillance?

Headlines: Trends in Yoga, Tai Chi, and Qigong Use Among US Adults
Teaser: This study examined trends in the prevalence, patterns of use, and predicting factors of the mind-body therapies yoga, tai chi, and qigong among US adults.

Headlines: Cardiovascular Protection With Anti-Hyperglycemic Agents
Teaser: Anti-hyperglycemic drugs are commonly used in the treatment of diabetes. Could certain agents provide cardiovascular benefits as well?

Headlines: The Nocebo Effect in Biosimilar-treated IBD Patients
Teaser: While biosimilars have been shown to be effective and safe in treating IBD, some patients may experience the nocebo effect. How can the negative impact of this effect be prevented or reduced?

Headlines: Postoperative Analgesia for Pediatric Craniotomy Patients
Teaser: What is the optimal regimen for postoperative analgesia in pediatric neurosurgery patients?

Headlines: Precision Medicine to Prevent Glaucoma-Related Blindness
Teaser: How might the principles of precision medicine apply to the prevention and management of glaucoma-related blindness?

Headlines: Response to HCV Treatment by PWID in Needle & Syringe Program
Teaser: This study aimed to assess whether people who actively inject drugs can be recruited and treated successfully through a community needle and syringe program.

Headlines: Using Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy With Immunotherapy
Teaser: Learn about ongoing clinical trials and the potential for clinical synergy between radiation and immunotherapy.

Headlines: Allogeneic HCT Provides No Benefit for Hypodiploid ALL
Teaser: Is HCT still indicated for pediatric patients with hypodiploid ALL? New reports call this practice into question.

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Metabolic Syndrome and Neurocognitive Deficits in HIV
Teaser: Is there a link between metabolic syndrome and neurocognitive impairment? What role might these conditions have in HIV?

Headlines: Application of SMART Trial Design in Older Patients With CLL
Teaser: Can a clinical trial in which treatment decisions are guided by intermediate patient outcomes be used in cancers?

Headlines: Long-Term Safety and Efficacy of ABP 501 in Patients With RA
Teaser: How does the safety and efficacy of the adalimumab biosimilar ABP 501 compare with that of the reference product?

Headlines: ASCP 2019
Teaser: Read clinically focused news coverage of key developments from ASCP 2019

Headlines: COPD Exacerbations Associated With Biomass vs Tobacco Smoke
Teaser: Might the risk of acute COPD exacerbations differ between biomass smoke and tobacco smoke exposure? In what ways?

Headlines: ADAM Zolmitriptan for Difficult-to-Treat Migraine
Teaser: This study evaluated the efficacy and potential for adverse effects of a novel, investigational intracutaneous drug delivery system for zolmitriptan when used for refractory migraine headache.

Headlines: When to Stop the Bisphosphonate
Teaser: When is the right time to stop a bisphosphonate in a woman who is just tired of taking it? We present a case and ask for the opinion of readers.

Headlines: Tafamidis for Transthyretin Amyloid Cardiomyopathy
Teaser: A new drug for the treatment of transthyretin cardiomyopathy looks to be a game-changer; but will it benefit all TTR patients?

Headlines: Stop Incentivizing Drug Companies for More Rare Disease Drugs
Teaser: Time to revise the Orphan Drug Act, which gives extra payment to companies that develop drugs for rare diseases. The Act has fueled a price explosion and possibly hindered research into other drugs.

Headlines: Your First ASCO: Remember, the Goal Is to Feel Inspired
Teaser: Junior faculty oncologist Bishal Gyawali talks about how first-time ASCO attendees can make the most of their experience.

Headlines: The Week That Wasn't: DBS, Algorithms, Trichomegaly
Teaser: Read the latest on deep brain stimulation for addiction treatment, machine learning to predict cardiovascular events, and unusual eyelash growth after cancer treatment.

Headlines: Recent Immunotherapy Treatments for Metastatic Breast Cancer
Teaser: Several novel therapies for metastatic breast cancer are proving effective.

Headlines: From Medical Skeptic to Researcher: The View From the Other Side
Teaser: Critiquing studies is all very well until you’re one of the co-authors. John Mandrola, MD feels the heady joy of having a late-breaking clinical trial at a major meeting and the temptation to ‘spin’.

Headlines: Life and Times of Leading Cardiologists: Deepak Bhatt
Teaser: A ruptured appendix and a love for writing helped ignite Bhatt's passion for cardiovascular research and medicine.

Headlines: We Still Need a Sham-Controlled Trial for AF Ablation
Teaser: Catheter ablation for atrial fibrillation has yet to be put to the ultimate test of a sham-controlled trial. John Mandrola, MD, makes the case for doing one now.

Headlines: Severe Malaria: Only One Drug Option Remains
Teaser: Patient with severe malaria? Call the CDC, rather than the pharmacy, to obtain artesunate.

Headlines: Toddlers With Autism: Is That Early Diagnosis Reliable?
Teaser: Can we diagnose autism in children as young as 12 months? How stable is that diagnosis over time? Perry Wilson comments.

Headlines: Managing Inflammatory Rheumatic Conditions in the Elderly
Teaser: What special considerations should be taken when managing elderly patients with chronic inflammatory rheumatic diseases?

Headlines: When Is Stopping Immunosuppressives in AIH Justified
Teaser: How long should immunosuppressive treatment of autoimmune hepatitis be continued, and which patients are suitable for drug withdrawal?

Headlines: Methylphenidate Capsules for Morning ADHD Symptom Control
Teaser: Newly approved delayed- and extended-release methylphenidate capsules designed for bedtime administration may provide better early morning symptom control for ADHD patients.

Headlines: Glycopyrronium Tosylate (Qbrexza) for Hyperhidrosis
Teaser: Topical glycopyrronium tosylate was recently FDA-approved to manage patients with primary axillary hyperhidrosis. Review the clinical trial results in this article.

Headlines: Practice Variation in Lumbar Spinal Stenosis Treatment
Teaser: When it comes to the diagnosis and treatment of lumbar spinal stenosis, how do surgeons' practices differ?

Headlines: Irradiation to Contralateral Breast for BRCA+ Breast Cancer
Teaser: What role does contralateral breast irradiation have in women with early BRCA+ breast cancer who have declined contralateral mastectomy?

Headlines: Value of Androgen Receptor Expression in ER+ Breast Cancer
Teaser: Does androgen receptor expression predict response to tamoxifen in women with ER+ breast cancers?

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Premature Aging in Young Cancer Survivors
Teaser: Cancer survivors are more likely to experience cardiovascular disease and other chronic health conditions as a result of premature aging. What can be done?

Headlines: Neonatal Prophylaxis and Hematologic Toxicity in Infants
Teaser: Is the use of combination neonatal prophylaxis associated with the risk of severe hematologic adverse events?

Headlines: High Cortisol/DHEA-S Ratio Is a Risk Factor for Sarcopenia
Teaser: In this study, a high cortisol/DHEA-S ratio was shown as a strong risk factor for sarcopenia among elderly patients with type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: VOCs Emitted From Feces as a Biomarker for Colorectal Cancer
Teaser: Could specific volatile organic compounds given off from feces serve as biomarkers for colorectal cancer?

Headlines: 70th Anniversary of Glucocorticoids in Rheumatic Diseases
Teaser: The introduction of glucocorticoids marked a breakthrough in the treatment of inflammatory conditions, but the high doses and adverse effects were concerning. Are they ready for a comeback?

Headlines: Machine Learning Model to Predict Recurrent Ulcer Bleeding
Teaser: The authors present a novel clinical and laboratory parameter-based prediction model to predict recurrent ulcer bleeding in patients with a history of H. pylori-negative idiopathic bleeding ulcers.

Headlines: Cryosurgery Plus Topical Interventions for Actinic Keratosis
Teaser: Is a combination of cryosurgery with a topical intervention superior to cryosurgery alone for treatment of actinic keratoses?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: CPAP Adherence and Cognitive Decline in Adults With MCI, OSA
Teaser: This study demonstrated a beneficial effect of CPAP adherence on multiple domains of cognitive function in persons with mild cognitive impairment and obstructive sleep apnea.

Headlines: eResearch in Acute Kidney Injury: A Primer for EHR Research
Teaser: Learn more about the role of eResearch and EHR data in acute kidney injury research.

Headlines: Drug-Induced Liver Injury by Sevoflurane and Desflurane
Teaser: Have modern volatile anesthetics reduced the incidence of drug-induced liver injury compared to that reported with older agents?

Headlines: Post-op Complications With Pre-op Anti-TNF Agents for CD
Teaser: Does pre-operative exposure to anti-TNF agents increase the risk for post-operative infectious complications in patients with Crohn's disease?

Headlines: Cannabinoids in Inflammatory and Neoplastic Skin Diseases
Teaser: The endocannabinoid system is responsible for maintaining many aspects of skin homeostasis. How might cannabinoids be of value for treatment of various inflammatory and neoplastic skin diseases?

Headlines: A Novel Approach to Neuraxial Anesthesia Using Ultrasound
Teaser: The authors present a novel intelligent image processing system that identifies spinal landmarks using ultrasound images to guide neuraxial block.

Headlines: A Risk Score for Predicting Major Acute CV Events in NAFLD
Teaser: The authors developed a novel risk score which incorporates mean platelet volume to accurately predict 1-year risk of major acute cardiovascular events in patients with NAFLD.

Headlines: AF: Highly Prevalent Yet Undertreated in Patients With NASH
Teaser: This study found that the prevalence of atrial fibrillation in patients with NASH is twice that of the general population. Are these patients receiving appropriate anticoagulation therapy?

Headlines: Signs and Symptoms for the Diagnosis of Acute Rhinosinusitis
Teaser: What are the key indicators which most accurately identify those patients with clinically suspected sinusitis who actually have acute bacterial rhinosinusitis?

Headlines: Cardiac MRI in Patients With Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy
Teaser: Would keeping resynchronization therapy active during MRI in patients with cardiac resynchronization therapy improve results? This article presents a strategy for conducting high quality scans safely.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Training Vulnerable PC Patients to Use a Patient Portal
Teaser: This study tested the effectiveness of delivering online, video-based portal training to primary care patients with limited health literacy.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Action Steps for Older Adults With Multiple Chronic Conditions
Teaser: The AGS presents a framework of actions and accompanying action steps for decision making for clinicians who provide both primary and specialty care to older people with multiple chronic conditions.

Headlines: Perioperative Fluid Therapy for Major Surgery
Teaser: This article reviews the latest evidence on preoperative and intraoperative IV fluid therapy for major surgery, reviewing different strategies as well as type and volume of fluids.

Headlines: Extended-release Gabapentin for Failed Back Surgery Syndrome
Teaser: Is extended-release gabapentin efficacious for persistent pain after lumbar surgery?

Headlines: Factors Affecting Older Adults' Hospital-to-Home Transition
Teaser: This study aimed to identify and elucidate the performance-shaping factors which contribute to older adults' successful hospital-to-home transitions.

Headlines: Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir for Treatment of Chronic HCV
Teaser: The study evaluated the effectiveness and safety of glecaprevir/pibrentasvir under real-world conditions in adult patients with chronic HCV infection.

Headlines: Cardiac Stem Cells in the Post-Anversa Era
Teaser: Recent investigations have discredited much of the literature supporting c-Kit+ cardiac stem cells having any role in cardiac repair. Where do we go from here?

Headlines: Growth Hormone Therapy and Short Stature-Related Distress
